name: Mythic Battles: Chiron Promo card
description:
The legendary centaur Chiron from Greek mythology.

"You can play this card at any moment. Until the end of the turn, each Art of War card that you convert into Power Points is worth 3 Power Points instead of 2."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Zmajarenje
description: Zmajarenje (Hang gliding) is game for younger players. Each has one figurine. From the top of a hill located on a shore of a bay, kites fly over to the other side of the bay. While flying, kites should to make as many photos of birds, ships, .... In real sport kites are trying to stay as long as possible in the air. In this game the most points gets the last player who reach the finish line. Each photo (counter) also brings one point. The winner is the player who at the end of the game has the most points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Šmizling
description:
Šmizling is a game for girls. On the board is presented a shopping center. In stores can be purchased (collected) different clothing items (counters), by standing on marked field next to counter.

The task in not to collect as many counters, but to make certain outfits. The first player who succeed in that is the winner.

name: The Reel Script
description:
You're the director & need to pitch the winning story to become the Reel Script!

Bid on story parts to make the best story of the round then vote on which 'director' has the best script of the round.

name: Lines of Battle: Quatre Bras 1815
description:
Lines of Battle: Quatre Bras 1815 covers one of the last battles of the Napoleonic wars.

In 1815, Napoleon ordered Marshall Ney to capture the critical crossroads of Quatre Bras in order to keep the Allied army away from linking up with the Prussian army. Fortunately for the Allies, the Dutch had disobeyed orders and posted a strengthened division at the crossroads. Wellington, the Allied commander, swiftly reacted and reinforcements were force-marched to aid the beleaguered Dutch. Ney also ordered reinforcements, but in his case the reinforcements were supposed to be helping Napoleon in his own battle with the Prussians at Ligny. In the end, Wellington's forces drove the French from the field, while Ney never got his reinforcements, which marched back and forth between Quatre Bras and Ligny affecting neither battle.

In this 2 player wargame, can you do better?

Each side controls around 10-20 units - these are infantry, cavalry, and artillery. The cavalry are further subdivided into 3 types: Heavy, Light, and Lancers. Each unit has a rating ranging from 2 to 4. When this is reduced below zero through combat hits, the unit is eliminated.

The scale is around 2000 men or 1000 cavalry per unit. Each game turn is half an hour. The map shows the environs of Quatre Bras, divided into areas. Between Areas are Approaches where infantry may deploy.

Each turn, a player receives a certain number of actions. These are spent manoeuvring the forces, including into combat, and rallying those with hits. Then both sides fire artillery, then the 2nd player does the same, and the turn is over. Quatre Bras has 14 turns in it, and victory is determined by casualties inflicted, and objectives held at the end.

There are optional rules and possible alternatives, such as the arrival of different French reinforcements.

name: Earth Encounters
description:
Earth Encounters is a board game fueled by the concept that conversations among friends ignite big ideas that not only impact our world, but make it a better place as well. Earth Encounters brings the Einstein in all of us to life. It’s not only fun to play, but it sparks dialog among friends, brings value to our community, and perhaps can even change our world for the better! Earth Encounters is anti-trivia.

The game starts with the Timeship Encounter. An alien creature escaped the timeship and is hiding somewhere in the Eastern Time Zone. Encounter launches an elite team to recapture the alien creature. Players travel across the U.S. and the seven continents, competing to be the first to locate and capture the powerful yet invisible alien before it awakens and consumes all the knowledge possessed by Earth’s inhabitants. Throughout this adventure, each player learns about the states and continents as they collect as many states and continent deeds as possible – they’ll be needed when you come face-to-face with the alien creature.

Each player can only advance by correctly answering a question from the Q&A Deck or successfully completing a thought experiment from the Challenge Deck. In doing so, if they are the first to land on that particular state or continent, they are awarded a State Deed of Trust. That means the state or continent is now under the players protection from the alien. The player who protects the state where the alien is hiding is considered the winner!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Simulation, Voting

name: Turkey My Mayonnaise
description:
Have you ever built your dream sandwich? Imagine doing that and having a great card game too! Introducing Turkey My Mayonnaise, the hottest new card game on the market!

The object is simple. Be the first to complete sandwich recipes... any way you can. See a piece of cheese on someone's sandwich you like? Take it with a "Steal" card. Pepperocinis in the discard pile? Time for a dumpster dive! Sandwich combinations are virtually endless so the game is unique every time!

A set collection and building game.

name: Monopoly: Bottrop
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bottrop, a city in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Olympique Lyonnais
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from OL, a soccer club in Lyon, France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Safari Sabana
description:
Experience a real adventure in the African savannah and find out if you are the king of the herd, but beware! in your wild world lurking dangers and unexpected traps that would change the course of your adventure.

Safari Sabana is the first game of the brand and the first of its kind, is a game where stealth is the key to win, fast and fun collect all the animals of the herd before your opponents. Set in the sunny Africam savanna and features artwork that takes you to the wild world where you can show if have what it needs to be the king !!

You can play fron 2 until 8 player and from 7 years old up to top, its easy to play so you can play it anywhere you want, its small to fit in your poket.

Make sure you have always 3 cards in your hand, every movement you do always keep 3 cards in hands, attack the opponent's animal to collect it in your own deck or defend others opponent's attaks to draw the animal. The first one who collect the 5 animals of a same herd wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Lion's Lair:  Malta Convoy Battles 1940-42
description:
A rather simple game following the 3-4 day track of convoys from Gibraltar and Alexandria to Malta in the face of Stukas, torpedobombers, high-altitude Italian bombers, MAS torpedo boats, U-boats and Italian submarines, and the Italian navy.

Battleships and carriers (usually) in single ship units, cruiser divisions, and convoys. 10th Army's/Afrika Korps' progress ... or retreat ... inversely proportionate to Malta's strength.

One representational convoy each may start from G and A per season - 11 seasons total, unless Malta falls or Alamein or Tripoli fall.

Summer 1940 and Operation Pedestal (Summer 1942) scenarios or campaign game.
categories: Dice, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Relative Paradox
description:
Relative Paradox could best be described as a Deck Building Game, with mechanics including Strategy, Hand Management, and a little bit of Luck. The point is to match up History A with People B and multiplier/bonus for History C with Cosmos and Paradox Cards create "trouble" that alter history all together. All the cards are easily recognizable to their time in history, so you don't need to be a Historian to play. This game features all Public Domain Time Travelers including Professor Helvetius and Doctor Omega.

2 to 8 Players will have to take their Traveler into Time and Space to collect pieces of history and put them back together. First players will be dealt one time traveler to represent them during the game, these are Traveler Cards, The Traveler you are dealt is who you will represent throughout the game. Then each player is Dealt Five Cards from the main deck, the remainder are separated into one pile per the amount of players (i.e. 2 somewhat even piles for two players) and a card is placed face up on all sides (see the image above), these cards are now obtainable.

Each turn you can either create a timeline (matching cards with same symbols) or draw a card from the tabletop that is obtainable. A player can have as many or as few cards as needed in their hand at one time. When you make a pair, you do not draw to replenish. Also, if you have a timeline available to lay--you must use it and lay your pair/three of a kind. Each Timeline Card will have a value that will count towards your final tally, these are called Timeline Points. Each Traveler interacts with a particular timeline differently, either giving them a bonus/multiplier for Timeline Points or immunity from a certain Paradox.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Novel-based, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Mongols: La Grande Chevauchée (1194-1294)
description:
Mongols : La Grande Chevauchée (1194-1294) is a solitaire wargame simulating the Mongol expansion from 1194, when Gengis Khan becomes the chief of principal Mongol clans, to 1294, death of his grandson Kubilaï Khan.

The map displays the historical area of Mongol conquest till the end of XIIIe century, from Europe to the Sea of China and the Indian Ocean, from the Scandinavia to the lands of Egypt and Arabia.

1 turn - 10 years
1cm - 200km
324 counters
1 map (two piece) 56.6cmx40cm

The game lasts 10 turns

name: Dolmen: Lone druid
description:
Solo expansion for Dolmen.

In solo play you play against three virtual players. Your goal is to achive as many vicorty points as possible, to beat your highscore and to increase the amount by which you beat the best virtual opponent.

Adds 36 new cards to the game.

name: Marsolimpijada
description:
Marsolimpijada is a very simple game for 2 to 6 players.
Players move figurines in direction of paths. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles that slow them down. The winner is the player who first gets to the finish line.

name: Formula indi
description: Formula indi is game for younger players. Each has one figurine. 3 laps are driven. Everyone has to stop in the pit stop once. It is important to find the shortest path.

name: The Sealed Ark
description:
The Sealed Ark is a co-operative game which can be played solo or all the way up to 5 people.

Before you roll the die, you must gather a single focus then roll the die to see where will the spirit appear i.e.
(rolls a 4, a single spirit will appear at that 4th circle.)

Players now have the choice of moving to another circle, perform an ability, banish a spirit or do nothing and keep the focus. If the player rolls a 6 on the die, a spirit will appear at the center of the ark (the void) and a spirit card will be drawn and read out loud and do what it's told.

To win, players must carefully plan out their strategies with each unique spirit of harmony and gather enough focus to seal all 5 circles before the void reaches a total of 9 spirits.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Batallas Históricas "Verdun 1916"
description:
Historical Battles "Verdun 1916"
It is a war game for two players set in the First World War, where we take control of German or French army to destroy our enemy.
This game has two game modes: The Front is a game system Ameritrash and Defending Line is more strategic. It also features expansions: Supremacy and Brotherhood latter with four-player mode.

This game is created by Rúnica Art Games, in 2016 in Colombia.

Thank you all for believing in the Colombian creativity.


Batallas Históricas "Verdún 1916"
Es un juego de guerra para dos jugadores ambientado en la primera guerra mundial, donde tomaremos el control del ejercito Aleman o Frances para destruir a nuestro enemigo.
Este juego tiene dos modos de juegos: The Front que es un sistema de juego Ameritrash y Defending Line que es mas estratégico. También se cuenta con las expansiones: Supremacía y Hermandad esta ultima con la modalidad para cuatro jugadores.

Este juego es creado por Rúnica Art Games, en el año 2016 en Colombia.

Gracias a todos por creer en la creatividad Colombiana.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Snitch
description:
There’s a Snitch in the Mafia, and the Godfather has ordered us to take him out! Snitch is a hidden identity card game set in the world of the mafia, played with 4-6 friends in about 15 to 30 minutes. Play as the Mobster and attempt to whack the Snitch. Or play as the Snitch, and frame the mobsters so they turn on each other! Watch out for the Police, as they can be tipped off towards anyone. If we don't whack the Snitch in time, he's sure to get into protective custody!

A round consists of a hit being placed on one of the players. Whether or not they’re a Snitch is for you to decide. Use cards in your hand to attack, or protect the target. Cash can be used to influence the hit in either direction! If enough damage is dealt to a player, they can be sent to the hospital, or whacked!

Players take part in Mob Jobs. If the job is snitched on, the game gets more difficult for the Mobsters, and the Snitch gets closer to protective custody. The deck also consists of mafia associates, who's skills can be used to further your agenda.

The Mobsters win if they whack the Snitch! The Snitch wins if enough Mobsters are whacked, or if enough police are in play!

name: Llama Fight!
description:
Are you Llama enough to please your goddess? The Llama Goddess is not a sweet goddess. She likes the fight more than anyone and if you want to gain her respect, you are going to spit til the last drop of drool you have!

Command your Llama around the battlefield, spit the others, gain goddess favor points and try to look clean in order to achieve the higher score!

Llama Fight is a board game for 2-4 players in which you command a Llama with cards. You have 3 different actions: Spit, Move and take towels for later cleaning. Combine them with values and make those actions X times. Everytime you spit, you gain favor goddess points. Two rounds later, the cleanest and devoutest Llama wins the match.

name: ATS Great War: Tankschreken!
description:
From the publisher's website:

Legendary designer Ian Daglish (dec.) left behind his take on the Great War for tactical-level gamers and the baton has crossed the finish line in the form of ATS GREAT WAR I: Tankschreken!
The module includes all the combat counters needed to play plus 10 scenarios, all featuring British vs. German actions ... and of course some of them debut tanks ... the name deriving from an attempt to keep this new technology secret by making the enemy think ‘water tanks’ were being constructed. You also receive—as a SPECIAL BONUS—ALL OF THE BOARDS NEEDED TO PLAY in 11” × 16” folding format. You also receive a Play Aid to augment standard system play aid cards.

You receive all the combat counters you need to play. Special rules in color, 3-hole format. And of course, a collection of color format scenarios (8 in all) that all feature German/British combat.

name: Battle at Lone Jack: A Missouri Street Fight
description:
Both sides saw the other as "invaders," so the fight quickly escalated to one of extreme violence. The fight seesawed up and down the main street of Lone Jack, and when the rebels fired the Cave Hotel, a Yankee stronghold, their advantage appeared decisive. Foster now wheeled his only two artillery pieces forward, blasting the gray attack with double-shotted canister.

The Confederates owned the field as well as the dead. They quickly gathered the remains of the fallen, already spoiling under the torrid sun. Friend and foe alike they buried beneath the arching shade of the lone jack oak.

About the Rebel Yell! system

Rebel Yell! is a simulation of American Civil War small-unit tactics. The playing pieces in the game represent companies of infantry and cavalry or sections of artillery Each infantry and cavalry unit has one strength point and is equivalent to between 45 and 100 men, depending upon the scenario. Each artillery unit has two strength points and equals two guns. The players of Rebel Yell assume the roles of divisional commanders.

Each game turn is broken down into segments. During an action segment, the units of a particular player may conduct a single action. In the beginning modules these actions are: Move, Fire, Assault, and Rally. During any Small Arms segment, the units of a particular player may only fire.

There are no movement phases, fire phases, etc., as there are in other Civil War games. This absence, in addition to the fact that player segments are structured reciprocally, produces a feel of simultaneity uncommon to other designs.

One of the most difficult problems faced by the Civil War tactician was the "problem of approach," in other words, how he should maneuver his unit to some objective while keeping his casualties and disorganization at a minimum. A commander who did not pay heed to the destructiveness of "modern" weaponry would find his formation damaged up to three hundred yards from the enemy. Rebel Yell addresses this problem. Within restrictions, defending units may fire at the enemy as he advances. Like a real-life commander, a player can no longer be certain that when he initiates an advance, his units will reach their objective. Players may find that even one or two companies Standing to Fire will be difficult to dislodge by frontal assault.

Although Rebel Yell is a complex design, it is not out of the reach of the novice gamer. The rules are programmed, allowing small portions to be digested first and getting players into the game quickly. Provisions are made for such factors as infantry line formations (Standing to Maneuver, Standing to Fire, Skirmishers, and Cover), volley effects, leader quality, morale, and regimental flags. The rules for cavalry and artillery are also extensive.

Although an excellent multi-player game, Rebel Yell accommodates the solitaire player, Likewise it can be played in a physically limited area. Rebel Yell is big only in the sense that it is detailed.

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Umhang der ewigen Wache
description:
This item Card gives you +1 Charisma

it was given away at Essen Spiel
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Cakes Athirst Hilarity: Volume #4 (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
The Unofficial, Disturbing, Illegitimate child of an expansion pack.

An unofficial, unauthorized 3rd-party expansion to the hit part game Cards Against Humanity.
Includes: 80 white cards, 30 black cards.

Semi-professionally printed on linen-finish. Premium casino-quality cards, should only be played by people who have a crude sense of humor.
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Form on Admiral's Wake
description:
Form on Admiral's Wake is a quick-playing miniatures game of fleet naval battle during the age of sailing warships. It allows for the play of larger naval battles with a small number of players who will each control one or more squadrons of ships. The game is typically played with miniatures on a hex grid.

The game system uses an action deck to determine which ships can activate and what actions they can perform. The action cards have limitations based on a ship's fleet, sail state, wind orientation, crew quality, and damage level. The more favorable the condition and status of a ship, the more cards it will activate on.

One card is flipped each turn and ships that meet the requirements of the card may perform actions as indicated in the instructions. The actions allowed vary by card, but include moving one hex, sideslipping one hex, turning in a hex, and reloading cannons. Once fired, cannons require two actions to reload.

After all actions from the flip of a card are completed, all ships with loaded cannons may fire simultaneously. As a ship takes damage, its status reduces from undamaged to disabled to crippled. As the status changes, the ship will have less chances to activate.

Additional rules cover critical hits, grappling, fires, forts, anchoring, and fire ships.
categories: Age of Reason, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Shadows over Normandie: Ben's Game Shop
description: This mini-punchboard expansion is a promo to Shadows over Normandie. It gives boasts a beautiful game store with a variety of Heroes Tactical System products on its shelves. The owner, Ben, is also a friend of the designers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Across the Wide Missouri-An adventure game of mountain men and Indians
description:
In keeping with the spirit of the Rocky Mountain fur trade, Each of the four game pieces represents a fur brigade:
1) The Rocky Mountain Fur Company
2) Manuel Lisa's Missouri Fur Company
3) The Mountain Fur Company
4) The men of the Hudson's bay company
As a player you move out across the wide Missouri river into the wild, free country in search of Fur and riches.

The object of the game is to return to one's starting point with as many packs of Beaver pelts or Trade goods, or their equivalent in blood brother cards and fort ownership, as possible.

The game is played until each of the players has moved over all of his hunting trails, designated by his particular color, through the Rendezvous twice, and back home. Each trapper move along spaces, encounters adventure or situation generated by pulling cards from a deck.

name: Chemical Spill
description:
Chemical Spill is a chemistry based drafting card game.

How to play:

Chemicals are spilled and each player gets 10 cards each. They are allowed to 'cleanup' one card before the rest are washed to the next player for the next round. Each round players select one card from the cards passed to them and continue to pass until all cards are chosen.

Players use the elements they have chosen to create molecules. Different molecules score different amounts of points (as seen on the scoring cards). Any elements that have not been made into molecules cost you points!

After each round users tally the molecules in their hand. After three rounds the person with most points wins!!!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Helvetia Cup: DeLuxe Box
description:
The box contains :
o 1 miniature cup.
o 2 prepainted miniature stars (the Medusa and the Genius).
o The player, POWER and LEGEND cards in relation to the Stars.
o 4 new goals with a beautiful new design.
o 40 boosts in form of potions.

This is an expansion box. It needs the standard HELVETIA Cup box to be played!

name: Colonisation
description:
Game Background:

You are the leader of a village in the forest of Na~TACE. Your expansion views require resources and pushes you to explore the surrounding areas.

Your lumberer will quickly discover areas for the development of agriculture for your farmers or mining for your blacksmith.

The wood harvested and will allow you to build farms, forges, fences or barracks for your soldiers.

But will your farmers and your hunter be able to provide enough food for your soldiers? No problem, send your merchant to other villages to share valuable resources.

Many other surprises await you in this game of resources gathering, war and colonization.

Finally, attack enemy villages to colonize the entire forest and win the game!

How to play:

The goal of the game is to eliminated other players by destroying their village with your soldiers.

24, 36 or 48 hexa cards (forests) are placed in a predetermined shape according to the number of players.
Each player choose a village and pick 3 ressources card.

Player 1 will advance his lumberer pawn forest by forest and discover 3 areas by flipping the forests he passes on. Underneath, he may discover a regular forest, a farm land, a mind land or a special land.

The lumberer will pick 3 wood cards and will use them to build farms (placing a pawn on the farm land), mines (placing a pawn on the mine land) or barracks (placing a pawn on the village).

For each farmer, the player will pick 1 farm card per farm land with a farmer. The food will be use to feed the soldiers (1 per barrack). Soldier pawns will be moved and advance to eventually attack the other villages or soldiers.

When a soldier or a group of soldiers attack, a D6 is used + all bonus cards the attacker player may have collect. Defense is fixed by the number of soldiers or what type of building is attacked + any defensive bonus the defendant player may have gathered.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Trading

name: Sochaczew 1939
description:
Game covers battle of Sochaczew, fought 13–16 of September 1939. Sochaczew was the last city on the way to Warsaw.

Scenarios:
"Sochaczew 14 September"
"Sochaczew 15 September"
"Sochaczew 15 September"

Game was published in the 41 issue of the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine, in the both Polish and English editions. It uses the B-35 System (Bitwy II wojny światowej 1943-45).

name: Clockwork Renaissance
description:
The year is 1525 in the Republic of Florence, and the city-state prospers under the rule of the Medici family. It is a time of artistry, of education, and of invention. All over the land, people are vying to find a patron, one of the rich noble families who will support and encourage a creative soul with their wealth, fame, and good name.

One of the members of these illustrious nobility is looking for a fresh, young mind to carry into the halls of history. To find the best and brightest, the Patron has organized a challenge. All geniuses should seek to emulate the greatest man of their time, Leonardo da Vinci, and therefore, the most worthy artist will be the one who can turn Leonardo’s dreams into reality.

As one of the Patron’s hopeful aspirants, you have been invited to one of daVinci’s private laboratories, to compete against other artists in their goal to follow in the late Master’s footsteps. Your job is to maneuver around the puzzle that is daVinci’s lab, traversing the rotating gears of his workshop, all the while assembling a team of expert engineers to study and be the first to build a replica of one of da Vinci’s designs. The first recruit to successfully assemble and test the proposed machine will win the coveted spot in the Patron’s household. Do you have what it takes to win?

The object of the game is to move around a moving gear board, with each gear offering up a different resource for your build - plans, engineers, tools, and materials. The plans tell the players what other resources they need to collect. Plans are played with cards, engineers and tools are played on tokens (so they can be left on a board location), and materials are played with shards.

Once a player has all of the resources necessary to complete his build, they can move on to the final gear to assemble their creations, and then return to the beginning of the room.
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Invocation Frontiers
description:
Real-time game, in which up to 6 players must simultaneously and continuously play cards to its own boards trying to defeat at least one of the different powers of any of the opponent's cards and take them. The effects of the played cards are instantaneous and change the powers and abilities of other cards in play.

It's a fast and frenetic game, that can be played even with kids.
The game is played in rounds until the deck is empty (more players means less time). When this happens, the players count the total strength of the defeated cards, and who has more is declared winner.
It can also be played in constructed deck mode.

name: TYPHOON-ALERT
description: In TYPHOON-ALERT, each player owns a randomly chosen area in East Asia and tries to avoid damage caused by typhoons, which form continually during the game. The goal of this game is to survive typhoons and earn/keep as many life points as possible.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area-Impulse, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: The Encounter
description:
With a creeeeak the door opens.

Jane asks, "What are you doing?". You reply, "There might be something valuable in here, it’s a mansion after all, worth a quick inspection". Your other companions agree.
...you enter the attic. While searching through the dusty shelves you hear the door shut loudly followed by Jane’s scream, she leaps toward the door pointing a shaky finger toward the opposite corner. You look where she's pointing and see strange movement. A z..zombie shambles toward you. Everyone appears at Jane's side in front of the door... it won't open; it's locked?!

To escape the zombie you must roll the dice until you get a specific number. If you fail to get it then record the highest possible as close to the number. When in the same place as the zombie, the lowest number is bitten. Bitten twice and you become part of the zombie hoard chasing your friends for their sweet brains!

The estate's residents went mad during the 1906 incident in the old town of Hallux, none were recovered. Margaret Ferne escaped the asylum just prior to the exodus of the town. While being treated she was diagnosed with a sever case of sarcophagy and insisted she needed to get home to feed her hoard.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Yggdrasill
description:
Yggdrasill A game for 2 players set up in Nordic setting and based on Nordic mythology, where one side (good gods of Asgard and vikings) try to eliminate the bad guys (evil gods and monsters) by defeating a giant snake Jormungard living in the crown of the Yggdrasill tree.

In the beginning, the good side can play only with 12 vikings, who are not too powerful. Their task is to send the message to the gods of Asgard to ask them for help in the war with evil forces. They can do it by either building the ships and sailing to Asgard, or by killing one of evil monsters (Trwyth), after which, they will be allowed to go through the stone forest and reach Asgard. Evil side, of course, tries to prevent it from happening, but with slick tactics, vikings are able to achieve it. And this is when the real fun begins. With the help of almost 20 gods, the good side begins an even battle.

The evil gods and monsters try to chase and eliminate the good gods and vikings, to prevent them from reaching Yggdrasill. the tree on which Jormungard the snake lives. If the good manage to kill it,they win. If the evil, eliminate all good ones, they win.
Every character in the game has 2 traits: strength and magic power + some of them, are able to use spells. Duels are, unfortunately simple, you choose either strength or magic, roll a die and add the result to the chosen trait. The higher result denotes the winner. After the 1st wounded the character's token is flipped and remains wounded until healed (successful die roll)or attacked and wounded again, which is the end for a given character.

The game is played on a huge board, divided into lands. There are seas, rivers, mountains, forests and places to explore, where magic items can be found. Characters can also learn spells in magic schools.

There are also event cards, drawn at the beginning of a new round.
The game, though simple, and rather visually not too attractive, is a lot of fun to play. Because of the size of the board and numerous charters, it is never played the same way. The good may have many possible routes to get to Yggdrasill, and the abilities (spells) of some of their mightiest gods, can change a hopeless situation.
If one changed the rules of battling, made a new colorful board and substitute cardboard tokens with plastic figures, the game would be a hit.

name: Table Air Combat: Spitfire V
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Spitfire V, which was was the most-produced variant and considered by many to be the definitive Spitfire. Compared to the Spitfire II, The Spitfire V has heavier armement and much greater speed, as the cost of some maneuverability. This Spitfire is in desert camouflage, perfect for battles in the Mediterranean theater.

name: Table Air Combat: TBF-1 Avenger
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the TBF-1C Avenger. Also known as the TBM, Avengers were effective torpedo bombers in the Pacific.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower – Battlemage
description: A promo additional character card given as a preorder bonus from Games Workshop webstore.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Federation & Empire: Minor Empires
description:
From the publisher:

New Empires! New Ships! New Tactics! New Scenarios!

For years, players have wondered what effect the Lyran Democratic Republic, the Vudar Enclave, and the Seltorian Tribunal would have had on the General War. Wonder no longer! Play these empires and find out for yourself.

The Lyran Democratic Republic is more than just a renegade province of the Lyran Star Empire. It is a vital balance point between the Lyrans and Hydrans. In Wall Cloud, find out what would have happened had the LDR reunited with the Lyrans.

The Vudar Enclave has far different than the Klingons tricked the Federation into believing, but it was still a player in the final years of the General War. They locked up territory in a "neutral" enclave that was secretly much closer to the Klingon Empire than thought. Find out about "The Hole," containing a secret shipyard and fleet. In Static Fog, the Klingons decide to crush the Vudar. In Electric Storm, the LDR and Vudar decide to carve new empires from old.

The Seltorian Tribunal arrived late in the General War and asked the Klingons for a planet where they could set up a base to attack the Tholians. The Klingons were only too happy to have a new ally – until they discovered the Seltorian secret. In Vortex of Vengeance the Seltorians declare war on the Tholians. In Freak Storm Seltorians, Hydrans, LDR, and Vudar attack the Klingons.

Includes three copies of Countersheet Five, one copy of Countersheet Six, three Depot Charts (one for each of the new empires), and three Fleet Charts (one for each of the new empires).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Project Nos
description:
Project Nos is a real time dice drag race that attempts to capture the high performance rush of street racing.

1-4 Players start the game with a car and 3 dice and modify their cars by selecting modification cards and taking the associated dice.

A six card track is laid out and, on go, players roll two dice at a time trying to match the number on the track. Once a number matches, player places it in their space on the track card and grabs a new dice.

First player to complete the track wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Grim Heroes
description:
"To the ramparts! Show no quarter! For none shall be given."

Grim Heroes was scheduled to be the first game to implement the DiceQuest game system as used in the games, Ancient Terrible Things (2014), Konja (2017) and Ancient Terrible Things: Reawakened (2023).
Grim Heroes remained in development until 2012, at which time Dicequest game system was implemented instead in the game, Ancient Terrible Things.
An advertising card featuring Grim Heroes is included in the first edition of Ancient Terrible Things, with the intention of the game's eventual release after Snowblind: Race for Pole (2015), and the game to be the second to use the Dicequest system. Ultimately, Dicequest Version 2 was published as the 2-player-only game, Konja (2017), and Dicequest Version 3 in the game, Ancient Terrible Things:Reawakened (2023)'

—description from the publisher

name: The Dragon Games
description:
The Dragon Games is a collection of four events all using the specially designed Dragon cards. Each card describes a unique dragon, with a name, colour, gender, age, strength, height, breath-type, behaviour and number of horns. There are also 12 Attribute cards, used in two of the games, 36 cardboard connectors, used in one game, and 12 gold medals, for scoring. The four games each take about 10 minutes, and use different skills.
The first event, formations, has players racing to put their dragons in piles or in order, depending on the attribute shown on the randomly produced Attribute card.
Matches is the second event. Players look for things in common between two randomly chosen dragon cards, and use that to take an attribute card from the pool or another player, in order to get the required number of attribute cards.
The third event, Connections, incorporates connectors with the Dragon cards for a strategic domino type game, which uses comparisons to link or lock out other dragons.
The final event, Battle, is the simplest, as players take turns to decide which attribute wins a battle between randomly selected cards.
Cards are placed on the table, so there is no need to hold a hand of cards.
The events are easy to play and help practice mathematics skills.

name: 3D Pawn
description:
3D Pawn is like a simple 3 dimensional chess, played around a 3 by 3 square cube just using pawns.
Players take turns (starting with white) to move a piece. Pawns can be moved forward and sideways but not backward. Pawns can also take diagonally. If a pawn is on its starting side, it can be moved twice in the same direction.
Goal: players aim to win by getting one of their pawns onto their oponent's side without being immediately taken.
The bag contains a wooden cube to play around, and 9 magnetic pieces of each colour, which stick to the cube. An instruction sheet is also included.

name: Robotech RPG Tactics: Zentraedi Glaug Command Pack
description:
From the publisher:

Prepare for invasion with Robotech RPG Tactics! Take command of the deadly mecha fighting forces of the United Earth Defense Force, the Zentraedi Armada, or the Malcontents. Robotech RPG Tactics is an epic 6mm scale battle game where players control whole armies from the Robotech universe. Take to the battlefield to crush your friends in a dynamic tactical game where the outcome is always hanging in the balance. This diverse pack provides your Zentraedi forces with greater tactical capabilities; three figures total. 1 Glaug Officer's Battlepod - the fast and deadly mecha of Zentraedi field leaders., 1 Quel-Regult Scout Battlepod - the stealthy eyes and ears of your Zentraedi battle force; electronic warfare capabilities., and 1 Quel-Gulnau Recovery Pod - enhances the Glaug's ability to bring in Battlepod reinforcements. Note: This figure has NEVER before been offered by any company. Plastic game pieces. Assembly and painting required.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Kumiliki: The Property Game
description: Kimiliki is an Inland made monopoly-like game with some rule changes. It is made in Kenya with handmade carved soapstone figures, and the upgraded version includes carved hut houses and hotels instead of plastic. The board pictures the region in which the game is played. Like all other games in this genre, you will roll dice to move and purchase properties as you go; building upon them every round to start collecting more money from your fellow players.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Groot
description:
Description from the publisher:
The Guardians of the Galaxy is a group of cosmic adventurers led by Star-Lord to protect the universe from threats all across space. The team also includes Drax, Gamora, Groot and Rocket Raccoon! The team are good guys, though sometime not that good. Groot is an unknown tree like creature that only talks with Rocket Raccoon through 3 words, "I am Groot".
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Nova
description:
Description from the publisher:

Richard Rider is a middle-class man from the United States who became a member of the Nova Corps for which he gained superhuman abilities including enhanced strength, flight and resistance to injury. Calling himself "Nova," Rider is an inter-galactic peace-keeper. He is empowered by the Nova Force.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Pike & Shotte: For King and the Country
description:
Pike & Shotte is a game of tabletop battles with model soldiers set in the 17th century. Pit your wits and tactics against your friends as armies clash in massed combat.

This starter set gives you the splendid Pike & Shotte rulebook and two starter forces field them as Royalist or Parliamentarian in the English Civil Wars or as one of the many protagonists involved in the immense Thirty Years War.

This boxed game is only the beginning, as you battle all-comers and reinforce your army further in the pursuit of glory...

Pike & Shotte - For King & Country contains:

Full-colour 208-page hardback (Pike & Shotte Core Rulebook)

82 multi-pose, hard plastic 28mm miniatures:

58 pike and musket including command
12 Cavalry
12 infantry with Firelocks
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Holy Roman Empire Expansion 1: Battles of the Thirty Years War
description:
Description from the publisher:

Holy Roman Empire is a strategic game, and while conflict is normally resolved abstractly by the throw of some dice, an Optional Tactical Combat system is included for those players seeking to add a bit more flavor to the game. This game-within-the-game system can also be used to re-fight some of the great battles of the Thirty Years War. The 12 scenarios included in this pack are not in-depth simulations of those epic contests; they are instead a collection of quick mini-games that are meant to allow players a glimpse into the way battles of that era were fought. As in any war, not every battle is an even contest; some are puzzles where players take turns commanding each army to see which of them can do better as the disadvantaged side--or through luck and skill turn an historic defeat into a surprising victory.

The 12 battles in this pack are presented in chronological order, and if fought in that order will give players a brief running history of the war. Contestants may choose to play the games in any order, may select favorite battles to re-fight or may make a campaign by taking each battle in turn, with one player always taking the Imperial side in each contest and then tallying the results of each battle to reach a final score of wins and losses.

Players resolve the battles in this booklet utilizing the Optional Tactical Combat systems as found in the Holy Roman Empire game. Additional options for "Create Your Own" Battle scenarios are also included in those rules.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Death Masque
description:
Description from the publisher:

Eldrad Ulthran, the most skilled of the Eldar’s prophets and one of the most powerful psykers in the galaxy, whose existence has spanned ten millennia, has put into motion a series of incredible events. Descending upon the planet of Port Demesnus, his intention is to seize its crystal moon, Coheria, for a forbidden ritual capable of awakening a slumbering god…

Watch Captain Artemis – born into violence, recruited into the Mortifactors, his talents in the art of detecting and slaying the merest hint of xenos taint saw him plucked from his Chapter and sworn to lead Kill Teams of the Deathwatch. The first to respond to the distress signals from Port Demesnus, and the first to realise Eldrad Ulthran’s motives, he has diverted his strike force to Coheria.

The battle for this moon, and the events that transpire, will send shocking reverberations throughout the galaxy.

In the Death Masque boxed game, you’ll find two forces of Citadel miniatures with which to re-create the tense battles set upon Port Demesnus. The included booklet contains 3 Echoes of War missions which allow you to play through the story, with full background explaining each battle. Full rules for all the miniatures are included, with an exclusive formation for both forces. Also included is a 208-page softback copy of Warhammer 40,000: The Rules with an exclusive Watch Captain Artemis cover.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: The Fall: 1453
description:
A cooperative survival game where players take the role of an elite group of men, where you need to take an objective and escape from a city that falls into enemy hands after a long siege. Time is running out, you will manage to escape safe from the hordes of enemies as they enter the city or you will die fighting.

Gameplay
Players take the role of a bodyguard of the king which should, in cooperation with the other players must find and save persons or objects from destruction. The game is played on tiles (with squares) representing, streets and alleys of the castle or the city. Players should move through the streets and trying to overtake obstacles and people trying to escape. But the greatest risk is the enemies that come from unexpected places and you need to engage with them or avoid them. Each player has a personal dashboard which will have places for extra weapons and armor that finds killing enemies, a personal special skill, a personal special action, a blood line that places his wounds and an action track that calculates his priority in game. Players in each round must take some actions. This actions comes from action cards that players draw a number of cards in each round. With these cards and with their personal special action, they can move, or fight with the enemy, or defend themselves, or make same special actions. Enemies and residents coming into the game with token form. The Tokens are moved according to some cards into the tiles of the game, until they come in line of sigh from players. Then the players draw a card that showing how many and what miniatures replace each token, depending on the threat level that exists in the game. But the tokens can become residents, enemies, elite enemies or warlords. Things can be reversed at any moment because various events occur and affects the development of the game. The time is running and the number of enemies and residents increases, the streets filled with people, ruins, obstacles and bloodthirsty enemies. But things get more complicated because one of the players is the traitor who waits for the right moment to appear and overturn the expectations of his teammates.

Playtest Components
- 12 Tiles for Game board
- 20 Buildings tiles
- 7 Map obstacles
- 14 Random events obstacles
- 10 Entry tokens
- 74 Character counters/figures
- 186 Cards
- 205 Game tokens
- 2 Game trackers (time & priority)
- 4 Player Dashboards, 4 References & 24 Player tokens
- Dices d8 (2), d10 (4) & d12 (2)
- 1 Rulebook
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Monster Melee: The Monster Mashing Card Game
description:
Desciption from the publisher:

Monster Melee is designed to be a simple game, combining the dueling aspect of a classic card game like War with the betting and bluffing elements of Poker. It's quick to learn and can be played anywhere, anytime you have 30 minutes to spare. All you need is some strategy, a flat surface and 2-4 players.​​

The object of the game is simple: have a higher Power Level than your opponent to defeat their Monster and win gold. Earn enough gold, and you win the game.

But watch out! Fix Cards can secretly change up the fight without your opponent knowing until it's too late.

Monster Melee includes 40 unique Monster Cards and 20 unique Fix Cards.

name: Secret Weapons of the Third Reich: Ahnenerbe Expansion
description:
A mini-expansion that introduces several new projects and powerful event cards.

Discover new weapon projects developed or though of by the Germans, such as the Silbervogel (a sort of shuttle), the Himmelsturmer fligh-pack, the Messerchmitt Me-262 and the Me-163 "Komet", the flying-wing bomber of the Horten brothers and more!

This expansion consists of:


a instruction card
6 new project cards
3 new technology cards
8 new event cards
2 white cubes
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Latrunculi XXI
description:
Classical Latrunculi (Ludus latrunculorum or the Game of Little Soldiers) was an ancient strategy game played throughout the Roman Empire (27 BC - 1453 AD).

Latrunculi XXI is a variation of the ancient Roman game, expanding on the classical rules and adding new tactics which allow a modern 'XXI' (a.k.a. 21st) century player to force a win on his/her opponent, while minimizing the number of draws or blocked positions.

Latrunculi XXI is played with light and dark pieces, checkers or stones to represent the soldiers, and a 2nd piece to identify the Dux (Leader or King). It can be played in various size boards: 8x8, 10x8 or 12x8.

The objective is to immobilize the opponent's Dux, to stalemate him, or to annihilate his army.

Classical captures (custodial and corner) apply to Latrunculi XXI in addition to the following capturing tactics:

Push and Crush Attack
Flank Attack
Phalanx Attack


Latrunculi XXI has rules that limit the Duxes' mobility when they are in combat, as well as locked soldiers (similar to blocked pawns in Chess) which strategically limit the pieces mobility to increase capture opportunities, and to minimize the chances of draws.

http://www.chessvariants.com/invention/latrunculi-petteia-xx...

name: WCW Nitro Trading Card Game: Hardcore Expansion
description:
This expansion adds 114 cards to the original game, including 8 new wrestlers:

"Big Poppa Pump" Scott Steiner
Brian Knobbs
Hollywood Hogan
Norman Smiley
Ric Flair
Tank Abbott
Terry Funk
Vampiro

The focus of this set was allowing players to take the action outside the ring and perform special moves that could only be used on the arena floor.

Game description from the back of the Slap Pack booster box:
Get in the Ring! The high-flying action of the WCW Nitro trading card game spills out of the ring and into your hands with the Hardcore expansion set! Grab that folding chair and jump into the melee with the newest hardcore Wrestler cards. Create crushing decks with all-stars Funk and Vampiro or ring monsters like Tank Abbott and Big Poppa Pump. Collect them all and watch your opponent beg for mercy.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: You've Been Shaved
description: You've Been Shaved is a fast paced up to 6 player card game for all hipsters, hipster haters, and the family. Trust us kids love it. The purpose of the game is to be the remaining player still with beard intact. The joy of the game is to debeard all the other players using cards such as Beard infestation, beard itch, and the killer dark arts razer card.

name: CoolCats & AssHats: Extreme NSFW Booster Pack
description:
The CoolCats & AssHats Extreme NSFW booster pack is a perfect addition for when you really want to dial up the party.

Cards are uniquely designed so players know they're in for an extremely aggressive task.

Just mix it in with your regular CoolCats & AssHats game and check your morals at the door.

Don't worry, you probably won't remember tomorrow anyway.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Storytelling, Take That, Voting

name: Words Against Morality
description:
Adult party game sure to add color and vulgarity to your next game night. Gameplay is as easy as A-B-C. One player poses a question using a Black Card, and the remaining players respond with their most amusing White Card.

Object: Create the most unique, hilarious, and downright devilish combinations of black and white cards. Setup: Each player is dealt ten white cards.

Gameplay: One player (the judge) flips over a black card. The remaining players place their most hilarious white card facedown in a pile. The judge reads the combinations aloud, and awards the black card to the player with their favorite match. Rotate the judge each round.

Winning: After all cards have been played, the player with the most black cards is the winner.

4-Volume set. Includes 440 cards, 120 Black Cards and 320 White Cards.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: La Grande Armee 1805
description:
La Grande Armee covers Napoleon's 1805 campaign in Germany-Austria, a campaign which culminated in his great victory of Austerlitz over the combined Austro-Russian armies.

The new La Grande Armee wargame system recreates entire Napoleonic campaigns using a small number of pieces, largely corps and armies. Each player has a set of cards which bring in their army's special capabilities as well as random events. The game contains standard rules that apply to all games in the series and special rules that apply specifically to the campaign being explored.

Components:
1 x 17x22 Map/Playing Surface
1 x Sheet of Die-Cut, Mounted, Full-Color Playing Pieces
1 x Set of Playing Cards
1 x Book of Rules
1 x Player Aid Card

Solitaire Suitability: 7 out of 10
Complexity: 5 out of 10

name: Monopoly: University of Michigan
description:
Object. Buy Sell! "Pass GO and Collect $200!" Or"Go directly to Jail!" All the fun and excitement of Parker Brothers classic real estate trading game is here in this University of Michigan Edition. Buy famous alumni and coaches, utility companies, and properties of all types including President Gerald Ford and Coach Bo Schembechler. Increase the value of your properties by adding houses and hotels. Amass the greatest fortune in money and property and you're the winner!

Equipment. Game board 10 tokens Title Deed cards Package of playing money Chance cards. Community Chest cards Package of houses Package of hotels. A pair of dice
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Куба: Эль Президенте
description:
Cuba and El Presidente released together in one box.


Game description from the publisher:

Cuba prior to the revolution: Under turbulent circumstances, the villages of the island strive for independent wealth and influence. Who can buy and sell his products and goods on the domestic market profitably or take in the most on the trading ships? Who can send the right delegate to parliament in order to influence the government legislative process, or erect distilleries, hotels and banks at the right moment to the benefit of his village?

Whoever has accumulated the most victory points in Cuba by the end of the game wins. Players earn victory points by shipping merchandise from the harbor, but also by erecting and using buildings, and by abiding by the law.

El Presidente:

The expansion to be used by 'Cuba'. An additional game board, more and different ship cards, laws, buildings, new character cards to be used with the other characters, and a whole new phenomenon: Cuba - the Arrival of the President!
In their turn, players may take and play a character from the 'El Presidente' board: the worker, dancer, attorney, warden, revolutionary or musician. They all have different effects.
The worker puts your goods into the warehouse; all your goods are safe this turn. The revolutionary gives you one victory point, the musician two money. The player with the dancer card becomes immediately the new start player; the old rule for determining the new start player is no longer in effect.

With the attorney a player may use a building even when his supervisor is not on the row or column of this building, paying one money. The warden may change two adjacent ships in position. There are two mule cards being used when playing with less than five players; these cards cannot be chosen. When all players have chosen a card, the car of the president moves to the position of the remaining card; remember, there are six cards that each turn are shuffled and randomly placed.

Under each card on the board are symbols that come into effect when the car of the president stops there. The first makes all law proposals go into effect; the second makes it possible to move the supervisor anywhere on a player board in the next round. The next symbol also is in effect for the next round: it allows you to pay one money and overbuild a building with another; the difference in resources must be paid as well. One symbol makes the leading player to go back two points on the score track; another allows players to purchase market wares at discount prices. Players must now not only consider which role they would like to take, but also which position they likely want to be visited by the president.

There are 2 additional laws in each of the four categories, so that the game can now last up to 8 rounds instead of just 6.

name: Pukes and Staggers
description: This is a basic roll-and-move game -- similar to Snakes and Ladders -- where the goal is simply to be the first to reach the finish space. The game board consists of a series of spaces, each requiring the player to perform some drinking-related task. "Staggers" allow the player to skip spaces ahead (like the Ladders) and "Pukes" cause the player to lose ground (like the Snakes). Due to the increasing level of intoxication of the players during the game, there is no guarantee that all (or any) players will make it to the final space.

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Pauper Soldiers
description:
Disinherited samurai lord Senzo ‘the Thorn’ leads a group of pauper soldiers, using his legendary skills with the bow in the hope of winning back his fortune.

Once again, the metal straw hat heads that come in this set completely change the feel of the models, making them less military and more like peasants (especially if you leave off the back-banners).

Remember each expansion set contains one type of plastic sprue, but there’s nothing to stop you mixing the heads around on bodies from other sets if you want to create a more balanced force.

The samurai archer character from this set is backed up with some useful shooty skills, plus other skills and quests that reflect him being more at home with the local peasants than most noble-born samurai.

Contains:

18 unique cards - including One with the Target and Hidden Marksman
1 metal character model - Senzo ‘the Thorn’
10 plastic figures
10 metal 'straw hat' heads
3 mulltibases
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: VooDoo: Kickstarter Bonus Cards
description:
10 bonus Permanent Curse cards.

A stretch goal from the 2016 Kickstarter Campaign.

Originally contained in a plastic zip baggie.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: PeltaPeeps
description:
A fast paced boardless board game – PeltaPeeps is a game for 2 to 6 players. The play combines negotiation and placement. Players take turns placing new game pieces and making connections in the play area. They may also flip or move another player's piece in each turn. Flipping a piece down lowers its scoring. However, a piece that has been flipped face down, may also be flipped up with some help from other Peeps, restoring its value. A piece may also be moved from one area to another. A player may never move their own pieces, and a piece may only be moved if it will not cause a discontinuity in the connected pieces already in play. The player with the most points counted up at the end of the game wins.

Each player has either 8 or 16 unique pieces per team color, with up to 6 colors, depending on game version. The versions are- PeltaPeeps For Two (2 player) or PeltaPeeps Core and Full games, both of which are 4 to 6 player.

Play revolves around the unique connections each piece can make- blocking pieces preventing other players from making favorable connections, leaving open connections that allow you to connect to your own color (giving you bonus points) or creating hubs for future plays. Different playing pieces have varying point values based on being face up or down and who they are connect to as well as what they are. Play continues until no more valid placements are available.

The game combines bluff and negotiation, as players get bonus points for connecting to their own color, but cannot directly reverse the moves other players make against their pieces. Even if players choose not to discuss their moves, the moves, themselves act as a form of diplomacy, potentially forcing other players to react to 3rd parties as play progresses.

The pieces started out as wood, but are now coming to market as UV printed and laser cut Acrylic.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Bastogne or Bust (Designer's Edition)
description:
Bastogne or Bust is a single-map, regimental treatment of the Battle of the Bulge. This is a PLAYER'S wargame! Designed on purpose to be more of a warGAME than a simulation. Referred to affectionately by wargamers as BOB, but the designer prefers the moniker “The World's Finest Bulge Game.” It addresses a number of issues common to most Bulge games. Some of these issues include:

OFF BOARD MOVEMENT CHART [what happens to all those pieces that 'exit the map?']
STACKING POINTS [one of the greatest mechanics of all time - why don't designers use it more often?]
COMMAND & CONTROL [divisional bonuses for unit cohesiveness]
SUPPLY DIFFERENCES [different effects on ALLIES vs GERMANS]
INITIATIVE [essentially, the 5-1 column on the CRT is gone]
NO OVERRUN [squads held crossroads against regiments]
NO WEATHER RULES [weather is reflected in air support]
VON DER HYDTE [ALWAYS gets on the board]
STREAMLINED PLAY [I don't need water allocation points]


So what can you expect to be different in this new Designer's Edition?

about 8 counters will receive Road Bonus Movement status
a rule addition allows all Combat Engineer units to repair/construct bridges
one ‘errata’ change line within the rulebook
An all new DEC 10 Tournament Scenario
30-40 additional counters
new German OOA
new Allied OOA
new Off Board Movement Chart with new Turn Record Track. One aspect being explored is to incorporate much of the Off Board Movement Chart onto the sides of the game board, rather similar to Off Map Displays used in Market-Garden games such as Hell’s Highway.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Heroes Cove: Apothecary
description:
This adds an additional Shop and Quests to go along with it!
There is also a Race and Class to add more unique ways to play.

Syrenall has made Heroes Cove her home and she is trying to help young Adventurers (Players) become the best. In order to gain notoriety Adventurers risk it all. Syrenall is there to provide needed potions, for a price of course.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Pirates
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Trading

name: Heroes Cove: Clockworks
description:
Adds a Shop and Quests to go with it.
Adds a new Race and Class to expand Heroes Cove.

Demmr’th has decided to open up his own shop. He was once known as a locksmith, but due to some misunderstandings that caused the death of many a Knight, Demmr’th had promised to never work as a locksmith again... but he didn't say anything about working as a Clocksmith!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Pirates
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleCON: Karin Brandtford – Terror of Kor Karoli Costume
description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Karin & Jager from BattleCON: Devastation of Indines.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Rotfather: Intrigas
description:
Translated Box Text: In The Rotfather universe, Rats, Cockroaches, Spiders and other disgusting beings vie for control of New York's sewers through Sugar smuggling. Defeat your opponents using bluff and cold blood to attack and steal them. Form alliances between characters to perform more powerful actions and doubt the actions of your opponents. For in this game, everyone may be lying.

Each player must try to eliminate all others. For this they can use the actions of the 6 available characters, even if he does not have such cards, paying the cost of the actions in clods of sugar. Just as players can bluff about owning a card, others can also doubt at any time.

Besides adding a sixth character, the important differences from the Coup, are the different abilities and especially the possibility of making pairs of characters and thus performing stronger actions. Some basic rules are also different, such as the possibility of paying clods of sugar to exchange a card.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Escabel
description:
Escabel is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.



DefinitionsA stack is a set of one or more pieces piled onto each other on the same point. The color of a stack is the color of its topmost piece, which denotes its owner. The height of a stack is the number of pieces in it.

A crosscut is a 2x2 area containing two diagonally adjacent black stacks and two diagonally adjacent white stacks.

Two like-colored stacks are considered connected in the following cases:


They are orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to each other and not part of the same crosscut.



They are both part of the same crosscut and higher than the lower enemy stack in that crosscut.




PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform exactly one of these actions:


Place a piece of your color on an empty point.



Move the topmost piece of a stack of your color onto an orthogonally adjacent enemy stack, provided that, before the move, the heights of both stacks are the same. Then, place a piece of your opponent's color onto the stack from which you just moved your piece.


You win if, at the start of your turn, there is a chain of connected stacks of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color. You lose if, at the start of your turn, your opponent has such a chain and you have no moves available.

To make the game fair, White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.



NotesFor a variant, allow piece movement only between stacks that belong to the same crosscut, or start the game with the board fully covered with black and white pieces in a checkered pattern. On odd-sized boards, the two possible checkered setups may be used.

Escabel was inspired by Matteo Perlini's Consta.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Core Worlds: Champion of Ra
description:
This single card expansion for Core Worlds was a physical reward for backing the Core Worlds Digital Kickstarter at the $50 USD level.

Shuffle this Prestige Card into the 5th Sector deck at the start of the game.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Axes and Allies
description:
Axes and Allies is a simple dice game for 2-6 players. One axe and 1D6 are required for each player.

During his turn a player rolls his dice. The number obtained is the power of his axe for that turn only. The player than has the choice between attacking another player or declaring an alliance.

If he chooses to attack, he selects a victim (he may not choose to attack an ally) and rolls his dice. If the roll is less than the power of the axe the attack is successful and the player is eliminated. If the roll is equal to or greater than the power of the axe the attack fails.

If he chooses to declare an alliance he may ally with any one other player. The individual chosen has no choice in the matter. Allied players may not attack each other.

If at any point a player rolls a one for power all players' past alliances are voided. If a player is allied with all other players, that player's turn is limited to a power roll (to see if they roll a one).

The last player to execute a turn is considered the winner.

name: Ynavi
description:
Ynavi is a game where you play for victory points, and there are several mechanics to attain them. the main way is by scoring 'drakkars', the viking ship. Each drakkar needs to be filled with cubes of specific color in order to be scored, each scored earns 4 victory points.

At the beginning of each turn, the first player rolls 5 dice of different color each with 2 sides of values 1 through 3, each of which correlates to a different color of cubes and pile of cards. Then, players rotate in choosing a die. For a selected die, the player can either take a number of cubes equal to the number on the die, or draw that many cards from the pile, but may only keep one and discard the rest.

The 5 piles are as follows: blue, green, red, black, and yellow. Blue cards are equipments that stay with you for the rest of the game. Green cards are 'chiefs' that need to be filled with cubes to use, and can do powerful things, and stay for the rest of the game. Filling chiefs with cubes earns a victory point, failing to do so loses a victory point. Red cards are one time spells that can do cool things. Black cards are negative statuses you assign to an opponent that they may only remove by filling it with cubes. Lastly, yellow are quests, that if satisfied in the scoring phase at the end earn victory points.

Once an option is chosen, a player may use a card if applicable, or place their cubes on their drakkars, chief, or black card inflicted on him/her. Then turn rotates until all players go and all dice are chosen (first player gets 2 turns each round), and then the first player token rotates and a new round begins. The game ends when either a pile of cards or cubes remains empty at the end of the round.

name: Railway Rivals Map NW: North Wales
description:
An expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. It has been sold at various conventions.

The map covers Wales from Holyhead to Aberystwyth, with one hex representing approximately 3.5 kilometers.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: SLAM
description:
SLAM is a tabletop simulation of the full-contact, high-flying sport of slamball. In SLAM, each minute of the game will feature an exchange and a highlight. The exchange streamlines back-and-forth play producing a baseline score for each team. The highlight then focuses in on the talents and play style of the individual players.

SLAM is primarily intended as a solitaire gaming experience, although it can be enjoyed by two, with each person coaching their own team. A single game should take about 20 minutes once you are familiar with the game.

name: Impact: A Foresight Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Impact is a foresight game. It is designed to help people imagine and think critically about the future. Players take on the roles of distinct characters, each with their own 'Job of the Future' and unique set of preferred future conditions. They compete to create a world where their future job is relevant and secure.

Description from the publisher:

Up to 5 players choose from 10 "Jobs of the Future" with differing back stories and victory conditions. They draw and play cards from a deck of 100 Impact Cards that relate current technological trends to future conditions. They assess and discuss the likely primary and secondary impacts of each card on one or more of 10 different "domains" (e.g. Manufacturing, Energy, Security, Home, Work) and place or remove influence cubes.
There are also Disruption Cards that indicate large-scale or sudden shifts in the system that pose larger challenges to the players.
After each round of play (every player has had one turn), players collect the played cards and generate the "Headline of the Era" from player suggestions.
When a player sees that the number of influence cubes equals or exceeds the win condition on three of the domains specified for their "Job from the Future", they reveal their role and win the game.

This game was originally designed by Idea Couture in collaboration with Policy Horizons Canada, an organization within the Public Service of Canada that examines emerging policy challenges and new ideas and questions posed by trends in technological and social development.

There is not a great deal of strategy or mechanical challenge in this game, but that's not the point; the purpose of the game is to get the players thinking and discussing the possible second-order effects of current developments, using their logic to persuade other players on what other domains could be affected besides the obvious ones.
This game appears to be aimed at wannabe policy analysts, amateur futurologists and soi-disant speculative thinkers generally.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Negotiation, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Second Succession War
description:
By 2821, the "Great Succession War" has ground to a halt, the participants seeking desperate respite and to forge a new peace and hope for mankind. Yet not everyone shares this ideal and soon secret machinations undermine the peace efforts and propel the Inner Sphere into a new round of violence. Soon brother will be set against brother and madness will reign once more: The Second Succession War.

The Second Succession War covers the aftermath of the titanic First Succession War and the Great Houses efforts to survive before the machinations of Conrad Toyama propel them into a new round of blood-letting. Detailing the efforts to build a peace while preparing for a new war, this volume showcases the causes and consequences of the Second Succession War, as well as the politics and stresses between and within the Great Houses.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BrazChess
description:
BrazChess is a Chess-like game that combines in its design several elements found in other games of its kind (like Modern Chatranj, Makruk, Shogi and FIDE Chess) along with brand new ideas to provide a unique experience to the players.

Pieces are weaker than in FIDE Chess, but stronger than in Modern Shatranj and Makruk - so the game fits as another bridge between these games and regular Chess. Even though the game has the same number of pieces that there is in Chess (32), there is a slightly greater variety of them in BrazChess (8 against 6 in Chess). Some of the "parachuting" that occurs in Shogi is present (regarding the movement of Grand Dukes - a promoted Pawn); you'll also find different forms of capturing (suicidal attacks and the Grand Duke's Zone of Control).
