Also present is the concept of passing your turn.

What you need to play it:
In order to play BrazChess, you will need:
A) The rules (see Files);
B) A Modern Chess board (8x8) and Pieces (you'll need to either paint the heads or bases of two Pawns from each side, or use some other Pieces to represent the 2 Lords from each side). Note that the starting position of some pieces (like the Rooks) is different than in regular Chess;
C) 6 different pieces, coins, tokens or even checkers pieces (for the promoted Pawns aka Grand Dukes);
D) 1 tokens to represent Passing;
E) An auxiliary board (the Duchy) or a designated space on the table.

The creation of this game was inspired by Chatranj, Modern Chatranj, Makruk, Shogi, Chess/Orthochess (FIDE Chess) and the book "Encyclopedia of Chess Variants" - by D. B. Pritchard. While it is true that there are several Chess-like games like this in the World, Chess is, itself, a variant of an older game, that was already a variant of an even older game. BrazChess, while definitely a member of the Chess family of games, has many unique features that will certainly deliver a different experience than the other games of its kind.

name: CAPCHA!
description:
The animals have escaped from the zoo, and you want to recapture them before other zookeepers do!

Your goal in CAPCHA! (ペアっと！) is to be the first player to capture either all seven different animals or four animals of the same type. The deck consists of 56 cards, with eight copies of the seven animal types. To play, you have a 3x3 field of animal cards face down on the table. If you reveal an animal that matches a card in hand, you've made a match, can use the special effects of the card, and can keep looking.

You can also make matches on other players' turns, depending on the cards you hold. The 3x3 field of animal cards is replenished at the end of each turn, so keep track of who lies where if you want to be a capture captain.

name: Mech Force: International Defense League
description:
Take on the role of a fearless mech warrior, and defend Earth from invasion!

Build your mech, gain ‘Battle dice’, and inflict massive damage to the enemy. Every successful engagement will earn you Battle Points (BPS), skill cards and resources, allowing you to upgrade your warrior and mech.

But beware, many enemies will be too powerful to take on alone so you’ll need to work with others to defend the planet. But how much and with who is your choice, as a problem shared means half the reward and, more importantly, half the fame. After all, you can’t put the world’s finest mech warriors in the same room and not expect some ‘friendly’ rivalry!

Don’t be too greedy though, if the threat level climbs too high, Earth will be overrun and everyone loses!
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Genies
description: Genies is a bidding game about the world´s most famous scientists. Each player tries to hire scientists in his academy to score in three rankings in eight different disciplines. Therefore the players have to simultaneously make secret offers for five scientists each round. After each second round, there is a new ranking. Action cards can give the players special incentives concerning the profile of their academy. After the third ranking the player who has scored the most points in all rankings combined wins the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Twin Play Classics: Monopoly and Scrabble
description:
"Two of the world's favorite family games, Monopoly and Scrabble, in an beautiful boxed set."

These board games were a combination of two popular classic games contained in a premium wooden box, with the idea that they would grace a coffee table. The boards of each paired game were on each other's flip side. The case came with a brass plate and was sometimes called The Collector's Edition. It was marketed as a game that would "a great gift" or "part of your family's collection".
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Classic BattleTech: Blake Ascending
description:
The Early Years of the Jihad

November 3067 saw the culmination of work two centuries in the making, work begun by Primus Conrad Toyama of ComStar, successor to Jerome Blake and the man responsible for single-handedly turning ComStar into a pseudo-religious organization with a vision: to lead mankind to the light...by any means necessary.
When the Star League self-destructs, a shadowy power behind the fanatical Word of Blake pulls the strings taut in righteous anger, launching a war to bring humanity to its knees. Confusion reigns, and each faction finds itself isolated amid its own turmoil. Yet as a new decade dawns, glimpses of the greater whole begin to appear through the dark clouds. The true battle has only just begun.

Blake Ascending: A Jihad Compilation is an omnibus reprint of Dawn of the Jihad and Jihad Hot Spots: 3070; the first two sourcebooks in the seminal Jihad plot line. The Blake Ascending sourcebook shakes the Classic BattleTech universe to its foundation, documenting the opening years from 3067 to 3070. The series of events presented in this book unfold in a rolling format, allowing readers to immerse themselves more directly into the action than ever before. Players of both Classic BattleTech and Classic BattleTech RPG will find framework rules to run any type of campaign in regions through out the Inner Sphere during this chaotic time.

Notes:

Blake Ascending is a reprint of Dawn of the Jihad and Jihad Hot Spots: 3070, in one volume. Except for errata, no changes have been made to the contents.
Editors: whenever you cite Blake Ascending in an article, please also cite the relevant pages from the other two books. In Blake Ascending, the first 160 pages match those of Dawn of the Jihad exactly (ex: BA p. 137 is the same as DotJ p. 137). All pages after p. 160 correspond with Jihad Hot Spots: 3070, when 160 is subtracted from the BA page number (ex: BA p. 200 is the same as JH:3070 p. 40). The reprinted JH:3070 table of contents is on pp. 162-163 in BA.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Fat Turkey
description:
Fat Turkey – The mini card game for 2–9 turkeys.

Farmer Jack is busy trying to fatten up his turkeys ready for market. As one of the turkeys your aim is to try and keep your weight down and avoid being selected.

Turkeys select cards from the food pile which will add to their weight. The food pile also includes cards such as Weight Loss, Poop and Feed Me which will enable turkeys to shed weight and distribute their food cards amongst other turkeys.

When Farmer Jack is selected from the food pile, the round ceases and the fattest turkey is selected for market and taken out of the game.

A strategic little card game played in rounds until only one turkey survives.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Farming, Humor

name: Aventuria: Promokarte "Liebestrank"
description:
Promocard #24 for Aventuria card game. It was available in the "Drachling" box.

It reads:
Wenn der Aktionswurf eines Schergen mit dem Schlagwort "Mensch" einen Angriff anzeigt, darfst du diese Karte abwerfen, um für diesen Angriff ein neues Ziel zu bestimmen, das du angreifen könntest.

Roughly translated:
If a actionroll of an enemy with the keyword "human" shows an attack, you may discard this card from play to choose a new target, which you could attack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: The Darkness Comes
description:
A cooperative adventure game set in the 16bit era. Explore, upgrade and fight back. Games last between 10-40 min depending on the scenario. All you need is 4 dice or use a dice app (many of which can be found for free). The game contains some great little mechanics which include, random placed map tiles, allowing for a different experience each game. The random placement system (RPS) tells you where certain things in the game will appear. Enemies will move around and use special abilities triggered by dice combinations. Light fires to craft potions, by collecting items found in the world you explore. Battle great monsters and bring light into darkness!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Ascension: Valley of the Ancients – Project Beta Promo Card
description:
Promo Card given with pre-orders of Ascension: Valley of the Ancients.

Mechana Construct

Cost: 2 Runes
Value: 2 Honor
Effect: Once per turn, when you play a Mechana Construct (including this one), you may acquire a card with Rune cost less than or equal to that Mechana Construct without paying its cost.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Cats vs Dogs
description:
For years cats and dogs have feuded over who was the greatest pet in the neighborhood. Today they have decided to settle the argument once and for all with an epic battle in the streets!

Cats vs Dogs is a two-player game. One player will control the cats and the other the dogs. Your goal is to take control of the yard friendly to your opponent – or scare them off the board. But be careful, the board is littered with distractions that will make your animals lose focus during the heat of battle. Can you lead your animals to victory?

Each player gets 10 pieces which are set up hidden from the opponent. Players move on a grid showing several houses and a street from the neighborhood. When two pieces occupy the same square, both players will reveal their piece and play a card adding to its value. The player with the highest total will win the battle. However, if you're fighting in a square with a distraction, you total battle strength will be reduced.

The winner is the player who can occupy his opponent's yard on the far side of the board. This is a lighthearted game that plays quickly and is simple enough for young children but with enough strategy to keep their parents entertained as well.

—description from the publisher

Cats vs Dogs by Chris Hansen is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Children's Game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Gameshop Mirrorverse
description:
This is the 7th in a series of Annual Games Unlimited Holiday Games and is the followup to Gameshop Express (2011), Gameshop Workday (2012), Gameshop Gladiators (2013), Gameshop Adventurers (2014), Gameshop Expansions (2015), and Gameshop Collector (2016).

The Mirror Universe employees of Unlimited Games have come to our reality to battle gurus Kylie, Candra and Andrew for control over the Games Unlimited store. Only one game team will reign supreme!

To Win: Place all your active Guru markers (any remaining on the board) on any of the gray marked spaces in your opponent’s home row or remove all of your opponent’s markers.

Setup: Place the board between players and orient it so that one player is facing the 3 Games Unlimited Gurus and the other player their mirror duplicate Gurus from Unlimited Games. The row closest to the player is their home row. Each player receives
3 Guru markers in a matching color. Place these markers,
1 each, on the 3 gray spaces on your home row. Shuffle the
4 Action cards and, without looking at them, flip half the cards over to their opposite side. Deal 1 card face up in front of each player and place 1 card to the side of the board. The 4th card is removed from the game. The first player will be the one who has most recently looked in a mirror.

Play: Each player has an Action card that displays a possible move for any of their markers. There is a 3rd card to one side of the board that cannot be used by either player during their turn. On a player’s turn, they move 1 of their active Guru markers (Note: Active Guru markers are the ones remaining on the board) according to the Action card; they then replace the card they used with the 3rd card. The other player then moves accordingly, and exchanges their card with this new 3rd card - the card the first player just used.
Moving a marker on top of one of an opponent player’s markers removes that opponent’s marker from the game.

A player may stack a maximum of 2 of their pieces on any space except the center space. A stack prevents either stacked piece from being captured.

Moving your active Guru markers to the home row spaces of
your opponent wins you the game.

As long as one of a player’s markers remains on the center space on the board, that player may, during their turn, flip their Action card over to its opposite face to introduce a new move into the game.

Action cards should be oriented with the name of the action at the bottom of the card. Each card shows the player’s marker in the middle of the card and indicates which spaces, either forward, backward or to the side, to which they may move their marker. Below this diagram, the action on the other face of the card is displayed.

—description from the publisher

name: Magik Realm
description:
Magik Realm is a game designed to recreate the experience of the AH classic Magic Realm with newer and simpler game mechanics. It is a completely separate game with its own rules and components. The biggest differences are not needing to choose goals (Victory points are scored) and not needing to record a plan for each day’s actions.

Players choose one or more characters to play and move those characters through the game area of clearings on a 4 x 4 grid of tiles. They will fight and avoid monsters that appear on the map, look for treasure sites and the treasures therein, meet with natives to buy and sell, hire muscle, and take on quests. They gain Victory Points by discovering treasure sites, treasure, killing monsters, fulfilling quests, and learning new spells.

The game lasts thirty days. Characters can perform a certain number of actions each day based on their current health. The actions include: Move, Sneak, Search, Parlay, Rest, Magic, and Combat. Every two days, an Occurrence chart is used to randomly determine which monsters and natives appear on the map and which ones leave. At the end of the thirty days, characters add up the Victory Points they scored and a winner is determined.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Onium
description:
Nanoadaptation of Pentaquark.


An even smaller quantum solo game.

Onium is a 6-card solitaire game in which the player tries to gather the requested data on an element called onium from a particle collider.

The game proceeds in a sequence of attempts. During each attempt, the player will roll a black and a white die (and if possible an additional scattered die). If the die-roll seems unsuitable, the roll may be discarded by scattering the dice. This can be done only a limited number of times.

The player may alter the results with special abilities, if these are charged up. After that, the dice are assigned to their respective detectors (depending on die color and number).

Dice of opposite color in the same detector annihilate. If there are dice of opposite color and the same number in detectors, these will form onium (and be removed). The player may optionally remove a set of dice to charge a special ability.

The game is lost if the player exceeds a given amount of annihilations or onium, or if they don't have enough dice for another attempt. The player wins by recording the required amount of onium.


Released in the November 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Flapjacks & Sasquatches: Promo Pack
description:
This is a promo pack usually obtained at conventions.

Cards include.

Beard Envy..
But we have Beer!
Camp Foreman
"I'm Thirsty, eh!"
Lucette
That's NOT Jimmy!
Ultimate

Most of these cards simply get added to the deck. However a few have special rules.

Beard Envy and Lucette should be given to the players listed on the cards before the game starts. Some folks find these two cards can be rather harsh on the starting player when combined but Prolific games thinks they should put on their big boy pants and earn that beard they were so proud of before these cards.

name: ブックメイカーズ (BOOK MAKERS)
description:
Publisher's summary
週刊少年漫画のトーナメント編の優勝キャラを予想し当てる！

User summary
In the game of ブックメイカーズ (BOOK MAKERS), there is a manga, a Japanese comicbook magazine named "Shukan Shonen Boardgame (Weekly Boys' Boardgame)", and a comic strip named "BOOKMAKERS" is the most popular in the magazine. Its story is heating up, and the most climactic event is about to begin: The Tournament Battles!

In this game, players are readers of the manga "BOOKMAKERS". The player who has been most excited at the manga wins the game. The game is published in the same format as 'Weekly Shonen Jump', a very popular weekly manga in Japan. The designer is publishing under his own label Ōtsuka seisaku (オオツカ製作) outside of his other work with KUA. The doujin publisher Gyunbuku-ya (ぎゅんぶく屋) is listed for design work on the game, not strictly as the game publisher.

There are nine competitors in the tournament. At the beginning of the game, each player is randomly assigned a competitor as their favorite character. Players take turns placing a competitor to form a tournament bracket. Then players secretly choose who will be the champion of the tournament.

There are eight battles in the tournament. Most of a battle proceeds automatically, and rough probability of victory is calculated easily. But before the battle begins, players have some chances to place a fan letter face-down on a competitor to modify the result toward their favor.

Here are how you get excited (score victory points).
1) You score points when your favorite character wins a battle, and ultimately, you score big points when your favorite character wins the tournament.
2) Each competitor has a destined rival. You score points when your favorite character fights with their destined rival. Win or lose doesn't matter.
3) For each battle, you score points if you have correctly predicted who will win the battle.
4) You score points if you have correctly predicted the champion of the tournament.

The player with the highest total wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Math
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simulation, Voting

name: Field of Mars
description:
Field of Mars was originally intended to function as a 'battle board' for the Lace Wars series, which is 'operational' in scope and normally resolves battles using a combat results table. To add value to the product, Field of Mars has been designed to function as a complete game in its own right, suitable for playing both random and historical battles devised by the players. No knowledge of the Lace Wars rules is required. (Caveat: the game does not include any historical scenarios.) With some modification it could also be used to play battles generated by different game systems.

The game uses a gridded mat and terrain tiles to create a wide variety of battlefields. The players' forces are deployed on this mat in stacks of counters called 'wings'; the wings are the 'manoeuvre unit' in this system. The players issue orders to their wings by rolling dice and distributing them among their wings. The more pips a die has showing, the greater the number of tactical choices its wing has. Once orders have been issued, a series of discrete steps is followed, each permitting the execution of one particular kind of action (for example: Advance, Fire, Assault). In each step the players decide whether any eligible wings (those with the correct die value) will execute that action. The object of the game is to render opposing wings hors de combat. In the context of the game this means the wing is removed from play. This is accomplished through artillery and musket fire, cavalry charges, and infantry assaults. The first side to go over the required number of hors de combat wings loses the battle.

The rules include instructions for creating random battles using the counters provided and also instructions on how to use the game to fight battles generated within the Lace Wars system.

Components
1) One large play mat, called the Battlefield.
2) 360 die cut counters representing various generic forces, plus markers. Scale is variable.
3) 60 terrain tiles
4) Rules, charts, and tables.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Market Garden
description:
For Bolt Action players Market Garden has it all – daring attacks, determined resistance and heroic last stands by American, British, German and Polish troops ranging from elite veteran paratroopers to novices and from obsolete armoured cars to King Tiger tanks.

This volume covers a very short space of time compared to other Bolt Action campaign books – just a matter of nine days in September 1944 – and is focused on a much smaller geographical area; a single narrow route through the Netherlands rather than a broad sweep of very variable terrain across several countries.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Osprey Games, Osprey Publishing, Warlord Games

name: Mage Wars: Eeker Promo Card
description:
DriveTru Kickstarter promo card

Creature. Animal
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 2d6 Sword & Sorcery
description:
2d6 Sword & Sorcery is a fast-playing "beer and pretzels" miniatures game of fantasy confrontations. Each figure represents either a player-controlled star or a grunt whose actions are wholly determined by the game mechanics. It's possible to play solo against "AI-controlled" grunts or against other players' stars, with our without grunt allies.

Miniatures are further classified by reputation (essentially skill/quality), class (shooter, close combatant, or spellcaster), and armour class. The game is well suited for campaign play.

name: Konflikt '47: Defiance
description:
Delving deeper into the weird world of Konflikt '47, this supplement presents a range of new material for the game, including:

- New units: Options for troops and technology that can be added to the armies presented in the rulebook.
- Special characters: Field the best of the best, elite men and women who may single handedly be the crucial element between victory and defeat.
- New background: The history of the world of Konflikt '47 is detailed in more depth.
- New rules: All-new means of waging war, including material previously published online.

-From the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Picky Eater
description:
Play food and topping cards on your own plate or on your opponents' plates. Haggis? Here...you enjoy that. Form bonus-point combos to maximize your score. Ketchup on ice cream? Yep. Use over a dozen different action cards to feed the dog, steal a pile from another player's plate, initiate a food fight, and many more. Or use one of your turn's actions to draw a new card from the buffet. Great for strategy fans and point maximizers, yet accessible and quick enough for kids. And everybody enjoys the hilariously disgusting food combos that get created. Picky Eater is played over three meals (rounds), with each meal lasting until there's only one player remaining with any empty spots on their plate. Whoever has accumulated the most points at the end of the third meal wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Star Trek: The Dice Game – Away Team
description:
No Star Trek episode is complete without a perilous away team mission.

The Star Trek: The Dice Game – Away Team expansion introduces a challenging new away team side board and mechanics as well as new personnel, equipment and tactics.

You'll need every advantage you can get; Starfleet has tough new missions for you, and there are new dangers waiting for you in deep space and on strange new worlds.

This expansion adds:


An Away Team side board: following the Transport action you will assign Crew Dice from your pool to this board, and use them separately from those on the ship to complete Mission stages, overcome Events and unlock Developments.



The division of Development cards into Equipment, Tactics and Personnel, and mechanisms which utilize these distinctions



The division of Event cards into Ship and non-ship. Away teams can only overcome non-ship Events.



16 new Event cards



8 new Mission cards



8 new Development cards (including Chekov and Sulu!)


-description from designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift – The Sabotage
description:
Descending lower into the dungeon, Neshilim and Raven noticed that a faint buzzing sound, which could be heard near the stairs going down, had suddenly stopped. Below them an even blacker darkness than normal greeted them...

This is a Hard scenario which adds a clever timer mechanic and multiple objectives. Thanks to the timer the pressure is on in this scenario. Can you save the Victims in time and make it out alive yourself?

This scenario was first released as a pdf promo to raise funds for the Uganda Gamechangers project.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: OrcQuest WarPath: Chapter Box – Death Crypt
description:
Death Crypt is a new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With this Campaign Chapter, your heroes will find some good old orc pleasure: crossing the dark corridors of evil dungeons and crypts, haunted by revenants hungry for fresh meat and looking for new souls to join their ranks. There might even be some evil necromancer that possesses the key to a well kept treasure! It all depends whether you are there to smash some skulls or to bring back some treasures.

Revenants are not guided by the same principles as the living. There is no Alert level, nor Patrols. However, if an undead notices a possible prey he will attract others like him, and if you let the undead ranks grow, you will end up overwhelmed. During the Patrol phase, each tomb over the tiles where heroes are can generate undead. And at that point, it's pointless to try to hide… the fresh odour of fresh meat will attract them, wherever you may be.

At the heart of the gloomy crypts, many morbid events may arise. Be careful where you set your feet, spectral hands may get you and hinder your movement. If there's a Necromancer around, his maleficent spells can create several fatal situations. When it's time to draw from the Event cards, your fingers might end up shaking a lot…

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Drop Racers
description:
You are a Drop Racer. Your goal is to be the best racer in the land and get the Great Drop Trophy. But this isn't any normal race. Instead of who can go the fastest or farthest, you are trying to be the first one to earn enough points. To earn points, you must collect special Drops that litter the race track while avoiding the Black Drops. Collect the right Drops, score points, win the trophy. Welcome to Drop Racers.

Drop Racers is a fast, family-friendly game about flicking and nudging small cars around the table and trying to bump into different colored drops. Each player is trying to use the drops they've bumped into to score cards in their hand. The first player to score 15 points worth of cards wins the game.

-description from publisher
______________

This game was one of the 4 finalists in the 2016 Mayday Games Design Contest held at Geekway to the West (game convention). Thanks to all the folks at Geekway, the judges, and Mayday Games for giving us the chance to create and show off our game.

name: OrcQuest WarPath: Chapter Box – Blood for Blood
description:
"Blood for Blood" is a brand new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With the Secondary Campaign included, your heroes can compete against the Barbarians, this famous warrior folk that can easily compete with the Orcs. Along with Humans, Elves and Dwarves, the Barbarians are one of the major nations to have always been at war with the Orcs... or is it the other way around? Nevertheless, it remains a major problem: a rumor of alliance with the Kingdom of Istarra in the conquest of the Bloody Woods begins to cause trouble among greenskins. Our heroes have thus decided to go to settle their account as they know how best to do it: with brutality.

At first, the heroes will have to return home and repel the Barbarian troops, thrown in the vicinity of the Bloody Woods. Barbarian camps are set up everywhere and our heroes will have to attack and destroy them as quickly as possible, before their enemies gather. The Alert track will be used to generate waves of increasingly powerful enemies.

Through a series of unfortunate events, the heroes find themselves facing Ragnar, the Barbarian King, and will have to entertain him in a battle arena. If they emerge champions in the events, they can challenge the warring regent and compete against him. Be careful, because his strength is legendary. Moreover, as he plays at home, his subjects will not stand by idly. In this situation, the Alert track will serve to measure the enthusiasm of the Barbarian King. The more combos the heroes make, the higher the cursor on the track goes. When the cursor has passed the last level, Ragnar the Barbarian King will finally be eager to descend into the arena.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Over the Hills: The Napoleonic Wargame
description: A fast paced easy to play game that has basic and optional layers - The Psychological effect of warfare is very strongly reflected throughout the game and the rule mechanics. - Command and Control has effect in the basic and optional rules - National Characteristics and army lists - Napoleonic tactics are firmly rooted in the game - Players can use all the modern figure scales available e.g. 6mm, 10mm, 15mm and 28mm - Accommodates numerous figure to actual men ratios"

name: Kleptopoly: The Board Game
description:
A satire version of Monopoly to reflecting the state of Malaysia's 1MDB Scandal

A democracy is “rule by the people”. A Kleptocracy is the terrible “rule by thieves”. What do these Kleptocrats do when in power? They steal the people’s money, that’s what!

C4 Center is proud to bring to you KLEPTOPOLY: THE BOARD GAME, designed to help you understand the ins and outs of asset declaration, money laundering and anti-corruption work. We engaged the talents of Hardknock Creatives to deliver a game experience that uses the Malaysian scenario to show you how terrible kleptocracy can be… and that citizens, we have a powerful role to play in checking the government!

Kleptopoly is inspired by the brazen thievery of Malaysian public monies in the 1MDB scandal and using the United States Department of Justice Civil Forfeiture suits. You pick 1 of the 4 characters "involved" in the 1MDB scandal, either as the Malaysian Official Number 1, the Shopping Mama, Mr Klepto or the Rich Arab Donor. Like Monopoly, the richest will win via stealing of property and wealth. But beware that your assets may be seized if found to be CORRUPT unless hidden away at the Cayman Islands!!!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Hail Caesar: Age of Caesar
description:
This campaign sourcebook focuses on the Battles that brought Julius Caesar to power as Rome's first emperor and the covers the military beginnings of Imperial Rome.

—user summary

Gaius Julius Caesar was surely the most famous Roman of all time – conqueror, statesman and founder of an empire that would shape the destiny of the world. What’s more, we know just how great a commander he was because he took the trouble to write and tell us so, recording his heroic exploits in all their gloriously impressive detail.
Join the mighty Caesar at the beginning of his glittering career of conquest and refight one of his most famous battles against those heinous enemies of civilisation, the dreaded Germans led by none other than that ambitious fiend Ariovistus of the Suebi.

March with Caesar’s legions into the land of implacable savages as our hero subjugates the barbarous Gauls and confronts that most dangerous of moustachioed monstrosities the treacherous chieftain of the Arverni tribe, Vercingetorix.
Cross the Rubicon and cast your own dice as Caesar pursues his rival Romans across continents in the Roman Civil War, facing his most deadly challenge yet in the form of famed conqueror of the East, Pompey the Great. Fight by Caesar’s side as he wages war for mastery of the Roman World upon battlefields soaked in Roman blood.
Regretfully we cannot tarry, as did Caesar, in the arms of Egypt’s beautiful Queen Cleopatra, but we can join him for the concluding battles of the Civil War in Africa, where we shall at last confront Caesar’s relentless opponents together with the armies of that inveterate enemy of Rome, King Juba of Numidia.
With this supplement for Hail Caesar we invite you to come, see and conquer for yourself in a series of new scenarios representing key battles in the career of Julius Caesar. We take a detailed look at the armies of Rome and her enemies, and we consider the lives of some of the greatest Roman commanders of them all, together with suitable rules to represent them on the tabletop.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Soqquadro Visual
description:
Soqquadro is an innovative party game in which what's happening away from the table is as important as what's happening on it.

The game takes place in real-time. You draw a card from a deck and search for an object that satisfies the request on the card. When you find the object, place it on the table and draw another card.

While in Soqquadro you have to find things that begin with a specific letter and/or correspond to an adjective, in Soqquadro Visual each card shows an image that suggests you what to find in order to collect points!

name: Landau ou la mort!: Hoche et la lutte pour l'Alsace 1793
description:
Landau or Death! Hoche and the Struggle for the Alsace, 1793

VaeVictis issue #141 game, depecting the winter campaign of generals Hoche and Pichegru in Alsace in 1793. At the operational scale, with each unit at division level, a turn per day and 6km per hexagons, both players must battle for the control of Landau, along the Rhine.

While the French gains the initiative, the Coalition holds the grounds. Will the French be able to concentrate both his armies in the Valley of the Rhine ? Will he renew the failed attempt to crush the Prussians at Kaiserslautern ? Will the latters be able to support their allies and put an end to the campaign against the Revolution on the Rhine theater ?

With three scenarios, including a full solitaire one, the game intend to let players answer these questions.

—description from the designer (translated)

Second game of operational system La Grande Tactique (first one is Montenotte 1796 published in VaeVictis issue #128)
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Don't Mess with Cthulhu: Double Agent
description:
A promo card made for the Man vs Meeple Kickstarter project 2018.

Setup:
Add this promo character token to the investigator & cultist tokens.

Rules:
When you are dealt this token, reveal it, then:

If there was both an investigator and cultist token not used during setup: Take those two tokens and choose one as your role. Discard the other secretly.

If both those tokens are not available: secretly look at the character tokens not dealt to the players and choose one as your role. Discard any others secretly.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Drinks With Frenemies: NSFW Edition
description:
The game of creating friends out of enemies & enemies out of friends. If you like games, drinking and sabotaging your friends, this game is for you! Drinks with Frenemies is a card game that brings the worst out of you and rewards you for it!

It's an entertaining party game that will keep you on your toes as you adjust to the ever-changing rules. It's a drinking game that's also family friendly. Meaning you can play with any type of beverage you prefer. In fact, we've made gameplay rules for those who wish not to drink at all. From water to moonshine, we think there's no perfect way to ruin... uh... enhance your relationships!

It's a great icebreaker game that gets you moving, thinking and laughing. We've designed it to be instantly playable and incredibly enjoyable with rules that are simple to follow and cards that are easy to understand. It's just as much fun to watch others play as it is to play the game yourself. It's a great addition to any game night, pre-game or party and makes for a great gift for birthdays, graduations and holidays!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Drinks With Frenemies: Retro Edition
description:
The game of creating friends out of enemies & enemies out of friends. If you like games, drinking and sabotaging your friends, this game is for you! Drinks with Frenemies is a card game that brings the worst out of you and rewards you for it!

It's an entertaining party game that will keep you on your toes as you adjust to the ever-changing rules. It's a drinking game that's also family friendly. Meaning you can play with any type of beverage you prefer. In fact, we've made gameplay rules for those who wish not to drink at all. From water to moonshine, we think there's no perfect way to ruin... uh... enhance your relationships!

It's a great icebreaker game that gets you moving, thinking and laughing. We've designed it to be instantly playable and incredibly enjoyable with rules that are simple to follow and cards that are easy to understand. It's just as much fun to watch others play as it is to play the game yourself. It's a great addition to any game night, pre-game or party and makes for a great gift for birthdays, graduations and holidays!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Tau Ceti: Planetary Crisis – The Living Starship
description:
The living Starship is an expansion to Tau Ceti: Planetary Crisis core game that finds a mysterious living starship roaming around the cosmos. This ship is intent on making your life harder and destroying anything it can. Multiple copies of the expansion can be used with the core game and the expansion is also compatible with all game modes.

The starship will jump from system to system attempting to steal exploration tokens and possibly destroying your orbitals! You must stop this ship before it stops you!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Economic, Environmental, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Magnio
description:
Magnio consists of unique and mesmerizing pieces that push, pull and shoot on each other - with the power of magnetism. Similar to a deck of cards, you’re not limited to a single game. You'll find several fun and attractive games in the box, but you will soon find yourself experimenting and playing with the pieces freehand. Now you'll be able to create your very own games, expanding the possibility of Magnio even further!

Magnetic air-hockey? No problem!

Magnetic curling? Create it!

It's a game designed for those that desire to think outside the box, or just want to casually play some magnetic dexterity action!

You're invited to explore the possibilities with hands-on demonstrations of physics and fun. Push, pull, and shoot magnets with other magnets as you manipulate the set. Create structures and sculptures, test your skills, create new games, and find even more ways to play. However you decide to use them, we're positive you'll enjoy the experience of Magination.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Astrahys
description:
Astrahys is a skirmish miniature game for two or more players in a fantasy world.

Each player play with a battle group (5-6 miniatures). Each miniature generates actions to create a pool. All actions in each round are allocated to the miniatures your group.

Astrahys is a tactical game based on the anticipation and strategy.

A bad tactical choice could be fatal...

—description from the publisher

name: Jumping
description:
Jumping is a 1vs1 abstract game, where a player, to win, must keed the other player to move.
The 54 cards build the game bridge, composed by 9 platforms, where the players move their markers.

—description from the designer

name: Times Up!: Dice Tower Expansion Pack
description:
A custom deck of 52 Time's Up cards chosen by Kickstarter backers and Dice Tower staff from a poll during The Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter Campaign.

The deck includes 52 cards.

—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Tribes: The Gathering of Elders Mini-Expansion
description:
At the holy gathering place the elders of the tribes meet. Here you have more action options.

A single double-sided large format card (12x15cm). One side is rules, the other spaces to place tribesmen. The tribesmen placed here stay in place permanently, and only one per tribe on each space is allowed. The longer you wait, the bigger the benefit from placing a tribesman on a particular space. But there must be balance, no space may have 2 tribesmen more than another.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Prehistoric, Territory Building

name: Super Dungeon: Moon Princess
description:
The Moon Princess is a Hero model for your games of Super Dungeon.

Schooled since birth in the ancient, esoteric arcana of her family, the Moon Princess sometimes tires of merely watching the Moonlight Tournament. Sometimes, she wishes to pit her own strange and terrible power against the warriors competing to do her honor. Several true assassinations have been attempted upon the Princess, and surely more will come. In truth, this danger is part of what makes these outings so appealing.

—description from the publisher

name: 8Bit Box: Outspeed and Stadium – Goody Tiles
description:
Goody tiles given out by IELLO at Essen Spiel 2018.

Outspeed Tile consists of a track segment with "new experiences".

Stadium goody tile consists of the sport "Curling" using the cubes supplied in the base game.

—user summary

name: Competitors
description:
Become an international freight forwarder, create your company fighting against the others and showing your logistic skills. Challenge your friends and using your strategic skills, carry out as many shipments as you can and at the same time do not let your opponents overcome you!

You can play Competitors in 2 different ways:

Timed game mode: When the Round token is on the last mark on the left of the board and the last player has finished his round. The player who scores the higher number of Victory Points than others wins.
Victory points game mode: The player with 10 Victory points at the end of the last player’s round wins.


Game start:
Once positioned the Board on the table, the round token on the upper left edge (at the first orange mark) and positioned the 3 decks of cards ( Territories, Contracts and Customs ) each player roll a 6 sided dice to determine who will be the first to start. The player who obtains the highest score has the right to choose the color of his company and his Headquarter among the 9 available. He takes the corresponding card and places it on the table in front of him. Other players act, then, clockwise.
at this point each player will be given the following standard equipment:

1 Player board
1 Victory points crown tokens
200.000 euros ( 1 coin of 100.000 euros, 1 coin of 50.000 euros, 4 coins of 10.000 euros, 1 coin of 5.000 euros, 4 coins of 1.000 euros and 2 coins of 500 euros )
10 Territory cards
5 Contract cards
1 Headquarter card
2 Trucks
1 Ship
1 Aircraft
1 aircrafts on flight


The Game starts
Establish the geographical area of danger. By consulting the Meteorological-Natural and Human events table, the first player rolls the 6 sided dice
to determine which geographic area will be hit, and then the
12-sided dice to determine the event that will hit the territory. On the The target is immediately placed a Danger token of bad weather. The event described will have immediate effect and will last up to the end of the last player’s round
when the dices must be rolled again.

Starting from the first, each player has can choose 2 actions among 6:
Draws Cards, Sign the Contract, Delivery, Move tokens, Buy or sell a Token, buy or sell a Branch

Planning phase
Each Player is free to combine among 2 his Territories the shipper and the consignee and once he has reached with one of his movement token ( truck, ship or aircraft ) the shipper he can choose a good or a passenger he has in hands into the contracts cards.
On the contract cards is showed:
type of good to be transported
Time to deliver that good ( T.M.)
Reward if delivery has success
limit of transpors on board certain tokens

The contract cards cn be of 3 different kinds:
Legal goods/passengers
Illegal goods/passengers
Special cards ( used in every moment during the game )

Every time a Player deliver with success a contract receive Victory points but every time a player fails a delivery loose Victory points.

Each player must also be careful to the strong impact caused from the Political and social events typical of many countries in the world.

Depending the game mode chosen at the beginning the player who will has reached the highest score of victory points when time ends or when a player reaches 10 victory points and is able to keep his score until the last round up of the last player will be the winner.

During the game there's a high negotiation impact among the players and success will strictly depends from their capability to reach agreements and to betray them.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Bolt Action: Korea
description:
A new supplement bringing Bolt Action to a new period and conflict, the Korean War, with special rules, forces and scenarios to game this conflict.

This supplement for Bolt Action expands the rules-set from its World War Two roots to this new, and truly modern, conflict. Bolt Action: Korea contains all the rules, Theatre Lists, scenarios, and new and exciting units, never seen in Bolt Action before, to wargame this turbulent period of world history.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Brook City: The Secret Cabal Promo Card
description: An Ally / Rival card released as part of the Secret Cabal's 2018 Kickstarter.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Obsidian Tower: Downfall
description:
While the Obsidian Tower game along with its first expansion pack (Uprise) is a challenging experience, this Expansion Pack has been designed for the staunch strategist who requires the ultimate test. This Expansion Pack is not intended to be a standalone game and must be added to the original Obsidian Tower game ideally along with its first expansion pack.

Additional heroes join the battle and a new hybrid attack mechanic ensures that the difficulty of the game gets amped up a few notches.

If you like the ultimate test, then The Obsidian Tower: Downfall is for you!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Orcs & Goblins
description:
Warhammer: Orcs & Goblins is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 112-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Orcs & Goblins faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon and the Hermit Kingdom: The Second Korean War
description:
Modern War #45, November 2019.

The Dragon and The Hermit Kingdom is a two player game that covers the hypothetical simulation of a second Korean War that could occur in the very near future. This game is a precursor to The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun (Modern War #42). It simulates the war that would have occurred on the Korean peninsula just prior to that game’s setting. The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun assumes that a Chinese victory had already occurred in Korea. This game, however, simulates the entirety of that preceding conflict, beginning with a supposed North Korean invasion of South Korea.

Components: One 22" x 34" map on one sheet & 176 counters.

(perhaps it would be useful to spend fewer words on The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun and instead tell us more about this game? Like who is fighting who?)
(seconded. Also,disambiguate "It" and "that game". It sounds like Dragon and Hermit Kingdom is a NK invasion of SK that somehow ends in a Chinese victory that then leads to whatever happens in Dragon Engulfed the Sun (Japan?).

name: Alliance: The Card Game
description:
Alliance: The Card Game is a fantasy, dueling card game with warring factions, fighting to become the new and true Alliance. Players can enjoy this simple-to-learn, two-player, battle game between armies to defeat your opponent's Leader and win the battle. The game of chance, simplified strategy, and fantasy warfare!

Zaldar's return from the dead, with a dragon army behind him, has shaken the world and now armies and factions of all kinds rally for war! The world needs a new Alliance, but who will form this new Alliance? Will Zaldar reign supreme? Or will it be...you?

Objective of Game: Battle between armies to defeat your opponent's Leader and win the battle.

Components of Game: 35 Cards per deck, 6 sided die, Health Point Tokens, Game Board, Scroll of Rules, & stickers

How To Play:
Leader Appears - place your Leader closest to you. The Leader will not be able to battle until the army in front of the Leader is defeated.
Shuffle - shuffle your deck and place your deck face down to your right.
Army Line Up - draw the top 5 cards from your deck and place them face up in front of your Leader. This is your army, ready for battle.
Roll Order - both players roll the die. Whoever rolls the highest number goes first. Each turn consists of a Placement Phase and a Battle Phase.
Placement Phase - if you have an army space open place the next top card from your deck in its place.
Battle Phase - you may attack twice per turn, but not with the same character. First declare who you're attacking by whom you're attacking with. Roll the die. If the number matches your character's Roll Number, you deal the character's corresponding Attack Number to your opponent's character's Health Points. If not, the attack misses and no damage is dealt. If damage is dealt more than your opponent's character's Health Points, then the character is slain and placed in the Slain Pile. If damage is dealt less than your opponent's character's Health Points, then Health Points are replaced with the correctly numbered Health Point Token.
Leader's Entrance - Your Leader comes into play when your army is depleted and no Units or Generals stand in front of him. The Leader can now attack, dealing the most damage on the battlefield, but can also be attacked by your opponent.
Victory - Once your Leader's Health Points reach 0 you lose the battle. If your opponent's Leader's Health Points reach 0 you win the battle

Classes:
Unit - bulk of army, 30 per deck, average attack and health points, & adorned with copper frame and tablet
General - more powerful characters on the battlefield, 4 per deck, stronger attack and health points, & adorned with silver frame and tablet
Leader - Leader of your army/Alliance, 1 per deck, strongest attack and health points & adorned with golden frame and tablet

Battling: Roll Numbers & Attack Numbers
When battling roll the die. If your roll matches your character's Roll Number then you deal the corresponding Attack Number (below the Roll Number). If the Attack Number is higher than your opponent's character's Health Points, then it's Slain and sent to the Slain Pile. If the Attack Number is lower than your opponent's character's Health Points, than replace their Health Points with the correctly numbered Health Point Token.

Character Types:
Warrior
Beast
Mage
Beast Warrior
Beast Mage

Health Point Tokens:
The numbered, circle tokens replace a character's Health Points after they take damage. If you character takes 3 damage, from your opponent, and your character's Health Points are 5 then you replace your character's Health Points with the Health Point Token numbered 2.

—description from the designer

name: FiveCore Brigade Commander: Brigade Level Warfare in the 20th Century
description:
FiveCore Brigade Commander: Brigade Level Warfare in the 20th Century. By Ivan Sorensen. While the rules are not written for any particular scale of miniatures, they will work very well with 3mm, 6mm and 10mm figures, where each stand can look like a unit in its own right. Playing in 15mm is certainly possible, but tank models will take up a disproportionate amount of table-space compared to infantry stands.

GROUND AND TIME SCALE:
The game does not adhere to a strict time scale. A turn is the time it takes for a meaningful action to take place on the gaming table and for units to potentially incapacitate an enemy company sized formation. Depending on the actions taking place, this may be from a few minutes to half an hour or longer. If you are tracking time for the purposes of a scenario, assume an average of 10 minutes per turn or roll 3D6 each turn, to determine how many minutes it took. Think of your game as a movie. As the battle rages, the camera zooms in on a particular unit and focuses on it, while the rest of the world ceases to exist for a moment. Ground scale is roughly 1” = 100 yards.
Engagement distances have been kept very conservative, to account for the fact that our flat, featureless tables would be covered in hedge rows, hills, crevices and depressions.
categories: Korean War, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Hail of Fire: WWII Company-Level Miniatures Warfare Rules
description:
Hail Of Fire is a company-level, WWII themed miniatures war game designed to be both simple and easy to learn while keeping both players engaged in the action! And best of all, the rules are only few pages long! So print out the PDF, throw some models on the table, and jump right into the exciting tabletop combat!

Using a fast, interactive turn sequence, players are always in the fight. The addition of hidden action points, fast and easy deployment, and a delayed combat resolution system ensures that both commanders will be fighting the friction and fog of war as much as they are each other!

—description from publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Ultimate Secret File
description:
A bomb has been located near the world biggest nuclear facilities. Time is missing and you need to crack a code in order to defuse the bomb. The world is counting on you, good luck! Find the password, save the world.

A 1 to 6 players cooperative game

+ If you play solo, you have 30 minutes to find the solution.

+ If you are 2 players, you have 15 minutes to find the solution.

+ If you are 3 players, you have 10 minutes to find the solution.

+ If you are 4 players, you have 8 minutes to find the solution.

+ If you are 5 players, you have 6 minutes to find the solution.

+ If you are 6 players, you have 5 minutes to find the solution.

Simple rules
1) You have the rules, a code to crack and a zip bag.
2) Take a pen with some paper.
3) To defuse the bomb, you need to crack the code.
4) According to your sources, the solution is a five-letter word.
5) When you are ready, launch the timer and open the zip bag.
6) Try to crack the code and find the solution.
7) To check the solution, open the tiny envelop.
8) If you find the solution before the end of the timer, you win.

name: Reanimator: Dual Expansion Set
description: Expansion for the interactive horror game featuring 2 new tales of horror: Modern Times & The King in Yellow
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck, Storytelling

name: Zany Zoo
description:
Zany Zoo is a card drafting game for 1 to 3 players, where you play as zoologists gathering creatures that emerged from another dimension, and taking care of them.

The game is played over 3 rounds, where 5 multi-use cards are dealt to each player per round, from which you will draft 4 for a total of 12 cards. You will then utilize 1 of the 3 functions of these cards to either build your creatures, feed them or clean up their wastes to score victory points.

You decide which strategy to adopt as there are a few ways to score victory points. Manage your sanctuary well to score more victory points than your opponent and be recognized as the ‘best zoologist of the third dimension’!

-description from designer

name: Colorado
description:
Colorado is one of several games playable with the Katarenga board and pieces. This game is invented by the author of Katarenga. It's the original game for which the board was designed.

In Colorado you try to be the first to get all of your (remaining) pawns to the opposite side of the board (homing baseline). Pawns can be captured like in Katarenga.
When you get a pawn home to the opposite baseline your opponent may, if possible, use their next move to capture it. If not captured immediately, it becomes invulnerable so long as it remains on the same homing square.

The game ends as soon as one player wins by getting their last remaining pawn home, by capturing the last remaining enemy pawn, or (unusually) when their last remaining unhomed pawn is captured, at least one of the others being already home.

name: Fleets of Fortune
description:
Hoist the main anchor and batten down the hatches, as you and your opponents compete to rule the seven seas in Fleets of Fortune! Recruit your crew members through influence, put them to work to amass your wealth, and use your riches to acquire your fleet of ships to conquer the world. Rough tides await, and it will take an even rougher band of buccaneers to heft and hornswoggle their way to the top. Do you have what it takes, or are ye just another cowardly landlubber.

Utilizing light engine building and hand management along with a 'take that' mechanic, players will utilize specific influence cards or items to recruit crew members to their team. Once recruited, each crew member has a unique action to either build wealth or improve their crew. Once a player has the proper payment, they can pay the fee to add a ship to their armada. The first player to build a fleet of the four most powerful and fully-manned ships before their opponents is the winner. There is no second place, unless you count Davy Jones' locker...

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Jack the Ripper: The Smartest Copycat
description:
Jack the Ripper: The Smartest Copycat is an escape room board game.
It is playable between 90-120 minutes with 2-6 people.
This easy-to-install game can be purchased in standard board game sizes.
It can be played anywhere you open the box.
You no longer need to leave your place to play an escape room.
Thanks to its easy-to-lock system, cabinets and drawers can be used as game objects.

- Game Scenario -

London wakes up on a bloody cold morning. The panic in the city is increasing day by day and the pressure on the security forces deepens. In the last seven months, the casualty reached five, after the brutal murder committed last night. These murders are very similar to the methods of a world-famous killer: Jack the Ripper. You have managed to identify the address of the potential suspect. you and your team are on your way. You have only 90 minutes to decrypt his identity and prove that the copycat killer is guilty.

—description from the publisher

name: Requiem: Vampire Knight – Lamias
description:
Lamias faction expansion, with the mini of Torquemada the werewol.
Contains 14 faction cards, 8 minis and a rules sheet.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Pirates, Zombies
mechanics: Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Requiem: Vampire Knight – Archaeologists
description:
The Archealogists are weaker but they will outnumber their enemies...
You may also animate you capital to make it fight for you!
Contains the Archaeologist faction, 14 faction cards, 13 minis and a rules sheet.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Tempus Quest: Episode 2 – The Dust Farmers
description:
After escaping the Dynasty, the crew lands on delling to load up on food and supplies. But the planet is almost barren. The colonists trying to make a living there need help irrigating the fields, and building up their town.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Crown Rivals: A Deckbuilding Game
description:
Crown Rivals is a 2-player competitive deckbuilding game of palace intrigue, played with regular playing cards. As rivals for the Crown, players work to raise their influence while lowering the influence of their opponent, to place their chosen monarch on the throne.

Build a new deck with each game; buy better cards as you go to coordinate huge combos.

Enlist Clubs to lower your opponent's Influence.

Use Hearts to raise your own Influence.

Play Spades to stir up the masses and cause distractions for your opponent to deal with.

Equip Diamonds to upgrade other cards.

Don't forget to buy high-value cards, so you can eventually get your hands on the game-changing King or Queen cards!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Maguro Zukushi
description:
This is a sushi-themed mahjong-like card game for two.

At the start of the game each player is dealt eleven cards. Five of these are put face down as your "prep", and then you each take turns discarding cards. To win you have to make a hand of either two sets of three-of-a-kind or three pairs by combining your prep and your opponent's discard. There's a catch, though - like in mahjong, you can't win with a discard that you've already discarded yourself. The points for winning hands also depend on what sushi you use in the sets, so will you try for big points or go for a lower-scoring hand your opponent is more likely to discard?

—user summary

name: Envyra: 5 Player Expansion
description:
Expansion allows Envyra to be played by 5 players.

CONTENT: 1 Player Shield, 1 Player Board (Grid), 5 Wooden Cubes, 5 Tiles

SETUP & RULES (for 5 Player game):
Before you start, prior setup, mix Tiles from this expansion with Tiles from the base game. Do not remove any tiles during setup. Use Playing Grid like in 4 Player game (full 3x4 grid).
Rules for 5 player game are the same as with other player counts.

If you use Equilibrium expansion in 5 player game, we recommend not to use 4 Points Equilibrium cards (displaying 3 Elements).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tigers in the Ardennes
description:
A small-format basically division level hex-and-counter game of the Battle of the Bulge. 12 day-turns, 16-27Dec44. Blitzkrieg.

Special rules: Tiger Fright, Tiger Tank Breakdown, Skorzeny's Brandenburgers, press-your-luck Waffen-SS Ruthless and Consequential GI Rage option, ...

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago – Cities of Bronze
description:
The islands of the Ghost Archipelago are covered in the ruins of ancient civilizations, but there is one group whose culture still thrives and whose power still grows - the Dricheans. Divided into many small kingdoms and city-states that wage near-constant war with snake-men, native tribes, and with each other, the Dricheans are renowned for the gleaming bronze of their weapons and armour, and their martial prowess. Organized and militaristic, these formidable warriors pose a new threat to adventurers exploring the Lost Isles.

This supplement for Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago examines the scattered realms of the Dricheans, presenting players with three new mini-campaigns featuring these bronze-armed warriors. Also included are additional rules for using Drichean Crew and Soldiers as well as guidelines for creating your own Drichean kingdoms.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 幻影探偵団〈新装改訂版〉 (Phantom Detectives: Revised edition)
description:
幻影探偵団〈新装改訂版〉 (Gen'ei Tanteidan: Shinsou Kaiteiban) Phantom Detectives: Revised edition is a reworking of Phantom Detectives.

In the game of Phantom Detectives, players are squad leaders of a private detective team called "Phantom Detectives". Provoked by an unidentified murderer called "Skull King", 12 detectives (one of whom is Skull King) entered a mansion loaded with death traps to identify Skull King. Some of them will be killed as they investigate. They must find out which one of 12 suspects is Skull King, and which squad other detectives belong to within time limit.

But one of detective leaders is "Shadow Man", who will deliverately confuse their deduction.

Who will uncover the truth with their clear brain?

大正末期の帝都・東京を舞台に、怪人・髑髏王の正体を暴け！！
深紅の猟奇ミステリふたたび——。
プレイヤーは〈幻影探偵団〉と呼ばれる秘密の探偵団です。
皆さんは〈髑髏王〉の挑戦を受け、死の罠が仕掛けられた〈歯車館〉に訪れました。
推理を進めるうちに、メンバーを殺害される者も出るでしょう!
制限時間内に12人の容疑者の中から、〈髑髏王〉とライバルの探偵団の正体を解明してください。
しかし、団長の中には、変装の達人〈影男〉が潜んでいます。皆さんの推理を迷走させることでしょう。
明晰な頭脳をもって〈真相解明〉を宣言するのは誰？
publisher's summary
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Grenade Salad
description:
This game is developed to be played with the Green Box of Games game system.

Grenade Salad is a light-weight tactical combat game in which soldiers (cubes) battle it out in an open playing field in the middle of the table. Use the different actions on the cards to deploy troops and attack.

Setup is as simple as dealing 5 cards to each player, and dropping 5 cubes from each player onto the table from a suitable height to create a random starting battlefield.

Each turn a player may move a soldier, play up to two cards, and draw new cards from the deck. The different card actions are equally represented in the deck, and they are:
Map pointer - Place one soldier in an exact spot on the table
Three circles - Drop three soldiers onto the table
Hammers - Close combat attack
Arrow - Ranged attack
Circle/grenade - Thrown to create an area-of-effect attack
Footpath/mine - Played in your opponents turn as a response to movement or deployment

Play until the deck is empty, and count points for survivors on the board and number of soldiers killed.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Take That

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Grand Alliance – Chaos
description:
Grand Alliance - Chaos is a guide to the armies and factions devoted to Chaos in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This book contains 156 warscrolls and 11 warscroll battalions allowing players to field the many mortal and daemonic servants of the Dark Gods, including;


Everchosen
Slaves to Darkness
Khorne Bloodbound
Daemons of Khorne
Tzeentch Arcanites
Daemons of Tzeentch
Nurgle Rotbringers
Daemons of Nurgle
Hosts of Slaanesh
Daemons of Chaos
Chaos Brayherds
Chaos Warherds
Monsters of Chaos
Chaos Gargants
Thunderscorn
Skaven Masterclan
Skaven Verminus
Skaven Skryre
Skaven Moulder
Skaven Pestilens
Skaven Eshin
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – The High Seneschal Promo Set
description: The Maesters are an ancient order of scholars, healers, and scientists who are trained in the Citadel, located in Oldtown. Chief among them and charged with the governance of the Citadel is the Seneschal. The High Seneschal is a Kickstarter Exclusive Non-Combat Unit that all Kickstarter backers will received. As a NCU, The High Seneschal doesn't take directly to the battlefield, but rather, influences the behind-the-scenes stages of war through his NCU card, which features a very unique effect. The High Seneschal is a Mercenary Character, meaning that he can be played with any Faction in the game!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dungeon Hoard
description:
Dungeon Hoard is a card game that allows you to build your dungeon and place creatures and traps to avoid incoming adventurers from looting your treasure room. The game can be played by 2 to 4 players and the first player to collect 3 treasure chests wins.

In the Draw Phase, the player draws a card from the Dungeon Deck.
Rooms, Creatures and Dungeon Upgrades can be played during the Build Phase. The following phase is called the Event Phase, in which the player draws an Event card face up. Some Event cards may start a Dungeon Crawl Event.

During Dungeon Crawl Events, a group of Adventurers raid your dungeon. Adventurers start from the Lair Entrance and move towards the Treasure Room. Defeated adventurers provide Loot Bags, whereas adventurers that manage to reach the Treasure Room collect Loot Bags from your stash. Every 5 Loot Bags are converted to 1 Treasure Chest.

—description from the designer

name: Muse: Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter Art Promo Pack
description:
Provided upon requested as part of the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign if you received the Muse promo pack

Includes 2 Art Cards, which also available in the El Dragon Azul Argentinian edition
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Wildlife Web
description:
Can you forage or hunt for food, find a mate, and raise your young... without becoming someone else's lunch?

Welcome to Wildlife Web, a game where you participate in the web of life.

Wildlife Web is an exciting, dynamic game of strategy where adventure, luck, and cunning provide hours of fun for family and friends, recommended for ages 9 to 99.

Do you want to be a mountain lion, deer, or elk? This surprisingly realistic game enables players to experience life as any of 50 different animals, and each animal has a mate.

How do you strategize to eat, mate, stay alive, and pass your genes along to the next generation? Each animal has a special survival rating, plus unique abilities to help when hunting or defending against predators...

Are you a carnivore, herbivore or insectivore?

A fox has special abilities and strategic advantages, but so does the whitetail deer, robin, and squirrel. Which animal is better... the moose or the mouse? Select your starting Pack of animals carefully and the race is on to pass your genes along to the next generation.

Wildlife Web is both competitive and cooperative. On the one hand, the game features classic predator-prey relationships where mountain lions hunt rabbits, deer, elk, or bison with the roll of the dice.

On the other hand there is cooperation as robins warn the deer as a mountain lion approaches. Your deer gains 2 extra defense points for every robin on the table.

Fifty random Event Cards introduce everything from hailstorms to bird alarms that can help or hinder your quest for survival.

Just like in real life, a highway runs through the game, forming a deathtrap for some species and an opportunity to scavenge for others.

A Day/Night card alternates play between diurnal and nocturnal animals so your bat is safe during the day while your hawk can go hunting.

With thousands of potential interactions and many uncontrolled factors, the game is never the same... except that you will have fun every time!

—description from publisher

name: Flying Tigers (Third Edition)
description:
Climb into the cockpit and recreate the gallant and unparalleled success of Chennault's famous volunteers against the invading Imperial Japanese Military in a challenging two-player WWII air-to-air combat game.

Flying Tigers allows players to assume control of either the invading Japanese or the defending Tigers and the Royal Air Force (RAF) counterparts, in a bid for control of China from 1941-1942. Tiger players must overcome a lack of intelligence, a dismal supply of spare parts and overwhelming odds to hold off and repel the Japanese. Japanese players must decide when and where to strike, work harder to outmaneuver the superior Allied planes and do whatever is necessary to further the empire.

Originally published in 1969 by Gamescience Inc and again in 1973, Lou Zocchi (Gamescience) and Derek Harris (Tupelo Game Days) have worked to rebuild this game from the ground up with new artwork, a revised combat system and optional rules that allow you to alter the course of history.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: L'osti d'jeu: Bon Cop Bad Cop 2
description: A promo pack of cards for L'Osti d'jeu release for the first weekend in movie theater of the movie: Bon Cop Bad Cop 2.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: TANGL
description:
TANGL is a quick abstract polyomino race game. Players race to create a rectangle using a mismatched set of heptamino and hexamino pieces and are rewarded for speed and accuracy. The player with the lowest score will win when time runs out.

—description from the publisher

name: New Corp Order: Consultant – Business Developer
description:
She's here to help you grow your business...with a rifle in her hand.

The Consultant – Business Developer is a double-sided item for use in both Peak Oil and New Corp Order!

name: Connect5
description:
Game description
The player who scores the most points, wins the game.
You can score points by eating your opponent's tokens (1 point each eaten token) or achieving a Connect 5 (5 points).
Once any player achieves Connect 5, the round is over.

Rules
The player who, at the end of all rounds scores more points, wins the game.
If, during a round, none of the players scores a Connect 5 or if there are no more available free dots on the game board and it’s not possible to place or move any token, the round is over and the final score is calculated counting the tokens that have been eaten by each player.
To score Connect 5, a player must have 5 of his tokens placed on 5 consecutive dots on the game board, without any obstacle.

The double board game
Connect 5 game board has 2 sides, one for basic games, one for advanced games!
The side labeled as “B” is the Basic game board.
It’s suitable for new players who want to gradually explore the game mechanics.
Nevertheless, the basic board offers a consistent challenge level also to more experienced players.
The side labeled as “A” is the Advanced game board and offers more challenging game paths presenting a harder challenge for the real Connect 5 champions!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Connections, Pattern Building

name: Unicorns & Urinals
description:
Unicorns & Urinals is the dreamy and dirty word game that really takes the (urinal) cake! The clue-giver tries to get their team to guess two unrelated and outrageous word pairs that start with the same letter, from ‘Chains & Cherries’ to ‘Licorice & Lubricant.’ It takes teamwork and a quick wit get through as many cards as you can before the time run out. Like they say, you can lead a unicorn to a urinal, but you can’t make it pee. This game really takes the (urinal) cake!

—description from the publisher

name: Indian Wars: Custer
description:
"Indian Wars: Custer" is a solitaire wargame in which you take command of the 7th Cavalry Regiment, under the famous general Georges Amstrong Custer and live again, in solo, three battles of the Indian wars.

In this game, three game boards represent the historic space of three major fights which delivers this hero of the western conquest to tribes Lakotas, Cheyenne and Arapaho: Washita (in November 27th, 1868), Honsinger Bluff (in August 4th, 1873) and Little Big Horn (in June 26th, 1876). On these maps, 1 cm represents approximately 200 meters and a game turn represent approximately half an hour of time.
The lenght of this game is 10 turns, it is the time which you have to manage the 7th of cavalry, the famous regiment of Custer, and allow him to fil his mission in spite of Indians warriors which will oppose you vehemently.
