Special Characters - 9 of the 27 characters have no weapon bonuses, but instead have special powers or abilities.
3-on-3 Elimination Matches - Continue fighting with your characters until they are reduced to 0 Hit Points, pulling a new character into the match until either you or your opponents have lost 3 characters.
3-5 Player Battle Royale Matches - Alternate rules for playing with more than 1 opponent. Last one standing wins!
With all of these options, this becomes a great game for 2-5 players, whether you only have 10 minutes to play or an hour. All it takes is 1 set of 90 cards, some standard RPG dice (D4/D6/D8/D10/D12/D20), and a friend!

—description from the designer

name: Like Herding Cats
description:
It’s time to put the cats away for the night. You’re throwing a dinner party, and your best friend’s spouse is allergic!
But making cats do what you want is never as simple as it should be.

The goal of this push-your-luck, pickup-and-deliver game is to put all your cats upstairs at the same time for the night and get them to stay there while their mood swings. You do this by picking them up, but first you must distract them by appealing to their mood.
Each turn, all the cats will have their mood swings, and then move, act or react accordingly. Then you can move around, opening and closing doors, moving toys and getting food and water where a cat will see it, and, if you played your odds right, pick up some cats to take them upstairs.

But they won't stay there forever - if they feel strongly about something, they'll come downstairs again, looking to satisfy their urges. So you need to hurry and put all the rest away quickly.

As if that wasn't enough, your time is limited: your visitors are arriving soon, and if you don't manage to get all the cats upstairs before the mood cards run out, they'll crash your party the entire night. Good luck getting your guests to enjoy their dinner...!

AWARDS
3rd place Best Overall Game in the 2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest!!

Additionally:
- 1st place Best AI
- 1st place Best Regular PnP Build
- 3rd place Best Use of Theme
- 6th place Most Innovative Mechanics
- 6th place Best Original Art
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Behemoth: Rise of Shadow
description:
Behemoth: Rise of Shadow is an epic and immersive co-operative adventure game with elements of deck building, exploration and innovative AI mechanics that adapts to players actions.

The game is set in a fantastic future - the story starts in year 2065, when Nyx awoke out of nowhere. We are now in year 2265, and we believe her to be an ancient goddess of Shadow.

Since her rise, she has been corrupting Earth...turning life and the very elements that constitute it, into shadow.
Human civilization as we know it, has been wiped out.
Surviving humans live on the Behemoth, a mastodontical magical rhyno, in close relationship with magical beasts.

A small group of people and beasts plays a crucial role in ensuring the survival of life, and constitute the last bit of hope.
Those are the rangers and their companion beasts, that wander through the corrupted land to fight the shadow, rescue other beasts and protect the journey of the Behemoth.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Avocado Smash: Party Edition
description:
Avocado Smash is back -- and ready to party! The smash hit snap card game from Ridley's Games has gotten even more smashing in this jumbo Party Edition.

You ordered it and we've served a brunchier take on the original by adding Avocado Toast to the gameplay! Packed with lots more cards and fresh rules, with each smash a player wins on a card that features toppings, they get to add that tasty topping like a fried egg or tomato to their Avocado Toast token. The goal is to have the most toppings on your Avocado Toast when the game ends! But watch out for the You're Toast card! Everything comes packaged in an extra-large avocado container wearing a fun party hat.

Perfect for avocado lovers and families, this game is suitable for ages 6+, 2 to 8 players and has an average of 20 minutes gameplay.

—description from the publisher

name: Towers of Yoma
description:
Towers of Yoma is a cooperative Tower Defense game, inspired by the genres warcraft heritage.

The races of Yoma unite to save the last valley from the steamed people.
Build mazes, upgrade towers and explore synergies between multiple fantasy factions and their unique playstyles.

All in all, Yoma can be described as a top down strategy game. You use Action Points to build towers and shoot neighbouring fields within your maze. Throughout the campaign, you and your friends will have to destroy all creeps before they reach the end of your valley(-map) in 8 missions with 2 to 4 waves of a handful of creeps each.

The game comes with 4 races, 6 race specific towers each to place and stack. Every player holds one player board and one of 8 general cards that have one unique ability each. E.g. Imp Meyer, is exclusively be allowed to deconstruct towers without spending action points.
The games map is modular and allows for various scenarios and even custom community challenges.

Game modes:
Full coop
1 Creep Master vs Many

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Cube Tower, Grid Coverage, Moving Multiple Units, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Action Dice Basketball
description:
Action Instant excitement. Easy-to-play pocket size. Lightning-quick, action in a fast-paced dice game.

Action Dice Basketball is a head-to-head dice game that can be played individually, or two players.

This dice strategy game has passing, shooting, 3 pointers and drives to the hoop for dunks! Watch out for penalties and shooting fouls. 4 quarters of non stop action. It's fast, easy to learn and you call the shots. Perfect for tailgating at games, at the home or in your office, or while traveling on airplanes -- play it anywhere! Call your play, roll the dice and instantly see the results!

Dice Basketball is a head-to-head dice game that can be played individually, or two players.

This game can be single or two players. To play the game simply choose one of the shots roll the dice to see the result. There are fouls, penalties, free throws, final minute shots and more. Play conservative with 2 point calls or more risky with 3 point shots, add the score as you go and see who wins.

Keeping track of time in this basketball game is easy. Provided are score sheets. There are 4 quarters of basketball action. After each play is rolled, check off the circle on the score sheet while you add the score and when all the boxes are checked then the quarter is over. If the score is tied after the 4th quarter then overtime will begin.

—description from the publisher

name: Hardwar
description:
The turn of the twenty-second century was a time of great progression of the human race, space exploration, scientific and technological advancements. It was also the time of neo-colonialism, and a new order emerging from the pyres of the old world. It was a time of a new breed of war – the Hardwar.

Hardwar tries to recreate possible future ground battlefield conditions, providing straightforward rules allowing for a fast-paced tactical experience in a relatively hard science fiction setting. Hardwar takes into account not only classic armoured warfare, enriched with fictional contraptions like mechs, spaceships, or exotic weapons, but also futuristic predictions of combat evolution – the importance of cybernetic warfare, decline in numbers of human soldiers replaced with AI algorithms, a rise of sentient combat swarms and electronic fog of war, or experimental development of new exotic weapons, to name a few. This approach, combined with simple and flexible rules should provide new and exciting tactical opportunities for tabletop commanders.

Aside from this rulebook, all that is needed for a game is a couple of miniatures, representing your battle group, a handful of twelve-sided dice and another one of small tokens or coins, measuring tape, a table, a couple of terrain pieces and, most importantly, an opponent.

Becoming a force commander in Hardwar world is not a difficult task. You can start your own private security company, lease a few war machines and go out there, looking for contracts from the big fish. You can be a corporate commander, working for one of the major forces of your world, executing the will of shareholders by all means necessary. You can become the charismatic leader of revolutionary forces, fighting against corporate overlords. You can be a small-time dictator in an area of wastelands forgotten by transnationals, or a noble self-appointed marshal, trying to protect helpless civilians from raiders. You can be a pirate, you can be a bounty hunter, you can be a mercenary. All you need is to get your hands on some equipment, find a few reliable hardware operators and convince someone with money to let you solve their problem. If you are good enough, you can get additional contracts with media, to make a reality holo-show about your group, you can get sponsors from the arms industry, agents and lawyers to negotiate your contracts, and that penthouse mansion in the orbital city you have always dreamt of.

Your force will face other security consultants, fighting for other employers. Sometimes you will take part in internal power struggles, sometimes you will perform a hostile takeover, sometimes you will sabotage a competitive facility, sometimes you will have to deal with locals unwilling to relocate from your employer’s property, sometimes you will go on bandit hunt, you will extinguish, or incite revolution… it will not always be pretty, but surely will be profitable.

–description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: BattleTech: Initiative Deck
description:
Enhance your battlefield tactics by substituting the Initiative Deck for the standard Initiative roll. Poor initiative position awards stronger strategic and tactical opportunities which can make up for "bad luck."

The Initiative Deck is 65 cards of 5 suits of 13 cards each in a single tuck box with a rules booklet.

Includes rules for four ways to use the deck:


Alternate Initiative
Initiative Effects
Poker (four or five suits)
Drax (a popular Free World's League game)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Turn Order: Random

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – Jihad
description:
November 3067 saw the culmination of work two centuries in the making, work begun by Primus Conrad Toyama of ComStar, successor to Jerome Blake and the man responsible for single-handedly turning ComStar into a pseudo-religious organization with a vision: to lead mankind to the light.

But then the Second Star League collapsed .

Denied their dream, the Blakists fought to preserve the Star League against the follies of the Great Houses, its fanaticism manifested as the Jihad: a horrific war that pitted every nation against each other. This era saw bleeding edge machines march off to war, while venerable ’Mechs continued to receive upgrades and facelifts. Even primitive ’Mechs not seen in over half a millennia once again appear on the battlefield.

Technical Readout: Jihad expands on Technical Readout: Succession Wars and Technical Readout: Clan Invasion by combining the ’Mechs previously found in Technical Readout: 3050 Upgrade, Technical Readout: 3055 Upgrade, Technical Readout: 3058 Upgrade, Technical Readout: 3060, Technical Readout: 3067, Technical Readout: 3075, Technical Readout: 3085, and Technical Readout: Project Phoenix. Each machine is accompanied by an illustration, a description of its history, capabilities, and game stats.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Caporetto: The Italian Front 1917–1918
description: Caporetto: The Italian Front 1917–1918 is a two-player wargame of the last year of the Italian Front, from the Central Powers’ offensive of the Fall of 1917 until the end of the war in October 1918. In this game, both players command two powerful but fragile forces: the armies of Italy and Austria-Hungary that, in the last year of the war, were at the end of their tether. Each game turn represents 1 month. Each hexagon is 10 kilometers from side to opposite side. Units are divisions, brigades, or equivalents.

name: Small Railroad Empires: Freight on Board
description:
Freight on Board is a new mini-expansion for Small Railroad Empires in which players will be able to export cargo containers via ships in port!

When a player delivers a good along their train route, if they match the good displayed on the Cargo Ship card, they will be able to place their own Cargo Container there. When the ship is full, it will sail away to export those goods, and the player that put the most containers on that ship will win the export and gain extra Prestige & Money!

name: Connect the Bay
description:
Compete with other players to create seamless connections across the San Francisco Bay Area, and build a dream transit system for the Bay Area.

In 30-60 minutes of game play, 2-5 players compete to create an integrated transit network to help Bay Area residents and visitors travel seamlessly around the region.

Strategically place your homes, jobs and activity centers to create a more Seamless Bay Area. Multiply your impact by cutting transfer delays and installing dedicated bus lanes. The player who builds the most connections wins!

Initially setup with the current situation of city and transit delays, then use dice to pick where to put housing. Each turn the player has ways to remove transfer delays or to place more homes, jobs, or activities. Score is based on how closely connected those homes, jobs, and activities are, not just to one player's set.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: District 9: The Boardgame – Faction Expansion
description:
The 5&6 player faction expansion for District 9: The Boardgame requires the core game in order to be used. These factions may be used in two different ways.

ALTERNATE FACTION: In a 2-4 player game, the Prawn Engineer or MNU Science Division may be selected by a player and set up as normal as defined by the setup section of the core rulebook.

ADDITIONAL PLAYERS: If desired, the new factions allow for 5 & 6 player games of the District 9 boardgame. To use the expansions in this manner, simply follow the setup section of the core rulebook, and add steps for the 5th and/or 6th player.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – ISU-152
description:
When you need big, bad and ugly it is hard to go past the ISU-152. This tank destroyer is designed to sit in a concealed position and destroy enemy tanks whilst being impervious to enemy fire thanks to a survivability stat of 2, Fortress, which helps to keep the tank safe when being shot in the side, and the benefits of being a Tank Destroyer which improves the tanks survivability when concealed. If there is one downside the ISU-152 it would be the relatively low initiative, but this can be improved by adding Situational Awareness to your radio operator.

—description from the publisher

name: Betrayal: Santa & Minsc Promo
description: This promotion is a reversible character card for Betrayal at House on the Hill and/or Betrayal at Baldur's Gate and adds Santa (Betrayal at House on the Hill) or Minsc, Beloved Ranger (Betrayal at Baldur's Gate) to the game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Avalon Hill, Wizards of the Coast

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – White Sunlion Armor & White Sunlion Mask
description: A lightweight version of White Lion Armor, usable in People of the Sun Campaigns. This set will grant the user more movement, less armor and the ability to ignore the extreme heat that would otherwise make wearing the heavy White Lion furs impossible under the intense rays of the sun sleeping in the sky.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeons of Kards
description:
"Yes! Dungeons, printed on cards the size of regular playing cards!"

Each Deck is a Standalone(doesn't matter with is an expansion or not)54 Card Deck, with a Dungeons&Dragons RPG style you get into direct action: monsters, items, heroes, and dungeons can play from 1 to 4 players, SOLO, COOP, and ARENA, games from 30 to 50min.

The coolest thing is that it becomes expandable by acquiring 2 Decks. Increasing possibilities: more monsters, more items, increased dungeon, and gameplay for up to 8 players.

Each Deck contains 54 cards
separated by color on the back, containing:*
Dungeon
Heroes
monsters
Accessories -Pet
Action/Attribute Cards
Gold bags

The game can be played by up to 4 Players per Deck. It is modular and infinity, so With more Decks, More Players, and big the map gets, and items are scarce in each deck making the adventure much more difficult, more decks, more items. (See the example on the photo with 4 Decks Integrate)

To win depends a lot on how you play.

ARENA:

The game becomes an arena, but to start the confrontations you need to walk through the dungeon, which contains items and monsters that can give advantages and disadvantages throughout the game. You win the match: beating the Boss (Boss) or eliminating all opponents in direct confrontation.

Coop (All against the game):

In this mode, you can help your friends to defeat all the monsters in the game and the mighty Bosso (Boss)

Solo mode:

As the title says, single player, you face all the difficulties of the game alone* (you can add the hero cards that are left in the items and during the game so you can find companions to join the adventure and help you in the battle against the incredible monsters that appear in front of you). You win the match by eliminating the Boss (Boss)

The game is a modular game, with you adding more decks, the bigger the adventure gets, with another theme the map gets huge and the difficult gets hard!
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: What's in the Bank?
description: A quick, quirky, and strategic card game good for 2-6 players. The basic goal of the game is to get the most points (or "Francs") in your bank by the time any player gets five cards in their bank. Most cards have point values on them, from 2-10 and then 13. Each turn, a player either puts a franc in their bank, takes a card from the draw pile, or takes a card from another player's hand. There are also special cards called Sanks, Yanks, and Thanks, which either take Francs from someone else's bank, or protects Francs in your own bank.

name: Mini expansion set for Sprawlopolis, Circle the Wagons, Stew and Tussie Mussie
description:
This set of 35 cards contains 9 different mini expansions to the first four games in our Master Print Mini series. These cards bring even more variation to Sprawlopolis and Stew and add a solo mode to Circle the Wagons and Tussie Mussie. The cards do not come in a box but in a zip-lock bag, for easy addition to your Master Print Mini games. The following expansions are included in this set:

Sprawlopolis: Beaches (4 cards)
Sprawlopolis: Construction Zones (4 cards)
Sprawlopolis: Interstate (4 cards)
Sprawlopolis: Points of Interest (1 card)
Sprawlopolis: Wrecktar (1 card)
Circle the Wagons: Lone Cowboy (6 cards)
Circle the Wagons: Lone Cowboy Rides Again (3 cards)
Stew: Fungus Among Us (6 cards)
Tussie Mussie: Flower Shoppe (6 cards)
categories: American West, Card Game, City Building, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming, Territory Building
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, I Cut, You Choose, Layering, Memory, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Crimson Typhoon
description:
The street fighter Crimson Typhoon storms into battle! Piloted by the Wei Tang triplets, Crimson Typhoon uses the ‘Thundercloud Formation’ to attack with her deadly triple saws!

Contents:

1 Crimson Typhoon Jaeger model
1 Crimson Typhoon Conn-Pod
6 x Crimson Typhoon Action Cards
3 x Crimson Typhoon Pilot Cards
1 x Charge Counter
1 x Ammo Counter
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Otachi
description:
The winged monstrosity Otachi soars into the fight! Combining a powerful crushing tail and burning acid spray with the ability to fly, Otachi brings down the pain from above!

Contents:

1 x Otachi Kaiju Model
1 x Otachi Kaiju Signature
6 x Otachi Action Cards
3 x Mutation Cards
1 x Rage Counter
1 x Kaiju Blue Counter
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Crash of Thunder: Napoleon at Austerlitz 1805
description: "Crash of Thunder: Napoleon at Austerlitz 1805" is a fast and easy wargame of the Battle of Austerlitz in 1805. One player commands the French Army of Napoleon and the other the Allied Army (Russian and Austrian). Each side tries try to win the battle by inflicting casualties and breaking the morale of their opponent. The combat abilities of each corps or formation as they historically performed in the battle are listed on its own Formation Card. Each Formation card represents a varying number of units that are placed on the map of the battlefield of Austerlitz. There are also tactics cards that reflect actual events of the battle, that each side may use in order to increase their chances of success in each attack or defense. The Game consists of each side taking turns by declaring an action to activate one card each turn.

name: Home Sweet Home
description:
Win the maximum number of points by counting how many windows there are in each façade and placing the corresponding roof card on the top.

Each player starts with 6 card on hand and takes turns to play.

Players can do either of these two actions:
A: Place cards on the table
In each turn, players can place one façade card on the table:
- a door card: to start constructing a new building next to the existing ones
- a storey card: placed on top of a building already in construction
In addition to playing your façade cards, you can, at any time during your turn, place one or more roof cards on top of the buildings. To do so, the value on your roof card must equal the total number of windows on the building’s façade.

B: Swap cards with other players
player can force an exchange with another player if they have 3 grey façade cards

When there are no more cards left in the pile and no more moves possible, the game is over. Add up the values of all the roof cards that each player has placed on their buildings. The player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Matching, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting

name: Sunny Day Sardines: Wild Fish
description:
Available in Pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Two wild cards that can be added to your sardines deck. These two cards contain a portion of each of the four fish colors in the game. It represents a single fish of your choice when you redeem your set. The pack contains two cards that are not included in the base game.

name: No Time For Prayer: The Battles of Head of Passes and Forts Jackson and St. Philip
description:
Come Mr. Osbon, this is not the time for prayer!
--Admiral Farragut, to flag officer Osbon, who was kneeling on the USS Hartford’s main deck preparing a shell fuse during the battle of Forts Jackson and Philip.

No Time For Prayer details the battles for the port and city of New Orleans; Head of Passes and Forts Jackson and St. Philip.

The battles to take control of New Orleans were not easy ones. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

Players will also need one standard deck of playing cards, a six-sided die and one ten sided die to play the game. A die roll of 0 is read as 10 and not zero.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Yakalaï
description:
Yakalaï is a cooperative role-playing game that takes you to fantastic lands. You must cooperate, survive and gain experience in order to complete your quest. No need for a passionate game master. The players, guided by the cards, take turns fulfilling this function.

Each turn, you turn over a card, decide to travel there, or not, follow the instructions. To resolve the events, just roll the dice. When you arrive at the end of the last card, you succeed the adventure. If you survive, that is.

Easy to access Yakalaï allows you a quick introduction to the mechanics of role-playing games. The 4 character classes and 36 event cards will create a multitude of situations for you that will challenge even the most seasoned adventurers.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wicked Apples: Hexed
description: The Wicked Apples: Hexed expansion adds 4 new apples (Charmed, Wickedest, Squished, and Sour) to expand the deck to 32 apples.

name: Black Stories Junior: Unbelievable Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: unbelievable stories are tricky riddles for animal lovers. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

In these incredible strategy stories about life-saving monster waves, dried-up waterfalls, flying children, monkeys with foreign language skills and budgies with their own phone number things are always a little strange. Only those who ask, puzzle and guess, to uncover these really true secrets.

Black Stories Junior: unbelievable stories includes fifty cards with riddles for you to puzzle out.

name: Mac and Lee
description: Mac and Lee is the second game in John Theissen's American Civil War Operational Series. Specific units and their strengths are hidden from your opponent as you perform a tense dance of cat-and-mouse maneuvers. This is especially important when modeling George McClellan’s ill-fated Peninsula Campaign, where doubts about enemy numbers and positions exacerbated the extreme caution that saw the promise of “the young Napoleon” give way over the course of these operations to his reputation as a passive, bewildered commander who was hopelessly outmatched by his Confederate counterparts. If they want to succeed, the Union Player will need to be bolder and more decisive than Mac; the Confederate Player, for their part, must use a skillful mix of maneuver, bluff, and nerve to stymie the enemy’s advance on Richmond. Knowing when to attack and when to hold back, when to run and when to make a stand, are paramount, and as ever, subject to the fortunes of war.

name: Siege of the Citadel: Boardgame Addons Bundle Expansion
description:
Collects some various addons from the Kickstarter in a bundle.

Includes a new hardcover 311 pages Collectors Edition rule book, 5 new playable characters (Tsarina, Sean D’Armatto, Cardinal Durand, Imperial Regia, and Major Tang), a 54-card Doomtrooler Hero Deck to use with Warzone miniatures, and 54-card Mission Generator Deck and 2 defence turret minis

This bundle also includes rulebook PDFs and all the digital stretch goals unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Realms: Rise of Empire
description:
Star Realms: Rise of Empire is a new standalone pre-quel to the popular Star Realm series game with 141 cards, and a 12-game legacy scenario campaign. Rise of Empire introduces three brand new factions: the Consortium, the Scavengers, and the Kingdom. Rise of Empire will take players on an epic adventure over the course of 12 scenarios where players will permanently alter the market deck cards while tracking their battle wins and losses. Players will compete to achieve various objectives, earning them Campaign Victory Points and unlocking the secrets of the worlds around them. Rise of Empire can be played stand-alone or combined with all previous Star Realms content after you’ve finished the campaign.

Features
12 Legacy Scenarios
9 Sticker Sheets
Starting decks for 2 players featuring 3 brand new factions
8+ Legacy Component Envelopes
Narrative Campaign for 2 players
Competitive and Cooperative mode
Plays on its own, or combined with any other Star Realms set.
An all-new 60-card trade deck featuring new mechanics like "when acquired" abilities!
Market/Campaign Board
Full-color rulebook

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Take That

name: Dragon Braggarts
description:
"So, Commander, you hear about that whopper of a dragon over in Norwich area? They say he's a real monster."
"Yeah, so what if he is?"
"Bet 7 of my knights could take care of him. They're good lads."
"Hah! 7 of your knights? I'd only need 3 of mine! Well... 4 if one of 'em is Sir Smarty-pants over there."
"4 knights?! That's impossible! I'd like to see you try!"
"You want me to prove it? All right, men! Suit up! We're off to Norwich!"

In Dragon Braggarts, players guess how many knights they need to defeat the dragon, scoring points if they are correct. However, only the biggest braggart (or rather the player who needs the fewest knights to successfully defeat the dragon) will be the one to snag the points. Using their cunning, estimation, and good old-fashioned luck, one player will earn the title of Grand Dragon Master!

—description from the designer

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Refined Lantern Sword
description:
Glossary Card, Gear Card and Weapon Proficiency Card that were included with the Willow First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box includes:

Photoresin Willow
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 1 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Weapon Proficiency Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Deathgrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note
DeathPink Edition limited to 400: Deathpink authenticity note

Willow is the most talented swordmaster to appear in generations. Her adaptability, sense of balance, and inventiveness have taken the lives of many and captured the attention of more. The Hand itself has taken an interest. It waits patiently to either best her in combat, or for her life to end so that he may soak a memory quill in her brain. The Scribe is always pleased to add new techniques to the corpse-filled library.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: The Rank Game
description:
Each round: One player is the ranker, and other players are guessers.

Whichever guesser comes closest to the ranker’s choices wins. It couldn’t be easier. Play one round, or many!

name: Panzer Tiger
description:
A simple WWII miniature wargame that simulates battles on the western front.
Suitable for all miniature scales (up to 28mm) and many table sizes (from 2x2ft).
A game lasts from 30 minutes to 1 hour.
Army lists and points values for many units are available on the rulebook.

name: Shadow War: Armageddon – Rulebook
description:
Shadow War doesn’t need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 rules to play – it’s effectively a totally separate game, but sharing the setting and some miniatures.

More than just a reprint of the book that originally appeared in the boxed game, this 200-page rulebook contains a wealth of new content.

The main update is the inclusion of all the factions, previously only available as PDF downloads. By popular demand, two new factions have been added too – the fanatical Battle Sisters of the Adepta Sororitas, and the grim warbands of the Inquisition.

This is a great book for those of you out there with an existing Warhammer 40,000 collection you’d like to play with in a different way, or for anyone who wants a way to play games with a small skirmish force while they build towards a bigger army.

—descripiton from the publisher
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Demeter: Bonus Objectives
description:
Two double sided tiles that gives you a total of four new objectives:


Combination of red + blue cards selected (5 - 6 is silver, 7+ gold)
Combination of yellow + purple cards selected (5 - 6 is silver, 7+ gold)
Number of grey cards selected (3 is silver, 4 gold)
Number of buildings (1 - 2 is silver, 0 gold)


These Bonus Objectives are included in copies of Varuana (Demeter 2).
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Space Exploration

name: Addio
description:
Addio ("Farewell" in Italian) is a solo, print-and-play card game inspired by Ernest Hemingway's A Farewell to Arms. Set on the front lines of Northern Italy during WWI, you must cross the landscape and evade both the Italian caribinieri and the Austro-Hungarian troops to reach the arms of your lover, who is waiting on the shores of Lake Maggiore.

Failure can come in many forms. You can be captured by dynamic Italian or Austro-Hungarian units, fall victim to starvation, or arrive at Lake Maggiore too broke to purchase the rowing boat needed to reach safety.

At stages in your journey the player counter will rest on cards representing towns, fields, and battles – opportunities, respectively, to find temporary employment and gather intel, forage for food (an activity not without risk), and fight or bribe your way out of trouble. If you opt to travel at night, there’s a fair chance now and again you’ll end up in places you had no intention of visiting.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Novel-based, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Paper-and-Pencil, Pieces as Map, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Goons: Survival Kit Expansion
description: Expand GOONS with 2 more unique Villains! Do you dare spin the lucky wheel of Ol’e Jist or try the Vicar’s Schemes that slowly builds up? The expansion also includes 2 new Goons and 6 new Item Cards!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Variable Player Powers

name: Posdata
description:
Have you ever written a letter and mailed it?
Did you have friends or pen pals?

That is why we ventured into this game that invites and challenges us to write letters. Some unexpected. Others, perhaps, waiting for the right time to see the light. Postdata reconnects us with the universe of the manuscript, where we can capture ideas, feelings, wishes, desires... where hope and expectation are the protagonists.


The deck has 50 cards: 15 possible recipients, 10 letter types, 10 epistolary fragments and 15 postscripts.

Players choose (or randomly select) one of each, and write a letter according to them. Who you are writing to, which type of letter, a fragment to inspire you, and a postscript option to use to finish the letter.

Then choose the best letter and send it!

name: Expedition to Skull Island
description:
Expedition to Skull Island is a long-form solitaire print-and-play expedition, where you take the role of captain and try to bring back as much fame and treasure you can from the mystery-shrouded shores of Skull Island.

Outfit a ship, recruit a crew, and set sail!

Randomized encounters will assail you in many different environments: on the trip to the island, on the beaches, in the jungles, on the rivers, in the cliffs surrounding skull rock, in the dark, and inside skull rock itself. With hundreds of "choose your own adventure" style paragraph encounters along with other table-based encounters, there's lots to discover and explore on the island.

Can you make it back to Tortuga alive? Your score at the end is dependent on the goals you set at the beginning – are you looking for treasure, are you looking for adventure, or are you interested in both – and what you discover and bring back from the island.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: CRIMELAND: Akte Falkenstein
description:
CRIME ESCAPE EXPERIENCE FOR HOME - Ideal for a convivial game night with friends and family
CAPTIVATING STORY - More than 25 realistic investigation documents and multimedia content take you into the world of real detectives for 2-3 hours of fun
FUN IN TEAM - For adults and children from 14 years - 1 to 6 people
GIVE AWAY - Perfect gift for all board game nerds, escape room enthusiasts and fans of tricky puzzles
SUSTAINABLE - Crimeland relies on sustainable materials and is a plastic-free & climate-neutral product with resource-saving packaging

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – The Architect
description:
The Architect made a name for himself by launching attacks on Gotham City and targeting the Wayne, Cobblepot, Kane, and Elliot families. These bloodlines are responsible for the construction of Gotham City. But so, too, were the Gates, and beneath the Architect’s mask hides Zachary Gate, heir to the Gate family. His aim is to stand victorious over these age-old blood feuds. By combining his expertise in demolition with his detailed knowledge of the city, he is able to locate and target weak points and hideouts. He is also a dangerous hand-to-hand combatant thanks to his costume that grants him Herculean strength.

Vengeance for the persecution of his notable forefathers drives this villains’ destructive goals.

Wearing the suit his grandfather created affords him tremendous fortitude as he plans massive swathes of destruction throughout the city thanks to his extensive knowledge of explosives.

It also allows him to create pathways through the city – where there were none before.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Spell Out!
description:
Spell Out! is an all-new word game from Next Dimension Games. Wordplay challenges meet area-control gameplay as 1-4 players race to claim words on the board before their opponents, blocking other players' moves on the way and claiming bonuses wherever possible. Choose your words wisely - the game depends on it!

Play starts by revealing a challenge card, for example 'words with the blend CK' and each come up with a 5-letter word that fits, e.g. cloCK. Players then take it in turns to move their pieces on the board, aiming to line them up with all the letters in their word and declare "Spell Out!" before their opponents can do the same.

Letters on the outer ring win you a bonus token if you can get them into a word, and you can exchange it later for an extra turn, but beware! Spent tokens are claimed by opponents, potentially handing them a very useful extra move!

With bounce spaces for advanced movement strategies, randomised start positions and two difficulty levels of cards, Spell Out is the always-fresh word game for families and groups of all ages, skilful wordsmiths and seasoned gamers alike.

Spell Out also includes a Solo Challenge Mode and multiple optional play variants.

-description from designer

name: Pub Battles: Bull Run – The Great Skedaddle
description:
Bull Run is a tense Military Strategy Board Game where players lead new, green armies in this first major battle of the American Civil War.

Union general McDowell developed a brilliant plan to launch a surprise flanking attack. Confederate general Beauregard was able to reinforce with Johnston’s army from the valley by rail. Many expected this to be the only battle needed to put down the rebellion. Instead, panic gripped both armies of green troops as they closed for combat. This quickly escalated into a full on rout all the way back to Washington, becoming known as “The Great Skedaddle”.

• Huge map (38” x 24”) covers the extended area, so you can explore many different possible strategies to the battle.
• This map also covers the area fought over in Second Bull Run, to allow for a Add-On, expansion scenario.
• Hardwood, Kriegsspiel style blocks for Fog-of-War.
• Fast play time.
• Tremendous Replayability.
• Excellent for Solitaire play.

Instead of giving players complete control of their units and perfect intell, this system focuses on realistic command and logistical limitations. In this chaotic and uncertain environment, you must learn to adapt your plans to accomplish your objectives.

This highly acclaimed rules system is based on real combat data, officer experience and training principles from the era: Kriegsspiel. It is used to train officers in the US military and in military academies around the world.

Yvonne Sparrowsmith is the developer.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order, Variable Set-up

name: Ride the Rails: England/Wales
description:
Ride the Rails: England/Wales is an expansion for Ride the Rails that can also be used with the Winsome original Rail USA. The game is for 3-5 players, takes less an hour, with one page of expansion rules.

The game covers the entire nation on two 11x17 inch color maps. Among other elements, some railway stockholders will substantially benefit from the bonus supplied when the conditions are met for the British Railways Act of Parliament of 1921.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Stock Holding

name: Hi MiLo!: A Cooperative Trick-Taking Card Game
description:
Hi MiLo! is cooperative trick-taking game for 1 to 5 players where the rules for playing cards and winning tricks changes for each trick based on the unique Hi MiLo! Deck. Your team strategy will never be the same twice as the Hi MiLo! Deck is shuffled between rounds creating a whole new set of rules for every game! After seeing their cards, players bid to take the highest, middle, and lowest number of tricks in a round. Without discussing their cards, players work cooperatively to take tricks which would allow each player to make their bid. If all players successfully make their bids, the team wins together!

Cardplay Overview
Hi Milo! is a trick-taking game like Hearts, Spades, or Bridge, and follows many of the same rules as those classic games. Each player places one card face up on the table and one wins the trick based on the value of the cards. However, Hi Milo! is unique in that the Hi Milo! Deck determines the rules for which cards you can play and which cards will win any trick. The Win Card for the trick is collected by the winner of the trick, and the next Win Card determines the rules for the next trick. The Win Card determines the rules for a trick in two ways. First, players must play a card of the same suit as the Win Card if possible. If the Win Card has no suit, players can play any cards and only the number value determines the winner. Second, the rank of the Win Card determines who wins the trick. If the Win Card is ranked “Hi”, the highest value card wins the trick. If it is “Lo”, the lowest value card wins the trick. If it is “Mi”, the player who played the card in the middle of the highest and lowest cards wins the trick.

—description from the designer

name: Panzer Grenadier: Peace in Our Time
description:
World War II was scheduled to begin on 28 September 1938, when German armies would cross into neighboring Czechoslovakia. Unexpectedly, Britain and France agreed to almost all German demands, and the Munich Agreement caused the Germans to cancel their plans.

The Czech Army numbered 1.5 million men, with 17 regular and 17 more reserve infantry divisions and four “rapid” divisions. Their tanks and artillery greatly out-classed those of the Germans. Germany had a paper strength of 3.3 million men, though thanks to the rapid expansion of the German Army not all of these were as yet fully trained. The Czechs would be fighting for their homeland, behind a thick line of modern fortifications sited in harsh terrain, and many of the Army’s leaders as well as rank-and-file were not only willing but eager to fight the Germans. The Benes government, almost completely surrounded by German-controlled territory, instead yielded.

That doesn’t happen in Panzer Grenadier: Peace in Our Time. The Czechs fight, and they fight very hard. The Czech Army is well-equipped with tanks, soft vehicles, artillery, anti-tank guns and super-heavy machine guns. You get 176 new pieces and ten new scenarios, all based on battles that could have happened, according to the detailed war plans of both sides.

Panzer Grenadier: Peace in Our Time is a free download; you’ll have to assemble the pieces yourself. The Germans come from 1940: The Fall of France, and the maps from Fire in the Steppe, Elsenborn Ridge and Broken Axis.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Bestride
description:
This is a battle royale-style combat game where you move cards on your desk to fight. Riders have range and weight. Beasts have mobility and skills. You unite them and fight, aiming to "survive to the end".

Obstacles, unpredictable erupting volcano, and ring cards scrambles that increase your chances of hitting make the game even more exciting.

name: Tachite al Tram
description:
Tachite al Tram is a game in which you drive the historic "tram de Opcina" of the city of Triest. It is an unusual hybrid tramway and funicular railway built in 1902.

Build your route, pick up passengers, customize your tram with special powers, and pay attention to accidents and unexpected events, called "disgrazie". The "tram de Opcina" is very famous for being unlucky.

You receive points when you bring passengers from a station to the other. The first that reach 12 points became the tram-driver of the year.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Pieces as Map, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Futegame
description:
Futegame is a card game that simulates a soccer match. In it, players will be able to assume the technical command of one of the four available teams and seek victory.

It is a game of comparing values that are computed with the aim of acquiring new cards with plays that enhance teams, goals or generate resources for your team. The coach who manages to score more goals than his opponent at the end of 22 rounds wins.
mechanics: Deduction, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Answer This: Couples
description:
WHO KNOWS WHO BETTER? - Answer questions about your partner. The first to answer 10 questions correctly wins the game. You will learn a lot about each other.
PLAY WITH YOUR PARTNER - Play one-on-one with your partner to deepen your connection and discover new things about each other. The loser has to do the dishes.
PLAY COUPLE VS COUPLE - It's a perfect game for a double or a triple date. The couple who knows each other best wins the game. Suitable for 2 or 3 couples.
FUN GAME NIGHT - This game is not just another deck of conversation cards, but a fun and exciting game to play. Laughter guaranteed.

—description from the publisher

name: float downstream
description:
float downstream is a game like no other. Embark on a meditative journey. 36 unique river cards create a poetic landscape through which you slowly drift. With a mixture of luck and strategy, attempt to negotiate the currents of life's river, all the while maintaining a balanced mind against the thought forms that arise, threatening to pull you under. Death is inevitable, but how much of life's poetry can you experience on your journey to the river's end?

No matter what you do you will always die. Scores are calculated based on the number and type of thought counters one has in mind upon dying. The higher the score, the closer to enlightenment. This score gives one a 'ranking' within the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Tic Tac K.O.: Dragons vs Unicorns – Angel Promo Card
description:
A holographic promo card that was originally available with a pre-order of the base game.

Special Unicorn Card:
-When this card enters the Grid, each player on the opposing team must DISCARD a card.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Interrupts, Square Grid, Take That, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2020 Planeswalker Deck: Sorin, Vampire Lord
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Sorin Markov is the lord of a proud, ancient lineage of vampire aristocrats. Gather an army of loyal vampires to drain the life from your opponents.

Contents: 1 ready-to-play 60-card deck featuring a foil Planeswalker card, 1 Core Set 2020 booster pack, 1 strategy insert, 1 Magic reference guide, 1 MTG Arena code card, 1 tuck box

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2020 Planeswalker Deck: Ajani, Inspiring Leader
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Ajani is renowned for his courage and compassion in equal measures. Gain life faster than your opponents can take it away, then turn the tide as soon as they run out of gas.

Contents: 1 ready-to-play 60-card deck featuring a foil Planeswalker card, 1 Core Set 2020 booster pack, 1 strategy insert, 1 Magic reference guide, 1 MTG Arena code card, 1 tuck box

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: ABCD
description:
Sometimes walls separate people, but the ABCD wall brings people together to play!

Find the letters that make up your word among the boxes that make up the ABCD wall!

By touching only one of the boxes on the wall each turn, find the boxes needed to complete your word without knocking down the wall or you will lose your turn.

The first to complete their word will be the winner.

name: Left Unsupervised: Mature Edition
description:
The mature edition of Left Unsupervised (ages 17+). It's a card game intended to bring everyone to the table and invoke laughter centered around YOU, the game players. What crazy things might you be up to when you and your friends are Left Unsupervised?

Here's how gameplay works:
- Each player gets 5 yellow cards and 5 red cards.
- Choose a player to be the judge for the first round.
- The judge rolls the special die and determines which player the arrow on the die is pointing to.
- That player is the unsupervised player for this turn.
- The judge chooses any card from their hand to play about the unsupervised player.
- This creates part of a story: "Brad [blank] and that's how legends are made."
- All other players play a card to complete the story and the judge picks their favorite.
- Cards are replenished and the judging role moves to the next player.

Think of Left Unsupervised as kind of like *that other* similar party card game, but staring the players at the table.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bzura 1939
description:
The game simulates the largest battle of the Polish Defensive War of 1939. The battle was fought near the Bzura River, west of Warsaw, between 9 and 19 September, 1939. The first stage of the battle was a Polish counter-offensive, which was successful. However, gradually, the Germans managed to halt it, outflanking the Polish forces and counter-attacking. Eventually, as a result of the battle, Polish Poznań and Pomorze Armies that took part in the battle were destroyed. The road to Warsaw was now open to German armies marching from Silesia.

This is a new edition of the "Bzura 1939" game that is based on the WB-95 wargaming system developed by Taktyka i Strategia. The previous editions of the game were based on different wargaming systems (e.g. W-39).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Valda: Companions – Kickstarter Exclusive Mini Expansion
description: This Kickstarter exclusive expansion gives you the chance to discover powerful Companions that follow you through your play. This expansion includes 15 new cards for the divine deck.

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Amazon Team Card Pack
description:
From the Publisher:

Unveil the mysteries of Lustria's guardians! This deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your Amazons, as well as your positions and Star Players. It also includes Special Play cards exclusively for use with Amazon teams.

CONTENTS
4x Player Reference cards for the Python Warrior Thrower, Piranha Warrior Blitzer, Jaguar Warrior Blocker, and Eagle Warrior Linewoman
4x Star Player cards for Boa Kon'ssstriktr, Estelle la Veneaux, Glotl Stop, and Karla von Kill
8x Random Events Special Play cards
8x Heroic Feats Special Play cards
19x Blank Positional Cards, to fill in for each player on your team: 2x Python Warrior Thrower, 2x Piranha Warrior Blitzer, 2x Jaguar Warrior Blocker, and 13x Eagle Warrior Linewomen
One all-important card that explains how to use all of the above cards, with a red card on the reverse

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl – The Official Rules and Spike! Journal Issue 15 to make full use of
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Team-Based Game

name: Superclub: FC Barcelona Player Cards 2022/23
description: Player cards pack containing the entire up-to-date FC Barcelona first team squad – hot off the press. Perfect for passionate FC Barcelona fans, as well as Superclub fans who just want more player cards but not necessarily all club manager folders. This is a real bargain on the transfer market!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Free Folk Heroes 3
description:
The Free Folk are a conglomerate group, consisting of many different northern tribes. Though they don’t all share the same ideologies or faiths, they do all have a shared goal: making a name and home for themselves in the southern parts of Westeros. Standing out from the average clansman are formidable adversaries, such as Barroq, a beast of a man who travels with his equally beastly Boar. The Great Walrus is well known for his skills in negotiation. And possibly most famous of all, Jon Snow seeks out his true destiny along the winding path that fate has taken him. Abel, the Bard, and his wife Dalla, make sure to sing their praises. These are but some of the individuals that have made a distinct name for themselves among the many faceless peoples of the Free Folk.

Contents:
6 Miniatures

Mance Rayder
Dalla
Jon Snow
Borroq
Borroq's Boar
The Great Walrus


5 Attachment Cards
3 NCU Cards
6 Tactics Cards
1 Movement Tray (73mm)

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: War Plan Z: The Kriegsmarine Strikes
description:
War Plan Z: The Kriegsmarine Strikes assumes that Adolf Hitler had not canceled the Kriegsmarine (Germany Navy) expansion program in 1939. World War II in Europe does not begin September of that year. Instead, Hitler waits until War Plan Z is complete (in various stages). The game is a strategic two player simulation of the ensuing hypothetical naval campaigns fought between the Germans and the Allies sometime in the 1940s. One assumption of the game is that since Germany concentrates on increasing the Navy, there is no campaign in the west, so France remains an Allied power. Germany and the USSR still divide Poland, and an uneasy peace remains in effect on the Eastern Front.

The game system shows the effects of various operations. Players conduct actions that encompass discrete combat, logistical, intelligence and other operations. A player can conduct one or more actions per turn, depending on control of bases.

Each area on the map is about 550 miles across. Each turn represents one month of operations. Ship units represent two fleet aircraft carriers, divisions of two or three battleships, four to eight cruisers, flotillas of 19-40 destroyers, or various numbers of other ship types. Most ground units in the game represent corps or divisions. Aircraft units represent six to twelve squadrons of aircraft.

—description from the publisher

name: Wizard Work
description:
There's work to be done in the fairy-tale kingdom, from transporting golden eggs to unblocking elven sewers.

Can you assemble the best team of wizards for each job?

You play as magical agents who are recruiting wizards as they walk into the local fairytale gathering-house looking for work. Chris invented and drew twenty-one original wizards - from Hercule the Impressive, master of mechanical magic to Small Norman, who is fairly good at not causing trouble. There's also a host of clients offering all sorts of gigs - your wizards might end up doing maze-building work for a Minotaur, putting in a shift at the magical bakery, or joining a dance troupe.

In each round, players compete to recruit wizards for the four different roles that the client needs, possibly bringing a familiar along to help out. Only the best team gets the job. So will you trust Sporegard Drizzle to put on a firework display for the king, or should you really wait to hire someone less damp?

—description from the publisher

name: Prosperitea: Halloween Expansion Pack
description:
Your goal is to be the most prestigious tea shop in the neighborhood.

With the halloween expansion pack you get a new cat friend called Nikki, she has special abilities in combination with a new pumpkin card.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game

name: WordUp!
description:
WordUp! Is a quick-playing word guessing game built for 2 or more players. The game plays well individually or in teams. You’ll flip over a card for a category (for this example, Animal) and then roll the die for the number of letters (let’s say 6). You have 60 seconds to give a 6 Letter Animal. Your score is based on the letters used in your answer. If you were to write down “Walrus”, you would receive 22 points, because...

W = 10 Points

A = 1 Point

L = 2 Points

R = 2 Points

U = 5 Points

S = 2 Points.

But there's a catch! If two people write down the same word, they both receive 0 points for that round.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Paper-and-Pencil

name: VS. System: The Coming of Galactus Giant-Size Deck
description: Expansion for the VS System that allows multiple players to fight against a single Galactus player.

name: Reavers of Midgard: Dan of All Trades Promo Cards
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

Set of 3 reaver cards for each of the clans.

Gain a terror token and a village spoils card upon activation.

name: Flick of Faith: Enki God Promo
description:
Originally available during the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Pack A.

Enki can use Prophets and Temples of any other god currently not in the game.

At the end of the Mission Phase, you may remove 2 of your Prophets from the Sea to place one of your Temples anywhere on any island.

name: Brave the Book
description: Turn any big book into a small solo dungeon-delving game!

name: Woodcraft: Italian Release Promo Cards
description: Set of 2 special order cards for those who pre-order the Italian edition of Woodcraft.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Income, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cards Christians Like: Trash Theology Expansion Pack
description: A 30-card expansion pack with the worst theology you’ve ever heard. Does the Bible actually say that or did your grandmother read it once in a fortune cookie and canonize it into your family’s theology? Are they Scripture or Hobby Lobby wall art quotes? You decide.

name: Cards Christians Like: Jesus Loves You Expansion Pack
description: A 30-card expansion pack with all the things Jesus ever said…completely out of context. Jesus said a lot, but did he really say that? People be taking things Jesus said out of context like they get paid do it, they might as well win a game of CCL while they’re at it.

name: Kill Sample Process
description:
Kill Sample Process is a stand-alone tabletop miniatures game and rpg setting from the creator of The Last War and Forbidden Psalm, inspired by and fully compatible with the CY_BÖRG ttrpg and other Forbidden Psalm miniatures games. Forbidden Psalm is a 28mm miniatures agnostic game. You can use ANY suitable miniatures you already own, or build custom minis for this game. Solo Play and Coop rules are included. All content is compatible with the CY_BÖRG ttrpg.

Kill Sample Process is a small-scale skirmish game, where you play with a crew of 5 miniatures per player, against AI controlled Hostiles in scenarios that take you across the neon hell scape of CY_. Play as enemies, cooperatively or solo.
Kill Sample Process Is a stand alone game using the Forbidden Psalm rules.

You do not require any other book to make use of this new setting, campaign, weapons, monsters and so much more.
Inspired by Neon, Narcotics and set in a world that should have ended, you will face such horrors as the The Un-Met, living clouds of Nano Swarms, The Machine God and many more hostiles from the rain drenched city.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: A l'Ombre de la louve
description:
A l'Ombre de la Louve is a Print & Play Strategic level Solitaire board-wargame simulating the expansion of the Roman Republic from BC 202, the victory of Zama against Carthage, to BC 102 the victory of Aquae Sextiae against the Cimbri. In this game, 1 turn represents 10 years of history. The player tries to conquer territories and develop colonies to increase the power of Rome. In correlation, the game mechanics simulate the opposition of the various nations to this expansion.
Can you do better than the Consuls of glorious Rome? Will you succeed in extending the shadow of the wolf over neighboring civilizations?

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: La Quête du GRaAL
description:
La Quête du GRAaL is a push-your-luck cooperative game in which you take the role of Parcival, going on a journey to find 4 great relics.

On their turn, players flip cards one by one, trying to find certain symbols, which will allow them to push their journey further by adding cards to the common deck. They must be careful, though, not to flip 5 skull symbols or they will lose a life, thus adding another skull in the deck.

name: Last Stand in Hokkaido 199x
description:
Last Stand in Hokkaido 199x is an "alternate history" Operational level two-player board-wargame set in the early 1990s when the Soviet Union invaded Hokkaido. In reality, this did not happen, and at that time the Soviet Army did not have the ability to land multiple divisions and maintain logistics, but the Soviet leader, who judged that the United States could temporarily gain sea and air control by allocating resources to other regions (such as the Middle East, as in history), judged that the military, economic, and political gains were balanced. Suppose you have made the decision to gather landing boats and transport ships and land and invade Hokkaido.

One person is in charge of the Self-Defense Forces and the other is in charge of the Soviet Army.


Published with Banzai magazine 14.

name: Days to Ragnarok
description:
A game of fragile alliances and utter tomfoolery. Vikings compete for loot as Ragnarök approaches. A card game for 3 to 6 players, featuring Nordic-themed puns that you may take quite the Viking too.
Play cards to gather loot and utilise the oxymoronic protection of the Doomsday deck. The player with the highest value loot and gold in their stash at the end of the game wins.

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Urlaubs Edition
description:
GAME PROCEDURE:
Each player receives one side of the A4 block and places it in front of them. A time is set for each round (we recommend 2 minutes as a limit). The innovative letter bar helps to determine the letter. Then it is a matter of entering all the terms as quickly as possible. There are 13 terms sought per round.

POINT DISTRIBUTION:

You can't think of a correct term = 0 points
At least one other player has the same term as you = 5 points
No other player has the same term as you = 10 points
You are the only one who can think of a term in the category = 20 points.


In addition, there are so-called FULL POST fields where you always get double the points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die urlaubsreife Edition des Kultspiels STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN rund ums Thema Ferien und Reisen.

Der ultimative Spielblock mit 29 kreativen und lustigen Kategorien für einen unvergesslichen Urlaub. Spaß garantiert!

Dieses Spiel fördert Wissen und Kreativität!

Die CHRISTMAS EDITION beinhaltet eine spannende Vielfalt mit 29 verschiedenen Kategorien.

Beispiele: Traumreiseziel, das hat mein Traumhotel, wird oft vergessen, auf der Skipiste, im Wasser und viele mehr!

Innovative Buchstabenleiste gegen Schummler.

Wische einfach mit dem Zeigefinger über die Buchstabenleiste. Wenn einer deiner Mitspieler “STOPP” sagt, steht der Buchstabe fest, mit dem gespielt werden muss.

Dieser ultimative Spielblock im DIN A4 Format beinhaltet 50 Blatt. So ist für viele ausgiebige Spielabende mit Familie und Freunden gesorgt.

Perfekt zum Verschenken oder den nächsten Urlaub.

SPIELABLAUF:
Jeder Spieler erhält eine Seite des DIN-A4 Blockes und legt diese vor sich hin. Es wird eine Zeit pro Durchgang ausgemacht (wir empfehlen 2 Minuten als Begrenzung). Die innovative Buchstabenleiste hilft bei der Ermittlung des Buchstabens. Dann gilt es so schnell wie möglich alle Begriffe einzutragen. Pro Runde sind 13 Begriffe gesucht.

PUNKTEVERTEILUNG:

Dir fällt kein richtiger Begriff ein = 0 Punkte
Mindestens ein Mitspieler hat denselben Begriff wie du = 5 Punkte
Kein Mitspieler hat den denselben Begriff wie du = 10 Punkte
Dir ist als Einziger ein Begriff in der Kategorie eingefallen = 20 Punkte


Außerdem gibt es sogenannte VOLLPFOSTEN-Felder bei denen man stets die doppelte Punktzahl erhält.

—description from the publisher

name: Beer or Air
description:
The players are a group of adventurers. After today's quest, you have come to a popular diner called "Barrel’s". Sadly, you are broke and don't have enough money to order a single beer. But don't worry! The restaurant has a beer dispenser that pours beer for every coin.
Stack your coins one at a time in front of you until someone decides to challenge everyone on the amount of coins they are ready to flip. Up the stakes by outbidding the Challenger and become the lucky adventurer who will fill their mug. The moment frothy foam is revealed though, the challenge is stopped and the player with a filled up mug drink it up!

Beer or Air plays like a variant of SKULL with with differences including scoring rules and special character abilities. Get your adventurer drunk and filled with happiness!

name: Football: Play It Again
description:
Football: Play It Again is a 1-2 player board game that simulates key moments in a football/soccer match. As a team coach or a spectator, you roll three dice (two 6-sided and one 12-sided die) to generate the event that occurred on the field.
The game has high playability, realism, and statistical accuracy. It allows matches to be played with retro teams taking into account the rules and playing styles of play in the era.
Sample events: long shots, headers, goalkeeper parades, tackles, cards, ricochets, injuries, the influence of soccer stars, unusual events.
The game includes 32 unique fantasy national teams (640 players) which can be used to play fantasy World Cup.
Players use tactics (basic and advanced) to attack or to defend the score. The player who scores more goals wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dragon Eats
description:
A food delivery game in a dungeon. Simple rules that can be explained in less than a minute, highly interactive strategy game Dragon Eats.
You need to collect the food items shown on the order card and complete the order to earn points. This is a set collection game that utilizes the timetracking mechanic.
Released at Tokyo Game Market 2023.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Flight of Icarus
description:
Soar high upon your wings, like an eagle, as you seek to escape the clutches of king Minos. But beware, fly too high and the sun will melt the wax that holds your wings together... fly too low and the moisture from the sea will make the feathers too heavy to keep you aloft.

Flight of Icarus is a fast-paced strategy game for 2-4 players in which you live out the classic Icarus myth. Build your wings, then brave the elements as you attempt to fly from Crete to the Greek mainland. During the first phase of the game you will collect wax and feathers using an action point system, managing these resources as you craft your wings. You may also play innovations to aid you during your flight. Then, you will take to the air, struggling against both the weather and your fellow fliers during the tactical phase of the game. Bid for the oracle's favor, that allows you to play weather cards and act first, as you jockey for position in the air.

An engaging mixture of strategic resource management and take-that mechanics, Flight of Icarus is fully language independent during play. Even should you fail in your flight, there is no player elimination, so you can still attempt to stop your competition from reaching the other shore.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Race, Take That, Turn Order: Auction

name: Dragon Gardens
description:
A 2–4 player strategy game where players, as cultists, must construct a garden in which shrines worthy of dragon worship are to be built.

The dragons however, are very picky about how the garden is constructed, and each only favours a single colour of decoration.

Players must perform 2–3 rituals at these dragon shrines in and around the garden. The first player to reach this number wins.

On each turn, players play cards to either move their cultists or decorate the garden.

The rituals have overlapping requirements however, so more often than not, the players will have to fight over the shrines they wish to access.

Make use of powerful warp spells to traverse the garden quicker, or build them into the garden for a permanent boost.

May the best cultists win the dragons' favours.

-description from designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Porca Miseria!
description: Try to make the best pizza you can. Take up to seven cards each turn, select an ingredient and be careful to not attract the fly that will ruin your delicious pizza. Get points by making pizzas with the most ingredients, while at least having the base dough. After three rounds, players count their points to be the winner.

name: Шакал Архипелаг: Остров приливов (Jackal Archipelago: Tide Island)
description:
This is the new island for the game Jackal: Archipelago. You'll have an adventure on a tidal island. The palm trees are tall and the shores go under water at high tide.

Tide Island has, you might guess, tides - if you come across one, be kind enough to remove the three squares from the surf strip. A palm tree has appeared (not just a tile, but physically, in the form of a wooden figurine): you can climb on it and be in the lodge. But with the gold on the palm can not, you have to leave all the coins at the bottom - they are also in the set.

Mix this set with the ones you already have to build even bigger islands.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Jungle Speed Collector
description: Jungle Speed Collector is a new version of the famous addictive card game combining observation, speed and reflexes. It contains twice as many cards as in the classic Jungle Speed game: a pack of 70 cards identical to the classic Jungle Speed version and 1 exclusive pack of 70 cards with totally new symbols! This Collector's Edition also marks the return of THE special color card and a new totem! With this Collector's Edition, the game can now be played by up to 10 players and the new cards make for even more exciting and rhythmic games!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Cyber Pet Quest
description:
Embark on a thrilling adventure with Jane, a fully bionic cat, and her cybernetically enhanced friends: Clay the dog, Freya the raccoon, and Roman the goose. Join this eclectic team as they set out to find Jane's missing owner, Howard, in the intra-apocalyptic city of San Lazaro. With its diverse and immersive locations and a quirky cast of enemies, this metropolis will keep you on the edge of your seat. As you delve deeper into the city, you'll need to flex your tactical muscles and harness the pets' array of unique abilities and powerful items to succeed in your quest. Will you uncover the truth behind Howard's disappearance and guide Jane to her missing owner? Your choices will determine the outcome.

Designed for 1-4 players, Cyber Pet Quest is played as a multi-chapter campaign. Taking the roles of the four pets, players investigate and interact with the environment, complete chapter objectives, gain power items and charms, and outsmart the enemies who are trying to stop them. The campaign has twelve chapters in a branching format so that players can play the full game multiple times to see the different branching stories.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Dice, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling, Turn Order: Random

name: Minerały: Promo 3 – Szlif (Kianit)
description: This expansion adds 1 tile - cut (Kyanite). It works like normal kyanite except that when you acquire collections with it you don't put it into the sack, but instead you put in on the player board, at the scoring phase it's always worth 2 points.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Victory Points as a Resource

name: WunderWaffen
description:
This is a game about two aspects of the last period of the Second World War: the troubled relationship of collaboration and rivalry between the Allies during the end of the war and the possibility that the Germans would develop the full potential of their new superweapons, to which the title was dedicated.
The game is published as a special of the Para Bellum magazine and he is the winner of the FIW award first edition.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation

name: Azione Violenta su Barcellona
description:
Azione Violenta su Barcellona is a small and simple Solitaire postcard wargame published as a freebie by SNAFU Design, as a gift to customers of SNAFU Store, and as a free downloadable PnP file.

It's a game on the “carpet bombing” campaign carried out by the Italian “Aviazione Legionaria” on March 16, 17 and 18, 1938. The campaign was carried out through over a dozen of daylight attacks by Savoia Marchetti SM.79s of the 8th Group “Falchi delle Baleari” and night-time bombardments by Savoia Marchetti SM.81s of the XXV Autonomous Night Bombing Group “Pipistrelli delle Baleari” taking off from Mallorca.

The player must plan in advance their air raids to some sectors of the city with the airplanes available each turn and manage to demoralize the city of Barcelona in a maximum of six turns. Failing to do this by the end turn 6 is a loss, which is the historical result. While the bombardments did inflict a lot of casualties and physical damage to the buildings and infrastructures, the population barely fled Barcelona, nor took the streets to force the government to capitulate.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Get the Ick
description:
Each round in Get the Ick the active player is presented with three distasteful situations that other people might do, such as:


Seeing them write "hehe" in a text.
Holding their nose while jumping into a swimming pool.
Walking really slowly.


The active player secretly chooses one of these situations as the thing that most icks them out, then everyone else tries to guess which situation this is. While guessing, however, the other players can secretly mark a situation as something they actually enjoy, scoring bonus points if others don't guess their "secret attraction" ahead of the tiles being revealed.

name: LÜK: Das Spiel
description:
This is a quiz game - fine the correct answer for each question and put the LÜK tile on that space. When you're done, turn it over and the pattern on the back will tell you if you were right or wrong.
A game for the whole family - everyone can share their expertise!
