name: My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game – Collision Course Expansion
description:
Due to some magical mayhem, the Transformers find themselves in Equestria, and the Decepticons have teamed up with nefarious Pony Villains, which can't lead to anything good.

In My Little Pony: Adventures in Equestria Deck-Building Game – Collision Course Expansion, the Mane Six (and Spike!) team up with the Autobots as two-in-one character cards. Use the Autobots abilities by generating Energon on cards — or getting an energy boost by eating a Sugar Cube instead.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Midnight Guardians
description:
Midnight Guardians Thanks to guardians like you there's still hope! Choose 1 of 4 Game Modes to experience this puzzly, set collection game of "cute horror."

As a Midnight Guardian, you alone stand between the innocent critters of Shady Valley and Zumoffa, Lord of Night. Zumoffa has manifested a great Wall of Pain, but a curse holds sway over the Lord of Night. Zumoffa is incapable of harming anyone found asleep.

Each Day Phase, you must act quickly to meet the critters' needs so they can get to sleep when night comes. You do this by collecting the food and comfort items they seek, and locating potent treasures to help speed up your work and slow down your enemies. If you don't find what you need in the field, sometimes a small roadside stand has just the thing. Its prices fluctuate frequently, but sometimes that can work in your favor.

Each Night Phase, the Wall of Pain slithers down over the valley like a forest fire, consuming one-quarter of the playing field, including resources and unsaved critters, which bolsters the wall's power. Dark Seeds grow here and there, empowering the wall further. House-sized metal monstrosities called "Little Horrors" herald Zumoffa's approach by capturing critters in cages. The tension ramps up as the resources dwindle.

Additional options and challenges are available using the Event deck, which temporarily alters certain rules or introduces new ones while hinting at the larger story and the wonders of the technomagical world of Toonaria.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Red X & Project Thaumaton Promo Cards
description:
These promo cards are included with Crisis Collection 2.

Red X
Villain (Impossible Mode Super-Villain)
You may discard any number of Ongoing cards you control. For each you do, gain a card from the Line-Up and put it into your hand. If you choose not to, +3 Power.
First Appearance — Attack: Each player destroys a card they control. Each who does gains the top card of the main deck and a Weakness.
Promo Crisis 4
6 VP
Cost 12

Project Thaumaton
Crisis
Put the top 2 cards of the main deck into the Line-Up.
Ongoing: When a Hero enters the Line-Up, Contribute it to this Crisis and put the top card of the main deck into the Line-Up. Contributed Heroes may be bought. Villains cost 2 more to defeat for each Contributed Hero.
TO BEAT: Contribute 2 Super Powers and 2 Equipment.
Promo Crisis 3
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Dominion: Verlies
description:
+ 1 action

Now and at the start of your next turn: +2 cards
Then discard 2 cards from your hand

Originally planned as correction card for the original Verlies out of the Abenteuerer-Box.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Rio Grande Games

name: 0-100 Vit: Mini
description:
A trivia game where you have to answer with a number ranging from 0 to 100. Answers can be in length, width, height, temperature, speed, size, age and given in units like centimeters, years, hours, crowns etc. The game differs from other trivia games which are often limited by given answer options.

The game is played in one round, consisting of seven questions. The player with the lowest score at the end of the game is the winner.

There are a total of 175 unique questions.

name: BIG 2: Pack O Game Micro Expansion
description: This deck of 30 cards adds new and extended gameplay for each of the titles in Pack O Game SET 2. 1-6 cards enhance: ORC, GYM, RUM, DIG, BOX, SPY, SOW and BOO.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming, Memory, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Mancala, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: The Audio Game
description: Turn up the volume at your next party with this hilarious game of raunchy setups and some of the internet’s most viral audio clips. Draw a setup card and have all players play their best reply with QR code facing up. Use the free The Audio Game app to scan the cards and reveal the hilarious sounds. For more laughs, we encourage you to play with 2 or more people. Spend the night competing with friends and family to see who can create the funniest combinations

name: Worms: The Board Game
description:
With a super-engaging blend of fun, strategy and luck – Worms is an absolute blast, and one of those ‘just one more game’ experiences that are amazing to enjoy with friends and family.

Featuring a hex-based landscape that your Worms will move around, collecting crates, dodging mines, and getting into position with the right weapon at the right time to unleash total tabletop hilarity on your foes. Keep your team alive, whittle down the opposition, and win the day!

We have classic weapons, supplies, a destructible landscape, oil barrels, wind, and should the game go on long enough…one of several sudden death cards will be waiting at the bottom of the deck…

And of course, we have our Worms! These are some of the most downright fun miniatures we’ve ever had the privilege to work on, and they’re full of charm and humor.

—description from the publisher

name: Adere
description:
Capture enemy discs by moving your own disc onto a stack of exactly the same height. Connect sides of the board to win.

You can play Adere on different boards, such as a standard triangular "Y" board or a rhombus "Hex" board.

name: Stool Pigeon: Stool Sample
description: Adds the new pigeon Pigeon Stool to the family. The new pigeon can lock down any face down card in any crime scene.

name: Obelisk
description:
Ancient Egypt is waiting for you!
Compete with your opponents and master the art of constructing beautiful obelisks. Collect different pieces of granite of the same color to build an obelisk. Play action cards to influence the game. Good timing and smart moves are required. What’s your tactic?

Obelisk is a set collection game for 2 to 5 players where players try to build Obelisks with the cards in their hands. These cards are received from a market in the center of the table. Players also each have their own market with cards that contains cards they didn't use to build obelisks, but these cards are open for other players to trade with camels.
The game ends when a certain part of the main market is empty. Players count the points of their obelisks and the player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Piraten Mikado
description: An exciting, dexterity game of skill. There’s Captain Mikado’s lost treasure! Carefully pull away the planks and collect coins without knocking over the animal pirates. Which player has just the right touch? A remake of the popular, classic game of skill with detailed illustrations that invite you to discover a 3D pirate ship.

name: Bunny Drops
description:
Everyone knows that bunnies can be messy! The more you feed them, the more little brown marbles show up on the floor. Bunny Drops is a light card game for 2-6 players. Cards are set in 6 piles, 3 piles acting as the column headers, 3 for row headers, with cards dealt to fill in the grid in the middle. When a card is in the column or row heading, it is shown bunny-side up. When flipping cards over to fill in the grid, they show as food side up (which also has bunny drops mixed in).

Each turn, players choose one column or one row to take. They get the bunny from the header and the combo of food and bunny drops from the remainder of the column or row they have taken. Each bunny has certain food requirements. Once a player collects 8 bunnies, the game end is triggered. Final scoring is 1pt for each food item given to a bunny to feed them and - 1 pt for each left over food item, and less the food item value of any rabbits not completely fed!

Will you feed the most bunnies or will you get caught cleaning up a mess?

—description from the publisher

name: Maailmanpelastuspeli
description:
Educational game for the Finnish schools. Promotes STEM studies as players try to produce enough resources for world population.

Simplified version of Kyoto Protocol. Played over three rounds and at the end of each round players with least production receive small penalty. Goal is to have most cards in play after three rounds.

name: Expansions of the Cariddean
description:
Expansions of the Cariddean features 5 different modules plus a set of promo Characters to enhance the experience of the base game, making it every time different.

It includes all expansions developed before the game launch which can be added one-by-one or bundled all at once in order to increase the playing group up to 5 Players adding variants with new ingredients (cards and tokens), increasing the scoring opportunities as well.

You can enroll shady character and exploit their special abilities; or gather map fragments and keys to obtain more prestige; grab precious stones being aware of the cursed amulet; assault opponent ships to steal their goods...

o Exp.1: Welcome to Shella (10 cards, Town folks, double side)
o Exp.2: Smugglers and Strugglers (10 cards, Onboard crew, dual types)
o Exp.3: The lost treasure (6 cards, Treasure map fragments)
o Exp.4: The cursed loot (6 cards, Shipwrecks’ presents)
o Exp.5: Flying knives (10 cards, Raiders’ stabbing )
o Special promo cards: Castaways (4 cards)

—description from the Publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: City of Myrkesh
description:
Welcome to the City of Myrkesh. Five districts, once divided with different goals and agendas for the city, must now stand together against the threat of destruction. Each player starts with a deck of ten ally cards and, on their turn, will send out their people to move through the city, recruit new allies and attack the monster that’s wreaking havoc.

The inhabitants of the City, although besieged, are mighty and resilient. Align yourself with the people of the 5 districts:

In the Merchant’s Row, Coin does the talking. Utilize your ability to procure cards better than anyone else, rush cards to the top of your deck and even utilize other players to broaden your card selection. Who will you barter with?

Those of the Royal Courts value flexibility and resourcefulness, utilizing both Coin and Power, Raise your levies, gain noble prestige and protect yourself from disruption. How will you show your status?

Those of the Industrial Grounds have one true motivation: Progress. Having the ability to draw cards like no one else and gaining cards that support multiple options, you will be able to adapt to any given situation with innovation by your side.

Those of the Wilds see Power as strength, and those that are weak will not last. Weather the destruction and ignore anything that would halt your ferocity. Brush off your wounds and inspire others to join your pack!

Those of the Undercity benefit from being anywhere in the city they want, utilizing speedy movement and sneaky tactics. Slander your opponents, cause their allies to revolt against them and slow down their movement so you can secure victory.

Whoever you align with, the unforgiving city will welcome you. Will you seek to have the most allies? Take on the monster before your opponents can? Or will you use the resources you have to spread your influence over the city and the people within it?

In the City of Myrkesh, Prestige is yours for the taking!

—description from the designer

name: Big City Builders
description:
Your toddler will build fine motor skills, color matching, direction following, turn taking, and decision making with Bit City Builders! Pick up materials from construction sites, roll the die and move your truck to the matching road, and deliver materials to the right site to collect stars.

Ravensburger preschool games grow with your child! Big City Builder includes multiple ways for your child to play on their own and for you to play together. Since 1883, Ravensburger has built a reputation across the globe as a trusted brand for parents and children. Ravensburger’s toys, games, and puzzles encourage discovery of what really matters through play.

Solo & Family Play!
Flexible Play for Growing Children – This game grows with your child! Explore multiple ways for your child to play on their own and for you to play together. Variant rules allow you to adapt the complexity of play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: FateFlip: Washed Ashore
description:
You come to on a sandy beach. The sun is burning your back, the sea salt makes your skin itchy, your tongue barely moves in your mouth… You remember a huge wave washing you overboard, and you quickly lost sight of the ship. You are lucky to stay alive. But where are you? Is this place inhabited and do ships sail here? Will you ever return to your homeland? And will you be able to even survive?

Washed Ashore is a story-based solo adventure in which the player takes the role of the game's main character who is shipwrecked and stranded on a deserted island. The player reads parts of the story on cards and makes decisions related to them, the consequences of which are revealed to the player immediately or after some time.

As the player progresses through the game and follows the story map by map, he finds/creates resources that he can further use to achieve the goals of the game.

The game consists of several parts/chapters, during which the main character tries to get off the island, finds and lives in a tribe of natives and tries to sail to his homeland on a ship that sailed to the islands.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Multiple Maps, Resource to Move, Storytelling
publishers: Alley Cat Games, Eclipse Editorial, Frosted Games, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, MeepleBR, Red Cat Games

name: Don't Skip Leg Day
description:
BRO, you've got only TWO weeks 'til the comp! Time to get serious about getting RIPPED. You gotta dig DEEP and max out those SICK GAINS if you wanna be the most YOKED bro on stage. But whatever you do, bro, DON'T skip leg day. A JACKED upper body wows the judges, but NOBODY likes chicken legs, bro.

Don't Skip Leg Day is a competitive game for 3-6 players, although you can add sets to increase the player count. The game is played over two rounds (weeks) consisting of seven turns (days). Each turn, all players select one card from their hand to keep, then pass the rest of their hand to another player. Players repeat this action (keeping a card and passing the ones they don't want) until all players have chosen seven cards. Some of the cards you choose to keep will be made public to all players, but many will remain a secret until the end of the game.

After two rounds, everyone's full collection of cards is revealed and scored based on a variety of scoring methods. The player with the fewest "Leg Day" exercises is eliminated from the competition. After that, the player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Cavern
description:
Deep in the woods, there's an abandoned tunnel network that has been overrun by a horde of creatures. You will venture inside and traverse through multiple floors and into its depths. Your goal is to clear each floor, defeat the creatures within, and collect treasure.

Each turn, you will roll to determine your type and amount of movement. As you pass through each square you will resolve interactions as they take place such as collecting weapons and items or fighting an enemy. You continue through each floor until you find the exit. You can use collected items/weapons, gain levels, and roll against traps, enemies, and bosses.

The game is over at the end of any floor when you wish to stop, or after five floors have been cleared. Count up all of the points you've earned on each floor to determine your total score. Compare this score to our ranking system to be awarded a title such as "seasoned adventurer".

The map size and difficulty increase as you get deeper into the cavern, so keep an eye to your hearts and be wary of the number of enemies you want to take on. If you lose your hearts, it's game over. Let your adventure begin.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Bier Pioniere: Th. Ganzenmueller Promo Card
description:
Essen spiel 2023 promo card for the base game.

You have to shuffle this card in the base deck.
Using this card you immediately take 1 beer barrel.

name: Bier Pioniere: Leopold Nathan Promo Card
description:
A promo card for Bier Pioniere, given out at Essen SPIEL 2023.

You have to shuffle with base deck, and using this promo you Advance your marker on progresso track or upgrade your marker.

name: Witchstone: Essen Spiel 2023 Promo Card
description:
Promo card given out at Essen Spiel 2023

4 points - own 5 scrolls
6 points - Have 7-8 wizards out on the board
8 points - reach at least the 4the silver space on the wand track

name: Zombies!!!: Museum of Weird
description:
When you thought you've seen it all, something like this comes along. Zombies!!! has spawned many different games with creatures that go bump in the night, and now they are all in one place: The Museum of Weird. But the creatures aren't the only strange things at this museum. You're in for the ride of your life!

Zombies!!!: Museum of Weird takes you on a journey through 20+ years of Twilight Creations' games. Visit the different rooms, fight the zombies that have been waiting for you, and hopefully make it out alive — if you're lucky! Movement is a challenge here...
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: B17 Twenty Five Missions: Pack 3
description:
This pack contains 15 additional missions (61-75) that can be played seamlessly with the B 17 Twenty five missions base game.

—description from the designer

name: Llépol
description:
Llépol is a card game that consists of opening a restaurant with typical dishes from the Terres de l'Ebre and using the coolest expressions of "Terreno".

It has very simple mechanics, ideal for playing with friends or the whole family.

The goal of the game is to get 4 customers (with a minimum of one regular customer) for your restaurant before the other players. Customers are obtained by adding up the points of each dish.


A regular customer costs 23 points.
A passing customer costs 12 points


—description from the publisher

Llépol és un joc de cartes que consisteix en obrir un restaurant amb plats típics de les Terres de l'Ebre i utilitzar les expressions més xaladores Del Terreno.

Té una mecànica molt senzilla, ideal per jugar amb amics o amb tota la família.

L’objectiu del joc és aconseguir 4 clients (amb un mínim d’un client habitual) per al teu restaurant abans que els altres jugadors. Els clients s’aconsegueixen sumant els punts de cada plat.

Un client habitual té un cost de 23 punts.

Un client de pas té un cost de 12 punts.

—description from the publisher (Catalan)

name: Final Fantasy VII Remake Boardgame: Materia Hunter
description:
Competitive 1v1 or 2v2 game where players compete to get the most materia.

Components:

20 Character cards
80 Materia cards (5 types of Materia x 16 each)
20 Medal tokens
5 Materia tiles (5 types of Materia x 1 each)
2 Rule sheets (Japanese, English)
publishers: Hobby Japan, Square Enix Co., Ltd.

name: Mango Tango
description:
In this action-packed reaction game, you call out "Mango" when you turn over the card, whereupon everyone else responds with "Tango" and throws their hands in the air - at least for the fruity mango. But what was the correct reaction to mango number 5 again? Six funny mangoes require different reactions, but if you're too slow or get confused and give the wrong answer, you'll never get rid of your cards! Can you keep track and win the game or will the others be quicker at the mango chutney? With different game variations: For an easy start, there are the basic rules, which increase to the super mango pro version - for even more excitement and variety!

—description from the publisher

name: Le Village
description:
Last night, your village was undermined by an authoritarian state. Some villagers had time to flee into the hills, others are imprisoned in the village. Luckily, you, the local child, are a mine-clearer. Your objective is to save the twelve villagers.

The Village is a single-player game halfway between Solitaire and Minesweeper. It's played with a traditional pack of cards in ~5 minute games. Deduction and risk-taking will be your best allies.

---

Cette nuit, votre village a été miné par un état autoritaire. Certains villageois ont eu le temps de fuir dans les collines, d’autres sont emprisonnés dans le village. Par chance, vous, l’Enfant du Pays, êtes démineur. Votre objectif est de sauver les douze villageois.

Le Village est un jeu solo à mi-chemin entre le Solitaire et le Démineur. Il se joue avec un jeu de cartes traditionnelles pour des parties de ~5min. Déduction et prise de risque seront vos meilleurs alliés.

name: SUPERA
description:
Three young trees, the White Bodied Beech, the Red Mahogany and a Dark Wild Chestnut are aspiring to be the tallest in a vast forest to rule the World.

Players on their turn are stacking their wooden blocks on a supporting base with limited stability aiming to grow their trees higher than the others. The more complex the elevating tower builds, the less stable it is bringing extra tension to this fast paced party-game.
The shape of the wooden block to be installed by the player is determined by the roll of a die. Players are requested to build their trees with the corresponding colors fitting to each other.
The game ends if the structure collapses or a block falls out from the tower or all blocks have been installed.
The winner is, who has the tallest tree, i.e. whose wooden block reaches the highest in the structure before the game ends.

This fast pace, high tension party-game makes family members of different ages playing together.

(Solo mode: pack the supporting base and the 44 wooden pieces back in to the tin container by solving this challenging 3D puzzle.)

—description from the designer

name: Temple Code
description:
Face rival archeologists in a race to unlock an ancient temple's forgotten secrets. Before you can lay hands on the invaluable treasure it's holding, you have to deduce the combinations of statuettes unlocking the hidden vault!

At the beginning of Temple Code, each player receives a combination card with a series of three unique statuettes that everyone can see but themselves. Each round, two combination cards are dealt face-up in front of each player. On your turn, pick a set of cards in front of another player, then take one for yourself and give them the other one. By aligning this card next to the one you're trying to guess, you will get hints about the matching statuettes: each blue circle indicates a statuette that is on both cards at the same place, and each orange triangle stands for a statuette that is on both cards, but in different positions.

At any time during the game, a player can guess the card in front of them. Whether they guessed correctly or not, they receive a new combination card to guess.

Whoever first correctly guesses two combinations wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Professor X & Shadow King
description:
Players will dominate the battlefield’s Astral Plane with the Professor X and Shadow King Character Pack. Both Professor X and Shadow King are mystic manipulators, with unique battlefield alteration abilities. Equipped with Team Tactic Cards that foster devious counterplay, these mental duelists are ready to boggle their opponents’ minds!

Professor X adds a long-awaited Leadership to the Uncanny X-Men Affiliation
Shadow King is a high-Threat miniature with a unique playstyle
The man for whom the X-Men are named finally joins his students on the battlefield!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Clash 451: Le Destin d'Attila
description:
In 451 AD, Valentinian III's army faced an incursion by Attila's Huns and his allies. Aetius, Generalissimo of the West, led the counter-offensive with the federated peoples of Rome's territory. History will be played out at the Catalaunic Fields.
Clash 451 is a duel card game for 20-minute games for players aged 14 and over.

—description from the publisher

name: Fake Crystal
description:
2377 of the New Era: steam, the world's main energy source, has just been relegated to oblivion. The discovery of the process for energizing power crystals has changed all that. Now, humanity runs on crystals.

Collect Crystals to claim trophies before your opponents, but beware of tempting offers and Fake Crystals!

Fake Crystal is a closed-economy trading and bluffing game where, to win the game, you'll need to collect crystals, earn trophies and save your credits.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction Compensation, Closed Economy Auction, Hidden Movement

name: Murder Mystery Mini: CANARY tells no tales
description:
A hard-boiled mystery set in Yokohama.
The woman who fell to her death from Hotel Nyao (Toriso) overlooking Yokohama Port was “Canary,” an undercover operative of the CIA who had been assigned to the terrorist organization ! Why did she die?
What is the connection with the terrorist plan that is being planned for the first time in 12 years? In order to pursue the ‘truth behind Canary’s death’ and prevent terrorism, two CIA operatives and two public security police officers begin an investigation.

“Mother Mystery” where each player takes charge of each character in the story and aims to “unravel the truth.” Please enjoy the story created by the detailed worldview and hard-boiled drama.

name: Dungeon Degenerates: Blasphemous Borborygmi of the Badlands
description:
The third book in the series of Choose or Lose Adventures. This book also came with a promo epic monster card: Jibbles.

Jibbles
Epic Monster.
Class: Ooze
Val: 4xp / 3 gold
Target: lowest MAG
Attack: 4
Armor: 0
HP: 11
Abilities: Acidic, Endless Regenerate, Slime

name: ライブミックス (Livemix)
description: A must-follow trick-taking game where players gain fans and idol group members by winning tricks. Idol member cards give players scoring conditions for the fan cards that they have won, but also give them negative points for any fan cards meeting those conditions that are left in their hand at the end of the round.

name: Don't Be A Donkey
description: Pin the tail on the donkey is so old school, am I right? If you're tired of the same old party games, try a different kind of donkey game. Get 4 matching cards and shout ""DONKEY!"" then hurry and grab a carrot or else slowly turn into a donkey. Lose one time, put up your left year. Lose two times, put up your right ear. Lose three times, and put on the donkey nose and give us your best ""HEE-HAW""! When the game is over, take a photo of the loser and share it with the folks at Brybelly. They'll sure get a kick out of it!
publishers: Brybelly, Entertoyment, Glop! Games, Grandi Giochi, Ideal

name: Sorcerer: Bloodcursed Ship Domain Pack
description: This pack is a complete Domain Deck for use with Sorcerer, containing the Bloodcursed Ship domain skill card and 10 cards for your grimoire.

name: Sorcerer: The Forlorn Opera House Domain Pack
description: This pack is a complete Domain Deck for use with Sorcerer containing The Forlorn Opera House Domain skill card and 10 cards for your grimoire.

name: Sorcerer: Merlin Character Pack
description: This pack is a complete Character Deck for use with Sorcerer, containing the Merlin avatar standee, the Merlin character skill card and 10 cards for your grimoire.

name: Sorcerer: Nicodemus Character Pack
description: This pack is a complete Character Deck for use with Sorcerer, containing a Nicodemus avatar standee, the Nicodemus character skill card, 8 stigma counters, and 10 cards for your grimoire.

name: Bolide Tracks #2: Bugeleisenring (Germany) and Tsunami (Japan)
description:
More Tracks for the Bolide racing Game
- Bugeleisenring(Germany) - "L" Curves
- Tsunami (Japan) - Race The Waves

Expands:

Bolide

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Written and Bound Asylum Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The quest for a deeper understanding of reality permeates Written and Bound, the first Asylum Pack from the upcoming "Revelations" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game.

While a few sensitive minds shudder at the darker powers they perceive, the bulk of humanity goes about its daily business blissfully unaware of the terrible powers that slowly dig their claws into the very heart of society. Cultists and servitors worship the dread Ancient Ones and seek to extend their influence on earth. Secret societies conduct dark rituals in hidden chambers beneath public notice, criminals buy and sell eldritch relics on the black market, and otherworldly creatures flit through the dimensions, existing beyond the realm of human perception.

Written and Bound introduces 60 new cards (three copies each of 20 cards) that reinforce the power of knowledge and the importance of knowledge seekers in the Call of Cthulhu mythos. New Tome cards, a Library, Criminals, Scientists, Investigators, and Relic Hunters all provide the different factions powerful new ways to use knowledge to manipulate the world to their own ends – or to liberate it from the Ancient One's ever-tightening grasp.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Evolution: Promo Pack IV
description:
This expansion add 35 traits cards to the base game Evolution :

7 cards "Sharps Teeth".
7 cards "Unstable DNA".
7 cards "Rapid Mutation".
7 cards "Quills".
7 cards "Pest".


Cette extension ajoute 35 cartes Traits au jeu de base Evolution:

7 cartes "Dents Accérées".
7 Cartes "Instabilité Génétique".
7 cartes "Mutation Spontannée".
7 cartes "Piquants".
7 cartes "Peste".
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Prehistoric
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That
publishers: Egmont Polska, Funforge, Gameland 游戏大陆, Gém Klub Kft., NorthStar Game Studio, Pendragon Game Studio, Rightgames RBG SIA, Schmidt Spiele, Siam Board Games

name: Magic: The Gathering – Dissension
description:
Trouble is brewing on Ravnica. Followers of the demon Rakdos live for instant gratification and nonstop hedonism. The Simic are tinkering with a primordial creature that threatens the very existence of the great city. Lawmages of the Azorius enlist spectral help to deal with the situation. Which guild will you choose?

This 180-card deck includes introduces three more Ravnica guilds: Azorius Senate (blue-white), Rakdos Cult (black-red), and Simic Combine (green-blue).

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Magic: The Gathering – Planar Chaos
description:
Dominaria’s time rifts are merging past with present, creating an overlap of bizarre, alternate histories. Can you mend the planar rifts before they corrode the whole Multiverse—and will you survive it?

The second set in the Time Spiral block, Planar Chaos features 165 cards, including 45 with a frame treatment from an alternative timeline, and randomly inserted premium cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Tusk
description:
Tusk is a beer-and-pretzels hunting game using 15mm miniatures on a terrain board (conversion to other scales is not difficult.)
Players represent hunters who either are cavemen or Victorian (Lost World) hunters hunting mammoths or dinosaurs.
The rules are tongue-and-cheek and easy to follow.
Solitaire play is facilitated by the system's animal reaction tables which detail how an animal reacts to certain actions by the player(s.)
Three basic scenarios are included in the rules.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: S.F.3.D II Operation Faserei
description:
(from the back of the Twentieth Century Imports version:)

S.F.3.D #2 is a fast-moving, realistic 2-player game of war. It is a sequel to S.F.3.D #1, and is meant to expand this game. While it can be played separately, most of the scenarios enclosed involve using maps and counters from both games. This game has been thoroughly playtested in the U.S.

Limited, Numbered Edition of 2,040.

- 480 Superb, die-cut, double-sided oversized counters; most are entirely new units (sp) types (see box front and back).
- 3 folding, full-color, semi-geomorphic mapboards.
- 24-page Japanese rules book, and...
- 16-page English rules book, numbered. This book contains the complete S.F.3.D rules, not just the new features to this edition. New features: Morale, Artillery, Mines, Engineers, Fire, Smoke, Elevation, Infantry, and others.
- Variants by the American Play test Team.
- 12 New Scenarios, in booklet form.
- 2 Combat Results Cards, 2 Dice, 1 counters tray.

(C) 1986 - Twentieth Century Imports, USA
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Rough Riders
description:
(from Simulations Workshop website:)

A tactical simulation of the Battle for San Juan Hill, fought on July 1, 1898 during the Spanish-American War. It was the largest land battle fought during the war, and the American victory would propel Teddy Roosevelt towards the White House. The battle was not as one-sided as most Americans think, as Spanish troops fought with bravery and grim determination, and inflicted 3 times their own casualties on the American forces.

The basic units in the game are regiments of infantry and dismounted cavalry for the Americans, companies and battalions for the Spanish, and batteries of artillery for both sides.
The scale is 125 yards per hex, with 45 minutes per turn, and roughly 60 to 75 men per strength point.

Ranged fire, assaults, morale, leader casualties, step reduction, Gatling Guns, sharpshooters, the observation balloon, journalists, trenches, and the Sims-Dudley dynamite gun are all covered. Two scenarios, one covering the historical fight and one a "what-if." Solitaire rules included.

name: Space Marvels 6 Express
description:
The future is here! Build the foundations of the Future Ages of Exploration in Culture, Science, Trade and Military while forming the Organizations that will rule Mankind.

Space Marvels 6 Express (SM6e) is a PnP Express tile laying game for 2 to 5 players in the vein of 7 Wonders playable in 15-20 minutes.

Players begin by each choosing a different Marvel Board, divided into 3 different sections, or Ages of exploration. Each board gives the player an initial resource. Players are also given 3 credits to start the game.

Players are then dealt a hand of tiles (8 tiles 2-3 players, 6 tiles for 4-5 players) and may do one of three things during each phase of a round:

a. Play a tile if they can pay the cost in resources, gaining future benefits, resources, and other bonuses
b. Use the tile face down + pay resources to build a section of their Marvel (thereby gaining bonus abilities)
c. Discard the tile for 3 credits

Players may play their tiles simultaneously and may buy resources from neighboring players at a cost of 2 credits.

After each player has played a tile, all players pass their remaining tiles to the player next to them.

The rounds end when all tiles dealt have been played. A VP scoring round them occurs comparing Military strengths of each player. VP is awarded and a new round begins with the next set of tiles.

After 3 rounds of play, groups of tiles are scored for VP based upon Organizations built as well as credits earned and final Military strengths of each player.

Player with the most VP is the winner.

For the 2 player game, a dummy hand of tiles is dealt and players use that dummy hand as part of the hand passing portion of the game.

Winner - 2013 In-A-Tin/Express Contest - Best Pre-Contest Game
categories: City Building, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Satirik: Herojska potraga
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Satirik - Heroic Quest is a fantasy adventure board game for 2-5 players aged 10 and over, playable for 25-50 minutes.
During each adventure where you play one of 5 brave heroes, you will find magical items that you use only once and equipment that give you permanent bonuses.You will meet companions who can help or hinder you in your quest, you shall fight with the guards unconquered region, but also with other heroes, and unforeseen events will dramatically change the flow of your adventures.

The game plays with moves(throwing dice), one player at a time. Move, attack other heroes and regions,use of objects and drawing prospective card only while in the course of your move. It is also not allowed and move and perform some action in the same turn. If during the movement meet with other heroes, you can attack it, do nothing or make a trade. Trump can exchange items, equipment, regions, etc., but not tasks. Battles are resolved classic throwing two dice (with the would-be certain bonuses and minuses), but you automatically lose if you get two aces,while with two sixes you automatically win the battle. There are also various other accessories that enrich the game: Treasury, shortcuts, dungeons, sanctuaries, teleport, an abyss ...

Despite this wealth of options, the game is very simple and the rules are very easy to learn and leave no room for doubts. Game will even complete inexperienced players quite soon. In addition, Satirik is a very addictive game and it will certainly hold your attention for a long time. We recommend a game with as many players so you can add more excitement to the party (and last much longer).
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS The Board Game
description:
Battlegrounds the Board Game is a battle royal game that can be played with 1-6 players. The game provides FFA, team mode, and solo mode with AI enemies.

Players use a variety of weapons and strategies to fight to the land man standing.

Each round, players spend staminas to move, loot, and attack other competitors to eliminate them and keep themselves safe.

When you attack, you choose a weapon that fits the range and roll the dice. Each face of the die shows which part of the body you hit.

As the game progresses, the blue zone narrows and the playing area shrinks. Players may utilize vehicles on the map to move faster and take advantage of the available terrains.

There are items that are attached to your firearm to enhance the weapons. Other items can be used on yourself or thrown.

You win if you survive to the end and become the last man standing.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Kill Steal, Player Elimination, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Food Fight Promo Cards
description:
You won't ever find these Food Fight promos in a kid's meal! The sumptuous Cheeky Royale, Aunt Butterface, and Humping Dumpty can be added to your regular Food Fight game, allowing you to spice up gameplay with these tantalizing instants! Oh, and as an added bonus: they are a hilarious departure from the cleaner comedy you may find in your regular copy of the game.

The 3-card Food Fight promo pack can be acquired by purchasing the game from Cryptozoic Entertainment at events or through the Cryptozoic Entertainment e-store.

name: 1988: Chirac contre Mitterrand
description:
In 1988: Chirac contre Mitterrand, each player embodies one of the two French presidential candidates. Each candidate will have to convince public opinion of three qualities expected of a future President of the Republic: charisma, courage and integrity.

On each game turn, you draw three Event cards recalling significant current events from the first cohabitation (1986-1988).

You will have to make a political choice associated with one of these events in order to influence public opinion. You will then put the other two cards back under your opponent's draw pile.

But beware: while some of these choices are more effective, they also expose you to power drain. Abuse of it can result in a cruel and premature defeat!

name: 포켓몬 칩스 (Pokémon Chips)
description:
포켓몬 칩스 ("Pokémon Chips") is a Pokémon-themed version of Bag of Chips in which everyone is trying to score valuable Pokémon each round to be the first to collect 10 points or grab one trophy. The Pokemon edition is scored differently from the standard edition.

At the start of a round, each player is dealt five objective cards and the Pokéball tokens are placed in the bag. Someone draws four tokens from the bag and places them on the beach card, then everyone discards one of their objective cards. The player draws three more tokens, then everyone discards another objective card. The player draws two more tokens, then everyone discards another objective card. The player then draws one final token.

If a played objective card has not been completed, discard it. If the objective is met, the player keeps the card. Of both objectives are met, the player picks which card to keep. First to ten points or meets the objective on a trophy card wins.

포켓몬 칩스 includes trainer cards that give each player a special unique power.

name: Star Wars Miniatures: The Clone Wars Starter Set
description: Standalone set of Star Wars Miniatures. Contains rules, double-sided map, die, character cards, and miniatures for General Kenobi, 2 Clone Troopers, Count Dooku, and 2 Droids. Can be played by itself or as an expansion.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Suspects: Shakespeares Tränen
description:
Murder has taken place at the girls' boarding school in Nottingham! Who killed the Head of House, Miss Doyle? And what role does Shakespeare's cat play in this affair?

In Suspects: Shakespeares Tränen, the player must solve this case together with detective Claire Harper! Throughout the fascinating story, you must collect clues, question suspects, discuss evidence, and investigate the crime scene. Will you rise to the challenge?

name: Dungeon Twister: Ogre
description:
The Ogre is a mini expansion for the Dungeon Twister series of games. The Ogre comes in blue and orange color, so it´s only usable in a 2-player game. It stats are Movement 2, Combat 4

Stun
Once per turn, the Ogre can stun an adjacent enemy character for 1 AP. Place a stunned marker on the victim. A stunned character is considered wounded. All rules applying to wounded characters also apply to stunned characters. At the end of his turn, the active player removes all stunned markers on all of his characters. They can act normally next turn.

The ogre was given out at Dungeon Twister tournaments during the tournament season in 2007. Leftovers are still given out at various Dungeon Twister tournaments.

Expands

Dungeon Twister
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Federation Commander: Academy
description:
Federation Commander: Academy is a lower-cost entry-level game for the Federation Commander Series. It includes the complete rulebook, counters, four ship cards, paper map, and a reference card.

Players will need dice and markers to play; everything else is included.

An expansion, Federation Commander: Graduation, allows owners of both Academy and Graduation to have everything in the base set: Federation Commander: Klingon Border.

Expanded by:

Federation Commander: Graduation
Federation Commander: Briefing #1
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: KiCKeT!
description:
KiCKeT is a football simulation game based on tactical movement of miniatures. The game is played with the feet: miniatures movement, passes and shots on goal, goalkeeper defence are all performed with one foot.

The game is about to get published and several versions of the box are envisaged. The boxes only differ in terms of amount of components, i.e. the number miniatures and the addition or not of various accessories.

“Standard" components:
- 2 or 4 wooden miniature field players, 20 cm high
- 2 wooden miniature goalkeepers, 20 cm high
- 2 goals of adjustable size
- 1 small fake-leather ball, soft inflated (no risk of damage…)
- markers for field and goal area corners

The game is playable on many surfaces: grass, carpet, parquet floor (with the “socks” accessory), cement, even sand !

The number of miniatures should be adapted to the field size, e.g. 2x3 m with 2 field players and a goalkeeper, 4x6 m with 4 field players and a goalkeeper.

As for human players, they can of course play 1-on-1, but playing 2-on-2 works perfectly, and with more players also assuming more miniatures (and space) are available. An atmosphere of table football played with the feet, or of giant, say, 8-players football table.

Basic rules:
- players take turns, and have 2 actions per turn
- possible actions are: move a miniature, or play the ball; the ball can be played directly with the foot, or a miniature can be pushed such that it moves the ball
- to be allowed to kick the ball, it must first be under control: a miniature controls the ball if one foot cannot be inserted between the miniature and the ball
- a shot on goal can be taken at any time, if the ball is under control; the intention to shoot must be announced
- the opponent can defend his goal with one foot; his other foot must stay planted behind the goal
- any contact with another miniature is a foul, which ends the turn

Other simple and logical rules take care of particular circumstances, in order to keep the flow of the game going.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Miniatures, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Simulation

name: Callanish
description:
In Isle of Lewis (Outer Hebrides, Scotland) are located some of the most impressive prehistoric megalithic structures in Europe. The most important sites are around the area of Callanish and include stone circles, cairns and stone alignments.

The goal of Callanish is to align a certain number of stones or stacks of the same colour horizontally or vertically along any file or rank of the board. The stones/stacks can be contiguous or separated.

MATERIAL

In order to play Callanish you need:

- A board with 9 squares each way, giving 81 squares in all. The outermost squares differ in colour, so players can choose to play either in a 9 x 9 (standard size) or in a 7 x 7 board.
- A supply of black and white stones.
- 16 gray stones (exclusively used to modify the board design).

name: Tank Leader Terrain Tile Pack
description:
Expansion pack for Sherman and Tiger Leader games.

This expansion includes Terrain Tiles for Europe, Winter, Desert, and Jungle. It also includes 4 new Terrain types: Roads, Rivers, Bogging, and Outposts and a rules sheet for new terrain types.

This new terrain will allow for different scenario layouts in either the Sherman Leader or Tiger Leader games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting

name: Fields of Green: Stolen Property Promo Card
description:
Part of Artipia's A Fair, a Robbery and a Promo Pack Kickstarter Campaign

Construction/Immediate card

Costs 3; Worth 1 VP at the end of the game

Text:
Choose another play and have them place Stolen Property in their farm. Take an Equipment from that player and place it in your farm.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order

name: Rolling Realms: Can't Stop Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Can't Stop.

To play this realm, you will first mark possible future rewards, which you don't gain immediately. After marking a reward, you may choose to stop in that column and gain all marked benefits. But be careful, because you might not roll the needed number anymore and be left with nothing.

-description from developer

name: Isla
description:
"...My satchel is packed and heavy with journals, sketchbooks, bell jars and test tubes. I am ready to fulfil my destiny, learning the secrets of this place and I must hurry as I feel almost as though I am competing with myself to become the master of this place. What Flora, Fauna and Fossil will I discover as I explore - after such a journey - this new world; Isla!"

Draw your journey across Isla, discovering the island's famous flora, fauna, and fossils. Following the end of your travels, if you’ve explored more of the jungle and discovered lots of species you’ll earn yourself international prestige. In contrast, areas unexplored will tarnish your reputation. When everyone has finished exploring the island, the explorer with the highest victory points wins.

The game is played through a series of rounds. Each round, players plan their day choosing to rest, move or research. One player will roll all 5 movement dice, players who chose to move can select a die result to explore Isla, those who rest can recover their lowest value die, and those who chose to research will select a card showing the flora, fauna or fossil they’ve discovered to earn themselves reputation points. But it's not so easy, the further you travel through the jungle, you may stumble over a branch, pick up a poisonous plant or discover you may not be alone on the island. As explorers, you are tasked with researching the species you discover so hurry before someone else claims the discovery!

An explorative roll and write game in which players uncover the mysteries of a curious island whilst battling exhaustion.

-description from publisher

name: Zooloretto: Capybara
description:
An expansion for Zooloretto, given for free by Abacus at Spiel 2019 in Essen.

This expansion consists of 1 tile with a Capybara.
Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for one rule: the first player, who fill his 6-space enclosure takes the Capybara enclosure from the middle of the table as a bonus.

The owner of the Capybara enclosure can pay twice in the entire game one coin to place a tile they have just drawn on a delivery truck that already has 3 tiles on it. The coins remain on the Capybara enclosure until the end of the game as a reminder.

Scoring: The coins on the Capybara enclosure are not considered during scoring.

One side is English (Capybara), other side is German (Wasserschwein).

name: Funkoverse Strategy Game: Squid Game 100
description:
In the Funkoverse Strategy Game, you combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in exciting game scenarios. Each turn, you select one of your characters and perform two actions. Each character has access to basic actions like moving and challenges as well as several unique abilities that may be performed only by spending ability tokens. Funkoverse uses an innovative “cooldown” system — the more powerful the ability, the longer it will take for the ability token to become available again — so players have to spend their ability tokens wisely. Each character in Funkoverse is unique, so players are encouraged to try out different combinations of characters and items in order to discover their favorite synergies and powerful strategies for the different game scenario.

Race to the finish line in Red Light, Green Light, or try to burst past your rivals’ defenses in The Squid Game! Each figure is a unique, playable character with their own abilities, and Front Man can change the rules of the game as you play, for both allies and rivals!
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Variable Player Powers

name: From Valmy to Waterloo
description:
From Valmy to Waterloo is a miniatures game detailing warfare in Europe from 1792 through 1815. The game is divided into 2 parts, grand tactical and tactical. At the grand tactical level, the player is able to take on the role of Army Commander issuing orders to Corps and Divisions. At the tactical level allows for players to implement the orders of the Army commander. Written orders make up a very important part of the game.

Rules are somewhat complex, but once mastered give an accurate picture of conflict in the time period.

Game includes:


104-page rule booklet
56-page Army Lists and Scenarios booklet
18-page reference-sheet booklet
4 reference cards
2 template sheets (to be photocopied onto clear acetate)
1 orders sheet
2 half-sheets of counters


Scenarios:

Golymin 1807
Linz 1809
Wagram - first day 1809
Quatre Bras 1815
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Special Ops Issue #3
description:
Special Ops Issue #3 includes the game A Victory Complete: The Battle of Tannenberg, 1914, articles and errata counters for several MMP games.

It also contains ASL/ASLSK material.

ASL/ASLSK articles:

ASL Etiquette by Dave Ramsey
Don’t Go Off Half-Tracked: Getting the Most Out Of Your Halftracks in ASL by John Slotwinski & Phil Palmer
Teaching ASL by Robert Wolkey
Forward to Elst! by Ken Dunn


ASL scenarios:

O5 The Tsar’s Infernal Machines (Brian Youse & Ken Dunn)


This 7-turn scenario is a 1914 World War I action between Russian and German forces and features two new vehicles: the Russo-Balt armored car and the Mannesmann-Mulag armored truck. The infantry of each side is represented by Conscript MMC that are treated as Green by SSR and may use a version of the Banzai Charge to maneuver “en masse.”
18 German squads, 10 Russian squads & 2 crews, 5 Russian AFV


O6 Third Time’s The Charm (Ken Dunn)


This 7-turn scenario, set in the Crimea in 1942, features a Russian relief force attempting to aid a surrounded Russian rifle regiment in its attempt to break out through German lines.
10.5 German squads & one crew, 14 Russian squads and a variable number of reinforcement Infantry, 6 Russian AFV

ASLSK scenarios:

S52 Extraordinary Bravery (Tom Morin)


Set in Danzig on September 1, 1939, a small but determined Polish force must hold off a polyglot force of VGAD (Reinforced Border Surveillance Service, or Verstärker-Grenz-Aufsichts-Dienst) and SS units in their efforts to wrest control of the Danzig Post Office away from its defenders in this 4½-turn scenario.
7 Polish squads, a mixed force of 4-4-7 SS squads and Axis Minor 1st Line/Conscripts, 1 German AFV and 2 German 75* INF guns.


S53 Workers Unite! (Vincent Maresca)


A mixed force of Russian industrial workers and NKVD troops must defend Smolensk for 6½ turns from the German 29th “Falcon” Infantry Division, including a detachment of Pioniers with flamethrowers and demolition charges.
18 Russian 1st Line and Conscript squads and 18 German Elite & 1st Line squads.

ASL other material:

Fourteen ½” and eighteen 5/8” counters for use with two of the issue’s scenarios
Also included are Chapter H entries for the Russo-Balt armored car and the Mannesmann-Mulag armored truck used in scenario O5.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Ambal Tournament: Foundation
description:
Ambal Tournament is a Card Game with simultaneous rounds, meaning each player puts their skills face down and reveals them at the same time. Deck construction and deck building allows deep customization using up to two Schools of Knowledge, each representing an area of knowledge with their own set of cards and style of play.
Ambal Tournament | Foundation is the first set released, containing 100 cards. Duels can be 1vs1 or 2vs2 and each card is a skill, varying from Actions (physically inclined), Spells (magically inclined) or Abilities.

Welcome to the Ambal Tournament! Participants from the spiritual land of Ambal gather in this friendly competition, promoting the development of knowledge and combat techniques. If the past taught anything to the human capitals, was that they should be prepared to defend themselves from the powerful spirits living in this world. Master the great Schools of Knowledge and their unique powers, competing in diverse and exciting duels to earn a spot amongst the elite group of fighters ready to defend Ambal.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game – Faramir Promos
description:
Set of 2 extra cards for Cryptozoic's The Lord of the Ring: The Return of the King Deck-Building Game:

- Faramir: another playable hero. Card text: "Human Hero / You start the game with 'I Did What I Judged to be Right' in your deck."
- I Did What I Judged to be Right: Starter deck card for player with Faramir as hero. Card text: "Maneuver / If this is the first card you play this turn, discard your hand and draw five cards. Otherwise, +1 Power."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Gil Hodges' Pennant Fever
description:
Part of a 5 game series of Rocky Graziano (Boxing), Vince Lombardi (Football), Gil Hodges (Baseball), Rod Gilbert (Hockey), and Oscar Robertson (Basketball).

Historical players are rated with batters having a numeric contact and alpha power factor. Pitchers had a numeric pitching factor and numeric endurance factor. Certain players had special fielding or running or power pitching factors. Interaction of pitching and contact numbers and dice roll drives each at bat. Results in high level treatment as players fall into broader groupings with the linear numbers (contact and pitching numbers 3-9).
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: Combat Commander 1973-1983: Battlefield Command – Land Combat in the 1980's
description: Battlefield Command is an "update and expansion" of Combat Commander. "By using rules in Battlefield Command in conjunction with Combat Commander, an extremely accurate 'advanced game' is achieved."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Heavy Gear Arena
description:
What is Arena? It's in your face! It's multi-ton robots trashing each other! It's all about drama on the field and off the field! This isn't your slow paced hack fest! This is Gears kicking tail and taking names!

Hire the best. Kit your Gears. Slug it out with the best. Only one team can rise to the top, but do you have what it takes to win?

Heavy Gear Arena is a fast paced, highly customizable tactical battle game set in the award winning Heavy Gear setting. For centuries, Terra Nova's best pilots have taken their Gears, advanced robotic fighting machines, and pitted them against each other in the world of sports dueling. Only the best stay in the games and earn their legendary reputations. Of course, reputations only get you so far. Winning equals money for upgrading your team and its equipment, the support of your adoring fans brings fame and more importantly the corporate sponsors, or just the thrills, pilots come from all over to find the thing they're desperate for in Khayr ad-Din.

Take on the role of team manager and build up your team to pit against the competition.

What you'll find in Heavy Gear Arena:

Robust tournament campaign rules
Duelists capable of growing in experience and talent
In depth Gear Customization
Support Personnel to aid your team's growth
Fast paced combat with combo chains and Duelist Talents

name: Dreadball: Galactic Tour Series – Azure Forest
description:
On the edge of the GCPS, DreadBall can be a little different than in the high-tech Core. The open-air arenas of Azure IX, situated amid the moon’s massive rainforests, bring a whole host of new challenges even to veteran players. They’ll have to deal with changing weather, local lifeforms and some very excitable fans if they’re going to make it in the Azure Forest League!

Galactic Tour Series packs let you play DreadBall in different ways to represent how the sport varies across the galaxy. In this pack, there are rules for weather effects and new Cheerleader actions, as well as new event cards to alter your DreadBall deck and bring new elements into play.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Delta Flyer Expansion Pack
description:
The Delta Flyer was a Federation shuttlecraft designed by Tom Paris, B'Elanna Torres, Harry Kim, Tuvok, and Seven-of-Nine and was created to handle the extreme environments of the Delta Quadrant. It featured Starfleet and Borg technologies, including a parametallic hull and photonic missiles.
This expansion adds a new ship and a new set of cards to Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Devil's Beach: The Omaha Landings
description:
The Devil’s Beach depicts the invasion of Omaha Beach and the fighting across the Normandy countryside on June 6, 1944. Player’s control the American and German forces that fought in the battle, in a bid to uphold history, or to change it.

UPDATE:

This game has been redeveloped by the new LnLP staff improving the counters, maps, rules, and scenarios in the game.

If you have purchased Omaha: The Battle for the Beach at the current LnLP Store, we will provide you a FREE Print and Play edition that you can be download from your order history from the LnLP Store.

Print On Demand Edition: The Print On Demand Edition includes full color printed, manual, player aid cards, larger maps, and counters printed on Sticker sheets and chit board to mount them on. Once you received your game you will be all ready to play. The Print and Play edition is included for free with our Print On Demand Edition.

Print and Play Edition: The Print and Play Edition is available as a downloadable Print and Play files that can be printed in both US Letter and A4 paper sizes. Our Print and Play Edition includes individual files for the manual, player aid cards, counters and smaller multi-part maps for home printers and larger map files that can be printed at a local print shop. You may select to purchase only Print and Play Edition and reduce the price of the game under the Available Options on the product page.

name: Archipirata
description:
Have you heard the rumour that's been running around lately? It seems that the Black Baronet, one of the most fearsome pirates, died and hid his treasures on the Skull’s floating islands. Hurry up and steer the ship to get your hands on the loot, as you might run into some greedy freebooters.
​
Move pirates from island to island to find treasures or pick a special action. Victory belongs to the player who discovers first three treasures or who eliminates the opposing crew. A captivating, straightforward game with a surprising level of strategy.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Shadows over Innistrad
description:
Shadows over Innistrad is a Magic: The Gathering expansion block consisting of the sets Shadows over Innistrad and Eldritch Moon.

Shadows over Innistrad has five main mechanics:


Madness: a returning mechanic from Time Spiral that allows a player to cast a card for its madness cost instead of being discarded. This is shown on the card Fiery Temper.
Delirium: counts the number of different card types in a player's graveyard. If that player has four or more card types among cards in their graveyard (e.g. creature, instant, sorcery, land), delirium will grant specific effects or bonuses, like the card Soul Swallower.
Investigate: a keyword that creates a Clue artifact token that you may pay 2 generic mana and sacrifice to draw a card, as seen on cards like Tireless Tracker.
Transform: a returning mechanic from original Innistrad, allowing the card to "transform" to its back side if certain conditions are met, such as the card Westvale Abbey.
Skulk: an evasion ability that appears on creature cards meaning that they can't be blocked by creatures with greater power, such as Rancid Rats.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Fast Action Racing: Open Wheel-Stock Car
description:
Fast Action Racing brings you all of the drama and excitement of motor racing to your tabletop. Do not let the name fool you. This is NOT a quick play game. However, it does play quickly. Our unique grid system allows you to play out an entire race in 20 minutes, once you have learned the rules.

Our grid system compresses each race into segments, making game play smooth, effortless and fast. Do not worry though, you will not miss any of the action. While you will not get all the action in minute detail, you will not miss out on lead changes, wrecks, great pit work, and mechanical problems that shape every race so uniquely. The game also lets you witness the challenges made to the race leader as well as the struggle of back markers to avoid being lapped or to rejoin the lead lap. All this action happens in a linear time span from green to checkered flag.

Fast Action Racing captures every important element of a race, produces very realistic results, and plays very quickly. And best of all, it feels like racing. No dice rolling exercises, no gimmicks, no math equations, or unrealistic tallying of numbers to determine a winner. Fast Action Racing is just that, racing, pure and simple.

The Base Game comes with everything needed to play. (Other than 4 six-sided dice for E-Book purchasers)

The Base Game also comes with the Short Track Legends Year Book, which is the perfect set to learn the game. It brings you 36 of the top short track drivers from all facets of the sport. From open wheel legends like AJ Foyt and Tony Stewart to Stock Car Legends like Ned Jarrett and Junior Johnson to Sprint Car Legends and Saturday Night drivers like Sammy Swindell, Steve Kinser and Frank Kimmel. The set also features individual track cards for 20 real-life short tracks.

—description from the publisher

name: Crisis: 1914
description:
Crisis: 1914 is a game of international brinkmanship - if you back down too soon, you lose. If you back down too late you lose.

But you also have hawks and doves in your cabinet and in your government, and out of these conflicting views you must somehow formulate a coherent response to the crisis to win the day and prevent war.

Designed for 1 to 5 players with a solitaire engine, and playable in under 2 hours.

There are 3 interrelated concepts at the heart of Crisis: 1914: Prestige, Tension, and Diplomatic Pressure (DP).

Prestige is how you win. The player with the most Prestige at the end of the game is the winner.

Diplomatic Pressure (DP) is how you score Prestige. Every card has a DP value. You apply DP by playing cards. The player with the most Prestige at the end of a turn earns Prestige points. There are other ways of scoring Prestige points too, but this is the most important one.

Tension is how you lose. If you end a turn in the red zone on the Score Track you are also creating Tension for your opponents which reflects how close you are to provoking them into mobilizing for war. If you provoke them too far war starts and you lose.

Cards drive the game. There are various card types that affect the game as follows:

Assertion Cards- which uses your nation's power to increases your Prestige

Consensus and National Interests Cards- these allow your nation to play more cards

Diplomatic Back-Channel Cards - these let you increase DP without increasing Tension

Caution Cards - allow more cards to be drawn

In addition, some cards have recurring effects on Momentum, which stops players from performing certain actions and Reduce Tension which lets you lower Tension in your country.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Tiny Epic Game of Thrones
description:
Prepare to navigate the perilous world of Westeros with Tiny Epic Game of Thrones, where alliances are fragile, betrayals are common, and the fate of your House hangs in the balance. Players will assume the roles of the mighty houses of the Seven Kingdoms, each vying for power, influence, and control of the Iron Throne.

As you step into the shoes of iconic characters, you'll face challenging dilemmas, engage in intricate political maneuvering, and wage epic battles for supremacy. Will you forge powerful alliances with other noble houses, or will you plot their downfall to seize their lands and resources? The choices you make will have far-reaching consequences, affecting not only your House but the entire realm. Can you outwit your rivals and ensure the survival and prosperity of your House in the unforgiving Game of Thrones?

In Tiny Epic Game of Thrones, players utilize an innovative limited-action dice mechanism to strategically choose actions such as plot, whisper, event, march, and sail. With the option to follow other players' actions, players will be engaged every turn.

Furthermore, players will wield the immense power of their respective Houses through a versatile hand of multi-use cards that allow players to plot against the influential houses of Westeros, orchestrate grandiose events, and partake in exhilarating battles. They will wage war across all of Westeros, sieging castles, taking lands, and forging crucial alliances, all for a chance to sit upon the Iron Throne. After six rounds of play, one player will emerge as the Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and be crowned the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Fantasy, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Follow, Hand Management, Income, King of the Hill, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Panzer Orders
description:
Welcome to Panzer Orders, a World War 2 card game. The game is fast and fun to play and takes around 30 mins. The game includes rules for a two player game and separate rules for the solitaire game.

The game contains two decks of cards - one deck for the Allies and one for the Germans. All of the cards have completely unique artwork with no duplicates. Each card has a points value based on the card characteristics and special rules. The players agree a point based battle and then build their decks, spending points on specific cards.

Each player must form three columns of any mixture of vehicles, tanks, or infantry and then attack the opponents columns. The first player to defeat all three columns or force the opposing player to draw their last card, wins the game.

During the player turn you can choose to dig and defend with your card, moves cards from one column to another or attack with long range or close combat. None of these are without their risks and weighing up the risk vs the strategic gain is part of the decision making elements of the game.

Combat is fast, simple but very brutal with all the dice rolls required on the cards - no charts or looking up in the rules. Damaged cards are suppressed first before being removed from the game and can still make a free saving throw on the dice to keep in the fight.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: The Royal Limited: Second Line
description:
Business is booming! Running two lines on parallel tracks allows for maximum profits, as long as there are enough passengers.

Second Line is a 4-card expansion for The Royal Limited that introduces additional train cards in a new color and allows players to operate a second train below their first line.

To play with the Second Line expansion, shuffle all train cards together to begin. Draw one additional card each turn and place cards into either row following the normal rules. Beware: the new grey train cars can only accept passengers that match the number (as well as VIPs). Keep your trains close in length, as you’ll lose automatically if one is too far behind when the game ends.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trains

name: Norsaga: Odds and Endings
description:
All stories must end. Take the stage one last time as gods battle giants, immortal heroes join your cause, and worlds shift underfoot. Make this tale one for the ages.

Norsaga: Odds and Endings is a 50-card expansion for the puzzle battle card game Norsaga. It introduces 3 new decks of cards: heirlooms and immortals provide permanent bonuses once unlocked, while realms change the fundamental rules of the game. It also includes additional hero cards and updated 2nd Edition basic embellishments which accelerate the flow of the game.

You can integrate any or all of this content with Norsaga and Norsaga: Into the Myths for an endless amount of variety in your games.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Narvik 1940
description:
"Narvik 1940" is a wargame for two players that simulates the tactical combats around Narvik in May and June 1940 between the French (Mountain troops*, ski scouts and legionaries) and the Germans (mountain infantry, sailors from sunken destroyers, and paratroopers). The rule is an evolution of the system En Pointe Toujours (At the Cutting Edge). Several scenarios are presented, both on the French attacks and the terrible German counter-attacks.

Complexity : 6/10
Solo playability : 4/10
One turn = 10 minutes
One unit = 4 - 10 men

—description from the publisher


including Polish troops
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Set-up

name: Cities of Venus: Lost Contact
description:
Cities of Venus is a medium weight, scifi Euro, based in the year 2222. Various countries on Earth have set up colonies in cities that float in the clouds. Each player represents the governor of a floating city and must compete with other players to maximize the growth of their city by growing their population and strategically deploying it across the various departments to keep their city running. To help the cities, Earth has been sending immigrants and city upgrades in the form of Drops. At some point, a catastrophe occurs on Earth, cutting off communication with Venus. No one knows when the last Drop from Earth will come.

Each round, players move through several phases: Resolve events, erode shields, grow and deploy population, mine for resources and modify the city, and grab a drop to improve the city.

A player can gain victory points in the following ways:
Points on station upgrades
Points for a certain amount of mined resources
Points for city population
Bonus points for the most populous, the richest, and most upgraded cities

Some time in the third phase of the drops, a card (randomly shuffled into the card deck) will turn up with the Earth on it. This card signifies that this is the last drop that will arrive from Earth and triggers the end of the game.

The player with the most victory points at that point wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Cradle of Civilization
description:
"Cradle of Civilization" is a two wargames in one pack that allows players to determine the fate of the ancient near east. In one game civilizations rise while in the other players battle over whether the great Persian Empire will survive. Both games emphasize simplicity but not at the price of being unrealistic.

From Sumeria to Persia is about the Bronze and Iron Age, when civilization was born and city states went from kingdoms and finally to large empires, culminating in the Persian Empire founded by Cyrus the Great. Players of History of the World will recognize the base mechanics whereby players randomly select civilizations from cards, although the player in last place has more power to decide which civilization they will play.

From Sumeria to Persia does offer players more options than previous games on the subject. Civilizations that survive can continue to expand in future turns. Random events create possibilities that defy history but were in the realm of possibility. The Minoans may have a brilliant military commander and the Egyptians could become a seafaring empire. There are also rules for constructing wonders, the placement of cities, and the general effects of the Bronze Age collapse. Lastly, the Persian Empire does appear.

Alexander vs. Darius: The Fall of the Persian Empire simulates Alexander III’s conquest of the great Persian Empire. Sometimes portrayed as a foregone conclusion, this game argues that Persia certainly had a chance to win if they had used different strategies or had some luck on the battlefield.
