Darius III need not have been Persia’s last king.

The heart of Alexander vs. Darius is a war weariness track, which moves down steadily for Alexander’s army. Historically, it did not reach zero until after his invasion of India, but a Persian battlefield victory could have changed that. The game also allows players to explore Memnon’s strategy of using Persian naval supremacy to raid Alexander’s rear as well as exploring the possibilities of the Spartan rebellion. Lastly, the Persians themselves must worry about legitimacy, and therefore must be active in resisting Alexander, or risk losing their grip on the throne.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Yvio
description:
YVIO is according to the developers "the best of two worlds".

The 2 worlds they refer to are electronic and board gaming.
YVIO is an electronic console which is the basic requirement for different board games which act together with the components of these.

The console itself is equipped with a lot of little LED-bulbs, an SD-card-slot, a loudspeaker and some expansion possibilities. It is further accompanied by 4 coloured disks which have to be inserted into the playing pawns of the different games. They communicate via remote access with the console.
You have to buy boardgames containing the SD-cards with the gaming software and the traditional boardgame accessories.
The boards of the games contain electronic devices too, and these connect to the console via the disks, called "Yvies".
With every game comes also a so called "Yvio skin" which is laid onto the top of the console depicting the symbols for the keys you have to press to play the game and the action segments lit up by the LEDs.

If you liked the game "Die Insel" from the Ravensburger editors, Yvio is your cup of tea, but it offers much more different options and games.
mechanics: Memory, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Innistrad: Crimson Vow
description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering tells the story of the wedding of Olivia Voldaren and Edgar Markov, two of the most powerful vampires on the gothic horror world of Innistrad. But it's not just a wedding celebration—it's also the kickoff for a dark ritual that could allow Olivia to take over the world, unless some brave heroes can crash the party and object in time!

Innistrad: Crimson Vow is a direct sequel to Innistrad: Midnight Hunt, sharing several of the same mechanics and themes. However, where Midnight Hunt shone a spotlight on werewolves, Crimson Vow has a vampire theme. Each vampire card in the set has a special "fang frame" showcase version that appears in boosters approximately half as often as the normal version. Additionally, 18 cards from the set were given a special re-skin representing characters, locations, and events from Bram Stoker's Dracula. These "Dracula Series" cards feature a full-art borderless frame and are found only in collector boosters and as box toppers.

This set contains 277 cards (100 commons, 83 uncommons, 64 rares, 20 mythic rares, and 10 full-art "Eternal Night" basic lands) and is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Reykholt: Shed Promo Card
description: Every time you sow at least once, choose a greenhouse with only one kind of vegetable. You can sow there as well with a different kind. Place goods only on top of other goods, not on empty slots. If you Harvest from this greenhouse, you take both goods from the slot.

name: Grachtenpand
description:
Build the most beautiful Amsterdam canal houses, full of shops, cats, seagulls and tulips in this fun card game!

Grachtenpand is a light hand drafting game for 2-4 players where you build an idyllic set of canal houses. You build the houses using 'bases', 'floors' and 'roofs'

Each turn, each player simultaneously chooses one card from their hand and builds it, using the rules detailed below.
After building their cards, each player passes the remaining three cards to the player on their left. After receiving a new hand of three cards from the player to their right, each player chooses a type of card (base, front, or roof) and draws one card of that type from the corresponding deck into their hand to refresh it to four cards.

A completed house consists of a base at the bottom, any number of
front cards, and one roof at the top. When building a house, you must build
from the bottom-up (starting with a base and ending with a roof)

When you build a base, you start a new incomplete house by placing it to the left or right of an existing base (or starting your first house if it’s the first card you build)

When you build a front, add it to the top of any of your incomplete houses. Once you build a roof, that house is complete, and may not be built any further.

Each player scores points for flowers, colors, bases, and roofs

Flowers: Score 1 point for each window with flowers you have in your tableau

Colors: Find the largest continuous group of cards of one color. Score 1 point for each card in that group.

Bases and Roofs: Each base and roof card in your tableau has a condition and a point value (). If the building this base is a part of meets the condition on the base, you score all the points on the card. If it does not meet the condition, you lose 2 points for this card. Scoring conditions may refer to the number of seagulls, flags, or cats visible on the building. They may also refer to their own height, or the height of the buildings to their left or right. A building’s height is the number of cards in the building (base, fronts, and roof).

name: Gunrunners: Homens de Preto
description:
This expansion brings all the components for a 5th Player. It includes all the cards for the color black, additional crate cubes and a new region: South America.

This was released only in Brazil.



Esta expansão traz todos os componentes para a adição de um quinto jogador. Nela estão inclusas todas as cartas da cor preta, cubos adicionais e uma nova região: América do Sul.Ela foi lançada apenas no Brasil.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Are You Patient Zero?
description: In the social deductive card game Patient Zero, you must figure out who amongst you has first contracted the virus that will eventually turn you into a member of the living dead. The fate of humankind rests in your hands. Thinking of hands, why are your hands shaking? Why is Bobby laughing after everything he says? The virus is spreading fast. Will you survive?

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Mordor
description: Mordor is a supplement for The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game containing rules for field a force from Mordor including Nazgul, Black Numenoreans and forces of Minas Morgul.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: Golem Arcana: Durani Empire – Jagara Colossus
description: The Jagara Colossus is the largest Golem in the Durani arsenal! The Jagara not only wreaks havoc on enemies with its terrifying Apocalyptic Blast, it's so might that it destroys terrain and obstructions as it strides across the battlefield!
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Battle For Arnhem
description:
Battle for Arnhem is a low-complexity board-wargame on Operation Market-Garden. Designed for two players or solo play.

The Allied player drops his paratroopers ahead of the ground advance, hoping to capture key bridges and cities. Meanwhile the tanks roll in from the south and fight their way through the German counter attack.

This is a small game with simple rules, suitable for beginners, but play is tense and often comes down to the last turn. The Allied player has two ways to win which forces both players to plan ahead.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Ancients Part 1 (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
This fan scenario (AT) will take you to a magical world (inspired by Asia) where you will encounter a new faction connected to the Syaan and Elois in a mysterious way. The scenario serves as an introduction to the trilogy and is a bit a tribute to the old RPGs and role-playing gamebooks - so you will need to have your dice ready!

The trilogy is set in several times and timelines (AT and NT) and will take you on a greater journey where not only the background to Elois, Syaan and the third faction will be revealed eventually but also the question of your allegiance will be raised.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dixit AsmoPlay Ingenuity Promos
description: A set of 5 Dixit cards included in the AsmoPlay Ingenuity box. The box was released in January 2020
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Red Dust Rebellion
description:
“200 years of Earth rule. 200 years of being told what to do by people on some distant blue orb in the sky. A pampered planet populated by soft people. Earth politicians playing golf on a sunny day, while sipping French champagne and eating grapes, dare to tell us how to live? They don’t know us, because they are not us! We are the sons and daughters of Mars! The children of the red planet! We were born in the red dust and we say no more to Earther rule!”
Aroha Thompson, Red Dust spokesperson and Mining Union organizer.

It is 2250 and the bicentennial celebrations of the first human colony on Mars are about to begin. 200 years of human achievement, but also 200 years of hardship. Mars is an unforgiving world, a barren wasteland on the surface, therefore the people live in vast underground cities known as labyrinths.
Over the years, the people of Mars have formed their own culture and identity and want more say in their own rule. To many, Earth is a remote world with too much control over Martian affairs. Furthermore, Earth’s corporations have too much power over life and death. Some long for a green Mars, covered in oceans and life. While others recoil at the idea that humanity will destroy the climate of another planet.
Red Dust Rebellion is volume XII of GMT's acclaimed COIN Series, and tells the story of the Martian revolts of the 2250’s and the rise of Martian nationalism.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civil War, Political, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Events, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Clackerjack
description:
Clackerjack is a climbing game that is played with two sets of double-six dominoes. It can be played by four players, in fixed partnerships, or by two players, in a head-to-head duel.

The blank tiles, which are all wilds, get distributed equitably between the two sides; each player then draws their own hand of tiles from the boneyard. The goal is to ditch all of these dominoes through the skillful play of combinations and bombs.

Lots of bombs.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Team-Based Game

name: Das Dinner: Die letzte Arie der alten Dame
description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

Quarterly, Agneta Hellwig invites to an opulent dinner at home. 7 selected guests are looking forward to a glamorous performance in front of an impressive backdrop. Theme of the evening: 'Cleopatra's last aria'.

But the closed society has to watch in horror as the hostess collapses at her own event. In the hospital, it quickly becomes clear: Agneta has been poisoned and barely escaped with her life.
But who wanted to poison the lovely old lady in her own home and why? All guests and employees are stunned because it must have been one of them.

The Bremerburgen police are overloaded and need your help. Take on the file and solve the case before Ms. Hellwig becomes the victim of another attack.

name: Gin Crafters: Spirits Expansion
description:
The Gin Crafters Spirits Expansion Set adds three elements to Gin Crafters: base spirits, distillers, and supporters.

This package requires the original Gin Crafters game in order to play.
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Nobunaga's successors war
description:
After Japanese daimyō Oda Nobunaga's forced suicide on June 21, 1582, other daimyōs fight for power.
Note: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honn%C5%8D-ji_Incident
Each players represents lords from the period: Hashiba, Akechi, Shibata, Oda-Nobukatsu, Oda-Nobutaka, Sanhoushi, Takikawa, Uesugi, Mori, or Hojo.

The game uses Successors (AH, GMT) card-driven mechanics and can be played in 6 to 8 hours.
It is designed for 3 players in the basic version (4 players with the expansion in Game Journal 49).

Tha map covers Shikoku to Kanto area.
The game starts in Tensho 10 (1582) and ends in Tensho 13 (1585).

Components:

252 counters
1 map
64 cards
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Heart of Crown: Fairy Princess Elrune promo card
description: This promo Princess card was offered as a reward for certain tiers of the Dized Kickstarter campaign in December 2018.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: The Feds
description:
Organized crime has overtaken the city. Headquarters wants you and your team to infiltrate the ranks, identify the key players, and break up the syndicate. Do you have what it takes to put a stop to their insidious operations?

In The Feds, players are leaders of FBI units seeking to send agents out to combat crime by arresting criminals. The game is heavily inspired by Gunrunners, an earlier game by the same designer and publisher.

The game is played over a series of rounds. In each round, players simultaneously choose an agent card to play from their hand and a location to play it. In turn order, players then deploy their agents as moles (face-down) to the chosen locations. If a mole is already at a location, that mole is revealed and is now a "field agent". Sometimes, when a mole is revealed, a special power will be performed by the owning player of the mole (some agent cards have powers). These special powers change from game to game for variety of play (based on the City Card being used for the game). They do such things as forcing criminals to move, redeploying agents to new locations, making small arrests, and so on.

At the end of the game, each location is scored and players arrest criminals based on their agent powers at each location.

-description from designer
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Palabrea 2
description:
New version of the best-selling card game! You can play only with this version or combine it with the original Palabrea. New categories: music, sports, fictional character, parts of the human body... Discover them all!

How to play:

Step 1: Place the deck of cards in the center of the table with the category side up.

Step 2: Each player, in turn, turns over the top card and places it next to the deck of cards, letter side up.

Step 3: The first player to say a word, starting with the letter of the same color as the category letter, gets the card. The one with the most cards wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

¡Nueva versión del juego de cartas superventas! Puedes jugar solamente con esta versión o combinarla con Palabrea original. Nuevas categorías: música, deportes, personaje de ficción, partes del cuerpo humano… ¡Descúbrelas todas!

Como se juega:

Paso 1: Coloca el mazo de cartas en el centro de la mesa con la cara de categoría hacia arriba.

Paso 2: Cada jugador, en su turno, gira la carta superior y la coloca junto al mazo de cartas, con la cara de las letras hacia arriba.

Paso 3: El primer jugador en decir una palabra, que empiece por la letra del mismo color que la de la categoría, consigue la carta. Gana el que más cartas tenga.

—description from the publisher

name: King's Forge: Queen's Jubilee
description:
With the Queen's Jubilee only a few weeks away, crafters from all over the kingdom are now hard at work creating new and wondrous items to celebrate the beloved Queen.

King's Forge: Queen's Jubilee is an additional set of components for the King's Forge board game. This expansion includes a new craft deck introducing the Jubilee items. This variant deck of items includes 54 craft cards that can be used in place of the main craft cards in the base game (25 items use glass dice and require the King's Forge: Glassworks expansion). In general, these items promote faster and more aggressive King's Forge play styles and grant temporary and permanent bonuses to the player crafting them.

The expansion also includes 7 Gather cards:


Conjurer - utilizes special temporary "wild" dice (5 clear dice included)
Farm - offers two dice that can be used as metal or wood (2 brown dice included)
Merchant - offers 4 ability choices, but you can only pick one
Traveling Camp - you may pre-roll some of your dice for that round
Dungeon - allows you to strategically handicap your opponents (12 Escape The Dungeon cards included)
Monastery - immediately add gem or magic to your supply
Festival - get a free wood die, if you're okay with other players getting a free metal


Additionally, the expansion includes 6 apprentices featuring glass that can be used if you have both the King's Forge: Apprentices expansion and the Glassworks expansion.

Previously, the apprentices, two of the Gather cards (Farm and Dungeon), and the glass Jubilee items were included in the King's Forge: Glassworks Plus Pack (referred to as Glassworks 'Deluxe' during the Kickstarter campaign).
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Worker Placement

name: Alien Frontiers: Galactic Pack
description:
Upgrades the existing Alien Frontiers series to be equivalent to the extras included in the Alien Frontiers Big Box.

Contents:

1 Big Box (Empty)
1 Expanded Game Board (Double-Sided)
1 Expanded Outer Belt Board (Double-Sided)
2 Matter Extractor Alien Tech Cards
1 Special Relic Die
1 Special Relic Rocket Die
1 Brethren of the Stars Rocket Die
1 Asteroid Rocket Die
45 Deluxe Fuel Tokens
30 Deluxe Ore Tokens
12 Deluxe Player Tokens
Enhanced Score Board
Enhanced and Consolidated Rulebook


Note: The Matter Extractor card provides the same ability as the previously released Kickstarter Exclusive Space Crane card.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Classic BattleTech: Starterbook – Wolf and Blake
description:
Starterbook: Wolf and Blake is the second volume in the Classic Battletech Starterbook series. Each book in the series is designed to act as a "bridge" between various Battletech products, making it easier for players to jump into an enriched but more complex game. While Classic BattleTech: Starterbook – Sword and Dragon serves as a link between the BattleTech: Introductory Box Set and the full tournament/standard rules found in BattleTech: Total Warfare, Starterbook: Wolf and Blake links Total Warfare to BattleTech: Tactical Operations, the on-world advanced core rulebook. Wolf and Blake also offers an introduction to the current Jihad storyline and to the religiously driven Word of Blake faction. The famed Black Widow Company serves as the opposing force.

Wolf and Blake follows the basic pattern laid out in Sword and Dragon: brief bits of fiction, profiles of each side's history and current Mechwarriors, a rules annex (here previewing some of the advanced rules from TacOps), a "warchest" campaign system, and a series of branching missions that players can explore. The book ends with a series of filled-in record sheets, including variant 'Mechs depicted in the text.

Total Warfare is required to use Starterbook: Wolf and Blake. Technical Readout: 3050 Upgrade is recommended.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Ricochet Pyramids
description:
A Components: Looney Pyramid Games game in the spirit of Ricochet Robots: an 8x8 board has 9 stationary towers and 3 mobile robots. Each turn, a randomly chosen robot must move onto a randomly chosen tower. Towers and the map edge and other robots block movement (but the goal tower does not block movement).

Player simultaneously try to find the smallest sequence of moves to achieve the goal, and the lowest bidder who successfully moves the specified robot to the specified goal earns a point.

3 stashes of pyramids (in 3 different colors), an 8x8 board, and an optional 30-second timer are the only equipment needed.

name: Kriegbot Expansion
description:
Includes new weapons, systems and skins to fight with, including but not limited to: Cluster Bombs, Infantry Pods, Electrolasers, UAVs, Super-steel Rams, Limpet Mines, and Thermal Lances.

The Expansion also introduces a new type of card, the Powercore, which tracks your robot's battery level. Use your stored energy to activate the Powercore's special ability or to overcharge your electrical weaponry and unleash devastating attacks, but manage your energy levels wisely otherwise you might find your robot out of juice when you need it most.

The Expansion also introduces infantry to the fray and provides rules allowing your pilots to fight on foot if their robot becomes crippled.

Ten new scenarios are included which cover new ground including solitaire, pilot rescues, orbital insertions, free-for-alls and a post-apocalyptic campaign.

Includes:

6 Extra Vehicle Figures
6 Power Core Cards
32 Design Cards
20 infantry, Mine, & UAV Tents
Expansion Game Rules
Science Behind the Game
Kriegbot Errata
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: ISS Vanguard: Equipment Promo Cards
description:
Originally available from Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Bone Pack.

5 equipment cards to add to the Armory.

Promo 1: Flickering Booster
Promo 2: Energy Spear
Promo 3: Mobile Warehouse
Promo 4: Wyrd Generation
Promo 5: Dog Tag

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module D2 – Tournament Tactics
description:
(This paragraph paraphrased from the Module.)
This module contains material for the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition game system. To use this product you must have Star Fleet Battles Tournament Book 1991 or later. You will also need the Star Fleet Battles Basic Set. To use some portions you will need Advanced Missions, Module C1, Module C2, Module J and/or Module K.

This 32-page book consists of over a dozen chapters covering tournament tactics for specific tournament cruisers. The chapters, in order, cover Federation, Klingon, Romulan, Kzinti, Gorn, Tholian, Orion, Hydran, Andromedan, Lyran, Wyn, and ISC tactics. There is a final chapter that covers general tournament tactics.

Each chapter has articles written by aces, staffers, and/or unrated players. These articles were published without extensive editing with the intent to accumulate more material and feedback that would be used in a later 1993 publication for Star Fleet Battles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Harad
description: Harad is a supplement for The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game including rules for the Corsairs of Umbar and the entirely original (not featured in the books of films) Mahûd tribes of Far Harad.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: Field of Glory Napoleonic
description:
From the publisher:

Field of Glory Napoleonic is written in an approachable and easy-to-learn manner to allow players to concentrate on realistic deployments and battlefield tactics of the early modern era. FOGN will cater for both types of player, with a full point system allowing theoretical battles between balanced armies to be played out, as well as accommodating factual scenarios. The rulebook will maintain the same production values as previous FOG and FOGR releases and will be designed both to explain the game and be a reference guide when playing. To make the rules easier to follow, we will include examples, detailed descriptions and explanations of unusual situations in a similar way to our Ancients and Renaissance rulebooks.

Based on the core mechanics of its predecessors, Field of Glory: Napoleonic is a tabletop miniatures game that allows players to command the armies of any of the nations involved in the Napoleonic and French Revolutionary Wars, emphasizing the combined arms tactics that dominated the battlefields of the period. Players will deploy cavalry, infantry, and artillery units to move, fire and assault their way to victory.

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Iron Golem
description:
Super Dungeon is headed to video games with Super Dungeon Tactics! In this turn-based strategy game you create a guild of Heroes to combat the Dark Consul. Accept bounties, help the downtrodden, and answer the noble call for adventure!

The Iron Golem is useable in your tabletop games of Super Dungeon. Also included is a Steam Key, which unlocks the full version of Super Dungeon Tactics.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Expedition Zetta: Andromeda
description: The Andromeda expansion for the game Expedition Zetta adds new planetary systems to visit when you use the Quick Zetta deck. This expansion can be used alone if you want to make journeys that visit stars in only the Andromeda Galaxy, or it can be mixed with the standard deck that comes with the game (that features stars from the Milky Way).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Uptown
description:
Uptown is a 3D-stacking strategy game where players take turns placing a tetracube of any colour on the game board trying to dominate at least four columns.

COMPONENTS

- A checkered game board with 35 squares arranged in seven columns.

- 8 red and 8 grey tetracubes.

A tetracube is a geometric form that consists of four cubes joined.

HOW TO PLAY
Each player has an allocated colour (red or grey). Red player begins. Take turns placing a tetracube of any colour on the game board according to the following constraints:

1. At least one of its cubes must rest directly on the board, within a square.

2. No cube may rest outside the game board boundaries.

3. No cube may “hang in the air” without support from below.

The game ends when the player in turn has no legal moves.

WINNING THE GAME

The score is set column by column. A column is dominated by the colour that occupies at least three of the five squares when the game board is looked upon from above. The player dominating at least four columns wins the game.

-description from designer

name: Star Wars: Legion – BARC Speeder Unit Expansion
description:
Versatile and swift, BARC speeders are designed to assist clone troopers as they scout the field, protect key targets, and launch rapid surprise attacks. These durable speeder bikes are armed with heavy blasters and fitted with powerful engines, making them useful in nearly any theater of ground war across the galaxy.

Within the BARC Speeder Unit Expansion, you’ll find one unpainted, finely sculpted BARC speeder miniature identical to the miniature included in the Star Wars: Legion Clone Wars Core Set. If you choose, this miniature can include a sidecar featuring a built-in M-45 Ion Blaster or a Mark II Medium Blaster. Similarly, a Phase I Clone Trooper can fire an RPS-6 rocket launcher from the sidecar. This expansion also includes a unit card and an assortment of six upgrade cards inviting you to outfit your speeder to fit your personal battle plan.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Barons' War: Medieval Skirmish Game
description:
In the Kingdom of England by 1215, a group of powerful barons had reached breaking point due to King Johns despotic rule, high taxes and failed leadership. It was time to rebel!

Written by Andy Hobday, these rules enable narrative-driven tabletop games set in an England gripped by civil war played out against the backdrop of the Magna Carta and the invasion by the Crown Prince of France.

The historically themed gameplay is fast-paced and tactical. With warriors of this period being pretty similar, it is easy to base your medieval skirmish games using these rules in any setting.

This softback rulebook contains 138 pages (with original wraparound cover art by Peter Dennis) which include the rules (of course), retinue lists, a quick reference sheet (with page numbers), a glossary and an index!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: The Battle for Sampo
description:
In The Battle for Sampo, you lead a village as a hero. You have combat and rune scores, and unique powers, and aim to become the legendary hero by claiming twelve heroic deeds. Deeds require different tasks, like battles or helping the village. Manage skills, companions, and resources while balancing different actions. Search for the Golden Sampo for bonuses, but watch out for dark deeds that can tarnish your honor. The player with the most deeds wins in the end.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Talisman: The Magical Quest Game – 5th Edition
description:
The otherworldly artefacts known as Talismans have once more descended onto the mortal plane, signaling the dawn of a new era— and the need for a new ruler!

In Talisman: The Magical Quest Game – 5th Edition, set forth on an epic adventure, racing to be the first to obtain a Talisman, reach the Crown of Command in the center of the board, and defeat the elder dragon to win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Race to the Reichstag: Berlin, 1945
description:
(from the editors's website: )

Race to the Reichstag is an innovative design that allows players to play both sides of two competing commands as the Red Army fights its way into Berlin during the closing days of World War II. There are two areas of operations for the Soviets and Germans, and each player runs one area for both sides, opposite his opponent (Battle for Germany-style). Players compete for reinforcing assets and to seize objectives, in an attempt to be the first to capture Berlin’s city center and end the war.

Race to the Reichstag includes a beautiful map of Berlin, which includes all the historic and infamous landmarks that were the backdrop of the Third Reich, and a counter sheet (228 counters) of the two competing Soviet fronts (Zhukov’s and Koniev’s) versus the shattered remnants of the German army attempting to hold Berlin against the inevitable. The player who plays his Soviet and German commands best will win.

name: Ministers Chess
description:
Chess on a 9x9 Board using 36 pieces instead of the standard 32. The 9x9 board is symmetrical, unlike the asymmetrical standard chess board. Each players gets 1 additional pawn and 2 "Ministers" which replace the Queen and move in the same manner as the Queen.

Shares some similarities to Modern Chess.

name: Formula D: More We Are Driver Expansion
description:
Discover the two new drivers for the urban race of Formula D. These crazy guys join the race.

Released on Asmodee's website are two brand new print & play drivers for Formula D. They were described in English at:

Formula D: More we are... (dead link)
Internet Archive (2010-02-0)


A PDF of the Driver Cards was made available for free downlaod:

pilotes-boris-et-pipo-pdf-1-48-mo.pdf at fr.asmodee.com (dead link)
pilotes-boris-et-pipo-pdf-1-48-mo.pdf at www.asmodee.com (dead link)




Boris Spoutnik(6) Tires
(3) Brakes
(3) Gearbox
(3) Car body
(2) Engine
(3) Road handling

Special: Aspiration Pro – Once per lap, Boris Spoutnik can move 5 spaces when doing a slipstream.



Pipo Rapido(7) Tires
(2) Brakes
(3) Gearbox
(3) Car body
(3) Engine
(3) Road handling

Special: Fast Starter – Pipo Rapido has a Great Start on a result of 11 to 20 and on a 1 he has a normal start.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Racing, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Winter Queen: Mini-Expansion Set
description:
Mini-expansions set expand your experience of Winter Queen and consists of 3 fully compatible mini-expansions that you may use with the game.

This set includes:

• Gratitudes mini-expansion:

This mini-expansion increases player interaction and competitiveness of Winter Queen. We recommend playing your first games without it, though. Gratitudes, when you’re ready to use them, will let you experience a new layer of strategy.

At the beginning of the game, you receive 5 Gratitude tokens. Each of them corresponds to one of the crystal colors. When you place a crystal on a Queendom Map board, you flip the Gratitude token of the corresponding color face up, thus activating it. From now on, you may use it. Each token grants you a special one-time ability. When the token is used, it flips face down... until you retrieve it again by placing the crystal of its color on the Map board. Each Gratitude token is a very powerful tool if used wisely. For example, green token allows you to swap any 2 Queen’s Domain tiles on the Map board, and red one can replace up to 3 crystals on the Crystal Holder tiles.

• Royal Jewelry mini-expansion:

This expansion adds a whole new level of strategy. In the base game, crystals from the Spell Books you activate are discarded. Royal Jewelry gives these crystals a second life. After you activate a Spell Book, instead of discarding crystal(s), you move them to your Royal Jewelry card. You may choose to put crystal(s) in the Treasury or add it to your Tiara. At the end of the game the Treasury generates 1 VP for every 2 crystals in it, and The Tiara can generate up to insane 10 VPs!

• Great Wizard solo mini-expansion:

What do wizards do when there are no other wizards to compete with? Well, they perform special quests for their Queen! This solo mini-expansion is fully compatible with other mini-expansions and allows you to experience almost the same gameplay even when there are no other wizards around.

When you play solo, replace common Spell Books with 8 special ones and remove all but 20 crystals from the game. Create patterns out of enchanted crystals as usual and do your best to score as many VPs as possible. Compare your result with the chart and measure your success on a scale from a mere Charlatan to a truly Great Wizard!
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Task Force 421 (Iran-Iraq naval war, 1980)
description:
Task Force 421 is an attempted simulation of the most important combined naval and air battle of the Iran-Iraq War 1980-1988, named Operation Morvarid (pearl), in a tactical/operational level. This particular battle took place in two days, during 27 and 28 November 1980; initiated by Iran landing a small Special Forces demolition team aboard the Iraqi al-Bakr offshore platform. Al-Bakr was a significant intelligence gathering post, and a safe haven for the Iraqi missile boats, from which to operate against the Iranian shipping. Before the start of the war, over one-third of the Iraq’s oil was exported via al-Bakr and the nearby al-Omayeh platform.

The main map illustrates the northern Persian Gulf and parts of the Iranian, Iraqi and Kuwaiti coasts, divided into flat-up hexes, each representing a distance of 4.5 kilometers across.

A unit is an individual naval vessel or aircraft. The counters represent the Iranian and Iraqi naval and air forces, distinguishable by color, and their national flags. The Iraqi counters have beige background, while the Iranian counters have grey background.
categories: Modern Warfare, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Panzer PaK 4: Lend Lease Forces
description:
Panzer Miniatures Rules: A Tactical Game of Armored Combat contain all gameplay aids and rules necessary to use the additional unit cards and organizations contained in Panzer® PaK 4—Lend Lease Forces.

This book is packed with 32 pages of detail in full color. Inside you will find Soviet TO&E charts covering the Soviet forces using lend lease equipment. You will get to field tank, anti-tank, anti-aircraft, motorcycle, SU, sapper, mortar, mechanized units and powerful guards variants. You won’t lack for variety with this expansion. In addition you get an additional 8 lend lease vehicle unit cards, including the Stuart III, Sherman III and Churchill III.

Included components:


Detailed Soviet TO&E: 18th Tank Corps — as of 1 July 1943 (fielded the Churchill III in its 36th Guards Heavy Tank Regiment) and the 1st Guards Mechanized Corps early 1945 (fielded the Sherman III in its mechanized and tank brigades)



Optional Rule: Hidden movement rules for Panzer



Unit Data Cards: 8 new unit data cards



Scenarios: Five historical scenarios including two that may be linked into a mini-campaign



Hidden Movement Cards: Two hidden movement play cards


Expands:

Panzer Miniatures Rules: A Tactical Game of Armored Combat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: PO-GO
description: In PO-GO (which stands for Polarity-Go) 2 players alternate turns placing two of their discs of opposite polarity on the board, the goal being to have the largest contiguous group of adjacent discs in either polarity.

name: Pluto Attacks!
description:
It's 1953 outside a small town in Kansas. Unseen by the sleepy residents below, a small craft approaches just before dawn. Settling down just outside town, the craft quickly deploys an antenna of strange design, pointing it toward the town.

A small group of high school students who were up before the dawn witnessed the strange craft landing, but as they try to tell their parents or the authorities, they get glassy stares in return.

The alien invaders have some kind of mind control over the town, and these students will have to become Small Town Heroes in order to defeat them and save the town. Are you going to be one of those Heroes?

Pluto Attacks is a cooperative game where you play as high school students, each with different levels of skill in strength, intelligence, and communication. On each turn, players reveal a new town card, then attempt to save part of the town by rolling and allocating dice. Players can team up over multiple turns to overcome difficult obstacles. As the game progresses, Plot Twists will pop up to change conditions, and The Big Reveal! provides the victory conditions needed to save the town from alien invaders. Cooperate and defeat the alien menace in this B movie inspired adventure.

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Empress Marava Far Trader
description:
A Ship Deck comes with 81 cards:


1 Ship Card
20 Adventure Cards
60 Captain's Cards


Each deck is distinct, containing its own list of cards, though some may be common to multiple decks.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Munchkin Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Lightning Dice
description:
They say lightning never strikes the same place twice . . . but how about six times? These supercharged dice will bring the thunder to any Munchkin game . . . and they come with four new Munchkin Warhammer Age of Sigmar cards!

Doors (2)
Kitbashed
Wee Enforcers
Treasures (2)
Scroll of World Blending
The Cosmic Balance
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Now or Never: Crafting Arzium Promo Set
description:
Two promo cards that were a physical reward for backing the Crafting Arzium film campaign by Zoom Out Media, which covered the design and development of Now or Never.

The additional cards are: Lava Flow (Shell Armor) and Junk Yard (Fate Magnet)

name: Tang Garden: Seasons
description:
The roofs of the villages of the Tang Dynasty are the first to notice the slightest temperature changes and the passing of time. The wind blows, raising dry leaves that fly before the snow covers every architecture. After several days the air starts smelling like pollen and gets warmer, the flowers start blooming again, and the sun dries the mud into cracked earth once again.

Tang Garden: Seasons is the final expansion for Tang Garden. We have crafted different rich scenarios by getting inspiration from the mechanisms you most love in board games that will completely change the way you create your beautiful garden. In this expansion, you will find new tiles, decorations, panoramas, visitors, boards, and new components that you have never seen before.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction: Sealed Bid, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Unsurmountable: Acclimatization
description:
Higher altitudes means lower oxygen. Make camp periodically to acclimatize or you’ll be too sick to complete the climb.

This 6-card expansion introduces Camp cards. Two of these are dealt at the start of every game and both of these camps must be reached sequentially before the summit. Making camp requires aligning two specific features horizontally adjacent. Players with the Big Climb expansion can even combine it with Acclimitization, drawing three camps instead for a massive multi-stage hike.

name: Ezra and Nehemiah: Scroll Tiles Promo
description:
A set of 6 extra Wood Scroll tiles


Gain 1 additional Banner for each Silver you spend when taking a Main Action.
Gain 2VP when placing Wood in the Temple, instead of 1VP.
Lose 1VP Immediately. Score your lowest-scoring tucked Character Card twice during each Sabbath.
Pay 1 fewer Gold, Stone, Cinders, or Wood, or 2 fewer Silver when turning over Development Tiles.
You may spend Cinders in place of Stone or Wood when building Gates and Walls.
Gain 1 additional Blue Banner for each pair of 1 Red Banner and 1 Grey Banner you have when taking a Main Action.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Religious

name: Tra Asburgo e Borboni: Camposanto 1743
description:
Tra Asburgo e Borboni: Camposanto 1743 is a two player light-weight Tactical level board-wargame.

Para Bellum XII presents a wargame that uses a simple and original system to simulate a 18th century little-known battle: Camposanto 1743.

The two players have a certain number of Order Points available and must activate their wings, one at a time.
The combat occurs between two lines that fire at each other until one of the two retreats or rout.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Deck the Halls
description:
It’s December 23rd at 4 PM and the house is not yet decorated for Christmas! Work together (Collaborate) to get the house “decked” in time. Christmas is fast approaching. Get the 10 locations inside and outside of your house “decked,” and the house cleaned up by the time the clock strikes Midnight on December 25th. Play as a team against the game. You all win or you all lose. Choose your actions carefully because time passes quickly and supplies are limited. There are many distractions keeping the task from getting done. But keep your chin up, Christmas is a time to celebrate and there’s plenty of Christmas cheer to keep you motivated. The magic of Christmas is in your hands!

To start players will select one of six characters and place the Clock Token on Dec 23rd slot. On his/her turn, each player will roll five dice, collect the associated ornament pieces, and cheer/distraction cards. They'll then perform up to 4 actions. You may repeat the same action multiple times or choose a combination of different actions. At the end of their turn, players will advance the Clock Token one space.

If you and your friends can get all 10 locations inside and outside the house "decked" before the Clock Token strikes midnight you win the game.

name: Speed Circuit: Accessory Pack 2
description:
Speed Circuit Accessory Pack 2 included 8 new tracks to be used with Avalon Hill's version of Speed Circuit. There are 4 sheets with one track on each side. The track included in this pack are: 1- Monte Carlo's Monaco, 2- Belgium's SPA, 3- San Marino's Imola, 4- Switzerland/France's Dijon, 5- France's Rhiems, 6- Brazil's Interlagos, 7- Las Vegas' Caesar's Palace, and 8- Le Mans. This set was released in a tube.

Expands:

Speed Circuit

name: Mechwarrior: Dark Age – Fire for Effect Expansion Pack
description:
MechWarrior Fire for Effect is an expansion to the MechWarrior Dark Age collectable miniatures game and was launched in February 2003.

The Fire for Effect set introduces Artillery, including classic artillery vehicles with new rules; Mercenaries, featuring BattleTech fans classic favorite mercenary companies; Transport Vehicles, designed to get infantry on the battlefield quickly.

This Booster Pack contains 4 randomly inserted, painted, fully assembled, prepainted plastic miniatures 1 Mech, 1 Vehicle, and 2 Infantry. Each figure stands on a unique combat dial with all the information needed to play.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic – The Dryad of Harper's Wood
description:
Convention and Webstore only promo set, provided with purchase of the Dark Gothic Deck Building Game.

The Dryad of Harper's Wood is a Level III Magick villain. When revealed, she places a line of Living Trees below the center line. Whenever a card is acquired from the center row, a Living Tree card moves in to replace it. Living trees require a player to pay extra resources when they are defeated or they go directly to the Shadows pile. Additionally, the Dryad herself requires +1 resource to defeat for every Living Tree still in the center line.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Magic: The Gathering – Betrayers of Kamigawa
description:
As the spirit war raged on Kamigawa, those close to the daimyo Konda began to fear for his sanity. His isolation drove his willful daughter Michiko away to seek the truth about the war. To make matters worse, an unimaginably powerful kami, the O-Kagachi, had begun to manifest in the material world, devouring Kamigawa piece by piece.

Turn the tables on your opponents with Ninja, Patrons, and Genju—yes, even the land gets into the act!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Pindua
description:
In Pindua, you change the color of the five suns to earn points by creating patterns in the sky. You do so by manipulating sun cards on the table. Flip them, switch them, or invert them all to match your pattern cards. Take turns with your friends until no pattern cards remain, then count the points you have scored on your completed pattern cards.

If you are good at recognizing patterns on the table and in the gameplay of others, you will rule the sky.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Party Game, Puzzle

name: Escape from Monster Island
description:
The publisher sometimes describes this as a sequel, but note that it is an expansion and requires the original game. Comes in the form of a 32 page, saddle-stitched book.

From the publisher's website:

Alien saboteurs have collapsed the force bubble around Monster Island, unleashing hordes of titanic terrors on the nations of Earth! Giant creatures trample the great cities of the world while conventional military forces and special UN Science Alert Corps units struggle to contain the monster menace. Tanks, attack helicopters and infantry pound rampaging kaiju as laser cannons, jetpack platoons and other experimental weapons deploy.

A sequel to "Monster Island: The Game of Giant Monster Combat," Escape From Monster Island provides expanded rules for fighting military units and crushing cities for your kaiju. Or you can play the military forces battling the monsters, using color cardstock counters included in the game or your own plastic soldiers, tanks and other toys. game also includes new kaiju powers along with dozens of new quotes from your favorite monster movies. Players must have Monster Island to use this expansion.

Expands:

Monster Island
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Tremor
description:
Set in a post apocalyptic world destroyed by climate change, Tremor is a 2 to 4 player medium weight strategy game where you redesign and rearrange the board every turn. As an animal ancestral spirit, to win you must exploit a disaster-ridden world to help your species progress, while hindering your opponents. The goal is to save your species by helping them reach their last remaining natural habitat in the opposite corner of the board, before your rivals get to theirs.
​
Tremor is played on a modular tile board. On your turn you must take 3 actions in any order: Traverse, Tectonic Twist, and Scout (a choice of component actions Explore and Forecast).

These actions allow players to move across the board towards their goal, reorient tiles, and accumulate Tremor Tokens. Tremor Tokens are placed on the separate Catastrophe Board, and players must strategically allocate and optimise them to ignite a disaster.

There are 6 disasters that will help or hinder your passage to safety. Each of them have unique effects, and the area of the board they affect is based on how you manipulate their position and orientation. You can also evade, combo and amplify their effects by using secret Catastrophe Cards, Disaster Die rolls, and abilities unique to your species.

Tremor can be played as a competitive or team co-operative game. It's easy to learn and hard to master, making it suitable for all skill levels. Games last between 30-60 minutes depending on how seriously you take your strategy.

— Jonah, Curly Bros Games
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Trailblazers: Sasquatch Expansion Pack
description:
In Trailblazers: Sasquatch Expansion players cooperate together to build hiking, biking, and kayaking loops in a shared area. But be careful, one player might secretly be a traitorous Sasquatch seeking to sabotage your trailblazing efforts!

Sasquatch wants to be left alone and will thus do anything he can to keep pesky humans out of his woods — including undermining trail construction. If there is a Sasquatch in the game, then the other players (humans) want to find him!

How to Play:


Deal out the secret identity cards. All players are humans, but one player might secretly be Sasquatch.
On your turn: Play 1 trail card, discard the other facedown into a discard row of your choice. Then draw back up to 2 trail cards.
If you are Human: Cooperate together to build hiking, biking, and kayaking loops through new hybrid camps to maximize your points… and keep an eye out for the sneaky Sasquatch.
If you are Sasquatch: Blend in with the Humans while subtly sabotaging their trails. Reveal yourself when you think you can win, or ride it out until the end-game scoring to determine the victor.
If Sasquatch is revealed, then Humans must race to build a loop through his location before their turns run out. If Sasquatch is not revealed (or there was no Sasquatch), then Humans tally up their loop points to see if they won.


The game ends after a Sasquatch Hunt or when a discard row is full.

This expansion is compatible with any edition of Trailblazers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Layering, Network and Route Building, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Traitor Game

name: D.50: Las Redes del Reich
description:
It's the 1940s, and Nazi spies have infiltrated three cities in Chile. Department D.50 of the police is charged with uncovering their evil plans.

One player in this asymmetrical game is the Nazi spy and has to enhance bases in Chile's three major cities, gain control over resources and protect their bases from the investigations of the D.50. The others are the investigators and also have to collect resources, but also 20 evidence points. With these, they can manage to shut down the Nazi bases to win the game.

The game is based on historical events and has been sponsored by the Fondo Nacional para el Desarrollo Cultural y las Artes (National foundation for Cultural Development and the Arts).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: TRAILS: Watchtower Badge Promo Cards
description:
Originally available during the Dice Tower 2022 Season Kickstater campaign, Promo Set A ("Air").

A set of 3 additional badges (1 each in rock, acorn, and leaf badge type), for use with TRAILS base game. The "Watchtower" badge has a steep cost of 6 identical resources of that badge's type, with the worthwhile upside of 5 victory points, and 3 of that same resource back to you.

name: Shuuro: Turanga
description:
From the back of the box:

TURANGA – an expansion for Shuuro.

Turanga transforms Shuuro into a four-player battle.
Together with your ally on the opposite side of the board, get ready to fight for supremacy. But watch out: only with perfect timing and harmony of intents, is your team going to achieve victory!

Requires a copy of Shuuro to play.

name: Metallum: Extractor Attack
description: Metallum: Extractor Attack, a promotional card for Metallum, is a new Action module that allows a player to remove an opponent's Extractor from a planet, but then providing him no $ during the current scoring.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board

name: My Neighbor Totoro: Aruite Sagaso Totoro`s Dondoko Game
description:
A diorama-style powerful game board!

Combines elements of standard memory game and traditional collect-and-win family games in a wonderful world of My Neighbor Totoro by Studio Ghibli.

In this game you will play as one of four small Totoros.
On your turn you will roll the dice to move around big camphor tree and then:

-uncover as many matching memo cards as possible to get more acorns or get suprised upon uncovering disadvantage memo card

-encounter middle Totoro and move your Makkuro Kurosuke figure to the next level of the tree (this will also give you more acorns)

-perform special actions (only on specific fields): redraw or cards uncovering

Game finishes when any players Makkuro Kurosuke reaches the top of the camphor tree.

Goal:
To win the game collect the most acorns of all players until any player reaches top of the camphor tree!

Sounds simple, but surely satisfies with uniquely modified memo-game mechanics and surpising bonuses or disadvantages, which may cause sudden twist in overall outcome of the game.

Board game contains 10 Totoro related figurines, big camphor three, tokens and many cards with beautiful drawings from original movie.
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Memory, Racing

name: Newton: Extra City Tiles
description:
7 new city tiles to be shuffled with those of the base game, bringing even more setup variability and combo possibilities on the map !

Setup

Remove the Medicine City tiles from the game and the Medicine Income tiles from the game.
Add the new City tiles to the base game City tiles, then randomly draw the 7 City tiles to be used.

These tiles give you a permanent effect as soon as you place a cube on it :

- When you place a new Student on the Technology track, perform a level 2 Technology action
- When you play a Master Card, perform a level 1 Lessons action
- When you place a Development Tile on your desk, gain 3 coins
- When you perform a Travel action, you can get a 1-time discount of 1 coin when you pass through routes with a cost
- You can now as a quick action, pay 3 coins to add 2 to the value of the Basic Action you are performing
- You now gain 2 times the lowest value active income of your Study board during the end round phase
- When you place a piece of your color on an Objective tile, gain 4VP
mechanics: Map Addition, Point to Point Movement

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Lou Promo
description:
The first promo in the Kerubim series of mini-figs for the game Krosmaster Arena.

Available in French Flunch restaurants from december 2013 till January 2014.

This was also the streched goal number 8 in the Kickstart Krosmaster Frigost campain.

Story: (from card)
Treasure hunter, detective, baker: she's done it all! As well as being an independent woman, Lou is a true adventurer! And Kreub Crepin isn't the only one to like her feisty ways... because Indie Thikovit is also desperate to woo the lovely Ouginak... The two of them would go to the end of the earth just for a kiss from her! But will either of the dogged rivals ever manage to tame her wild side?
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Mixtape Massacre: The Black Masque Expansion
description:
The Black Masque brings to 'Mixtape Massacre a main adversary, as well as other new enemies, challenges, and of course, more fun.

• Do battle with Death in hopes of diffusing Death cards from over taking the board and ending the game with no winner.
• Draw Challenge cards forcing you to to roll the new Challenge Dice vying for a kill, but sometimes activating other troubles.
• Activate the new 'A-Bit of an Event' cards which can change the rules, add side missions, introduce new enemies, and more for rounds at a time.
• Alternate Rules of Play i.e. using the Challenge Dice during Brawls to defend yourself, or using the Challenge Dice to Resurrect yourself when dead and more.

These components and more are packed into the expansion bringing with it more gameplay, and of course, more horror, gore, and wonderful eighties nostalgia to keep you laughing while you’re slashing.

name: See-Queue
description: This is a two - to four person tic-tac-toe-like game using a four level circular board. You try to complete a line of four in your color or an "orbit" in your color. Interesting "twist" on a rather basic game - interesting ability to add additional players - helps mitigate first player advantage.

name: Brandy Station: Cavalry vs Cavalry, June 1863
description: Just after Chancellorsville, the biggest cavalry engagement occurred on June 9, 1863. Reorganized Union forces under Pleasanton engaged JEB Stuart's Confederate Cavalry. This game was recently published in the new Panzerschreck issue #14. This is a 9 turn game on a small map with 10 units per side. Should play quickly. The game has initiative, disruption, counterattacks, event chits (which modify a rule or condition). Victory is determined by comparing (at the end of the game) the randomly drawn Victory Chit (by the Union player) with the status at the end of the game. The Confederate player does not know what goal the Union player has. The CRT is relatively bloodless, but you accumulate Disruption Markers which represent losses and reduced combat/maneuver abilities (sort of a step loss system).

name: Starfight: Expansion Pack II – Starmaps
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

This is the second expansion to the Beer & Pretzel’s Game Starfight. The expansion features four new star maps. This is not a game itself, you’ll need the STARFIGHT© base rules in order to use this expansion. This PDF contains:

• a rule sheet
• Four star maps
• #5 Black Hole
• #6 Mines
• #7 Nebula
• #8 Stardust

Expands:

Starfight
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Silent Death Annex: Hangar 51
description:
Description from ICE's website:

This is the first PDF-only Annex for Silent Death: The Next Millenium! This exclusive PDF Annex for Silent Death contains the complete ship sheets for all 228 Silent Death ships, including the Dolphin, Orca, Piranha, Executioner and Snarling Badger prize ships.

Expands:

Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Chaos in Carpathia
description: Gothic Horror miniature battles featuring struggles between men and monsters in the style of the films and fiction of old. Chaos In Carpathia is a skirmish miniature game designed for 28mm miniatures and perfect for use with the new line of miniatures by Blue Moon Manufacturing. Chaos In Carpathia will be 84 pages with color front and back covers and a black & white interior.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ouroboros
description:
Ouroboros is an abstract strategy game for 2-4 players, best with 2 players. Players start with no discs, and gain discs from other players during gameplay.

Ouroboros is played on a 6x6 grid filled with four-colors of randomly placed discs. On each player's turn, they do one of three things:
1) Choose a square with a disc in it to place a stone there, taking the disc from that square and giving away the discs orthogonally or diagonally adjacent, OR
2) Remove two stones from the board matching a pattern and discard many discs in specific amounts, OR
3) Discard one disc.

The winner is the first person to get back to zero discs (after the first turn).

name: Android: "See this? See this? See this? That's right."
description: A single-card expansion that can be obtained by using the order form in the "Strange Flesh" book from Fantasy Flight Games. This is an event card entitled “See this? See this? See this? That's right.” and recreates a police raid on Humanity Labor headquarters, a pivotal event from the book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Fire Made Flesh
description:
“I found one account of the Long Night that spoke of the last hero slaying Others with a blade of dragonsteel. Supposedly they could not stand against it.”
–George R.R. Martin, A Feast for Crows

Fire Made Flesh is the third Chapter Pack in the "Conquest and Defiance" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game.

In George R.R. Martin's fantasy saga, A Song of Ice and Fire, dragons are fire made flesh, and they are every bit as important as they are powerful. Dragons allowed the Targaryens to unite the Seven Kingdoms. Their return to the world coincided with the revitalization of magic. And some think that dragonfire played some role in the creation of the Valyrian steel of which all the most legendary blades were forged.

Among the sixty cards from Fire Made Flesh (three copies each of twenty individual cards), you'll find a host of Prized characters, locations, and events, as well as Prized versions of three of the world's most storied Weapons: Heartsbane, Ice, and Blackfyre. Meanwhile, three neutral characters, a powerful event, and a plot card with a claim that you can ratchet as high as "6" introduce more support for the Neutral Faction House card and decks that unite multiple Houses.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Munchkin La Rivincita del Babbo
description: Contains the italian edition of Munchkin Santa's Revenge and Munchkin Reindeer Games plus three exclusive promos for a total of 33 foil cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Trains: Bay Area & China
description:
Bay Area / China map for Trains

This was given out to attendees of the 2015 AEG Big Game night as part of the swag box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Network and Route Building

name: Munchkin Vinyl Figure: Dopple Spyke
description:
First edition:

Need someone to take the blame when you stab your buddy in the back? Look no further! The new Munchkin Vinyl Figure from Funko will keep all the orcs at bay, ruin miniatures gaming, and probably won't spontaneously combust! Huzzah! Includes a new exclusive Munchkin card!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Knight's cross of Iron
description:
Knight's Cross of Iron is a dual pack of two wargames designed by Masahiro Yamazaki. Those games are Paulus' 6th Army and Zitadelle: Duel for Kursk 1943.

Paulus' 6th Army is an operational level simulation of the Soviet encirclement operation named "Operation Uranus" and the German escape attempt from Stalingrad from 19th November to 24th December, 1942. This game represents the first significant operational victory of the previously inferior Soviet Red Army over the Wehrmacht. For this reason, the battle of Stalingrad in often referred to as the "turning point" of World War II. But in this game, the German player has more command options than Friedrich Paulus, the German 6th Army commander. So the German player may withdraw from Stalingrad his troops or may defend more effectively than in the historical static situation.

Zitadelle: Duel for Kursk 1943 is an operational level simulation of the greatest tank battle in history. Beginning on July 5th 1943, strong German forces attempted to cut off the Soviet Kursk salient. Hitler had decided to delay the attack however, until he had sufficient new Panther and Tiger tanks available. During that time, the Soviet forces were reinforced on a scale not seen since World War I, and in addition they knew the details of the German offensive plan. The defenses were deployed on six lines deep. As a result, the German summer offensive named "Zitadelle" (Citadel) was checked, and on 13th July, Hitler informed his generals that Operation Zitadelle was called off.

The original edition of Paulus' 6th Army and Zitadelle: Duel for Kursk 1943 were published by Six Angles in 2005 and 2009 as issue games of #10 and #13. This renewed editions contain improved components; both for counters and game maps.

Scale
◆ 1 hex: 5.5 kilometers (Paulus' 6th Army) / 3.2 kilometers (Zitadelle)
◆ 1 turn: 3 days (Paulus' 6th Army) / 1 day (Zitadelle)

Contents
◆ 2 rule books (32 pages each)
◆ 2 A1 size color maps
◆ 5 countersheets (1200 pieces)
◆ 2 A3 size charts
◆ 4 A4 size charts
◆ 2 dice

(source: Six Angles webpage)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Rising Sun over China: The Sino-Japanese War, July 1937-Nov 1941
description: Rising Sun over China( RSOC) simulates the Japanese invasion of China prior to World War II (1937-1941) on a table top map scaled at 50 miles per hex with division-level playing pieces and monthly game turns. The simple I-go-U-go game mechanics keep play fast and focused while additional rules evoke the feel of 1930s China. Two player game as written, but can be played solo like many wargames, as there is little hidden information. Game comes in Paper Wars #83.

name: Munchkin: Playmat – The Flower of Love
description: Munchkin Playmat: The Flower of Love is a 28"×14" playmat that showcases Flower conversing with a love-struck shark. It includes spots to keep track of your Class, Race, level, and all your monster-slaying gear, and it features an in-game bonus: Once per game, you may play a monster from your hand to add its Level to your side in combat by discarding the number of Treasures printed on its card.

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Goblin & Halfling Referees
description: Models available via Forgeworld. Rules released in the January 2017 issue of White Dwarf magazine, then later in The Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac. These optional rules are for using referee tokens as they advance along the turn track following specific rules for fouling.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Special Ball Rules
description: The March 2017 issue of White Dwarf contained optional rules regarding use of the extra spiky ball (any team) and the team specific game balls such as limpin' squig (orc), warpstone brazier (skaven), and master-hewn ball (dwarf). There rules were reprinted on page 82 of the Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

name: Paramedics: Clear! Gen Con 50 Stampede Promo Card
description: Gen Con 50 Stampede is a promo Patients card for Paramedics: CLEAR! given out at Gen Con 50 with copies of issue #210 of Game Trade Magazine (not included in retail copies of GTM #210)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medical, Real-time

name: Blood in Space
description:
Blood in Space is a micro but complete set of rules for solitaire or co-op skirmish game, set on a sci-fi background. “Micro” refers to the small set of rules, the small time required to complete one game session and the small number of miniatures required (4-10 figures being a common range).

The game includes eleven Scenarios covering iconic sci-fi scenes like exploring the planet surface, attacking an enemy base, searching an abandoned starship, freeing prisoners. Event markers placed on the Map will create the needed Fog of War and randomize the placement of enemies, events and of course loot! Terrain rules allow to quickly create different planetary conditions.

Scenarios can be played individually or as part of a Campaign game: in this case a flowchart will (randomly) determine the next mission; as an example, after a “Exploration” mission a bad roll could send your characters on the “Ambush” scenario. Characters on a Campaign will be able to improve their characteristics, but with the improvement of the Reputation Level of your Crew, your enemies will also become stronger.

Activation of units (friendly and enemies) is managed with a pool of activation markers, but you can never be sure that every unit will be activated. When an “Enemy” marker is drawn by the pool you will roll on the ENEMY ACTIVATION table in the current Scenario to determine the unit to activate and its orders.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Elemental Towers
description:
A Components: Looney Pyramid Games solitaire game

You will need 45 Looney Pyramids - 3 trios each of 5 colors (Red, Green, Blue, Yellow, Black) and an Aquarius deck (Any edition. The game was designed using a 1st edition deck, and the rules include a note about which cards to remove if you are using a newer edition.)

The trumpets have sounded, the fires are lit, and the Elemental Tribes are heading to the celebration! You have thirty days to harness the power of the elements to build towering crystal shrines as tributes. Can you impress the chieftains? The strongest Tribes award the most prestige, so make haste to complete your Elemental Towers!

The object of the game is to score points by building towers of pyramids. Towers that are the color of the most highly valued elements at the end of the game will score the most points. As you play cards to the table, placing matching elements side by side will allow you to build pyramids and move them from space to space to form towers. Try to achieve the highest score you can before the deck runs out!

—description from the designer

name: Blood Red Skies: German – Luftwaffe Expansion Pack
description:
German Luftwaffe expansion material for the base game.

Datacards for the following aircraft are included:

• Bf 109F "Franz" Fighter
• Bf 109K "Karl" Fighter
• Ju 88C Heavy Fighter
• Ju 87B "Stuka" Dive Bomber
• He 111H Medium Bomber
• He 177A "Greif" Heavy Bomber

This pack also includes Action Deck cards which cover the aircraft presented plus a wide variety of other aircraft used by the Luftwaffe:
• 22 Trait Cards
• 3 Theatre Cards
• 3 Doctrine Cards
• 2 New Equipment Cards
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Chu Han
description:
Chu Han is a two-player card game of dynastic intrigue set in ancient China before and during the Chu-Han Contention, 206-202 BCE.

Two clans, the Han and Chu, vie to supplant the weak Qin ruler and forge China's first true dynasty. Historically, the Chu began in a stronger position, but the Han managed to defeat them.

Chu Han is a trick-taking, climbing, and shedding game consisting of multiple hands. Players begin each hand with a mixture of Chu and Han cards, representing strains within clans, hostage taking, and shifting allegiances. Optional Events and two historical campaigns provide additional variety.

Can you outmaneuver your rival to found a new dynasty?

name: Tiger Leader: Panzers! Expansion #2
description:
Panzers! is an expansion pack with 24 cards and 24 counters to reinforce your Tiger Leader game!

The Expansion includes:


More Armor cards - Panzer II, Panzer III (75mm), Panther, Marder II, Marder III, Panzer Jaeger I, E-50, E-100
More Light Armor cards - SDF Kfz 234/2 (Long), SDF Kfz 234/3 (Short), SDF Kfz 234/4 (75mm), SDF Kfz 251 (ATG)
More Infantry cards - Rifle Teams
Counter for each Unit card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sant Jordi: La llegenda
description:
A mighty Dragon is raiding all the country and a knight is traveling from a far away lands for defeating the beast and letting those lands gorgeous as a bunch of roses, as they were before.

SANT JORDI. La llegenda is a 2 player game which recreate the Saint George Legend. One player will represent the Knight which is trying to travel from far away and face the Dragon. The other player will represent the Dragon which will try to discover why Saint George don't pass through certain territories. The game includes different degrees difficulties for playing with kids and also with more experienced players.

During the set up, the Knight will draw a condition card the will give him a condition under that will never pass through a certain kind territory.

Turn by turn the Saint George and the Dragon will choose a card among the 5 cards available. If the Knight can pass through the chosen cards will collect shields for passing through baronies, as soon as pass through 3 baronies will win the game.

On the other hand if Saint George can't pass through a territory the Dragon will remove a card of the current cards passed through and take blindly a token from the bag. If it is a villager he will remove the token from the game but if it's the princess/prince then will remove 5 cards from the deck or try to solve the condition card of Saint Jordi. In case of resolve the condition, the Dragon wins the game but if doesn't guess the right condition, Saint Geroge wins the game.

Finally, if the deck has run out, the Dragon wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Medieval, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Movement, Relative Movement, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection

name: Dice Nutz Pro Golf
description:
Monster drives, unbelievable hole-outs, sand saves, and mile-long putts for birdie...it’s all in here! Hit the links as your favorite PGA golfer and your results will depend on that pro’s abilities, your decisions, and of course, the luck of the dice. Will you choose to lay-up or go for the green? Drive for distance or play it safe? Or, Maybe you just want to play a relaxing round as yourself against the course...no card needed. Just grab your clubs (using the Club Selection Chart) and you’re off! Choose the right club for the shot and you will be rewarded.

It’s up to you to choose your golf fantasy with Dice Nutz Pro Golf!

—description from the publisher

name: Welcome to La Petite Mort
description:
A Deadly Crossover!

Welcome to La Petite Mort is a unique crossover expansion that works both for Welcome to... and La Petite Mort - le Jeu.

Set in the dark humour universe of the French comic book "La Petite Mort" by Davy Mourier, players will act as the Reaper's son, who has been ordered to wipe the population of your neighborhood.

This expansion can be played with both games independently (you do not need to own both) with the same components.

Played with Welcome to..., this expansion asks the players to reap the souls of the inhabitants using a particular type of death (drowning in pools, car crash in parks,...) corresponding to the different actions of the game. Faster paced than the original and more streamlined, the expansion changes substantially the original gameplay.

Played with La Petite Mort, this expansion asks the players to reach new objectives for their Diploma as the Grim Reaper.They will have to make sure old people are "collected" and avoid the new and young residents, much harder to collect. Adding a new "write" mechanism to the original game, the expansion drastically changes the way the cards are played.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Bingo, Contracts, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Divinus: Pandora's Box
description:
The Pandora's Box Expansion contains unlocked Stretch Goals from the Divinus Gamefound campaign and is included with every pledge.

Contains:

extra components for Eternal mode
5 extra miniatures
5 extra Myth scenarios
10 new god cards
15 new quest cards
20 new artifacts


–description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Okol Invasion
description:
We get into the role of some aliens from the planet Multiplus called Okols.

The goal of the Okols is to recharge the energy of mother D10 by conquering all the planets in the universe.
All this will be achieved by playing two of our 10 cards and multiplying one of them with the power of the D10 and placing the result in one of the squares of the map of the planet to conquer.
