description: A set of miniatures rules covering late 19th Century colonial combat in The Sudan (British vs Fuzzy Wuzzies/Dervishes), in the well regarded Peter Pig rule sets range designed by the RFCM Team. There is a supporting range of miniatures.

name: The Emperor's Arena
description:
The Emperor’s Arena is where legends are born. Lured by the promise of all the treasure one can carry from the Emperor’s Vault, heroes thrust themselves into combat with the Emperor’s fiercest monsters, the most diabolical of tricks, and the most blood-thirsty competitors. To those who can survive an hour in the arena, a life of fame and fortune awaits.

In The Emperor’s Arena, you and your opponents take control of rival teams of heroes battling for fame and fortune within the Emperor’s Arena. As time progresses, the Emperor will release increasingly dangerous opponents into the ring, requiring you to decide how much punishment your active hero can take before tagging to the next team member. Fame is gained from slaying monsters and attacking other players. The player whose team has gained the most fame by the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Controversia
description: A mix between Scrabble and Othello. The game is about creating words in a grid of 10x10; the players has the same tiles with letters, but one will play with the red side and the other player with the black side of the letters. The idea is to make words using letters with the colour of your opponent. That letters will now change to your colour, as in Othello. The player with the most letters of his own colour wins the game.

name: Queen's Gate
description:
Queen's Gate is a vehicle to bring licensed characters into Queen's Blade's world. Queen's Gate includes some well-known characters and character designers. Like Queen's Blade, it is also licensed from the Lost Worlds system, and completely compatible with any Lost Worlds book. As usual, it is primarily a one-on-one game, in which each player must have a book representing a character. The players swap books, so that each sees how his opponent reacts to his decisions.

The Lost Worlds system uses a much more complex version of rock-paper-scissors, in that both players blindly select an action, hoping to second-guess each other and score a hit.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.

name: Zen l'initie
description:
Alternative title: Zen, the initiate.

An abstract strategy game where players attempt to form an unbroken line with their pieces. Simple rules include sliding pieces, jumps, and captures.

Winner of the As D'Or (Best strategy game), 1997.
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/wiki/page/Golden_Ace

name: Word by Word
description: Move from start to finish by answering game cards from seven categories (slang, jargon, word origin, vocabulary, unscramble, cross word and roll 'em). A player is awarded points for responding with the correct answer.

name: Solar Marine
description:
Counter Strike: Solar Marine

THE TWENTY FIRST CENTURY
From the shadow of Jupiter, Taskforce Bravo approaches Io. Spaceships release a bombardment of nuclear warheads triggering a response of plasma bolts from the planetary defenses. Landing craft carrying the 124th Special Forces battalion make their final descent. Dust rises, hatches blow, and a thousand marines break out. Flying at one hundred kilometres per hour, these soldiers skim the surface firing laser and particle weapons as they approach the hardened defenses surrounding the European colony complex. Solar Marine is a science fiction game simulating ground combat in the future. Players are given troops armed with various weapons that may be developed in the future and fight on the various landscapes in the Solar System.

Contents:

* Full color rule book
* 288 die-cut counters
* 3 color hex map
* Charts & Tables
* 2 dice

Complexity: Medium

Map Scale: 500 metres/hex

Unit Scale: Squads of 10-12 Soldiers or 1 vehicle

Time Scale: 1 minute per turn

Players: 2

Re-implements Marine: 2002.

The game can be combined with The Final Frontier. Solar Marine includes rules for breaking down the Final Frontier space vessels, military companies, planetary defenses, and mining facilities/colonies into the equivalent Solar Marine units.
publishers: Microgame Design Group, Platinum Dragon Productions

name: Runs on the Board
description:
From the blurb.

RUNS on the BOARD' is a realistic cricket game involving skill, tactics, tension, risk, excitement & unpredictability. It is designed to have a high scoring rate (average 14 runs per over) allowing a single innings to be completed in about 30 minutes. Batting & Bowling cards include an ingenious colour coding system which makes the game easy to understand, it can be played by any number of players (ideally 2-4) from about 8 years of age to adultsdividing themselves into two teams, as in real cricket.

In the box:-

690x590 mm Game board
40 Batting Cards
40 Bowling Cards
14 Batting Bonus Cards
14 Bowling Bonus Cards
16 Umpire Cards
Score board with 5 rotating discs
1 Special Dice
11 Playing Pieces (fielders)
Rules booklet with Master Score card

Advanced rules exist which also add a solo variant (see company web site)

name: La Conquête du Monde revised
description:
This game is an expansion of Risk (Risiko/Ataque/War) and you will play it using the sets of playing pieces and territory cards from your own box.

The game is played on a Pacific centred map which shows a new link between Argentina and Eastern Australia. There are three main differences with Risk rules regarding:
- steps mechanism;
- territory's value;
- secret missions.

There is also a variant named "Blind play". People who are interested can ask for blind play rules.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Chaos Dwarfs of Deep Forge (fan expansion for Warhammer Quest)
description:
Excerpt from the introduction of the Chaos Dwarf Roleplay book:
"Players are most likely accustomed to playing Warhammer Quest as one of the Warriors in the core game, or possibly as one of the expansion characters, such as the Wardancer, Imperial Noble or Pit Fighter, for example. Similarly, players have also had access to official characters (meaning not characters created by fans) who are aligned with the forces of Chaos, in the case of the Chaos Warrior, or are at the very least unlikely to be seen as do-gooders, such as in the case of the Ogre.
If the players are so inclined they may forgo their usual characters with which they are accustomed, and take up a life of adventuring as a band of Chaos Dwarfs!"

The expansion rule book contains all the material necessary for players to adventure in the Warhammer world as Chaos Dwarfs (Dawi Zharr), working diligently to establish the city Zharr Grungron Ankor as the next great Dawi Zharr city.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly: John Wayne Collector's Edition
description:
From USAopoly.com:

Saddle up for an adventure with the Duke!

Celebrate the life and career of one of the most beloved actors of our time, John Wayne. Known best for his roles as a cowboy, he also was a great athlete, rancher and outdoorsman representing the adventurous spirit of America.

As you attempt to bankrupt your opponents by buying, selling and trading the most significant properties in John Wayne’s life, kindly heed these words:

"You can take everything a man has as long as you leave him his dignity." -- John Wayne

Includes six collectible tokens: Cowboy Hat, Belt Buckle, Cowboy Boot, "Duke" the dog, John Wayne’s Director's Chair and Stagecoach.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fighting Steam!
description: Fighting Steam! is a simulation of naval combat during the U.S. Civil War. The players control the vessels that took part in the battles on either the Union or Confederate sides. Each turn represents about 7 minutes. Each movement/range point equals about 100 yards. Each counter represents an individual ship that took part in the battles. There are 10 different naval actions, called scenarios, in the game.

name: The American Civil War: A Rank & File Supplement
description:
From their website:

A Supplement to Crusader Publishings Rank and File Rulebook.

The American Civil War supplement for Rank & File includes a historical background to the war as well as game aids that can be used with any rules system. There are optional and period specific rules as well as detailed weapon statistics, command ratings and army organisation.

Almost 1000 leader ratings for both sides of the conflict and army lists that are broken down by theatre and year allow players to design their own scenarios, create balanced forces for pick up games or calculate troop quality and strength for historical battles.

This supplement adds a further level of detail to the command and control aspect of Rank & File with a comprehensive order system that takes account of leader ratings, orders issued, distances and staff quality. Optional army morale rules allow large or small games to be played to a definite conclusion within an evening. This allows players to game larger conflicts with all of the problems and uncertainty of command that was a factor in so many ACW battles.

While much of the material included is of use with any rules system a copy of the Rank & File rules are required to gain the most from this supplement.

48page full colour perfect bound A4
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Yu-Gi-Oh! Capsule Monsters
description:
The Capsule Monsters game is a game released by Mattel, based on the Yu-Gi-Oh! Capsule Monsters anime arc, which was partly based on Capsule Monster Chess from early issues of the Yu-Gi-Oh! manga.

The object of the game is to defeat your opponent's King. The first player to reduce their opponent's King's Hit Points to 0 is the winner. The Game has two different levels, the Basic Game for beginners and the Advanced Game for more experienced players.

Little knowledge of the existence of the game became known and production was apparently discontinued after the release of just a two-player Starter Set and one Booster Pack.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: China: Arktica
description: Expansion map for China / Web of Power, part of Schacht's 1-year campaign of releasing a new expansion map every month. Available for online play at www.michaelschacht.net.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: BrainBox: Once Upon a Time
description:
Do you know how the gingerbread crossed the river? Or how many bears live in the house Goldilocks found in the woods? BrainBox Once Upon A Time contains 55 beautifully-illustrated cards showing scenes from some of the best loved children stories.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner. This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game.

Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!
publishers: Brainbox Games Pty Ltd, Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Malifaux: Cult of December
description: This box set expands the number of units available for Malifaux by adding the Cult of December crew. This set contains Rasputina (leader), Ice Golem, and 3 Ice Gamlins.

name: Win, Place & Show: Official Program
description: This expansion to Win, Place & Show is a second program to use with the game. You will need a copy of Win, Place & Show to use it. It was originally included as an insert in The GENERAL Magazine Vol. 30, No. 4 (July-August 1996). It includes six full new races with new horses to use sometimes in place of the original program, for variety. The accompanying article also included some miscellaneous variant rules, including rules for interchangeable apprentice and veteran jockeys.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Blocco
description:
Blocco is a dice game with strategic elements for 2-4 players.
On your turn you roll two dice and chose the result from one dice and move one of your pawns accordingly over the board. Then you put a block ("Blocco") on the field from where you started. Nobody can go back to that field anymore or jump over it. Therefore, the board gets smaller and smaller. The first one who cannot move anymore loses the game. Additionally, if you land with one of your three pawns on a field with an enemy pawn, you can kick it out of the game.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Fan Deck
description:
The Fan Deck includes 24 new large cards and 4 small cards, inspired by the fans themselves! These have never been available apart from the Deluxe set until now.

The Fan Deck includes both the Theta series promo cards and the Phi series promo cards. The Theta deck is 12 large cards and 4 small cards that were created by special backers of the Quest Deluxe Kickstarter. The Phi deck were created by fans who entered a fan card contest in 2012. These cards are compatible with Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Trading

name: Rome in Crisis
description:
Card game of the Roman Empire in the second half of the third century AD, a fifty-year period during which the average reign of an emperor was a mere 2.5 years.

Each player controls a number of imperial candidates whom they try to push to the top position to gain honor and prestige by solving some of Rome's many crises -- invasions by Goths, Persians and Palymrans plus the incessant demands of the populace -- before quickly yielding to the next emperor.

In a system reminiscent of King's Breakfast, players draft influence cards which they may later deploy to help them win top jobs in the empire or secretly use against opponents to make existing crises more difficult to handle. To gain power players must commit cards sufficient to outpoll the opposition and solve crises, but must avoid overcommitment that reduces future options and opportunities. In addition, each candidate has a different special ability which must be reckoned with.

At the end of play the player with the most prestige points wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: L' Audace: The Battle of Abbeville – May 28-29,1940
description:
L'Audace: The Battle of Abbeville: May 28-June 4, 1940, is a two-player game that simulates the climatic battle of Abbeville. One player takes on the role of the leader of the counter-attacking French 4th DCR forces, the other the commander of those defending the German bridgehead.

After breaking out of the Ardennes Forest and fighting over the Meuse River at Dinant and Sedan, German mechanized forces raced across France to the Channel, effectively splitting the Allies in two. By the end of May the English announced their intention to withdraw the BEF (British Expeditionary Force) at Dunkirk. Increasingly desperate, the French high command cobbled together a counter-attack force centered on the newly-formed 4th DCR (Division Char de Reserve), led by General Charles DeGaulle, to retake the channel port of Abbeville. Victory here against the strung out 57th Bavarian Infantry Division could reunify the Allied forces, and also cut-off the deadly but depleted panzer divisions that had earlier wrought so much havoc.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 40 minutes
Hex: 0.25 miles / 0.40 kilometer
Units: Company

Game Inventory:
Two 11x17" full color maps
One single-side printed un-mounted countersheet (200 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 8-page rulebook
One Player Aid Chart

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1.5 to 2 hours

name: Eccentria: The City of Trends
description:
In Eccentria, the players tell the story of a medieval city-state that savors the benefits of technology. Its neighborhoods, parks and city sectors are all built over a fine and innovative technological piece of hydraulic machinery. Its people live their pompous life in lavish luxury, as many trends among the society come and go.
During this time, players find themselves, as overseers of a city sector, tasked with the duty of maintaining the city's prosperity. Thus, they're given a neighborhood in which they must expand.
They must build buildings and invite prominent figures among the neighboring "elite" to help. All this in turn affects the society as it constantly demands more and more. And as the trends change so does the path to victory and to total prestige.
In this game each player has his own board to build buildings. As players deploy them with puzzle-like strategy, they affect the society -the core aspect- of the game that changes according to the player's decisions. By selecting specific buildings they also acquire the help of individuals that offer them versatile abilities.
All these changes however may result into a trend change in the society and so do the victory conditions.
Whomever manages to be the most versatile in strategy and grasp the chance for success by earning the most victory points, will be the Grand Overseer and the victor of this game!
mechanics: Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Seeräuber
description: Each player has 8 ships with different speed and weapons range. The ships move on the grids on the game board. The goal is to steal the treasure from one of the home harbors of the opponent with one of the two pirate ships. It can be arranged before the game, if the winner only has to reach one of the opponents harbors, or if he has to return to his own Harbor afterwards.

name: Siege of Verdan
description:
Siege of Verdan is a military strategy game with aspects of area-control, diplomacy, resource management, and combat. Each player is attempting to eliminate the other players by attacking their rulers and capital.

Each token on the board of Siege of Verdan represents a card a player will have in play. Each card imparts different abilities. Large and small military units battle over control of states, explorers, and scouts to acquire new lands. Merchants and diplomats help to form alliances and develop resources. Rulers help in all aspects of the game and spies and assassins help to remove the rulers.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Super Tooth: Herbivorous Heroes Expansion
description: This expansion to Super Tooth is comprised of 6 unique armored and spiked Plant-Eater cards: Ankylosaurus, Einiosaurus, Kentrosaurus, Sauropelta, Stegosaurus, and Styracosaurus. The explanation for their special ability may be found on the Expansion Events reference card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric

name: Robinson Crusoe
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 60
- moving by turns -
Typical 'Roll & Move' game

Roll the 2 dice by turns and step forward - until you end on a red marked space follow instructions (lid inside)
Notes:
Likely published 1910/20s
cute pewter pawns
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Nautical, Novel-based, Racing

name: Korea: Race to Pusan
description:
Korea: Race to Pusan is a low complexity wargame covering the Battle of Pusan Perimeter. The game includes an 11x17 map, countersheet, and 4 pages of rules. The game uses the standard WWII rules found in the TwoBuckGames WWII Series.

Each player has an objective that he or she must meet in order to win - either number of units destroyed or occupying certain hexes. Each counter can move one hex per turn. The combat is a simple system in which the players must roll greater than or equal to the number printed on the counter to achieve a hit.

name: The Russian Empire Strikes Back: Lodz 1914
description: This is a operational scale war game based on the World War One battle between Germany and Russia.

name: Retro Raygun
description: Retro Raygun is a fast-paced miniature combat game set in the retro sci-fi future of the 24th Century. The brave Galacteers fight to protect mankind from sinister forces, while the domineering Valkeeri seek to enslave humanity. Led by the Robot Queen, the unstoppable Robot Legion plots the destruction of all living organisms. This 102 page, full-colour book contains the full game rules along with complete force lists for the Galacteers, Robot Legion, and the Valkeeri. The rules include 6 objective-based scenarios that encourage tactical decision making and narrative campaigns. The book also contains a Galactic Bestiary so you can include alien creatures like the dreaded Aquaclops and the voracious Slishians in your games.

name: Deadline Saloon
description:
In a godforsaken town in the wild west a new saloon has opened. Citizents are scrambling for the admission in hopes of free booze. With wise and smart decisions you need to help them to achieve their goals and at the same time impede on other players as much as you can. Each citizen has unique capabilities supporting their admission but your decisions and tactics can make them succeed in this entertaining card game.

Setup: At the beginning sort all the cards by color. Each players chooses a certain color. The optional characters (negative numbers) can be used or can be excluded from the deck at your will. For the first few playthroughs, until you get familiar with the characters and game mechanics, it’s best to play without the optional characters. Each player shuffles all of their cards, deal out 4 cards for their hands and placing the rest face down in front of them. Place the Entrance card on the table and in clockwise order the players begin to put their cards one-by-one next to the Entrance card.
Gameplay: (each step is mandatory)

Place a card
Execute the action for character of the placed card
Execute starred characters’ actions in the queue from back to front. In every turn each character executes their action once, hence if a starred card is placed during the turn then its action won’t be executed again.
Draw a card if you have less than 4 cards in hand.
If there are at least 5 cards in the queue then the first 2 cards enters the Saloon. At the end of the game (even if Thief is in the queue) when all of the cards are played out the first card of the last queue enters the Saloon and the others go to the Cemetery. Cards are collected facing down.
If the color of the last card of the queue doesn’t match the color of one of the cards which enters the Saloon then the last card walks sadly to the Cemetery. Optional rule: The player whose character walked to the cemetery is allowed (but not compulsorily) to draw one card from one of their opponent’s hand if this opponent holds at least 4 cards in their hand. The player puts the drawn card facing up in front of the opponent. The opponent must play out this drawn card in their next turn. Card can not be drawn from opponent who already has a drawn card in front of them.


Ending: Game ends when all of the cards are played out. The player who has the most characters in the Saloon wins. If several players end up with a tie then the player whose characters in the saloon have the lowest overall values wins.

name: Great War at Sea: Rise of the Dragon
description:
From the publisher:

In 1907, the Imperial Chinese Navy proposed a new building program to provide three regional fleets, each built around a new modern battleship. Two years later a naval commission headed by the Regent's brother, Prince Tsai-hsun, recommended a fleet of eight dreadnoughts and 20 cruisers plus supporting vessels, and began soliciting bids from shipyards around the world.

China never built that fleet, but that doesn’t stop you from leading it into battle against the Japanese imperialists. Great War at Sea: Rise of the Dragon presents the Chinese line of battle as proposed by Prince Tsai-hsun, made up of ships built in Germany, Britain, Japan, Austria-Hungary, Italy and the United States.

The Chinese have nine dreadnought battleships: the eight new ships proposed by the Prince, plus the former Brazilian Rio de Janeiro. Plus the twenty proposed cruisers, and the destroyers, mine craft, gunboats and torpedo boats that made up the rest of the program.

Eleven new scenarios send this fleet into action against the Japanese in 1915, resisting Japan’s odious demands for control of Chinese ports, railways and mines. The Japanese have countered the Chinese buildup with additional new ships of their own, foregoing the reconstruction of captured Russian prizes to invest instead in additional new battleships and cruisers, including the small battle cruisers proposed in 1905.

Rise of the Dragon is a supplement for the Great War at Sea series, based on battles that never happened. It is not a complete game: Ownership of Russo-Japanese War, Pacific Crossroads and Central Powers (and only those three items) is necessary to play all of the eleven scenarios included.

Rise of the Dragon includes 90 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces: 50 "long" pieces representing major warships and 40 square ones representing smaller craft and fleet markers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Heroes of Metro City: Vile Fiends
description:
Includes these new cards:


The Grand Vizier (Archenemy)
Viprous (Archenemy)
Hidden Explosives (Minion x 5)
Shinobi Assassins (Minion x 5)
Crossover Issue (Storyline x 5)
Reformed Criminal (Storyline x 5)
Combat Instructor (Power x 10 + Randomizer)
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Bigside pocket
description:
"Bigside pocket" is standalone game of bigside. not expansion for bigside*


あなたはオールドボ-ス!
しかし、あなたには信頼を置ける部下がいない。
周りにはあなたの位置を狙う奴、 また、ソイツのために、あなたのことを裏切ろうとする奴らばかり! 奴らを見つけ出し、最後までボスの地位を守り切ろう!

Your are a old boss !
You must be find traitor and new boss !!
That's the way you survive.

Bigside pocket is a party game for multiple people together.One of the players becomes the Old Boss. The other players draw 2 cards. In turn, they use one of the cards. The card left on your hand becomes your identity. There are 8 cards total (2 per each Character) so it is possible to guess others' card. After all players use their own card, the Old Boss chooses a player to find the betrayer. Players get the income according to the result. The game ends after all players once played the Boss. The player with the highest money wins the game.

This game is release 2016 kobe game market.

name: Super Sandman the Game
description:
You must reach the opposite side of the board with your boot. The board is filled with sand, and getting across will not be easy, because your opponents will block you with water or walls.

On your turn, you play one of the 3 cards from your hand, apply the card effects, and then draw a new card in hand.

There are following card effects:

boot - move
wall/water - place a wall or water token to block your opponents
bridge - place the bridge
destruction - destroy walls, water tokens, or bridges


Whoever reaches the opposite side first is the winner.

name: Dungeon Storming: La Torre di Kunrat
description:
From the back of the box:

"Alone, in the depths of the dungeon, surrounded by monsters. A priestess and a thief fight their way trhu hideous ghoul back from the dead. Rich treasures await you, with which you can get new weapons, armor, spells and scrolls.

A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with more players by combining two or more sets of Dungeon Storming!"

The game is played by moving the miniatures of your heroes on the map, room by room, battling the monsters with a simple roll of a die, dodging the traps, collecting treasures and magic objects, until the heroes reach the last room and try to overcome the boss monster (the heroes can exit the dungeon and buy new objects with the money found).

The map and the layout of the rooms for this dungeon are fixed (all the tables for the encounters, treasures and magical objects are printed on it), but it can be played with four levels of difficulty.

____________________________________________

From the publisher (Italian):

Quarto capitolo di Dungeon Storming, il gioco da tavolo d'avventura che vi permetterà di vivere le emozioni di un dungeon crawler in modo tascabile! La Torre di Kunrat è luogo dove il potente stregone lich estende il suo dominio sulle lande ghiacciate, al comando di un'orda di temibili scheletri. Nei panni di una Barda e di un valoroso Paladino dovrete tentare di porre fine al lugubre regno del lich Kunrat, senza che questo vi utilizzi per infoltire le sue schiere di non morti.

Esplora corridoi e stanze, trova oro e tesori e scappa prima di essere sconfitto! Arrivando al villaggio potrai compare armi e incantesimi per tornare all'avventura ancora più forte, e avvicinarti al terribile mostro finale... e forse riuscirai persino a sconfiggerlo!

Giocate questa avventura stand alone o combinate il dungeon di questo capitolo con gli altri 3 per dar vita ad un'avventura ancora più epica! Gli eroi di ciascun capitolo sono utilizzabili in ogni altro, si tratta di un gioco duro, modulare, che in ogni set presenta miniature e schede di due Avventurieri con poteri e abilità peculiari, di mostri piccoli e di un grosso mostro finale, oltre a una “vera” mappa, un emporio con oggetti unici e una missione tematica!

ATTENZIONE: le miniature all'interno non sono dipinte.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Steal The Show! Act II: Theatrical Party Card Game
description:
Are you ready for Act II? Play as iconic characters as you challenge players to a Battle of Strength or a Battle of Wits using Shakespearean insults and the art of bluffing!

Steal The Show! is a race to collect five comedy masks, and the first player to do so wins. If a player receives five tragedy masks first, however, they're eliminated from the game. In more detail, each player takes on the role of a character. Characters have unique gameplay abilities as well as a strength value (used in a Battle of Strength) and a wit value (used in a Battle of Wits). One location card is always in play and changes throughout the course of the game; location cards modify the rules of the game.

Action cards (Insults) are used during battle to enhance the strength and wit value of the character as well as insert some trickery to mix! Don't forget bluffing! Players can use bluffing techniques to assist with a numerical boost as well!

Steal The Show! Act II: Theatrical Party Card Game is a standalone expansion for Steal The Show! that features new characters, new locations, and new actions/insults that can be played on their own or in combination with the first game.

name: Hastings, Stamford Bridge, Fulford - 1066
description:
Game about three batlles of the 1066, where Normans and Vikings attacked England. At Stamford Brige Englishmen managed to defeat the vikings, but they were beated at Fulford. Hastings was decisive batlle, where Normans managed to win.

Game uses the rules for the "Medieval" system, with classic "I move - you move" mechanics. Unitss are infantry and cavalry, light, medium and heavy, along with archers and leaders. Cavalry may charge to make it's attack more devastating.

Morale plays the important role in the mechanics - as he number of the losses increases, the stronger enemy player attacks. Defeated units might be weakened, destroyed or disordered.

name: Side Stitch
description:
Side stitch is played on board tessellated with hexagonal cells and possessing an odd numbered of sides. The goal is to create a group of stones that touches more sides than your opponent. (Note that on game boards that have colored borders, each distinct color counts as a distinct "side.")



RulesOn each turn, a player plays a single stone of his/her color to any empty cell; once placed, stones do not move. Play continues until the board is full or until both players pass in succession. The pie rule applies (that is, once the first stone is played, the second player can opt to switch colors with his/her opponent).

A group of same-color stones has a value equal to the number of sides it touches. (Note that a stone in the cell where two sides meet touches both of those sides). At the end of the game, each player identifies his/her highest-valued group. The player whose highest-valued group is highest is the winner. In case of tie, the players should ignore the tied groups and compare their remaining groups; the highest value among the remaining groups wins. This process is repeated until the tie is broken. Draws are not possible.

Honors


Side Stitch won 2nd place in the Best Combinatorial 2-Player Game Contest of 2017

name: Fantastiqa: Rift of the Rival Realms Promo Cards
description:
This card is a new Artifact Card for use in Fantastiqa: Enchanted Edition and Fantastiqa: Rucksack Edition. It's included in all copies of Fantastiqa: Rival Realms -- four total, one per player of Fantastiqa. Players each begin the game with one copy of this Artifact.

RIFT OF THE RIVAL REALMS: On the turn when played, any subdued Creature Cards are not discarded. Instead, they are added to the player's hand and can be used immediately.

(This effect is very similar to the use of combos in Fantastiqa Rival Realms.)
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection

name: Team Yankee: Red Thunder – Soviets in World War III
description:
Description from the publisher:

Team Yankee is a tabletop miniatures wargame that is set in a fictional World War III in 1985 based on the novel of the same name by Harold Coyle.

The game is a standard two player miniature wargame with each player taking command of a company or battalion level force consisting of hand painted miniatures. The game provides one 6 different missions for the purpose of pickup games. There are also several scenarios in the book that allow the players to recreate some of the battles from the Team Yankee novel.

The game has an accompanying line of 15mm scale miniatures to use but it can be played with models from any manufacture.

Red Thunder introduces new Soviet vehicles. First and foremost is the T-64 tank. The T-64 is a more sophisticated tank than the T-72. It comes with its own optional anti-tank guided missile that is fired through its 125mm 2A46 smooth-bore gun.

Red Thunder also introduces the BTR-60 mounted Motor Rifle Battalion and Companies. The BTR-60 is an 8-wheeled armoured personnel carrier mounting 14.5mm and 7.62mm machine-guns in its small turret.

Red Thunder is also packed full of other stuff. There are three Scenarios that can either be played as one off games or as part of a three game campaign. The book also covers the exploits of the 2nd Guards Tank Army, 94th Guards Motor Rifle Division and Major Yuri Volkov’s Tank Battalion during World War III, plus lots of other background and technical information.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Wizgille's Phenomenale
description: This additional drink card came as a SlugCrew Minor Reward for 2014; it also appears in The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Evil Pooky.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Guild Ball: Seenah
description: A player from the Hunter's Guild.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame

name: Guild Ball: Chaska
description: A player from th Hunter's Guild.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame

name: Willi Wörterwurm
description:
Willi the bookworm has eaten all the books and made a mess of all the letters. The players now have to clean up the mess and create new words.
Three theme cards are placed on the table, each player gets a certain amount of letters. Three letters are in the exchange area. The first player places a letter next to a theme card to start a word which fits that theme. The next player can start a new word for a different theme, or continue the current word by dding another letter. At the end of the turn, a player draws a new card.
Instead of playing a hand card, a player may take a letter from the exchange area and add it to any of the words, and must replace it from their hand. If this also doesn't work, they can discard a card.
When a word is finished, the cards (which show a number of points depending on how often they appear in German) are put on a score pile and a new word for this theme can be started. If the players agree that it will be too hard to finish a word, they can discard the cards and start a new word.
Play continues like this until all cards have been played. Points in the discard pile are deducted from the points in the score pile, and the overall number is checked on a chart to see how well the group did.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Shadowmoor
description:
The idyllic twilight of Lorywn is now the eerie eternal night of Shadowmoor. The gloom has seeped into the plane’s inhabitants, too, transforming creatures of fable into malicious monsters. The races and characters you know from Lorwyn are back, but with twisted allegiances and dark new powers. Even the new game mechanics are warped …

This 301-card expansion set features randomly inserted premium cards, mono-colored hybrid cards, and four new game mechanics: Wither, Persist, Untap, and Conspire.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Into the Black: Boarding Party – EPIC Encounters
description:
Just when you thought you had this, that this boarding was like a walk in the park, suddenly you can feel something ominous approaching. Who, or what, could it be? Will it be friend or foe?

Find out with the Into the Black: Boarding Party EPIC ENCOUNTERS Expansion!

Face fearsome enemies or earn their favour and loyalty.
Collect epic loot to improve your chances of survival and fame.

--

Into the Black: Boarding Party is a semi-cooperative space pirate dungeon crawl with a hidden traitor element.

Play as a fierce band of space pirates who have boarded an enemy vessel, set on accomplishing your primary mission while each pirate has their own secret goal to fulfill.

Explore the ship one section at a time, loot the vessel of its bounty, fend off a seemingly unending wave of enemy defenders and encounter a potentially lethal series of events around every corner; All while keeping morale high as the clock ticks down to your potential capture.

Be wary of the the traitor among you, out for personal glory at the expense of the rest of the crew!

Will you make it off the ship with all of your goals accomplished and your crew intact? Find out in Into the Black: Boarding Party!

name: Anklebiters: Pixies VS Gremlins
description:
Pixies VS Gremlins is a light-hearted strategy card game. The objective is to control enough magic rune stones to summon the magnificent and fearsome Wolpertinger! To do that, players choose a faction and send out their minions! Once a player has enough strength to capture a rune stone, its theirs.

But things are seldom so easy. Players will challenge each other by engaging in combat, unleashing mischievous spells, wicked traps and powerful gadgets.

The primary game objective is to capture more rune location cards than your opponents. To capture these cards, each player must choose and deploy some of their minions, which are acquired from their faction deck.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Minotaur
description:
Minotaurs’ enormous strength, minimal intelligence and vicious, depraved mentality would appear to make them almost perfect Blood Bowl players. Fortunately for most other players however, few coaches allow Minotaurs in their team. This is mainly because of their disconcerting habit of going berserk before, during and after the match and attacking anyone or anything that gets in their way: friends, foes – even the coach!

This multi-part resin kit contains the components you need in order to assemble a Blood Bowl Minotaur. You can field him as a Big Guy for your Chaos, Chaos Dwarf, Chaos Chosen or Chaos Renegades team – he definitely lives up to this, looking both pretty big and pretty chaotic. Densely packed with powerful muscle, the Minotaur is stomping forth with fury, challenging any opposing player to get in the way of his bunched fists and enormous horns. He’s not particularly heavily armoured, but the bits of armour he has strapped on are menacing and spiky, with a delightful skull on the right shoulder; this probably used to belong to someone who didn’t get out of the way quickly enough.

—description from the publisher

'NOTE: An alternate version of the Blood Bowl Minotaur was a limited release in June 2019:'

All minotaurs are slab-muscled and vicious as a rule. On top of all that, some of them carry mutations that make them even more intimidating and lethal, like this cruelly clawed brute. He’s also been fitted with a suitably brutal-looking helmet to protect what’s left of his grey matter. Minotaurs make ideal Blood Bowl players, but few coaches allow them in their team. This is mainly because of their disconcerting habit of going berserk before, during and after the match and attacking anyone or anything that gets in their way – friends, foes or even the coach!

You can field this Minotaur as a Big Guy for your Chaos, Chaos Dwarf, Chaos Chosen or Chaos Renegades team – his enormous mutated claws and sturdy head gear blend well with the look of brutal and corrupted teams. Densely packed with powerful muscle, the Minotaur charges forward to challenge anyone who gets in his way. Well armoured, his kit is fittingly menacing and spiky, with a form-fitting helmet and bulbous eye protectors, as well as a delightful skull on the right shoulder – this probably used to belong to someone who didn’t get out of the way quickly enough.

This kit comes as 6 resin components and is supplied with a 32mm round Blood Bowl base, featuring a slot to place a ball in. Rules for the Minotaur can be found in Death Zone Season Two and the Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Doodle Mash
description:
DoodleMash is a really fun party game for any occasion. What do you get when you cross a giraffe, praying mantis, and a penguin? A Manffeguin? How about when you cross a baboon with a bee and a spider? A Beeboonder? An eagle, snail, bear? Lion, moose, bird? You get DoodleMash! The combinations are endless with this one of a kind game that matches imagination with doodling to create some of the funniest, wildest creatures you could ever dream of! From art rooms to living room, or boardrooms to board game pubs. Doodlemash doesn't disappoint.

Each round every player will draw a token that has 3 random numbers on it. The numbers will correspond to animal cards dealt on the board. The players will then have 60 seconds (or less) to mash up the 3 animals into 1. After the timer is up, players exchange drawings and try to guess which numbers the other player has based on the drawing. Landing on an "X" on the board will draw a sketchy card which changes how the other players must draw. From non-dominant hand to blind draw, sketchy cards always draw a laugh.

First one across the finish wins.

-description from publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Galaxies
description:
A long time ago, the universe was composed of a big soup of matter that slowly expanded, cooled down, and condensed. This led to the formation of different structures in space including asteroids, comets, planets, stars, black holes, and galaxies. We are just starting to understand how these different elements behave and interact with each other. Stars were always a subject of fascination for humankind. In this game, we give you the chance to participate in their formation and organization into galaxies!

In Galaxies, you create newly forming stars in central nebulae by drafting stars from a bag. On your turn, you either draft from the bag, which represents intergalactic condensing matter, or select one of the nebulae and absorb it in your forming galaxy. By doing so, you place new stars in your galaxy in order to have the better composition and conformation. This allows you to optimize your victory points according to variable shared objectives that are common and visible to all players.

Will you be the one who creates the best galaxy according to the established universe rules in this captivating intergalactic endeavor?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: The Brigade: Bernhardt Blaze
description:
A new warden (centaur) available as a promo in 2017 and through the Kickstarter campaign.

Text from the card:
Allegiances: Until your next turn event cards do not effect blocks that are loyal to you.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Bretonnia
description:
Warhammer: Bretonnia is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Bretonnia faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Home from Oz
description:
Get ready for an adventure through the land of Oz. As you make your way home by following the Yellow Brick Road, you will encounter both friends and enemies. Beware the Winged Monkeys or the Fighting Trees that will try to keep you from reaching home. Gain protection from obstacles by befriending the Cowardly Lion, Tin Woodman, and Scarecrow. The Wicked Witch will try to stall your progress, but just as your friend Dorothy realized in her own journey through Oz, a simple bucket of water will get you back on your way. What happens when you encounter the Wizard or try to make your way through the Poppy Field? Find out when you get swept away by the tornado into this mystical land.

Home from Oz is a card game for 2-4 players, ages 8-adult.

Note: The expanded edition which goes up to 6 players is found here: Home from Oz: Expanded Starter Set

—description from the designer

name: OverBattle: The All War
description:
Wargaming 4X Refined! by Syther Gaming
Area control, tabletop space warfare... with a twist!!

Includes a unique utilization of cross-genre gaming mechanics generally un-used in wargaming such as drafting, engine building, worker placement and semi co-op components... all wrapped inside of a classic area-control wargame wrapper.

Visually stunning, 2 to 4 player gaming, with a 5th and 6th player via an expansion add-on.

All-new game mechanics such as zero-setup time, and brand new characters unlike anything in gaming that brings the story into the game and the game into the story in a brand new gaming way.

While you come to play "OverBattle: The All War" you leave with an experience that stays with you and drives an exciting level of replayability. Each game is unique and no two setups or experiences will ever be the same.

Over 1000+ pieces, Full color game mats and elements, 40xD12 & 4x D6 color specific dice, 4-Piece Modular Game mats at 30" x 72" total size via 4 sections (76cm X 183cm) for the full deployment, 30" x 36" for 1v1 play (76cm X 92cm). Modular system fits a standard US folding pop-up 6 foot table exactly.

Also utilizes the all-new, multi-tier / multi-dimensional 3D playing combat surface known as the "CASy: Combat Assault System".

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Economic, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement

name: Defiant Russia: Red Victory
description:
Red Victory is a 32 page expansion booklet for Defiant Russia that includes two countersheets of 180 .5" counters and three player aid cards.

Some of the included counters were previously released in the now out-of-print game Red Vengeance
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Elena of Avalor: Flight of the Jaquins
description:
Princess Elena and her friends have created a tricky treasure hunt to find out who is the most clever Jaquin in Avalor! Soar through the kingdom and collect all of the treasures first to win. It's a game of adventure and strategy!

This game offers 3 difficulty levels, each building off of the previous:
Level 1 (Ages 5+): Roll 2 dice and choose your destination. Be the first to collect the 6 different treasures plus 2 additional.
Level 2 (Ages 6+): Be the first to unlock all 4 characters, each of which give you special abilities.
Level 3 (Ages 7+): Earn three different keys by coming treasure, but watch out for Sudden Storm cards that take treasure away from everyone. You can also try to unlock characters, but there are one of each, so get them fast!

—description from the publisher

name: Escape Adventures: Von Basaren und Meisterdieben
description: Family friendly puzzle book in an oriental setting.

name: Money Maker
description:
Money Maker is a fun board game about creating money, debt and credit set in 16th century Amsterdam, the Golden Age of the Netherlands.
Every player is a commercial bank. It is your goal to end up as the richest bank of Amsterdam. You do this by earning as much money as you can. Luckily, you have an endless supply of credit to invest!

The game works like this:


Bid against your friends to acquire valuable companies.
The highest bidder is allowed to invest in the company using their bank credit.
Using the companies you invested in, produce consumption or production goods.
Sell the goods to the markets, earn money, and hopefully make a profit!
But be careful! The more credit is introduced into the economy, the more inflation will rise, causing fluctuating prices. You might not get the return you were counting on and cause a financial crisis...


—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, City Building, Economic, Nautical, Negotiation, Renaissance
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Bagan, the boardgame
description:
Bagan is a mystic place, in the heart of Myanmar. It is a place filled with thousands of towers and temples, as far as the eye can reach. It is one of the most intriguing places on earth! But in this area you can expect some devastating earthquakes.

The aim of the game is to build temples in the city of Bagan in order to collect the most points.
In the building school, you can train your builders to become a master or architect. This will make it easier for you to build the right building pieces, but you will not be able to use those builders to build on temple grounds.
A part of the game play is based on that other famous tower, the Hanoi tower. This means you can not build or move a large boulder on top of a smaller one.

A player's turn consists of:

The (re)placing of the builder(s) on temple grounds and in the building school.
Rolling the building dice or moving a building piece.
If the player has builders on the beginner's places in the building school: draw action cards.


Play continues until all the action cards have been used or until the Central Temple has been completed. Then, points are counted.

The higher the temple, the more points you get. Empty or hardly built-up temple grounds with only one building piece give you penalty points. The player with the highest score wins.

The game is a mixture of strategy, luck and tactics.
A lot of choices have to be made: Choose whether to train your workers, or let them build temples. Choose whether to build higher temples or more. Decide whether moving a boulder is a better choice than building one...

—description from the designer

name: Unstable Unicorns: Creature Master Unicorn Promo Card
description:
A Kickstarter Exclusive card to add to your Unstable Unicorns game! If you were a backer of one of Ramy Badie's (Unstable Games's) previous campaigns, this card was automatically included in your rewards as part of the "Runes & Regulations" campaign. It was also available as an add-on.

Card text:
Magical Unicorn card
"When this card enters your Stable, you may DISCARD 2 cards, then choose 2 Unicorn cards from the discard pile and add them to your hand."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Pocket Landship: Driver Danielson promo card
description:
Kickstarter exclusive promo card with the following unique one time use effect:

INTERCEPTED COMMS.:
Assign Enemy dice in any order
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Dicetopia: Crashing Waves
description:
Crashing Waves is the final expansion for Dicetopia that introduces a new unsettling dock area with three new locations adding more strategies and possibilities! Visit the Crashing Waves Stock Exchange to manipulate the value of dice resources. Break out a fellow thug from Cutthroat Prison for an extra turn and a stronger area control presence. Or drop by the Molotov Market to trade dice values!

You’ll also find more fishy factions, a rebalance of the original city board, as well as full support for an extra player, making Dicetopia go up to whopping 6 players together with the Roll with the Punches Expansion!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Laser Bots
description:
Spectators watch in awe as robots armed with laser cannons blast each other in vast arenas. Tactics and destruction rule, and only the best survive.

Laser Bots is a pocket sized game that comes in a mint tin. Players each control a robot via an innovative action management system: actions become more powerful depending on the amount of cards you have played.

There are four different robots, each with its own unique robot board and program cards. The program cards form part of your hand and are used to perform actions. Each turn players place their cards in their 'program row'; many actions become more powerful the more cards you have in your program row, so the order you play your cards can be the the key to victory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Nine Lives: Rogue-and-Write
description:
Nine Lives is a Rogue-Like Roll-and-Write Game

You are a Cat trying to explore a Dungeon. You only have Nine Lives to explore the Dungeon. Find treasure, upgrade your Cat, and explore the dungeon in order to earn the most points.

Players: 1 - 100+
Game Time: 20 minutes
Items needed: 6 six-sided dice, one of them being a different color than the other five and one “Nine Lives” sheet per player

Setup: Roll 2 d6 to determine the End Goals for the game, mark the End Goals with an X over the die symbol. (Re-roll if necessary until there are two different numbers)
All players will use the same Dungeon Map layout and End Goals. The game is played simultaneously, with players trying to earn the most points. All players will use the same dice pool for each roll, assigning however each player determines.

Gameplay:
Determine Starting Point - Roll 2 d6 that are different colors. Use the darker die for determining the columns and the lighter die for determining the rows. Find coordinating locations on the Dungeon Map. Choose one and mark an X on the Dungeon Map to show your starting point for this life. If a 6 is rolled on the die, it is a wild for that row or column, and you may choose any location while still following the other die rolled. If both dice are 6’s, you can start at any location on the map. Each player chooses their own starting point following these rules.

Choose a Cat - Choose a Cat by marking the number of this life in the corner for this run in the dungeon. For the first turn, use the Starter Cat. Following turns, you may choose any cat that has not yet been chosen. In a multiplayer game, each player can choose any Cat they would like for each life.

Roll 5 Dice - Roll 5 d6 for this Cat’s life in the dungeon.

Assign Dice - For each die, choose to either Upgrade a skill or Move the direction of the dice in the dungeon. Players simultaneously use the 5 dice rolled to move and/or upgrade.

Repeat these steps for each life of your Cat.

How Movement Works:
- Orthogonally (Up, Down, Right, Left; North, South, East, West)
- When you enter a new square/room, mark an X on it.
- Your next movement must always follow from the last X you marked this life.
- The die numbers correspond to the direction you may move; 1=North, 2=East, 3=South, 4=West, 5=North OR South, 6=East OR West
- You may only move into a square/room without an X. You may never retrace your steps or go onto a space that you have previously X’ed.
- If you enter a square/room with an icon that you have upgraded to, you earn a treasure. Mark an X over one of the Treasure. Each Treasure is worth 2 Victory Points.
- You may X squares/rooms that have icons you have not unlocked yet, you just will not earn that Treasure this game.
- There are “Upgrade Arrows” throughout the map. If you ever enter one of these spaces, you immediately mark the next X on any one Upgrade track

How Upgrading Works:
- There are four skill tracks to advance to upgrade your Cat throughout the game.
- Upgrade from left to right, marking an X in the leftmost empty square corresponding to the die.
- Once a square with an icon in it is X’ed, you now have that skill. When entering spaces in the Dungeon Map with that icon, you now earn Treasure.
- Once a skill track has been upgraded 9 times, you unlock a unique ability to use once during each Cat’s life.
- Upgrades remain for the entire game.

End of Game: After you have used your last Cat (9 lives), the game is over. Total your score. Each Treasure earned is worth 2 Victory Points. Earn corresponding Victory Points for each Upgrade unlocked (On each skill track, first unlock is 1 VP, second unlock is an additional 2 VP, third unlock is an additional 3 VP). Total your Victory Points for the two End Goals that were rolled during Setup. The player with the most Victory Points is the winner!

-description from designer

name: 4 хвоста.Гремучая пара
description:
The greyhound parade is a continuation of the story of fun pitons and friends living in jingles.

2 in 1: a stand-alone dueling game and an addition to the basic version to play big company! The dynamic game develops logical thinking, trains the oral score and perfectly raises the mood with the atmosphere of the wild jungle.

You will meet new heroes: pink mamba Pinky and Black Beck 's gremucca, treacherous hedgehogs of the Cactus family, fun rabbits and good friends, even more angry mosquitoes and a magic egg!

The GOAL of the game: to grow a python and identify, whose tail is longer?

Гремучая пара - это продолжение истории о веселых питонах и друзьях, живущих в ждунглях.

2 в 1: самостоятельная дуэльная игра и дополнение к базовой версии, чтобы играть большой компанией! Динамическая игра развивает логическое мышление, тренирует устный счет и отлично поднимает настроение атмосферой диких джунглей.

Вы повстречаете новых героев: розовую мамбу Пинки и гремучку Блэк Бэка, коварных ежей семейства Кактусовых, веселых кроликов и добрых друзей, еще больше злющих москитов и волшебное яйцо!

Задача игры: вырастить питона и выявить, чех хвост длинее?

name: First Contact: The Second Coming
description:
Angelic creatures descended from Heaven! Kings of the whole Europe joyfully welcome Aliens, and Сhurch declares them as envoys from the Paradise.
But there is one tiny trouble - marvelous creatures do not speak Latin! They do not understand either Arabic or Greek. However, they strongly want Brave Knights and Fair Maidens to travel with them to the stars.

Players are divided into medieval humans and aliens, who came with a friendly visit. Now they have to find a common language and decide which alien ships will go to the stars with humans onboard.

Players take turns: first one of humans, then one of the aliens, then again one of the earthlings, etc.
Humans use cards with medieval objects that are on the table or with already played cards from their hands and try to identify which symbols can aliens use to name objects.
Then one of the Aliens invites humans on the ship he has chosen for departure in this round by using symbolic description. The rest of Aliens are betting - where else can humans go by mistake.

The game continues until humans send all their representatives into space. The winner among Aliens is the one who have collected the highest amount of humans on their ships. The winner among humans is the one who sent more people into space and revealed most of the words from alien language, which are defined by his card of secret goal.

We tried to pay attention to all questions and suggestions from players in First Contact original game. So this time we made gameplay more diverse and deep, managed to solve the problem of active involvement of all players in each round, and in the end our game is more competitive now.

First contact: The Second Coming is compatible with the original game and you can still play this version with original rules.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Medieval, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Mixtape Massacre: Invasion Expansion
description: Fight back against monstrous invaders, a government cover-up, and old foes in this brand new expansion for Escape From Tall Oaks.

name: Moskva Bistro!(/Fast!), Oct-Dec41
description:
FAST simple family&friends point-to-point game about the Germans' last, desperate lunge at Moscow in late 1941 which proved to be (for them) their first strategic defeat on land.

Same system as for Barbarossa Fast! but with slightly more detail for the larger scale.

German side solitaire and team play (with the 3-piece map) - also playable with 2 player sides/teams. 7 turns taking 45-60 minutes to play.

Germans: 3 armies, 8 panzerkorps (parent units), 8 infantry korps, and 7 panzer divisions.

Russians: Play from a pool of 36 initially hidden-strength units.

Attrition - German losses - are possible in this (and maybe I'll retrofit them to BF, but maybe not).

As for BF, DICELESS ground combat - the hidden Russian units are heart-fatiguingly unpredictable enough.

Played on the actual 1:2,500,000 campaign map (corrected 1943-44) used by OberKommando Heeres for planning/plotting its campaign in Russia.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Стражи Галактики: Битва супергероев
description:
«Битва супергероев» — это карточная игра, в которой вы возьмёте на себя роли популярных героев вселенной Marvel. Вас ждёт грандиозное состязание: вспоминайте лучшие приёмы, готовьте ловушки и пользуйтесь суперспособностями. Последний оставшийся в бою объявляется победителем!

—description from the publisher

Стражи Галактики: Битва супергероев ("Guardians of the Galaxy: Superhero Battle") is a card game in which the players will take on the roles of world-known heroes from the Marvel universe. The great battle awaits: come up with the best stunts, set traps, and use your superpowers. The last one standing is the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Take That

name: Time Machine Rocket
description:
Time Machine Rocket is a fast, simple and fun card game. It has a great balance between strategy and luck, in addition to the possibility of interfering in the opponents' game.

The theme is inspired by time travel narratives that promote the unexpected encounter of figures from different eras. In short, the idea is to travel in time in search of forming the best team of historical personalities, bringing together figures such as Leonardo da Vinci and Bruce Lee.

In each turn, the player opens a card from the historic decks. She then decides whether to bring that character to her team, or to open a new card. If she opens a Rocket, she advances to the next deck. If she opens a character of the same type that she opened before, she now have to put that character on her team.

The game ends when a player forms a team of 5 characters, of 5 different types (Humanitarian, Military, Creative, Scientist and Explorer). The player sums up the numbers of each character, and the one with most points wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Houlala
description:
Small pocket game which could be a drinking game as its challenges lend themselves well to it. The game consists of series of cards with one task (counting from 0 to 20 or from 20 to 0) with one condition, e.g. for all the numbers of 5 letters say "bing" or if your number contains a T raises your fist, etc.
Players around the table each count in turn. If no one is wrong, add a new condition (to a maximum of four).
Players can choose to play together or to eliminate players who made a mistake.

—user summary

name: Investiture
description:
Go through the ranks in making yourself the greatest stock market trader the world has ever seen! Investiture is modeled after various stock markets around the world, enabling you to understand how transactions work and all the while grow rich. It combines the intensity of the stock market with the strategy to become rich and have fun! This game requires no prior knowledge of how stock markets work! Be careful, because your decisions will affect every other player in the market!

On a turn a player may buy a stock, short a stock, or sell a stock they currently own. They may also play one of the lucky break cards in their hand. They get 3 turns per round and after each player has taken 3 turns, one at a time, all the cards are thrown in the middle to reflect the price changes of the stock.

The game is won when the players have decided to end the game. We typically suggest 10 rounds for full gameplay. The player who has the highest value in terms of cash in hand and stock market value on the board is declared the winner!

name: Foul Play: Once Upon A Crime
description:
There's been a murder in Storybook Land! A Goodie has gone bad and it's up to you to swap, steal or search for the evidence, seek out the suspects and catch the culprit in order to scupper the other sleuths, and win this game of murder! Let's just hope your case doesn't go cold before revealing your solution (dramatically, of course) and catching the culprit! Case closed!

There’s more than one way to catch a killer though. So what’s it gonna be? Good Cop or Bad Cop? If you’re playing Good Cop you’re chasing down a specific killer, whereas Bad Cop you'll have to successfully frame any one of the eight suspects in order to win. Each way to play comes with its own set of rules and tactics, but will you use fair play or foul play? There's 8 new suspects but which of these fairy-tale felons committed the crime?

We've kept the same design for the backs of the cards as the 1st edition of the game. This means that you can combine decks, swap the special action cards around and even try and solve two murders at the same time! Want to separate the decks back again when you've finished? Don't panic - the font used for the titles on each action card is different to the original, helping you to tell which card belongs to what game!

name: Zerywia: Wholeater Expansion
description:
This Zerywia Board Game Expansion introduces the mighty dragon Wholeater. Try to slay the beast to retrieve legendary treasures, or make him your ally by fullfilling his missions. The expansion also brings a brand new Hero, unique Epic Feat cards and more new Saga cards for your adventures !

Components: 1 Wholeater Dragon miniature, 1 Hero miniature (Sovis), 2 Dragon Avatar cards, 4 Dragon Attack cards, 9 Dragon Mood cards, 3 Agenda cards, 7 Dragon Treasure cards, 13 Hero & Saga cards for Sovis, 5 Alternative Saga cards for Svara Hero, 8 Epic Feat cards, 3 New Saga cards , 1 Help card.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Storytelling

name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Hell on Earth
description: With Hellboy gone, the B.P.R.D. faces a range of horrifying new minions as the world descends into chaos. The Hell on Earth expansion introduces new minions to add to your missions. From swarming Crickets, to demons and Ogdru-Hem mutants, you’re going to wish you were only facing the Frog Monsters from the core game. This expansion includes 15 minion miniatures, the Nesting Site Case File and Encounter cards, plus all the minions can be mixed into existing missions using the previously released B.P.R.D. Archives expansion.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mafia the Party Game Deluxe Edition
description:
Mafia is a game of lying, bluffing, and deceit where players try to eliminate the other team from the game. There are two teams; Mafia and Civilians. The game is divided into two phases; night and day. The Civilians win if they eliminate all the Mafia players and the Mafia win if they equal or outnumber the Civilian players. Mafia is played with a Moderator. The Moderator guides the players through the night and day phases, keeping the game on track and keeping the players engaged.

Mafia Deluxe features 47 unique roles on 84 role cards, a moderator field guide, and quick start guide.
mechanics: Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deduction, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Player Judge, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Storytelling

name: Road Trip
description:
Road Trip is an 18 card solo game about a journey across the country. Find the most efficient route for your travels to make it the best road trip by arranging your 9 stops in geographical order (stop number) from left to right using Actions before your deck runs out.

Shuffle all 18 postcards together and set the Route by laying out a line of 9 face up going across the playing area. Set the remainder as the draw deck. Start your adventure by drawing three cards from the deck. Using the actions on the backs, play a card and adjust the Route accordingly. Then draw a new card to bring your hand back to three cards. Continue playing until you have rearranged the Route in order (win), or run out of cards in the deck (lose).

—description from the publisher

name: Saloon Showdown: Back in Town
description:
Back in town is an expansion for Saloon Showdown, that adds "skills" to all the characters in the game, for greater depth of gameplay and replayability!

The ranks of the gunslingers in the base game are also joined by the Sheriff and the Farrier, two very special characters. The Sheriff wears the real Sheriff's star, and makes extra bucks if she manages to keep it to herself. The Ferrier is a powerful character who can interrupt the game (almost) any time, by throwing his hammer to other players, in order to collect their bounties.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Real-Time, Variable Player Powers

name: Spirit Fire
description:
Spirit Fire is a non-linear, open-world board game system in which you explore compelling fantasy realms on an introspective journey of discovery, wonder, and mystery. Your choices matter, because instead of following a story, you ARE the story.

This is a substantive, emotionally-driven experience with aspirations beyond the expected iterations on tactical combat and standard gameplay. To emphasize this vision, there is no combat. Instead, this experience finds conflict, pressure, and suspense in the countless other types of difficult challenges life asks us to overcome, including the tensions we face deep within ourselves. In the world of Spirit Fire, wisdom is your only weapon.

The game’s system has two principal pieces: your character box, and realm boxes. With the first, you create your character, with whom you explore the open-world realm boxes. Across the realms, you tell your story in a campaign of your own creation, exploring where you want, pursuing the quests and ideals of your choosing, in an experience some have compared to an MMORPG (like World of Warcraft), but most agree defies easy classification.

Spirit Fire seeks to provide the greatest single player experience available, inspired by a love of TCGs, MMOs, rogue-lite-like loops, metroidvania map development and discovery, fantasy fiction, and—more than anything—a desire for something truly new and fresh.

You’ll explore a series of open-world maps, uncovering new locations and quests in worlds that evolve based on your discoveries and actions. As your character grows, you will craft your deck and bring it to bear against countless unique challenges in the game’s spiral bound book. Each quest or encounter card introduces variables that create a unique variation of one of the book’s dozens (and dozens) of challenge spreads, which vary wildly in style and function depending on the type of activity you are engaged in. Each challenge or activity you’re attempting (evading a threat, deciphering a lost language, negotiating with telepathic wolves, and so forth) recontextualizes your card play, giving you a constant stream of fresh opportunities for creative response without requiring you to learn a bunch of new mechanics all the time.

With drop-in / drop-out multiplayer (meaning seamless transitions between solo and cooperative play, if you’re a “never solo alone”-er), multiple open-world realms coming at launch (with many more in development), and a plan for a continuous stream of quest packs that can by played in any realm, Spirit Fire is a deeply customizable, on-going experience from the award-winning creators of Vindication and Unsettled.

What will you do, in this dark world, with the flame you carry?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Map Addition, Minimap Resolution, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Munchkin Warhammer: Age of Sigmar – Guts and Gory
description:
They say the third time's the charm, but in this third expansion of Munchkin Warhammer Age of Sigmar, there's precious little charm to be found . . .

The Gutbuster Mawtribe are obese, gluttonous, bloodthirsty ogors whose hunger for combat is as acute as their hunger for everything else. The Ossiarch Bonereapers are highly disciplined troops loyal to Nagash. You can serve them in life or serve them in death – they aren’t picky.

Contents: 112 cards in a tuckbox.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: F6F Hellcat
description:
26 July 1943, your squadron of Hellcats on the Belleau Wood carrier (CVL-24) have arrived in Pearl Harbor to take the war to the Japanese.

Armed with guns, rockets, and bombs, your job is to take control of the Pacific Islands overrun with Imperial Japanese. Take enough down and you can bring the battle to Mainland Japan and win the war.

Using the Gear Card System, you control your three flights of Hellcats and CVL-24 to shoot down Zeroes and bomb island bases. During that time, you must protect your carrier from Judy’s (Japanese Bombers) and Kamikaze pilots. If your carrier is sunk, it is game over.

You must maintain the right altitude to fire down the Zeroes and high-altitude bombers, while evading their attacks. Dive bombing enemy bases is also no easy task. Flak can bring you down in an instant. All the while, you must keep an eye on your fuel and the threatening sky.

Become an Ace by shooting down Zeroes and earn powerful Upgrades.

Make it through the day and lead the US Navy to victory in the Pacific!

-description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Etherfields: Awakened Items & Actions
description:
Originally available as part of Pack D from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A couple of new Actions and Items inspired by other games from the publisher.

Rules: To add these cards to the game, shuffle them into corresponding markets while setting up the game. They can be bought during the game using the normal rules.

Includes 5 cards:
Growing Crystals, Hibernation, Flick of Determination, A Great Wall, Menhir

name: Mini Meeple Melee
description:
"Big Battles, Tiny Tin!"

Mini Meeple Melee is a combat arena game you can carry anywhere! 2-4 players select from 6 unique classes and battle in 1 of 3 different modes to the death. You can fight in free-for-all fights, team matches, or boss battles. For such a small package, the battlefield is surprisingly modular. Select your terrain, place the crates and magic circles, and position the tins. Then you're ready to drop in and start brawling!

Each turn you can perform 2 actions. Basic actions include moving, resting, or taking cover. You can also use 1 of your characters unique skills, usually to attack your opponents.

This game is quick, fun, & simple. So it's great for anyone, anytime, anywhere!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
