name: Bridge City Poker: Promo Pack 1
description:
This is a 10 card Promo Pack, featuring 8 new Power Cards and 2 Blank “Create-Your-Own” Power Cards.

Power Cards Include:


Absorb
Gamble
Score
Multiply
Osmosis (Team Variant Card)
Ta-Da!
Detour
Steal Meld
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Melding and Splaying, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking, Variable Set-up

name: Dice Hospital: ER – Emergency Roll: VIPs Promo
description:
VIPs: Very Important Patients is a mini-expansion for Dice Hospital: ER - Emergency Roll. It gives every player a chance to score additional points by admitting an extra-special patient to their hospital and matching the VIP's specific preferences.

It is 6-card expansion included in the Dice Theme Park and Dice Hospital: ER - Emergency Roll Promo Pack #2.

name: Tablero di Berona
description:
Tablero di Berona is a quick-playing dice game for two players, with all the look and feel of a classic pub game. The game uses a simple 3x6 board, two dice, and twelve stacking pieces per player.

Players take turns rolling two dice. With each die, they may either place a new chip on that location in their home row, or move a stack from their home row if they already have a stack in that space. Movement is similar to games like Backgammon, Kalah (Mancala), Veritas, or Tak: a stack of chips is dropped one piece at a time, covering other stacks as it goes.

When either player runs out of options, the other player gets just one more turn, and then the winner is the player who captures the most points in the center.

-description from publisher's website

name: Jewels of Puerto Primo
description: A set collection game for 2-4 players. Players are pirates out to sell the most valuable jewelry to the self-crowned king of the Caribbean over the course of one year. Players assemble cards representing jewelry of seven different types with seven different gems. There are an assortment of bonuses to be earned when the jewelry is sold. The princess will pay for the number of pieces in the set (1 Real for 1 piece up to 21 Reals for 6 pieces). The queen will pay a bonus for three different types of either setting and/or gem that change each month. And the king pays for sets at the end of the year; his demands are revealed one-at-a-time at the beginning of each month. After a year of selling jewels to the family, if you can sail away with the most doubloons you win.

name: Make The Journey
description:
Make The Journey, a game where two players have to lead their own tourists. Find a vehicle that will lead them to their goal successfully.

How to win: Players who can spin or push tourist cards to meet a tuk-tuk gets 3 out of 4 tickets first is the winner.

How to play: Player can perform 1 of 3 Actions in the player's turn.
1. Rotate the tourist card 90 degrees in any direction.
2. Grab a tourist card. to the edge Top-bottom-left-right of the game and push another card slide into the game Change the location of tourists.
3. Rotate the vehicle card, tuk-tuk 90 degrees (only 1 time per game).

name: Tanks of August: Georgia 2008
description:
Tanks of August: Georgia 2008 is a two-player game of the conflict in Georgia and the two separatist entities of South Ossetia and Abkhazia during mid-August 2008. The Russian player is attempting to destabilize Georgia, destroy infrastructure and her armed forces, and render it unable to join NATO, thus leaving it as a “buffer zone,” as would happen in Ukraine during the next decade. By consolidating the separatist entities of South Ossetia and Abkhazia, Georgia would face a dilemma: recognize the independence of the two breakaway regions and try to join NATO or remain a “frozen conflict” and therefore unable to join NATO or the European Union in the foreseeable future.

Each game turn represents one day. The map scale is set at 10 km (6.2 miles) for each hex. Combat units are battalions with higher level headquarters providing additional capabilities. Air power and other supporting arms are abstracted using strike markers and events.

—description from the publisher

name: Drag Racing: The Dice Game Pro Stock & Pro Stock Motorcycle
description:
Welcome race fans and gaming enthusiasts to the world of pro-stock drag racing featuring factory hot rods and motorcycles. Drag racing is the ultimate extreme competitive sport where cars race over a short distance as a test of acceleration. This all results in a fast and exciting racing experience and in pro stock this is all performed on a straight quarter mile race track. Drag Racing: The Dice Game is an exciting and fast game that captures the competitive racing of professional pro stock drag racing right on your tabletop.

—description from the designer

name: Margraves of Valeria: Dragons Pack
description:
A four card pack that adds one Dragon per Lair. This pack is included in the Kickstarter version of the base game but is also available on the publisher's website.

The pack also includes a punchboard with ten Bounty tiles and a rules card:

During setup one Dragon card is placed above its respective Lair card (but underneath the regular monster cards).

During gameplay, if a Dragon card is revealed, two random Bounty tiles are placed face-up on that card. The first player to slay a Dragon earns the noted Influence and chooses one of the Bounty tiles to take as their Reward, but the Dragon stays in play. The second player to slay the Dragon earns the noted Influence and the remaining Bounty tile, then removes the Dragon card from the game.

Additionally a new Dragon Banner is introduced in the Bounty tiles. This Dragon Banner is scored at the end of the game as if it were a Banner Privilege tile and is a different Banner than those in the base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: Old Mage
description:
Welcome to Old Mage, the Spell Blasting Adventure game of Arcane Domination!

Explore ancient ruins, battle fierce monsters, invoke mighty spells and unleash powerful relics as you compete for the High Wizard’s throne. Terrible monsters and treacherous hazards await - yet none quite so terrible, nor so treacherous - as your arcane rivals!

Claim victory in one of two ways: Find the Master Orb and deliver it to a Mage Tower across the Great River ... or Destroy your foes with spell, steel and guile! But beware, Old Mages do not die quietly; they become Haunts that plague the living, or return as Undead Liches!

Is your sorcery strong enough, Old Mage?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Negotiation
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Interrupts, Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Imperial Settlers: IS vs EoTN
description:
Nine new cards for the common cards deck. Funny illustrations relate to the Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Save The Market
description:
Each player plays as a figurine collector who is looking to manipulate the market to ensure that their figurines are the most valuable.

Each round players will simultaneously select a figurine from their collection to add to the market (which is a pyramid). In market order they will place the figures into the market, if they can be played legally as there are some restrictions on placement.

The round continues until the market is full and points are scored for figures left in a player's collection based on the position in the market. Play continues for 3 rounds with the player with the most points at the end winning.

name: Pop!
description:
Up the ante in Pop!, a trick-taking card game for two. Players will have cards in hand as well as display cards that are visible to their opponent. Manage wild jokers, jacks that jump rank, and a slew of unknown cards. Bluff and bully your way to victory much faster with strategic use of the pop cube.

Each round, players will try to win the majority of tricks. Whoever captures four or more tricks wins the top prize. The total value of the top prize can go up as players pop the scoring cube. Each pop raises the top prize one point. Don't feel like you can win the round? Manage to capture three tricks and still win the consolation prize. Does even three tricks seem impossible? Fold before the score escalates too much and end the round immediately.

—description from the publisher

name: Lumberjacks with Rocket Launchers
description:
A fast-paced, take-that card game about exactly what you think: Lumberjacks with Rocket Launchers!

Rocket cards enter play and orbit the table, always pointed at one of the player-loggers. Some cards eliminate or modify Rockets in play, others spell the arrival of Rocket Time, when any player with three Rockets aimed at them is blown up and eliminated before any unexploded Rockets streak to menace the next player.

The last lumberjack standing is the winner!

—description from the publisher

name: Spearmint Valley
description:
Spearmint Valley is a 1-3 player cooperative game about farming, friendship, and community. To win the game, players must complete a set of random goals in addition to forming friendships with revealed friend cards.

Completing the goals and making friendships will require collecting resources from farming, fishing, mining, and fighting slimes. Resources can also be spent to craft items or build buildings for passive benefits.

The game takes place over 3 years with each turn representing a season. New friend cards will be revealed at the start of each year, and they will restrict actions that players can perform during different seasons of the year.

Managing time and planning actions to perform each turn is critical to winning Spearmint Valley.

—description from the publisher

name: Lacrimosa: Promo 1
description:
This is a promo expansion released as part of the 2023 Support the Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign. This expansion adds six Salieri cards to be added in to the period deck. The Salieri cards will impact the market of available cards by either occupying a spot in the market or wiping all available cards in the market back into the period deck.

Salieri was a contemporary of Mozart. Their relationship is unclear: some people say that they were rivals,
others say that they barely even met. Nevertheless, each of them was very influential in their time.

Setup: Shuffle the Salieri cards and add 1 of them to each period deck, along with the Opus and Memory cards. Discard the 6th Salieri card without looking at it.

Playing the Game: When one of the Salieri cards appears in the row of cards do the following, depending on the type of card


Empty Music Stand: If this card appears, each player immediately takes 1 Story Point counter of their choice. This card cannot be bought, and it will remain in the row until the Maintenance Phase. Then discard this card.



Salieri: If this card appears, shuffle all the cards currently visible in the row of cards and place them back at the bottom of the current period deck (right above the next Period Bonus tile in the deck). Then discard this card and refill the row with new cards.

name: Silent Hunter 1941-43
description:
You are a German submarine commander, going on a hunt for Allied ships at the beginning of 1941. In next few years you have to sink as many ships as you can, scoring enough tonnage to win the game.

Components:
54 cards with variable usage. Cards are split into: Air Attacks, Ships and Escorts. Ships can come into three different sizes with different tonnage as: Small Freighter, Medium Freighter and Large Tanker.
Escorts come into three different types: Green, Trained and Veteran Escort. Escort ships also are marked with a big letter E on the top right edge of a card.

Game objective:
Play 2 patrols per month (each month is split into 15 days period, or two weeks), sink ships and record their tonnage, until the end of December of 1943, if you survive that long. Depending on the tonnage.

you sank you will either achieve total victory, some kind of consolation victory or total defeat. Dying in this game is considered a defeat.

Sequence of Play:
You are doing one patrol per 15 days (half of the month), starting from January of 1941.
Each patrol is consistent of encounters. Number of encounters depends on you, but the type is always random.
Your Patrol starts by drawing one card and using its Encounter value.

– If its an Air Attack! You will not have an option to react or do any action. Draw one card to see how many depth charges airplane has used to hit you, then draw that much cards for damage. Then, if you are not sunk by that attack, decide to either return to base or have another encounter.
– If its a Group encounter, first draw a card to establish a time of day and weather (using both icons in a row from that card) and then draw number of random ships to form a group and continue to battle phase. Same thing is done for a Convoy encounter, but you must form a specific group of ships and escorts.
– Battle phase – torpedo attack – may have up to 2 rounds
– Before starting with a torpedo attack you may use an action called WAIT. If you are not satisfied with a current day of time and weather, you may replace that card with the new one from the top of the deck. You have to keep the new card and you can only perform this action once per battle phase.
– You may also decide to DISENGAGE and skip the battle phase after you have form a group of ships. But, you can do this only once per Patrol! If you do it again you must return to base immediately, ending a patrol for that month.
– To attack ships chose your targets and then depending on the weather you my fire up to 6 or up to 8 torpedoes by drawing cards from a deck and placing them face down in a column, under your targeted ships. You may split number of fired torpedoes per target as you wish, you may also decide not to fire a full complement. You my fire at multiple targets of your choice.

Marking your tonnage and time passage You can either use a chart provided with the game or keep a diary in a RPG style of writing. In both cases you must mark that half of a month has passed and write down your tonnage you manage to score from your patrol.

If your submarine had 4 to 5 damage, you must skip half of a month before going to another patrol. If you manage to survive whole three years (1941-1943), summarize all tonnage and consult the chart below to see how did you do.

-description from designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pędzące żółwie Extreme
description:
Turtles are again rushing in the race to the lettuce, but this time it will be extremely difficult. Up to 6 turtles, or 6 players, will be racing!
The route is longer and full of unexpected surprises prepared by malicious moles. The turtles will also have to cross a river and avoid a fox lurking in the bushes!

And that's not the end of the surprises - the game also includes special extras: a black turtle, a black raven and cards that will allow players to activate turbo mode and disrupt their opponents' plans.
So it's a race full of lurking dangers and amazing twists!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Racing

name: 1-48Combat
description:
Squad-level tactical WWII miniatures skirmish game. Units are individual soldiers, and the rules support up to company-level actions.

The initial release will consist of 12 different unpainted 32mm miniatures representing soldiers from the German and Russian armies at Stalingrad. Each piece will be individually packaged with its own stats card, game tokens, and a resin scenic piece. The unique scenic base can be used as cover in the game, but the pieces also fit into it, turning each soldier into a mini-diorama as well.

Measurements are in generic units, so the rules are suitable for any scale, and can be downloaded free from the company's website at for use with other WWII miniatures.

Rules for larger forces, multiplayer games and armoured support are in development.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Set Collection, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Lisbon Tram 28: One Way Promo Cards
description:
Expand your "Lisbon Tram 28" game with these 4 new special places to visit:

Card #1 - Sta. Justa
Card #2 - Bica
Card #3 - Lavra
Card #4 - Glória

Available in Pack Bard from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Marvel Dice Masters: Spider-Allies Promo Cards
description:
This promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters contains three cards:


Luke Cage: Power Man (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man)
Gwen Stacy: Spider-Ally
Mary Jane: Spider-Ally


All three cards use the dice from Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Order Battletome – Cities of Sigmar
description:
The Cities of Sigmar are blazing strongholds of light and hope amidst the deadly wilds of the Mortal Realms.

Battletome: Cities of Sigmar is your guide to the mightiest bastions of Order in the mortal realms – and the grand armies of humans, aelves and duardins that bravely fight to defend them. Inside, you'll discover just what life is like for the Mortal Realms’ “ordinary” inhabitants – the countless sub-cultures, guilds and tribal groups that band together to fight for Sigmar and the pantheon of Order. Rich art, lore and seven short stories penned by renowned Black Library author Josh Reynolds bring the world of the Cities of Sigmar to life.

Meanwhile, a vast set of allegiance abilities and faction rules allow you to field powerful combined forces of Order units themed around the seven most famous Cities of Sigmar. Perhaps you’ll harness the myriad war machines of the Greywater Fastness, or field a rapid-strike force from Tempest’s Eye – the choice is yours, and with warscroll battalions, artefacts and dozens of warscrolls to choose from, the possibilities are endless. What’s more, you'll find loads of top painting tips, colour schemes, bespoke missions, Path to Glory rules and more – this is the ultimate resource for any Cities of Sigmar collector!

This 128-page hardback book contains:

A history of how the Cities of Sigmar were founded, including guides to the seven greatest metropolises in the realms
Seven thrilling stories penned by renowned Black Library author Josh Reynolds
Tips for collecting Cities of Sigmar Citadel miniatures and rules that allow you to fight battles with them on the tabletop
54 warscrolls representing the citizenry of the Cities of Sigmar * humans, aelves and duardin alike
Allegiance abilities that bestow a wide selection of battle traits, command traits, artefacts of power and unique spell lores upon your Cities of Sigmar collection
A battleplan representing the heroic efforts of a Cities of Sigmar army to relieve an ally besieged by the forces of darkness
Rules themed around the seven most famous Cities of Sigmar, as well as a powerful warscroll battalion for each city


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Museum: The Historians
description:
The historians will allow you to commit objects to be studied, temporarily removing them from play. This object will then need to be moved along the research track. However, the pursuit of knowledge isn't' free, and to fund your research, you'll have to pay with Prestige Points.

Once the object reaches the end of the track, your Historian will have unlocked all of its secrets. This will earn you an Expertise Emblem, either from the Object's Civilisation or Domain. At the end of the game, any collections of the corresponding Civilisation or Domain that you score will be worth additional points.

name: Adowa: End of an African Dream
description:
Adowa was the first big defeat of an European power in Africa. Ethiopian Emperor Menelik II managed to defeat an Italian army through a combination of bravery, deficiencies in the Italian chain of command, and well exploited chances during the battle.The Italian Army fielded Italian infantry battalions, veteran Ascari battalions, and less experienced native units like Oculè-Cusai bands and mobile militia.

The Ethiopian Army was made of provincial armies made up of feudal militia and led by a Ras (Warlord).

This battalion level game comes with:

a map, 216 counters, player aid cards and rules booklet
map, counters and setup rules for Dogali, a scenario for the Ascari game previously published by ACIES.


Will you be able to continue the Italian African Dream by managing your Generals or will you suffer an utter defest? Will you win the day thanks to St George or loose the throne and the Empire?

name: Misión Chungungo
description:
Lead an expedition through space in search of copper, a valuable metal belonging to a civilization lost eons ago.
Players will have to make strategic decisions to earn crew members and copper pieces, but be careful! That the others will also form powerful teams to collect copper and win.
In Misión Chungungo players fight to achieve the goal (according to the number of players) of coppers to be the winner.
At the beginning of the game, an asteroid field is prepared on which you will interact throughout the game with your player tokens, and from which you will obtain copper.
On their turn, players discard a card and perform the action immediately, then their turn ends. On the other hand, the player may not discard cards from his hand to return all cards from the discard to his hand and then end his turn.
The actions are: a) Quantum leaps, allows you to move between the cards of the asteroid field, b) dig, allows you to take cards from the asteroid field into your hand, it is the main way to obtain copper, c) attract asteroids, take 2 cards from the asteroid deck and add them to the asteroid field, adjacent to other asteroid cards, d) shooting, allows you to shoot at other players drawing cards from their hand as a result.

The game ends when a player collects the goal of copper pieces from all his cards, according to the number of players, to be the winner.

Spanish--
Lídera una expedición por el espacio en busca de cobre, un valioso metal perteneciente a una civilización perdida hace eones.
Los jugadores tendrán que tomar decisiones estratégicas para ganar tripulantes y piezas de cobre, ¡pero cuidado! Que los demás también formarán poderosos equipos para reunir cobre y ganar.
En Misión Chungungo los jugadores luchan por conseguir la meta (de acuerdo al número de jugadores) de cobres para ser el ganador.
Al comienzo del juego se prepara un campo de asteroides sobre el que interactuarán durante toda la partida con sus fichas de jugador, y del que obtendrán cobre.
En su turno los jugadores descartan una carta y realizan la acción inmediatamente, luego termina su turno. Por otro lado, el jugador puede no descartar cartas de su mano para recuperar todas las cartas del descarte a su mano y luego terminar su turno.
Las acciones son: a) Saltos cuánticos, permite moverse entre las cartas del campo de asteroides, b) excavar, permite tomar a la mano cartas del campo de asteroides, es el principal modo de obtener cobre, c) atraer asteroides, toma 2 cartas del mazo de asteroides y las añades al campo de asteroides, adyacente a otras cartas de asteroide, d) disparos, permite disparar a otros jugadores robando cartas de su mano como resultado.
El juego termina cuando un jugador colecciona entre todas sus cartas la meta de piezas de cobre, según el número de jugadores, para ser el ganador.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Carrion Lancers – Unit Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Crush your enemies with the Runewars Miniatures Game: Carrion Lancers – Unit Expansion. The expansion features two Carrion Lancer Plastic Figures, one brand new and terrifying sculpt, and the other identical to the core set version, to expand your legions of the undead. The expansion also features eight new upgrade cards to improve your armies, no matter to which faction you declare allegiance.

name: Kriegspiel
description:
Invented in 1899 by Henry Michael Temple, this chess variant is played by 2 players but requires a third person to act as an umpire. Essentially, players only know the positions of their own pieces and have to make inferences based on what the umpire tells them (for example, that a move is impossible, or a capture has been made on a specific square).

According to The Encyclopedia of Chess Variants (D.B. Pritchard, 1994) alternative names are Screen Chess, War-Chess and Commando Chess.

David Li's book Kriegspiel: Chess Under Uncertainty (1994) provides a set of rules and some sample games.

name: Dunkirk: The Battle of France
description:
In "Dunkirk" German, Dutch, Belgian, French and British units fight it out on a 30 inch by 30 inch mounted map displaying from Southern London to Western Germany.

Four scenarios included:

Introductory - Germans must hold two key French cities for two consecutive turns.
Advanced -- Brings more realism.
Shortened -- Omits the side-show in the Netherlands.
Fortress Holland -- Maximum challenge.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Alpha Hunter Expansion Pack
description:
The Hirogen are a nomadic race of predators always looking for worthy prey. The Alpha Hunter is a Hirogen warship, or hunting vessel, and is typically manned by a crew of two Hirogen, an Alpha and a Beta. These vessels are well armed with a variety of weapons, including a subncleonic beam weapon which can scan an enemy ship and leave it disabled. These ships also have a monotanium armor plating which makes them difficult to target.
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Castle Crush! Cubes & Cards
description:
Guard your treasures! Kidnap foreign royalty! Bring honor to your family! In the first expansion for Castle Crush!, in addition to destroying enemy castles, looting and kidnapping present new challenges to the players. Additionally, family members of each kingdom's royalty can step out and fight for each kingdom's honor and victory!

With the Castle Crush! Cubes & Cards expansion, players have special scoring depending on the family cards they gain, and they can use new blocks to diversify the world of Castle Crush!

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: The Book of the Hybrids
description:
The Book of the Hybrids is a special eleventh chapter of the Apocrypha Adventure Card Game.

It's composed of nine missions, each of which uses two chapters. You'll need the boxes containing both chapters to play each mission.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Glyph
description:
Glyph is a card game system designed to be able to play an enormous variety of games and take up a small amount of space. The deck of 98 cards can be whittled down to a standard 52-card deck to play all the classics, though it contains 6 full standard suits and plenty more, including story suits for storytelling games (with images), 3 colored suits, and 6 minor elemental suits that have no problem sharing their cards with other elemental suits.

The cards are orientation-dependent, so the properties they take on will differ depending on whether they are played right-side-up or upside-down.

In addition to playing some of your favorite card games, you can use the deck to create new games. The different types of suits can be played separately or mixed and matched for tons of unique gameplay possibilities.

Some of the ways the cards can be organized are:

- Six suits (HEARTS, CROSSES, CLOVERS, TOADSTOOLS, DIAMONDS, and HORNS) numbered 0-14. Aces, Jacks, Queens, and Kings are further marked for use in a standard deck.

- Three suits (RED, BLUE, and GREEN) numbered 0-29.

- Two full sets of six suits (EARTH, FIRE, WATER, AIR, MAGIC, and ALCHEMY), numbered 2-9 plus the additional classes ACE, APPRENTICE, MAGICIAN, and WIZARD. These suits come 1, 2, or 3 to a card.

- Five story suits (WILD, ITEM, EVENT, CHARACTER, and LOCATION). Each card in the deck has a different image that can be used in creative and storytelling games.

The deck also contains 8 wild cards that can be organized by color (making 4 groups of 2) or by layout (making 2 groups of 4).
categories: Card Game, Game System, Print & Play

name: Joust for Fun
description:
Welcome to the zany world of Joust for Fun! To begin, gather your pun-riddled Knights, Yetis, Self-Rescuing Princesses, Luchadores, that ‘dude riding a giraffe’ (and many more)! On your turn, empower yourself with Court Cards that provide special abilities and then joust for FAN-tastic rewards!

The combat system of Joust for Fun combines elements of deduction, bluffing, and choice of how much damage you wish to inflict. The in-depth battle system allows you to strike with deceptively simple 1-5 valued combat cards! Just choose your attack wisely, if you aim to do (4) damage, and the opponent blocks with a (4), you’ll do no damage and gain no Fans!

Joust for Fun is a complete strategy game that runs for about 20 minutes. In regular games, Joust for Fun lasts until a player collects 12 Fans (but you can also play the special royal decrees and scenario guided Jousts, wherein the victory condition changes and you may spend Fans for incredible bonuses)!

Meet new friends like Sir Cumference of the Round Table, Dread Pirate Roberta, Sir Lances too Much, Lady Dun Waiting and Joust for Fun!

—description from the publisher

name: Who did it?: Kangaroo Promo Cards
description:
A package of promotional cards given out at SPIEL in Essen at the Blue Orange booth in 2018.

Six additional cards showing a kangaroo in each of the original player colors to add more variety while finding out who left the pile of poo in the living room.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: MadJack
description:
MadJack is a trick-taking game for two players that has two phases. During the first phase, players juggle capturing tricks and building their hand for the second phase. For the second phase of the game, players have the opportunity to capture Prize Cards that will be a huge help in winning the round.

Be wary of the wily Jacks. They will change rank depending on the card that leads the trick or the Prize Card that is up for grabs during the second phase. The player who wins the most cards during the round earns points, and the first person to earn 10 points wins the game.

name: Victory at Sea: Age of Dreadnoughts
description: Based on the Victory at Sea: World War II Naval Combat Game WWII game (core game design by Matthew Sprange) Age of Dreadnoughts is an all new set of rules and fleet lists for pre-dreadnought and WWI naval combat. Besides basic fire and movement rules formation fighting, destroyer flotillas, and even poor compartmentalization are detailed as well as other other rules simulating naval combat at the beginning of the 20th century.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Luna Llena: Death Moon
description: Expansion to Luna Llena. Including 6 new pack cards for the Werewolf player, 3 new hexagons, a "chainsaw" special item and 15 special abilities distributed randomly to all characters at the beginning of the game for being used once in the game.

name: Strategy of War
description:
Strategy of War is a turn-based card game that pits players against one another in pursuit of victory on the field of battle.

You command the forces of Aircraft, Infantry, Warship, Armor, and Politics as a military force of destruction.

You can use each of these divisions independently or combine them to create a formidable military force. You’ll have many assets at your disposal, including Units, Leaders, Attachments, and other tactics. You build a customized deck of 50 cards that utilize the powers of force and diplomacy all in an attempt to be the final Commander on the battlefield.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Net Results Soccer
description:
Net Results Soccer is an individual player based game that tries to incorporate everything that happens in a football/soccer game into the cards. Pretty much every result is taken off of the player cards.

Each position player is rated for goal scoring, shooting, possession, passing, defense, fouls, cards, offsides and endurance.Each keeper is rated for saves, passing and cards.

The game is triggered by results on the player cards through five dice - two 10-sided dice, one 20-sided die and two 8-sided dice. The only extra chart there is concerns special plays like corner kicks and direct kicks and those charts will be memorized within a game or two.

name: Kekionga!: A Dark and Bloody Battleground 1790.
description:
The struggle for the Old Northwest Territory (what would become the states of Ohio, Indiana, Illinois, Michigan and Wisconsin) was terribly violent. Massacres and atrocities seemed to follow one upon the other and in 1790 the new US Government authorized its first war against the Native Americans for control of the region. A force of US regulars and militia from Kentucky, Ohio and Pennsylvania gathered at Cincinnati and drove on the Miami’s main settlement of Kekionga. The resulting fight was a horrendous defeat of the US force, and ushered in a new and more violent phase of this struggle. Can you do better?

—description from the publisher

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Drums of War
description:
The time has come to prepare for battle, as Upper Deck Entertainment Introduces World of Warcraft "Drums of War- PVP Battle Decks

The thundering drums of war echo throughout the land of Kalimdor. New warlords ride through the gates of Orgrimmar, eager to serve the warchief and leave their marks on the pages of history.
Small battalions of Alliance soldiers arrive at outposts throughout Azeroth.
They solidify their footholds in contested areas as marshals draw up strategies to defend their territories and press any aggressors who foolishly cross their paths.
It is only a matter of time until the piercing battle cries, roaring magic, and crashing steel evoke the symphony of war once again.

When the dust settles, will you be remembered, or will you fade into oblivion?

Call to Arms!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: The City of Kings: Grimnir Costume Promo
description:
A promotional card originally given out during the 2018 ManvsMeeple Kickstarter campaign.

This promo introduces a new equipment card to the game and is part of the 'Costume Pack' of promotional cards.

Equiping this item will increase both attack and heal, along with health and worker movement making it a truly multi-role item.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Phantom: Treasures of Drakon
description:
The Phantom: Treasures of Drakon is a character driven race through a temple to hoard treasure to save them from the sinking island.

You will encounter hidden traps, sacred rooms and of course your nemesis.

Players use available action points to plan their way through the temple. Your hand of cards can aid your plans to steal items from other players, move faster or down hidden routes, avoid traps.

Each player has a custom dice, player board, unique player power and mini to move around the board.

The competitive game is won by accumulating the most Victory Points, and the game ends at a pre-determined amount of rounds organised at the start. The rounds are arranged in the form of a comic strip. There are also co-operative and solo game modes.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Pocket Paragons: Rivals of Aether
description:
Each player chooses a paragon and takes their deck of 7 unique cards. Every turn, players choose a card from their hand and play them simultaneously. Both cards are revealed and then characters either take damage, have their card canceled and sent back to their hand, or are defeated. Play the right card at the right time and have a strong read of your opponent's intentions to win!

This box features 6 characters from the world of Rivals of Aether. Featuring Zetterburn, Orcane, Kragg, Wrastor, Clairen, Ranno. Characters in this box feature an additional special move instead of a block ability. Use your additional ability to control your opponents!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Maharaja: Kickstarter Exclusive Contents
description:
Two punchboards and a rules sheet included with Kickstarter pledges, outside the game box, containing tiles not included with the retail version of the game. These include:


4 Final Scoring Tiles
4 Character Tiles
4 Special Rule Tiles
2 Reward Tiles

name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game – Spell of Separation
description:
Adds Evil Horde Faction.
6 new characters, 10 dice, 15 soldiers.
Path of Destiny Quest,
137 cards

name: Hábitat Espacial
description:
A “hard sci-fi” game about space colonization where players will be settling planets and moons of the Solar System in a not-so-distant future. Those will be of different types, ranging from orbital to subterranean ones. The different types of colonies will provide different resources, such as materials for self-replication (MAT), energy (NRG) or organic-life support (H2O), and each will adjust better or worst to the parameters of Gravity (G°), Pressure (P°), Radiation (R°) and Temperature (T°) depicted for each location.

As the game progresses, players will be building a network of colonies that will provide these resources to the joint colonization effort (for a price). Players will also be able to contribute in major shared projects, such as the terraforming of Mars. When a certain number of colonies are established the game will end, and the player having the most influence in the now-populated Solar System (acquired by leading the many logistical and technical endeavors) will emerge as the leader of the new Solar Federation.

The game uses a time/cost turn order track similar to "In the Year of the Dragon" or "Thebes", where players performing a more demanding action will be pushed back farther in the turn order track, while the player in-turn will always be the one ahead in the track.

Another distinctive element of the game is the shared nature of the resources, as every player can use technologies, colonies and their resources output, belonging to other players, to boost their own colonization plan. This is done for a price, as “lending” these assets advances its controller in the turn track.

The educational aspect of the game comes from the realistic depiction of the different environments in space, the theoretical technological and logistical steps required to settle them, and a number of “flavor data” notes scattered throughout the game board.
categories: Educational, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Counterplays
description:
Counterplays is a tile-stacking game that uses hexiamond-shaped tiles. A hexiamond is a piece composed of six congruent equilateral triangles, connected along their edges. There are 12 different hexiamonds. The game title is composed of them all (special thanks to Nathan Morse for this).

Counterplays is a brother game of SEVEN, Pent-Up and Stack-22, by the same designer. Players alternate turns placing one of their tiles according to some simple rules, trying to get the most of their pieces on the topmost layers when the game ends.

Note that some of the tiles are not symmetric, and can be placed either side up.

name: Blackstone Castle
description:
The realm of Westarland is in turmoil. In the wake collapse of the Permon empire, the power vacuum has left nations scrambling to exert local control. Some previously minor kings now aspire to the dragon-skull throne of Westarland.

The Kingdom of Avondell is embroiled in all this political confusion. The King and his council of advisors, based in Blackstone Castle, are struggling to establish secure borders with the neighboring kingdoms of Hanshore, Magdar, and Grambling. To that end, the king employs emissaries, scouts, captains, and even spies to carry out his political machinations.

Overview and Objective of the King’s Quest Game
You play as a courtier in the King’s court manipulating vassals to carry out the King’s political goals. Take actions to increase your influence with various knights and wizards in the court who can help you carry out the King’s political goals. Even gain influence with the King.

Use your knights and wizards to shift, swap, flip, retain, and guard vassal cards on the board. Ultimately, you must accumulate 21 or more Victory Points to win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Recognition, Variable Player Powers

name: Alewood
description:
ALEWOOD is a Wild West party game where your pint is your pistol! An inclusive and accessible card game that changes your strategy as you sip your pint - silliness required, alcohol is optional. Drinking is never used as punishment so enjoy your beverage of choice while you build reputations, act out hilarious card prompts and enter dangerous shootouts!

Outlaws have overrun the town of Alewood holding its citizens in a grip of terror. But when the citizens learn about the bounty on each outlaw's head... they "heroically" spring into action, banding together to take back their home! Sharing the danger but never the glory... nor the bounty.

In Alewood, your pint in your pistol. Drink to alter your shooting speed, play skill cards to forge your reputation and discard your hand to unleash a barrage of bullets and capture multiple outlaws. But watch out! These outlaws won't go down without a fight. Surprise attacks and unique abilities will keep each game unpredictable and competitive. Your fellow players can also play hinder cards onto you. Tarnishing your reputation and giving you outlandish prompts to perform during the game. If you fail to perform your hinders, you will be forced to discard - effectively making it harder for you to capture outlaws during shootouts.

WITNESS your reputation change throughout the game!

WATCH your friends act ridiculous just to keep their cards!

PUNISH your opponents for not acting silly enough!

GAIN permanent upgrades when you finish your pint. Never drink as a punishment!

Justice will be served through the wicked deeds of good people.
categories: American West, Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Freaks: The Violet Morass
description:
Ever since the oh-so-bureaucratic Magiss Empire purchased the rights to Space Freaks’ 35th season, viewers have noticed a number of… reforms. The irreplaceable Arena-Master has been… well… replaced. His head has been removed and we now find a Level 7 Functionary serving as Myron’s personal megaphone…

Level 7 Funticonary: “After careful observation of last year’s epic confrontations, I have re-aligned the confluence of strategic craft and command in battle, so that they may culminate in new, metaphysical experiences…”

Myron Musclehead: “YOU’VE re-aligned? This show is mine! ALL MINE!!”

With Space Freaks: The Violet Morass, discover two new arenas buried amongst the deadly thickets and perilous waters of the planet Azorax 5.

Mow down everything in your path as you claim new territory. Erect your corporate flag over a Neutral Base and score victory points each turn. Revel in the amazing combinations of new head- and body parts. Create Freak upgrades in laboratories to propel your Freaks to the next lethal level. Outwit your opponents by integrating new equipment into your game tactics. Be on the lookout for any tricks up the new Arena Master’s sleeve.

Staying in Myron’s favor may even allow you to modify the laws of Space Freaks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Sine Tempore: Pets pack
description:
During certain missions, the Sine Tempore heroes will come across various indigenous alien species. In some cases, they will be able to make friends with some of the animals. These may appear to be relatively docile, but with a bit of proper training they can become valuable sidekicks. To receive the pets, the first thing you need to do is make one of the Genesis rooms into a zoo.

Generally speaking, pets give their owners new and exclusive skills. A pet assigned to a hero can never change owner and will be removed from the game when the hero abandons the mission. If a hero dies, his or her pet will leave the Genesis forever. Most crew members can only have one pet. The zoo can be improved to hold multiple pets. In this case, a hero can own multiple animals, although they can only bring one into battle.

Content: 1 Brawler, 1 Krabnock, 1 Gorous, 3 Petc cards.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlefield Evolution: World at War – World War Two Miniatures Rules 1944-1945
description:
Battlefield Evolution: World at War is a complete stand-alone rulebook in the Battlefield Evolution miniature game series, set in the late part of the European Theater of WWII.

The 160 page book includes scenarios and army lists for the major forces involved in this theater (American, British, German, Soviet). The lists include infantry, paratroopers, and armored units, as well as aircraft.

The rules allow you to use whatever 20-28mm miniatures with 1/72 scale being the recommended choice by Matthew Sprange, the Battlefield Evolution system's designer.

The rules are easy to learn and fast-paced. The game has a built in "Reaction System" which allows you to react to your opponent's nearby "Move" or "Shoot Actions." No more sitting around staring at the wall during your opponent's turn.

Easy as the rules are, they allow for great tactical flexibility, and will require critical decision making at every turn.

The World at War rules are fully compatible with the future of the Battlefield Evolution line, including the forthcoming Battlefield Evolution: Modern Combat, due later this year.

Details direct from Mongoose Publishing:

"Using the latest generation of the fast-playing Battlefield Evolution rules, this is the action-packed rulebook that brings World War II to your tabletop.

Battlefield Evolution: World at War is a portal into World War II, providing everything you need to stage small firefights in far flung villages, or massive confrontations involving massed infantry, armour and air units, as the struggle for territory reaches a fever pitch.

The main rulebook covers Late War armies in the European theatre, with future expansions introducing new campaigns and different armies. In this mighty hardback, you will find army lists for;

British Army Infantry
British Army Paratroopers
British Army Commandos
German Wehrmacht Grenadiers and Panzergrenadiers
German Waffen-SS
German Fallschirmjäger
Soviet Infantry and Motor Rifles
Soviet Tank Desant
United States Infantry and Armoured Infantry
United States Paratroopers

Battlefield Evolution: World at War is designed for 20-28mm miniatures, and 1/72 scale models. The rulebook includes complete army lists, advanced rules, scenarios and a unique Engagements system allowing you to create your own missions.

This game is fully compatible with the rest of the Battlefield Evolution line, and hobbyists and publishers alike will have a chance to produce their own material for the game, through the introduction of an Open Content licence."

name: Bowie
description:
Bowie is a game best suited for 3 to 4 players. Each player will play David Bowie, or more accurately, a persona of David Bowie. The object of the game is to achieve the greatest legacy of any Bowie and survive the 1970’s. Legacy is judged by points earned from cutting records(flat, black, round- oh, nevermind). There is one slight problem. The Bowies are endangered by various threats, dark princes, and figures of the occult (which is in no way related to the copious amount of cocaine being inhaled by our hero). If any Bowie dies, all Bowies are dead and the game is lost.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Melding and Splaying, Variable Player Powers

name: Posthuman: The Wilds Mini-Expansion
description: The Wilds Mini-Expansion adds new encounters of all 3 levels, new weapons, equipment, followers and events along with 4 new characters from the world of Vengeance that come with their own set of starting items and skills.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Football Highlights 2052: Expansion #1 – Chicago & Green Bay
description:
This expansion includes 2 teams (Chicago & Green Bay) each consisting of 5 core star players and an additional 10 team cards for 30 cards total. They can be played straight out of the pack without an initial draft, or you can add all of the team cards into the Play Deck to start with only the 5 core Star Players and draft an additional 10 cards before you play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: My First Adventure: The Odyssey of the Phobos
description:
Today, you’re setting off on an incredible adventure.
Today, you’re going to take your spaceship, The Phobos, to find your robot friend lost in the space.
Who do you want to be in this mission ?
Eclypse, the hothead pilot?
Toby, the inquisitive scientist?
or Gloub, the Moon mechanic?
Choose carefully and plunge into this rather unusual story, a story where each choice you make will change your adventure.

The Odyssey of the Phobos is the third book in the "My First Adventure" collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero. Choose your character and plunge in this rather unusual story, a story where each choice you make will change your adventure.
categories: Book, Children's Game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
publishers: Board Game Box, DV Games, Fable Fox Press, Game Flow, Maldito Games

name: Trek 12: Base Camp 2
description:
Expansion for Trek 12.

Open routes to 3 new summits:

50 sheets for Pokhara summit,
50 sheets for Dhye summit,
50 sheets for Machapuchare summit.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Pin Pon!
description: Warning! The siren has just sounded in the fire station because a fire has just broken out! Can you arrive in time in the co-operative game Pin Pon! to help the firefighters and put out the flames to save the burning house?

name: The Greatest Show
description:
The Greatest Show takes you into the extraordinary and magical world of the circus, where you meet real Polish artists. Among them there will be illusionists, acrobats, jugglers and many other freaks known not only from the Polish circus scene, but also from Got Talent, YouTube and TikTok.

In the game, you take on the role of a circus director, who plans to create the greatest show in the history of entertainment. You will recruit artists for your show, and on the way to your goal, numerous castings, advertisements to increase popularity, and sometimes you will happen to plant a pig on other players.

The Greatest Show game promotes the circus without animals!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Pest: Event Cards Pack
description: This mini expansion adds 12 cards with street events.

name: A Very Civil Whist
description:
A Very Civil Whist is a historical board game that puts you in the middle of one of the most turbulent periods in English history. In this game, you'll play as either the Royalists or Parliamentarians, two opposing factions vying for political, economic and religious control of England. The game is based on the classic card game German Whist, but with a few twists – you'll be able to play with leaders and assets that represent key actors of the first English Civil War. With strategic play and a bit of luck, you can lead your faction to victory and secure your place in history.
Taking place in the mid-17th century, the first English Civil War was a time of great political and social upheaval. The conflict pitted the supporters of King Charles I against the supporters of Parliament, who sought to limit the monarch's power and establish a more democratic government. As you play "A Very Civil Whist", you'll experience the tension and drama of this critical period in English history. Will you be able to rally your troops and secure victory for your faction? Or will you fall to your opponent and be consigned to the dustbin of history? The fate of England rests in your hands!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Trick-taking, Tug of War

name: Portugal (fan expansion for Age of Industry)
description:
This Portugal map has been primarily designed for 3 players (though also playable with 2 or even 4, though super tight) and features Portugal during the height of its industrial development (1855-65). This map adds quite a few nuances to the base game such as:

a.) Banks were hesitant to invest in the industrial sector so loans return $1 less for each additional loan after the first.

b.) Railway expansion was highly encouraged - certain rails are worth $4 at the end of the game instead of $2 and there are bonus VP for the player who finishes with the most VP.

c.) Government debt was mounting rapidly due to poor management so to simulate this waste, corruption, and poor economy, there is always a region or industry where you CANNOT build.

...and many more!

Players must navigate the map's tightness - don't forget the option to combine both actions to build anywhere! - and suffocating economy to try and build a prosperous network.
categories: Economic, Fan Expansion, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Alliances
description:
This tricky game requires you to connect opposite sides of the board: purple to purple, orange to orange, green to green. To make those connections, you must use the colour matching the sides you are connecting… but your allied colour also works!

COMPONENTS


1 gameboard
42 green discs
42 orange discs
42 purple discs
2 silver discs


GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW (please refer to the rulebook)

On your turn, take a disc from the supply and place it on any empty space.

If you just formed a connection between opposite sides, with an uninterrupted chain of tiles of the sides’ colour and/or the allied colour, you win that colour, even if the disc you placed formed a connection for both of you.

When you win a colour, take a disc of that colour from the supply and place it on the corresponding cell of your chart, while your opponent places a silver disc on the same colour on their chart (they lost that colour). If you just won your second colour, you win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Knockdown: Chilly – Business Pingwin
description: What will the Penguin show us today? He showed himself in the Arena, trying to knock down his enemies! Will you make the Globetrotter from Etherfields a winner in a Great Tournament?

name: Runes of Mayhem
description:
Runes of Mayhem is a fast, competitive, historical tactical card game for two. Enter the Medieval world of the Vikings and the Anglo-Saxons! Rule the battlefield with powerful formations and lead your forces with mighty heroes. Overcome your opponent, destroy his fortress and reap the spoils of war! How will you earn victory?

The players face each other on the battlefield, they create powerful formations and lead their forces to victory with the aid of mighty kings. The game features tokens and dice expanding it beyond the limits of a mere card game, creating an exciting combination of tactics and luck.

Runes of Mayhem is a game where choosing the right units, using the proper abilities and formations are vital, but luck matters too - after all, you cannot wholly control the mayhem of an epic battle. If you play your cards right and lead your units as a true tactician, you can render your opponent unable to roll, eliminating most of the luck factor.

Runes of Mayhem is highly enjoyable from the very first play, and with experience, you will be able to make optimal tactical decisions. Take a defensive or an offensive approach, concentrate building momentum and speed or take your time and trade. Many paths lead to victory, but only if you pay close attention and grasp the pace of the game. In Runes of Mayhem, you decide what road to take!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Nicolas Flamel's School
description:
Congratulations! You have just been accepted to attend the school of the world-famous alchemist Nicolas Flamel. As a new student, your goal is simple: become the best disciple of the Master!

Each alchemy student gets taught an array of brews and potions by Nicolas Flamel himself. He will observe you while you prepare, cook, and perfect your concoctions.

Who will be the first to complete three parts of a Great Work?
Who will be the craftiest student, avoiding their classmates’ tricks?
Who will be the one to discover the Philosopher’s Stone?

Each student will have access to their own Cauldron. With this prized possession, they will mix the ingredients they have collected - but be careful, if the ingredients are unstable, they might blow up inside the Athanor - the alchemist furnace!

Creating the perfect mixture is not all. Each student has a whole batch of tricks up their sleeve to get ahead: steal ingredients, sabotage a rival’s potion, gain favors from the Master.

name: شمشیر سامورایی + آفتاب تابان (Samurai Sword)
description:
Samurai Sword is a game based on the proven Bang! mechanisms and set in feudal Japan. In this game, the familiar features of Bang! are enhanced by more dynamic and fast-paced game play, and thanks to a new scoring system – based on honor points and resilience points – there is no player elimination. Everybody gets to fight to the very end! Also, weapons and attacks are fused into a single card.

—description from the publisher

This edition contains the Rising Sun expansion.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: DV Games, Land of Beautiful Mind (سرزمین ذهن زیبا)

name: Magic: The Gathering – Onslaught
description:
Take on the Cabal and a fearsome new master illusionist. In Onslaught, Creature Types—Clerics, Soldiers, Birds, Wizards, Zombies, Goblins, Beasts, Elves, and Illusions—define the world of Magic like never before.

This black-bordered, 350-card set features randomly inserted foil premium cards and powerful mechanics like Morph, “Creature Types Matter” Cards, Fear, Chain Spells, and Cycling (an old favorite from Urza's Saga).

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Crisis at Steamfall: Kickstarter Promo pack
description: Contains 20 cards which can be used in competitive mode to play the Antagonist variant.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Smash Monster Rampage! Mega Monster Box
description:
The town is under attack again! Choose from 16 unique monsters to protect the town from, each with its own mechanics and cards.

The Mega Monster Box also introduces new unit types, weapon tokens for one-time attack bonuses, and variant Smash dice for a more challenging game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Elder Sign: Hastur Promo Card
description:
A new, official, Ancient One card, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 14-15 October 2016.

Consists of a new version of Hastur, that has been created exclusively for Arkham Nights.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order

name: Cry Havoc: Tactic & Sabotage Crystals
description:
Increase your Cry Havoc collection and add a set of cool crystals to it! They are not your average, everyday crystals. They are special crystals, that add new rules to the game, increasing its strategic aspect. Before the game distribute them on all regions. One type of those new crystals increases the Region value, the other decreases it. That change in Region’s value will mean you would need to play your whole game differently!

New Crystals is a very simple mini-expansion that adds a ton of strategy to the game. In the setup phase, players will plant different regions with white and black crystals. Unlike the ones from the base game, these black and white are one use only, sort of objectives to grab, secure and score. And unlike the ones from the base game, white and black crystals are located precisely where you want them to be. You set the scene. You prepare the game. You let other players know which region is vital for you. After the setup phase is over, the board is filled with white and black crystals, markers that manifest players plans. For winning in the region with white crystals, you get additional points. If you win in a region with black ones, the score for this battle will be lower. The map gets extra dimension, unique net of scoring opportunities plant on the board by players themselves.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Relic Expedition: Villages and Markets Expansion
description:
This expansion contains two new types of jungle tiles: villages and markets. Villages contain relics for which players must trade supplies; they make some relics more costly to obtain, and they give players a reason to carry duplicate supplies. Markets contain supplies for which players must trade relics; they give players another way to obtain the supplies they need, and they give players the opportunity to remove from the game a relic that their opponents need.

Contains 4 Market Tiles and 4 Village Tiles, one additional standard supply token of each type (marked with red text), a second additional First Aid supply token and a second additional Machete supply token (both also marked with red text), and 9 green triangular curse tokens.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Ninja: Silent But Deadly
description:
Ninjas! Their very name conjures images of black-clad, highly trained assassins. Now, the mystique and power can be yours to use as you see fit.

Ninja: Silent But Deadly is more than just a game; it's a metagame to be played in the background with ninja-like skills, making it perfect for a game night, casual party, or other social gathering.

To play, hand out one “You Lose!” card to every player. Each player has until the end of the game session to slip their card somewhere where another player will be forced to find it. Amongst other cards of a game currently in play, in their chips, etc. Be creative! And don’t get caught! When a "You Lose!" card is found by another player, that player is out. The last player standing wins.

—description from the publisher


The Kickstarter Even Silenter 5-card expansion is included in all editions:


Ninja Love Interest
Ninja Star
Ninja Mitosis
Oh Snap! Samurai!
Platonic Ideal of a Ninja


Shh! Do you smell that? Ninjas! Five optional cards to add to your games. You can now play up to 17 people, or remove up to 5 standard Ninja Cards from the game and substitute these Even Silenter cards in their place.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Excavation Earth: Pretty Boxes & Ancient Artefacts
description:
Excavation Earth: Pretty Boxes & Ancient Artefacts contains two sets of alternate artifact tiles — "Ancient things" and "Things that make noise" — as well as a "Pretty Box" expansion that adds one new artefact of each color, with that artefact being placed on top of the matching black market stack when revealed instead of on the map.

This item was a Kickstarter Limited Exclusive included in the Explorer, Envoy, and Collector pledges, and it's labeled "PROMO 01".

name: Basketball G.M.
description:
Basketball G.M. is a card game in which each player is the General Manager of his/her own basketball franchise. The GMs (human players) put together their teams through a fantasy-style draft and attempt to take their teams to the championship. In addition to basketball players, each GM will choose a coach and use Strategy cards to boost player abilities. The GMs must also contend with play injuries, suspensions, and other hindrances.

Each game begins with a fantasy draft, either auction style or through a "pick and pass" method, and then the season begins. Each game turn represents several weeks of a basketball season. GMs earn victory points based on their teams' total ability from their players, plus a small random factor of 1-3 dice. The teams with the most victory points at the end compete head to head in a championship game or series.

After the draft, GMs can improve their teams through the course of the season by trading with other GMs or through the trading block. The trading block is an auction in which GMs make trade offers for players from the player pool. Because only a fraction of the players in the game will be available for the initial draft, there is still a lot of talent to acquire over the course of the season.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation, Trading

name: Knot Dice: Squared
description:
Knot Dice Squared is an expansion to Knot Dice, with 26 more dice of 3 different types. New rules are included for many of the original games, and a puzzle book provides new puzzles incorporating the new dice. It also add tokens to accommodate 2 more players in some of the games.

You still create Celtic knot designs with these beautiful dice, but the new patterns make for slightly more difficult games and a much wider variety of designs.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Fate/Grand Order Duel
description:
F/GO Duel is a Miniature Board Game revolving around Mini Figures and Command Card. Similar to another official F/GO Tabletop game "Fate/Grand Order Summon Pencil Servant", this game also heavily involves "gacha elements" (Heroic Spirit Summoning). Battles using these mini figures will take place on top of a board (battlefield) and players will use Command Card to execute certain attacks

Source: Fate/Grand Order wikia
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Sherlock Holmes Detektyw doradczy: Nie ma zysku bez ryzyka
description:
Inspector Gregson came to Baker Street for help from Sherlock with a case of a girl that dies in hospital yesterday. She was beaten to death.

Sherlock Holmes: Detektyw doradczy - Nie ma zysku bez ryzyka (Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective - Nothing ventured, nothing gained) is a free print and play scenario for Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective!

This is a standalone game. It comes with an excerpt from the address book, map, and newspaper, and does not need any items from the base game.

name: Legends of the Old West: The Alamo – Victory or Death
description:
From the publisher:
This lavish book deals with one of the most infamous battles in the Old West when the Mexican army fought Texans at the Alamo mission in San Antonio. Inside you¹ll find new rules, army lists and scenarios so you can take your battles to a whole new scale, creating sweeping military actions to recreate the Texas War for Independence.

Relive the battle of the Alamo. Change history at San Jacinto. Hire David Crockett, James Bowie, or even Generalissimo Santa Anna to join your cause.

The fate of a nation rests in your hands.

Expands:

Legends of the Old West


Expanded by:

Legends of the Old West: Showdown which includes rules errata
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: 18NewEngland 2: The Railroads of the Northern States
description:
18NewEngland 2 is an alternate map for 18NewEngland. It was designed primarily as a 2-3 player game, but also accommodates 4 players. The play time should be about 2/3 as long as the base 18NewEngland game.

This expansion reuses the components from 18NewEngland except the board. Some trains and tiles are removed to fit the smaller map.

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: The Lounge: A Mafia Game
description:
The Lounge is an exciting social deduction game based on the extremely popular Mafia and Werewolf games. In it, you play the role of one of the members of a town. You could be in the Mafia, whose goal is to gain majority in the town by eliminating the townspeople. You could be one of those townspeople, attempting to rid their beloved city of all dangerous and malicious folks. Or, you could have your own goals, and be one of the several different 3rd party roles present in this game.

The game runs between cycling day and night rounds. During the night rounds, the Mafia wakes and chooses one person to kill off, and some other roles wake up and prowl the night. Then, everyone wakes up and a day round starts. During the day round, people discuss the recent happenings in the town, and try and see if there is someone suspicious enough to vote off. Once the voting happens, it's back to a night round until someone wins!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Mafia, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Relics of Rajavihara: Thrill Seeker Expansion Pack
description: 20 Additional levels to challenge your brain! Master these puzzling levels and collect lots of gems along the way.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Move Through Deck, Slide/Push, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Arcaven's Duel
description:
Arcaven’s Duel is a one-on-one battle game where players can use various spells in order to defeat their opponent. The game is fast-paced (ending in under 15 minutes) and has multiple levels of strategy that can be utilized and developed.

Each player starts with the same 7 cards (which are wizard spells). Players flip cards (casting spells) to gain charge tokens, attack the opponent or defend an attack. Play KEY to get unique powerful spells from the LOCK deck, before your opponent does! The first player to remove all 10 hearts from their opponent wins!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Nanga Parbat: Missions Pack
description:
The Nanga Parbat: Missions Pack is an expansion pack for Nanga Parbat. The pack includes a total of 14 cards: 11 game cards (5 mission cards + 6 reward cards) and 3 rules cards.

At the start of the game, the 5 mission cards are laid out in a row, showing the different missions for the game. Paired with each mission is a reward card. The first player to accomplish a mission earns the reward card. Since the mission cards are double-sided, there is a wide variety of mission combinations. Plus, with 6 different rewards and only 5 used per game, the reward combinations also differ from game to game.

More specifically, each mission shows 3 hikers in a particular pattern in a region. To accomplish the mission, a player must have their own hikers in the exact combination shown in one of the six regions.

The reward cards include an immediate point reward and/or a special power. The front side of the cards show the rewards using icons, while the backside describe the rewards in text.

-description from designer

name: Similarius
description: A number of cards showing faces are displayed face up. Players must try to remember the various features of each face. After one minute, the cards are shuffled and all but one are turned face up. Players then draw the missing person as they remember him. All the drawings are revealed and everybody votes for the one that most closely matches the original. Drawings are then scored according to six features: face shape, eyes, nose, mouth, hair and the extras. Players score points for their drawings and for voting correctly. An helper sheet helps players remember and draw the various features.

name: The Great Fire of London 1666: 2-Player Expansion
description:
In this 2 player expansion, each player owns two colours of house, scoring for the surviving houses in both colours as well as for objectives and fires extinguished.

They must not only play against each other but also contend with movements of the fire and the trained bands that are outside the control of either player.

Will you save London or watch it burn?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Take That

name: Stir Crazy
description: Invite over your closest friends (up to 12 people total) and start cooking! This game includes a "host guide" for making your party great, a cassette tape with instructions and theme music, invitations, an ingredient list, aprons, chef hats, name tags, menu cards, etc. Two teams compete to cook up the best meal. The game comes in several different editions, including Mexican, Italian, and Oriental.

name: Confrontation
description:
Confrontation is a wargame covering hypothetical conflicts during the 1950-70 period on a global scale. It is fairly abstract, with generic land units but some detail on the capabilities of different air and naval units.

Confrontation was notable for using a map of the entire world (a Rand McNally map with movement points and such printed over it). It was one of the first simulation games to cover modern warfare and to allow for more than two players (although the emphasis is on the two-player game).

Expanded by:

Confrontation Expansion Kit

name: Two Furlongs from Home
description:
Another "dice and chart" solo game from Lambourne games.

Put together a stable of horses (chosen from 600) and run them over a full 500 race season. Try to win prize money.

Includes racetracks, 30 racehorse figures, charts, etc.

name: Druid
description:
On a square board players take turns placing cubes (sarsens) which may be played on the ground or on any piece of your color, and (3x1) rectangles (lintels) which can be placed in such a way that they are supported at both ends and are supported by exactly two blocks of your color and optionally one block of the opponent's color. The simplest configuration therefore resembles a mini Stone Henge (hence the name).

The space in between can be empty or occupied by a piece of either color.

One player is attempting to connect the top and bottom of the board and the other player the left and right edges. Connectivity is judged as seen from above so that higher pieces can cut the connection of lower ones. Or to quote the rules:

Two sects of Druids want to build a monument on the same sacred site, however there is some conflict. The followers of Horizontus believe that the monument should track the sun from the East horizon to the West horizon to worship the passing days, while the followers of Verticalus believe that the monument should track the sun from the North to the South to worship the passing seasons.

The game has several variants including a version played on a hex grid (also playable by three) and both the hexagonal and square versions have a "Druid's Walk" variation in which an additional piece represents a druid out for a stroll.

Online Play


Gamerz (turn-based, play by email or play by web)

name: Ship of the Line
description:
Play out classic sea battles of the age of fighting sail using the Ship of the Line rules. The pdf has everything you need to play (except dice) including rules, maps and counters. Ship of the Line is for two or more players and a typical game will take an hour or less to finish.

Ship of the Line includes full rules for: All manner of ships; Unusual vessels; Fortifications; Islands, reefs, shallows, harbors and other terrain types; Ammunition types; Crew quality; Prize money and rules for campaign play; random scenario generator; Scenarios; Extensive notes.

Downloadable from rpgnow.com

name: ¡No Pasaran!: Mallorca 1936
description:
Alea Magazine nº 24.

This is a scenario for the ¡No Pasaran!: Las Batallas por Madrid 1936-37 system for the Spanish Civil War. It requires the use of the ¡No Pasaran! - Las Batallas por Madrid for rules. This is not a stand alone game although it has its own set of scenario-specific rules as well.
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Blood & Swash/Thunder & Plunder
description:
Actually 2 sets of rules of playing skirmish games of Pirates. Blood & Swash is for the tavern fights, the on deck one-one melee between many flying swords and pistols.

Thunder & Plunder allows you to include a more boarding party/coastal raid type of game between the pirates in a "grand tactical" sense, (at least as grand tactical as a ship of pirates can be!)

name: Star Mogul: Ruins of an Empire
description:
