Though their ancestors were common dwarves, generations of living in the presence of the island's primal elemental magic has infused them with a fiery essence that cannot be restrained. Molten fire runs through their veins, and their hearts smolder with fervor. They are children of the volcano.

Those who challenge the lava dwarves must be prepared to face the flames. In the dungeon, lava dwarves inflict damage that keeps on burning turn after turn. Their flames likewise burn the Champions' weapons, gear, and magic items. Not even the Champions' Totem cards are safe from the dwarves' devouring heat. All the same, the lairs of the lava dwarves are full of treasure, which means the reward for confronting them is definitely worth the blistering risk.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Wyrdhollow – Voidcursed Thralls Rivals Deck
description:
A curious affliction has been observed in Wyrdhollow – The energy from loosed Realmshaper Engines is striking living creatures and altering them to some unknown purpose. More sinister still, those affected appear to lose their volition, becoming vessels for a power and will not their own. While little is known about these emotionless Voidcursed Thralls, what is certain is that they are entirely devoted to their mysterious cause, forgoing sleep, safety, and in some cases survival. Those who seek to prevent or defeat them risk falling prey to the same cosmic hex, their flesh being slowly claimed by the star-dotted blackness of the Void itself, until they are little more than silhouettes.

Get stuck into Warhammer Underworlds or mix up your game with the complete Voidcursed Thralls Rivals deck, usable by any warband – including those from past seasons. These cards can be used as a standalone deck in Rivals games, mixed with a warband's unique cards for Nemesis games, or used to build a deck from the ground-up in Relic games. This deck doesn’t include any spells, so warbands from any season can put it to good use.

Each card is brand new to the game, focused on making your fighters Voidcursed so they can unleash hidden powers. Aggressive warbands with numerous fighters such as the Grinkrak’s Loorncourt, The Headsmen’s Curse, and Ephilim’s Pandemonium will find Voidcursed Thralls particularly suited to their play style.

This deck contains a 33-card universal Rivals deck, consisting of:

12x objective cards
10x gambit cards
10x upgrade cards
1x plot card with additional rules for using the Voidcursed Thralls deck


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Moxxi
description: Miniature and cards to use Moxxi as a Vault Hunter. This was a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion.

name: Cool Animal Facts
description:
Know your stuff or when to bluff!

Can you name an animal that lives in cities, has paws, and has a tail? What if it had big ears (and was spikey)?

Try to name more animals as the traits pile on, or play a new trait and test another player's knowledge! Just hope they can't name it before it gets back to you!

—description from the publisher

name: Syncro
description:
You are a mage who has taken a vow of silence. You will have to face an unprecedented threat and fight monsters that endanger the kingdom.

Cooperate without speaking to defeat all the monsters!


At the beginning of the game, communicate the potential of your cards with a gesture.
In turn, place a face-down card on a monster of your choice.
At the end of a turn, reveal the cards placed on the monsters and find out if your attacks were powerful enough to defeat them.


You must estimate the value played by your fellow players while having limited communication and information.

As the game progresses, you will advance in the adventure and unlock new effects that will spice up your games.

The game consists of 2 chapters with 4 and 5 levels respectively to cross in order to win the game.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Posłani
description:
In Posłani , you are one of the twelve apostles. Each of you has unique skills, it is not without reason that Judas is not afraid of the Pharisees, and John climbs mountains faster - this type of references to the Scripture will especially please those who know its content, but you do not have to be a believer to play the game!

During his turn, a player can perform as many actions as he wants as long as he has enough rest points. The player ends each turn by rolling a rest die. The player who scores the most victory points wins. They are obtained by healing the Needy, proclaiming the Kingdom of God and completing tasks from the Event Deck.

The game ends when the last day is drawn from the Day Deck or when all Needy tokens are removed from the board.

-description from designer

•••

Uzdrawiaj, nawracaj i wypędzaj złe duchy.
Jesteś jednym z dwunastu apostołów. Każdy z was posiada unikalne umiejętności, nie bez powodu Judasz nie boi się faryzeuszy, a Jan szybciej chodzi po górach - tego typu nawiązania do Pisma szczególnie ucieszą tych, którzy znają jego treść, ale nie trzeba być wierzącym żeby zagrać w grę!

Wygrywa gracz, który zdobędzie jak najwięcej punktów zwycięstwa. Zdobywa się je poprzez uzdrawianie Potrzebujących, głoszenie Królestwa Bożego oraz wykonywanie zadań z Talii Wydarzeń.

Gra kończy się wraz z ostatnim dniem wyciągniętym z Talii Dni lub po zdjęciu wszystkich żetonów Potrzebujących z planszy.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dédale
description:
In this cooperative game, help the famous architect Daedalus to lock the Minotaur in an inextricable labyrinth.

Daedalus offers 10 original challenges of progressive difficulty. You will have to create a Labyrinth for the Minotaur by placing cards each your turn on the center of the table. The goal of the game is to fulfill the challenge before you ran out of cards.

Dédale is created in partnership with the festival Alchimie du jeu of Toulouse for the 2024 edition whose theme is mythology. A portion of the profits is donated to the festival for each sale of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Cooperative Game, Layering, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tile Placement

name: Contraband Insider
description:
Contraband Insider is a deduction board game for 3 to 5 players.

The police are stepping up enforcement efforts to confiscate illegal contraband goods within the city. Unfortunately, players take on the role of moles infiltrated into the police force. These corrupted cops are also known as “insiders” who manipulate various operations to prevent their partnered contraband goods from being confiscated by police raids.

Each round consists of a game setup and 3 gameplay phases:
1. In the Contraband Goods Phase, players are to hide 3 Contraband Cards faced-down among 8 Public Locations and 1 Home Base.
2. In the Police Raid Phase, players take turns to play 1 out of 3 actions.
3. In the Scoring Phase, all the cards in the unraided Public Location and Home Base will be opened and revealed. Players will earn the number of points for the round.

The game is played over 3 rounds, which each round will determine points that add up to the final score. At the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Memory, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Ubongo Lines
description:
All players will try to compete by building the same pattern shown on the card as quickly as possible, using three-dimensional rectangular blocks. After 9 ores, the players add up the points. Whoever gets the most of them wins. Four difficulty levels allow you to adjust the game to the age and experience of the players.

The competition consisting in building the same pattern by all players at the same time introduces much more emotions than in the basic version or in Ubongo 3D.

This is the world's first release of this version of Ubongo!

name: Keyforge Adventures: Fall of the House Gormangeist
description:
In Fall of the House Gormangeist, players find themselves amidst the tenebrous events that preamble KeyForge: Grim Reminders (the next major KeyForge set after Winds of Exchange).

This adventure is sure to challenge even the most excellent of your decks. Like other KeyForge: Adventures, it is a multiplayer scenario (1-3 players) that also features a Nightmare Mode for those of you looking for a insanely difficult experience.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Zooloretto Würfelspiel: Affenstall
description:
Zooloretto Würfelspiel: Affenstall

Translated.... Zooloretto Dicegame: Monkeyhouse

Available as AbacusSpiele Catalog Edition 17.
Also as a download on M.Schacht's website, where he calls it Variante: S.

It is a different score pad for the Zooloretto dice game. There is an additional monkey enclosure on this pad and fewer spaces for most of the enclosures. Three enclosures score bonus points by filling these first and the three others earn coins instead.

name: Kirche, Glaube & Reformation (fan expansion for Catan: Cities and Knights)
description:
Unofficial fan expansion of CATAN: Cities & Knights.

Adds several new aspects to Catan: Cities and Knights.

Introduces an Inquisitor token, Religion Development Calendars, Religion Progress card set, Bread commodity cards and Beer commodity cards. While Bread is analogous to Grain (the way Coin is analogous to Ore in Cities and Knights), Beer is a commodity that can only be produced on a Grain intersection when a new Diocese building is present. Beer is used to create Beer Festivals which affect an opponent's Road, Ship, Settlement or City for a period of time; this action can lower the Victory Point total for that opponent!

The third edition of Kirche, Glaube & Reformation ("Church, Faith and Reformation") also incorporates another unofficial fan expansion, Hexen, Zauberer & Drachen (fan expansion for Catan: Cities and Knights) ("Witches, Wizards & Dragons"), which introduces a Wizard token, Magic Development Calendars, Magic Progress card set and Magic commodity cards. Magic commodities can only be collected on a brick intersection when a new Citadel building is present.

This combined version requires a custom 12 sided event die (6 barbarian ships and 6 city gates, the last of which is a "wild card" gate allowing the player who rolled the dice to choose the color gate).

If played separately, each fan expansion requires a custom 8 or 10 sided event side (4 barbarian ships and 4 city gates or 5 barbarian ships and 5 city gates, the last of which is a "wild card" gate).

Adds tactical complexity to the game and game length.

Belongs to the Catan Series.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Ancient Knowledge: Promo Cards
description:
Ancient Knowledge Con & Trade Promo 2023

3 new monuments and one artifact. All 4 of them are shuffled into the the standard deck.

name: Lords of Ancient Times
description:
"The game spans over several rounds. Every round each player selects one of the five different roles which will determine a certain action for all players. The player who manages to build the most powerful civilization at the end of the game will be the Lord of Ancient Times."

"Winning the Game: The winner will be the player with most Victory Points at the end of the game." Victory Points are earned by founding cities, discovering advancements, and building wonders.

The designer credits San Juan as the inspiration for this print-and-play civilization building card game.

name: PlusMinus
description:
The main principle of this game is a generally known law of magnetism, saying that charged particles of the same signs repel each other and attract the opposite, in other words: plus attracts minus, minus attracts plus, plus repels plus and minus repels minus. Players, using this principle, perform actions with their pawns, aiming to place five of them in a row. The first to achieve this goal wins the game.

Each player has 45 two-sided pawns with a plus sign and a minus on the other side.

A player in his/her turn must perform:

place his pawn from the pool on the board


and (if possible)

make one additional action out of the following:
repelling the pawn on the board
attracting the pawn on the board



and (if the additional action gives such an effect)

a pawn's reaction after an additional action (or a sequence of pawns' reactions)

name: Airfix Battles: Bonus Force Deck 1
description:
From the publisher:

Prepare to top up your troops, call in reinforcements and commit your reserves for your favourite Airfix Battles forces, with this brand new set of 24 bonus Force Cards for the Airfix Battles wargame.

With a huge variety of British, American and German troops, it features specialists like the Allied Bazooka team, the 6-pounder anti-tank gun, a ten man squad of Tommies with anti-tank Piats, as well as experienced leaders like the Commando Sergeant, Allied Captain and unit of Veterans.

You'll also find a huge variety of specialist Allied vehicles such as the Sherman Calliope tank with its rocket launchers, the M8 Greyhound armoured car, or the Churchill Crocodile battle tank, plus a host of classic world war two vehicles.

For the Axis forces you'll be able to deploy an array of fearsome vehicles and armour like Michael Wittman's Tiger, featuring the ace German tank commander, the Panther battle tank, the SDKFZ 222 armoured car and the deadly Tiger II King Tiger!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Equity
description:
Equity is an experimental economy board game played by 3 to 6 people from twelve years up.

Inspired by real scientific research on finance bubbles, Equity is a challenging tabletop board game that is competitive, social, filled with strategic choices and surprising outcomes! To win the game, you must trade in stocks and art and be the first player to own a yacht and have 50,000 in cash!

The trading is usually done through auctions. The stocks have no price and have no value when the game is over, but pay out a dividend as long as the game is still going. The art cards are also bought through auctions, but they get their value from the drawing of action cards with the chance of getting an art buyer card to sell the art.

There are also many chances to bluff and trade with your opponents during the game and many different strategies of how to win. Stay in cash, get all the stocks, only buy art or sell your cards to other players. The yacht may be bought only once every seventh turn, so get your money together and time it right. You might not want the other players to think that you are about to win!

name: Gorus Maximus: ManBearPig
description:
ManBearPig is a promo card for Gorus Maximus that debuted at Gen Con 2019.

Set-up:
Select the appropriate cards based on the number of players, then shuffle ManBearPig into the deck. After dealing cards out to the players, one card will be left over. Turn it face up and it will set the starting Preferred School.

Rules:
ManBearPig is the king of all gladiators.

1. He will win any bout he's in.
2. If he is led as the first gladiator in a bout, other players must play a gladiator from the current preferred school if able.
3. If another player leads a gladiator from the preferred school and you don't have any, you must play him.

name: Last Dungeon Pocket
description: You are the dungeon master of the demon army, who has been entrusted with the dungeon, which is called "the town of beginning," which is closest to the city of man.This dungeon is a popular dungeon where first-time adventurers come to test their skills, but strong adventurers don't visit, so they spend ordinary days dealing with first-time adventurers.However, a serious fact was discovered the other day.In fact, I discovered that the legendary holy sword used by the brave men of previous generations was hidden in the treasure which lay behind Dungeon.I found out that this holy sword was capable of cutting through mountains with one stroke.Ordinary monsters cannot even be touched by the overwhelming power of the Holy Sword.If the Sword is found by adventurers, especially the brave, it is obvious that the demon army will be inferior.Will you fight off the adventurers who challenge you one after another and protect the legendary holy sword that lies deep in Dungeon?
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Baronda
description:
Must follow trick taking game with simultaneous bids where you score points by taking at least as many tricks as you bid (if the total bid of all players is too high for everyone to take enough tricks) or no more tricks than you bid (if the total bid of all players is too low for everyone to duck enough tricks).

In addition to the four normal suits, there are special Naga (higher than trump) and Pass (lowest) cards that can be played instead of following suit, and the 0 card of each suit is a super trump if played in the same trick as a Naga.

name: Red Sand, Blue Sky: Heroes of the Arena
description:
Gladiator: Just saying the word conjures up visions of vicious combat between desperate men who fought to the death for the amusement of the crowd. These games of death, originally started to honor the dead (the munus), began in 264 BC and continued through the Roman Empire in one form or another for over 900 years until abolished in 681 AD. Now with Red Sands Blue Sky - Heroes of the Arena you can recreate the glory and splendor of these games on three levels.

As a gladiator you fight your way through the Empire in hopes of reaching the Colosseum in Rome and perhaps the ultimate glory, the wooden sword of freedom, the rudis. Or perhaps you would rather be a lanista, the trainer or manager of gladiators forming your own troupe or familia gladiatoria. And the third way to play Red Sand Blue Sky - Heroes of the Arena is as the owner of a ludus or gladiator school seeking to reach the ultimate honor, a school in Rome herself.

Red Sand Blue Sky - Heroes of the Arena gives you everything you need to do this and much more. But perhaps the best thing about the game is that it can be played solo against the game mechanics, cooperatively with all players on the same side, or competitively, head to head against your friends.

At the core, the game pits gladiators against other gladiators or animals in arena combat. Gladiator stats determine how many dice are rolled, and "successes" are then counted from among the dice. Each combatant, however, has a certain number of "bonus" dice which he may allocate throughout the game to improve his chances. Tactics enter the game in knowing when to use these dice.

Campaign rules allow you to follow your gladiator's career as he strives to earn his freedom.

A player may also opt to play as a Lanista, building a school of gladiators, buying and training slaves, pitting them against other players (or against the game mechanics) and earning money by wagering on their performances, or selling them to other schools after they have outgrown the region of the empire in which your school resides.

Re-implements:

Red Sand, Blue Sky: Death in the Arenas of Rome
categories: Ancient, Economic, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Rick on Horse Game Booster
description:
Nothing could stop Rick Grimes, a small town police officer, from reuniting with his family. Not a gunshot wound to the chest, nor waking from a coma into a world overrun with the dead, nor a lonely and harrowing journey through the Walker-infested streets of Atlanta.

This booster pack contains 2 Unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Rick on Horseback to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.

Requires The Walking Dead: All Out War Miniatures Game Core set to play.

name: Pirates of Penryn
description:
Sail your rum from your huge galleon down shallow tidal Cornish waters using your small cramped RumRunner boat. You must make several trips back and forth to port, re-loading your limited RumRunner hand with the best combination of rum, crew and florin cards. Changing winds and tides affect which areas of the board are navigable and how far you can sail on each turn. The waters are also full of whirlpools that can twist your fortunes for good as well as ill. Other players can set the local seamonster upon you to cause trouble, or sail abreast to start a skirmish with their ferocious or charming crew and steal your profits. The player who successfully stows the most florins safely aboard their galleon (and has a decent crew to defend them) claims victory.

—description from the designer

name: Football Highlights 2052: 15-Card Promo pack
description:
15 promo cards featuring 3 EGG All Pro players and 12 All Star players for Football Highlights 2052.

Cards PR-001 to PR-015

EGG All Pro players
- PR-001
- PR-006
- PR-012

Rest are the All Star players
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Black Stories: Das Spiel
description:
The famous black stories concept in board game format!

A murder has been committed! The players have to work together and cleverly combine and puzzle to solve the crimes. Unlike in other black stories, there is no game master: the game itself asks the questions. In typical black stories fashion, the players can only use "Yes" and "No" to answer the questions.

Are the players going to be skilled investigators and solve all the crimes?

name: Word Explosion
description:
UH OH! Games Presents, Word Explosion. Word Explosion is a highly explosive word game for 2 - 8 players that will challenge you like you've never been challenged before. Are you a teacher, spelling bee champ, master linguist, or just an average person who likes word games?

Word Explosion isn't just a word game, it's a strategy-based card game that will test your wits, vocabulary, knowledge of the alphabet forward and back, and your ability to sabotage your opponents to do whatever it takes to win.  
 
Players will take turns matching letters, continue the alphabet, spell words, or play action cards until they are the first to get rid of all their cards. Whatever method you prefer, be the first player to get rid of all your cards and be crowned the "Word Explosion Master."
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Matching, Spelling, Take That

name: 电影百年 (Film Century)
description:
The new works of Yang Zhixue, the designer of "The War of Song and Jin Dynasties" and "Decisive Victory", will take you to appreciate the development process of film art for a hundred years!

The steps of Odessa are screaming silently, the singing of Mumbai is surging, the beaches of Cannes are shining, the studios in Los Angeles are always noisy - the door of the factory has been opened, pick up the card in your hand, and write your own "Century of Movies" "Bar.

"One Hundred Years of Movies" is a game that supports 3-4 players. Each player will operate a film company established around 1896 and experience the development of the movie for a hundred years.
The game begins with the invention of the film by the Lumiere brothers in 1895 and ends with Hollywood's global dominance in the 1990s. During the course of the game, you will see countless dazzling names.

The real movie stills are used as illustrations in the game, and all the stills used have obtained the corresponding use authorization.

The basic system of this game is to build a card library, on which it draws on the classic board games "Dominion", "Brass", "Through the Ages" and "Several Acres of Snow" ( A Few Acres of Snow)", but overall it is still highly original.

The subsystems of the game include some interesting contents such as studio and theater system, industrial and aesthetic system, era system, commentary and market competition system.

The game weight is about 3.0, and the game duration is around 90 minutes. In order to make it easier for movie lovers without board game experience to start, we have also specially designed novice rules for novice players, and the complete video rules explanation of the game will also be uploaded to station B after entering the publishing process. You can scan the game package by scanning the The QR code to quickly learn the basic rules of the game through video.

Good luck with your studio shoot!

—description from the designer (translated)

来自设计师的介绍：

《宋金战争》和《决胜》设计师杨治学新作，带你领略电影艺术百年的发展历程！

敖德萨台阶无声尖叫，孟买的歌声山呼海啸，戛纳的海滩星光闪耀，洛杉矶的制片厂永远喧嚣——工厂的大门已经打开，拿起手中的卡牌，书写属于你的《电影百年》吧。

《电影百年》是一款支持3-4名玩家进行的游戏，每名玩家将运营一家在1896年左右成立的电影公司，经历电影百年的发展脉络。
游戏始自1895年卢米埃尔兄弟发明电影，止于上世纪90年代好莱坞在全世界范围内建立霸主地位。游戏的进程中，你将会看到无数光芒耀眼的名字。

游戏中使用的了真实的电影剧照作为插图，所有使用的剧照都获得了相应的使用授权。

本作的基本系统为牌库构筑，在此基础上借鉴了经典桌游《领土(Dominion)》、《工业革命(Brass)》、《历史巨轮(Through the Ages)》和《几亩雪地(A Few Acres of Snow)》的一些设计，但整体上依旧具有较高的原创性。

游戏的子系统包括了制片厂和院线系统、工业和美学系统、时代系统、评论和市场争夺系统等一些颇具趣味的内容。

游戏重度约为3.0，游戏时长为90分钟上下。为了方便没有桌游经验的电影爱好者入手，我们还专门设计了针对新手玩家的新手规则，而游戏的完整视频规则讲解也将在进入出版流程之后上传至B站，您可以通过扫描游戏包装上的二维码快速通过视频学习游戏的基本规则。

祝您的电影公司拍摄顺利！

—description from the designer
categories: Industry / Manufacturing, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Heroes Welcome: Kickbacks Expansion
description:
Monsters hate to wait. See those eager customers hanging out at the workshop, looking to buy an artifact? Well, they just keep getting more and more eager as time goes by. If they think the Heroes are headed to the Dungeon without them, they just might raise their asking price! An enterprising Goblin might be able to take advantage of the situation...

The Kickbacks Expansion to Heroes Welcome adds three new mini-expansions to the game.

Kickbacks are a new type of card that grants a special reward when you craft for a Customer. Some of the Customers in the Workshop will have face-up Kickback Cards next to them. When you craft for that customer, you take all of their Kickback Cards. Each Kickback is a unique reward.

Variant monster cards add a little variety to the monsters that appear at the workshop.

Starting shop tiles let you randomize the initial board layout.

-description from designer
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: All American: The 82nd Airborne at Timmes' Orchard – June 6-9, 1944
description:
From the Publisher's website:

Timmes' Orchard - The All American 82nd Airborne Division is a Variant Historical Module for owners of Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1 and/or Paratrooper: ASL Module 2 that tells the story of the Battle of Normandy from the perspective of the 82nd Airborne Division, the American paratroopers tasked with protecting hte Utah Beach exits from the Hitlerian boast that the invaders would be ... driven back into into the sea... and the efforts of the tyrant's generals to carry out that wish.

Contents:

First edition: A 28"x32" single sheet map. Second edition: A 22"x34" two-piece color map on heavyweight stock
A historical and scenario summary booklet plus variant rules
8 Scenarios , one of which requires ownership of All American: The 82nd Airborne at Kellam's Bridge – June 6-9, 1944
2 Solitaire ASL scenarios.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Masterplan
description:
In Masterplan, players take turns placing houses onto a 8x8 square grid. Houses can be placed at the sides or in the corners of the squares.

Whenever three houses are placed in such a way that a 4th house could make a row of 4 (no matter in which colour combination), a green park piece is placed where the 4th house could be placed. Players who have adjacent pieces to these new placed park(s) score at this moment. If a house is placed on the center of the sideline directly adjacent to this space (2 points) or at the corner (if diagonally adjacent, valued 2 points) or only on the adjacent space but at another line or corner (1 point).

Whenever a full square of houses could be build (3 houses creating an "L") a tower is placed onto the fourth space. These towers score only at the end of the game, depending on the majority around them. (Same scoring as parks, but you don't actually score the points. Whoever would score the most points for a given Tower receives 2 points.

Games ends after all houses are built and all towers are scored.

name: Wolfe & Co
description:
Wolfe & Co is a quick tile-laying set-collection micro-game for two players.

Each of the 17 game cards is double sided, with the same fairytale character on both sides, but with a different coloured background. Players take turns placing cards on a shared tableau with their colour showing. Once the tableau is full, scores are tallied depending on which combinations of characters and/or colours lie adjacent to each player's cards. A game consists of four rounds, with the tableau shape changing each round.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Print & Play

name: Wildlands: The Hagmoles
description:
"Powerful creatures from the darkness below have begun to surface throughout the Wildlands. Watch your step."

This promo was available from certain brick and mortar retailers, as a pre-order bonus, not from the publisher, Osprey Games.

This promo includes a setup sheet and two hagmole die-cut pieces.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Marine Adventures: Rescue Mission Pack Expansion
description:
Space Marine Adventures is a fast-paced game for one to four players, set in the dark and dangerous labyrinth of the Necrons. This expansion gives you a new mission to undertake - Rescue - and introduces three new Space Marines, each with their own unique wargear and skills.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Companion App Pack #01: Loury Totems
description:
This is the first of the three packs with a dark magic in it! You can use this pack when playing any existing scenario.

During your exploration of the Island you have noticed a couple of poles with weird engravings. You decided to research the engravings and found out they actually are the ritual totems made by a tribe, which inhabited this island centuries ago... Following days weird and bad accidents began to occur around them... You have to destroy these malicious constructions!

A physical deck of 75 Adventure and 35 Event cards which will be available also in the companion app.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Novel-based, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Chamber of Wonders: Sherlock – A Chamber in Red
description:
Moriarty got attracted by your precious objects. He will try to steal them or sabotage your collection. No need to fear, Mr Holmes and Dr Watson can help you. Use their help or play with the devil!

20 wrongdoing cards, 1 contact card, 1 mini-board, 2 meeples, 12 tokens, 1 area (building)

Free to KS backers but due to be available separately.

name: Golfie
description:
Welcome to the course! In this golf-inspired board game, each player must take action on the 9 cards on his or her course in order to score as few points as possible. For a 9-hole, the game is played in 28 actions. Each action is determined by the 28 shuffled action cards.
May the best golfer win!

—description from the publisher

Bienvenue sur le terrain! Dans ce jeu de société inspiré du golf, chaque joueur doit prendre action sur les 9 cartes de son terrain afin de faire le moins de point possible. Pour un 9 trou, le jeu se joue en 28 action. Chaque action étant déterminée par les 28 cartes action préalablement mélangées.
Que le meilleur golfeur l'emporte!

—description from the publisher (French)
mechanics: Matching, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pub Battles:  Marengo
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Pub Battles: Marengo, players fight in this final battle of Napoleon's Italian campaign of 1800 against the Austrians. This system is know for:


fast play time (1.5 hours)
simple rules (1 page quick start rules)
stunning components (real canvas period map with hardwood kriegsspiel style blocks.)


Units move by Corps in random order (chit pull). Your HQs can attempt to alter this sequence. This recreates the random chaos of battlefields. Players must watch for timing opportunities / threats; and be able to adapt their plans to battlefield conditions. You can order your troops forward but you can’t be certain WHEN they will move.

There are no hexes or areas in this game. Pieces simply move mini style across the terrain.

No CRT. Players simply roll dice to score hits in combat. Normally, you resolve combat at the end of each turn, after all units have moved. French Guard and Cavalry units have the special ability to resolve combat immediately during the turn after they move. Combined with Napoleon's ability to easily alter the turn sequence, this becomes a very dynamic and dangerous weapon.

The French are badly outnumbered in this battle. The Austrians have a 4:1 artillery advantage. The French must exercise patience and caution at first. A French Cavalry and Guard charge can shatter the Austrian army in one blow, IF unleashed at the right time and place.

You can play in multiplayer teams (up to 8 players) with each player controlling 1 Corps with restricted communication.

name: My First Adventure: The Egg Snatcher
description:
Today, a terrible egg theft has just been committed!
Today, you’re going to turn the town upside down to find the culprit!

Who do you want to be for this investigation?


Zoé, the mouse?
Jeppy, the bear?
Or Nouki, the raccoon?


Choose your character and enter a story like no other, a story where each of your choices changes your adventure!

The Egg Snatcher is the seventh book in the "My First Adventure" collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero.
publishers: Board Game Box, DV Games, Game Flow, Maldito Games

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Regent's Flagship Expansion Pack
description:
In a Mirror Universe, the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance fights to suppress the rebellion bent on freeing Earthlings, the equivalent of the people of the Federation of the Prime Universe. The alternate reality Worf, Regent of the Alliance, places little trust in his highest officers and often takes matters into his own hands, leading his forces aboard his massive Negh'Var-class flagship. With a crew of Klingons, Cardassians and Bajorans, this intimidating ship can travel at warp 9 to hunt down and punish rebels seeking to restore their empire to its former glory.
This expansion adds a new ship and a new set of cards to Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Meatgrinder: Battle of Xuan Loc 1975
description:
This is a redux to Perry Moore's original game. Defiance: The Battle of Xuan Loc (Swedish Games).

Covers the Battle of Xuan Loc April 1975. Basically ARVN defenders backed up by air power vs. hordes of NVA with tanks and heavy artillery. This was the last stand of the South Vietnamese Army against all odds (which is why it may become an ATO issue game). The ARVN 18th division armed with M-48 Tanks and Cluster bombs conduct themselves in a heroic manner, so much so, that it becomes noticed by the outside world media press. The battle involved large amounts of aircraft and tanks. The ARVN defiant stand stunned the three NVA Divisions assigned to take the town. The two sides clashed for 10 days-it became a battle of honor! This game is a much improved version of Perry's earlier 1982 game.

System is similar to Perry Moore's Nanawa: Verdun in the Chaco War, July 1933.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.S.S. Defiant Mirror Universe Expansion Pack
description:
The ISS Defiant was a Terran Defiant-class warship that was in service to the Terran Resistance Forces in the latter half of the 24th century. The Defiant was constructed and launched in 2372 by the Rebellion at Terok Nor, in orbit of the planet Bajor. The Defiant's design was based on specifications "acquired" from Deep Space 9 in 2371.

This expansion includes one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The ISS Defiant is part of the Wave 9 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: 100 Swords: Kick Sword
description: A promo card for 100 Swords, given out during the Kickstarter campaign. This item lets you defeat any non-boss monster.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: B-26: The Marauder Strikes
description:
The B-26 has arrived in the European Theater of Operations. It has now joined the B-17, B-24 and the Lancaster over the skies of war torn Europe...

B-26: The Marauder Strikes! is a solitaire game set onboard a Martin B-26 Marauder medium bomber during World War Two in the European Theater of Operations from July 1943 until the end of the war in May 1945. It is a comprehensive game with several bomber models, mission details and a large selection of targets.

The game reflects the twin engine B-26 Marauder and situations and events which crews experienced on their missions. If you add the advanced rules you will find “B-26” to become deep and detailed and you will find yourself in situations where you may have to make decisions that will affect not only the success of your mission, but the fate of your bomber and crew. Historical accuracy has been an important guideline throughout the development of this game, though there are also some ”what-if,” fictional, aspects added.

You can begin your campaign flying missions from bases in England then move to the continent later. You will find your station either in England, France, Belgium or the Netherlands, depending on when you fly your campaign. Put together a crew, name your B-26 and fly missions over France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxemburg, Germany, Austria and Czechoslovakia!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Snowdonia: Rolling Stock #1
description: Snowdonia: Rolling Stock #1 is a promo set of cards released at the UK Games Expo 2017 consisting of five "train" cards and one location card.

name: Munchkin Cheats
description: Munchkin Cheats is a 30-card expansion made up of various Cheats and other Cheat-themed cards. You can shuffle these cards into any Munchkin base game to put Treasure cards into play more often and make things more interesting for everyone at the table; the expansion also includes Monsters and Curses that interact with Cheat cards!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Arkantar
description:
The chivalrous strategy game!

By turning over the tiles, each player builds or destroys Walls, creating rather ramparts that protect their pawns, or Paths that allow their movement and the capture of the adversary's pawn.

There are 3 possible types of actions :

build a Wall
destroy a Wall
move a pawn


During his turn, a player can decide to do 1, 2, or 3 actions. The same type of action can be repeated.

The player who captures the opponent's Queen/King is the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Au
description:
Au is a real-time trading game for 4 players in which currency is backed by gold. The game takes about 45 minutes.

Played over 4 rounds, players take the role of a nation and start the game with some of their own national currency and an equal amount in gold. (No debt, no credit).

A round starts with players acquiring resources and printing currency. Then there is a timed trading session, after which resources can be spent to mine for gold.

At the end of the game, players are awarded Victory Points for the currencies they hold, however, the victory points are ranked according to the currencies strength.

—description from the designer

name: Ноги, лапи чи копита
description:
It started a long time ago. Apparently, when someone planted a mine in the middle of the yard. Or when someone broke a neighbor's fence…

Players take turns moving cards or using the properties of one of their cards and destroying opponents' cards. When no one can make a move, the game ends and the one with the lowest sum of lost cards' prices wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Modular Board, Pieces as Map, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Zendikar Rising
description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering returns to the world of Zendikar after the defeat of the Eldrazi menace in Oath of the Gatewatch. The skyclaves, floating ruins from an ancient Kor civilization, have risen into the air once more after being buried for millennia. Priceless artifacts lie within, and adventurers are already mounting treasure-hunting expeditions. Among the treasure hunters is the Kor planeswalker Nahiri, who has a plan to bring Zendikar back to its old glory days...at any cost.

Zendikar Rising sees the return of player favorite mechanics Kicker and Landfall, and introduces Party, a new twist on allies. Also featured in the set are special modal double-faced cards that can be played either as lands or spells.

The set contains 280 cards (101 commons, 80 uncommons, 64 rares, 20 mythic rares, and 15 full-art basic lands).
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Set Collection, Take That

name: Import / Export: Capital Expansion
description: The Capital Expansion for the game Import / Export introduces 15 capital cards that add new actions, new rules, a new good type, and special powers focused on giving short term opportunity at the expense of investment.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Economic, Nautical, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Boomerang: Around the World
description:
Using the cards found in two or three of the Boomerang games, players will be able to use the Around the World expansion to do a world trip - travelling to Australia, Europe and the USA in the one game. The cards included function like promo cards that can be added into a play of any of the Boomerang Family games.

But that's not all! The mini-expansion will contain rules for solo play and for a 5-8 player variant as well.

The expansion is simply 6 cards with a rule book shrink-wrapped together. The cards are 2 promos for each of the 3 Boomerang games (but they can be played within any Boomerang game) that also work with the variants in the rules.

- From the Kickstarter

name: Tarneeb
description:
The game may be considered a variation of Whist. The aim of tarneeb is to win a set of continuous hands. There are four players in partnerships of two teams.

A standard 52 card deck is used, each suit ranking in the usual way from Ace (high) down to two (low). The game is played in a counterclockwise fashion. The teams stay together for all the games of a set. The two members of each team are seated across each other, often on a table in such a way that no player can see the cards of other players (see seating charting image). Either player of a team may collect the winning tricks.

The first dealer is chosen at random and after each hand the turn to deal passes to the right. The cards are shuffled and cut by the player to the dealer's left, and are all dealt out beginning with player to the dealer's right, one at a time or in groups of thirteen (13), so that everyone has 13 cards.

name: Xtreme Zombie Hunter
description:
From the publisher:

Xtreme Zombie Hunter is a comedic table-top miniatures game compatible with all 25mm miniatures of Zombies and the personality types that might hunt them. Set in a fictitious modern day America where Zombies are real and hunting them on national TV has become all the rage! XZH delivers a simple system, which is character driven to encourage replayability, full of laughs and can be enjoyed by 1 or more players. XZH lets you experience the hysterical nature of a B style Zombie movie with a twist.

DEAD LINK
Home Page: http://www.xtremezombiehunter.com/
categories: Adventure, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame, Zombies

name: Renegade Legion: Centurion Technical Update
description:
The Centurion Technical Update contains newly introduced battlefield weapons, vehicles, and equipment for use with Centurion. Also included are new optional rules, a campaign generator, and rules for running double blind Centurion games.

Expands:

Renegade Legion: Centurion – Blood & Steel
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Forlorn Hope
description: Miniatures wargames rules for the English Civil War. Recently revised and expanded by Partizan Press. Contains army lists for King, Parliament and the Covenant forces plus Catholic and Protestant Irish; color plates depicting numerous flags from all of the factions, with particular attention to the London Trained Bands and 4 introductory scenarios, in colour, explore the many varied engagements of the period (Tadcaster 1642, Corbridge 1644, Dunbar 1650, Wigan Lane 1651).
categories: Civil War, Dice, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Treasure Quest
description:
The quest for the "Ultimate Dungeon Crawl" is over.

"Treasure Quest" is here...

An adaption of WOTC's D20 D&D system, D&D Mini's game and inspired by adventure board and video games, past and present, Treasure Quest takes player-heroes into the depths of treasure-rich and monster-ridden dungeons. The goal is to get in, get the treasure, and get out.
Alive.

Using your own grid/hex based maps/ boards, D&D miniatures and scenary, Treasure Quest is a streamlined set of rules for adventuring, combat, dungeon exploration, and treasure/experience collection with or without a DM.

Version 5.0 featuring new streamlined mechanics, solo play options and a more comprehensive rules guide is now available as a free download.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Fantastic Worlds
description:
Fantastic Worlds is a miniatures skirmish game and is the newest game system based around the mechanics developed for .45 Adventure. This game takes all the pulp action you're used to and move it out to strange new worlds or into the far future. Now you'll be able to recreate the adventures of characters like Flash Gordon, Buck Rogers, and John Carter!

This rulebook contains all the rules necessary to play, including archetypes for characters like Star Commander, the Traveler, or strange aliens.

Expanded by:

Planet X: Terror from Across the Universe

name: Warlands: Full Throttle Vehicular Combat!
description:
"No one can seem to remember exactly how it started or indeed how it ended. But it did…

Now decades after the last war, mankind fights for survival on the battlefields of a post-apocalyptic earth. WARLANDS pits the last human survivors against each other and the unnatural horrors that breed in the wastelands and dead cities. Strap yourself in for high octane action from small scale skirmishes to epic battles, The WARLANDS sing with the screams of the dying and the roar of machines…

WARLANDS is a turbo-charged miniature game of cinematic combat set in the ruins of a post-apocalyptic earth. Where the last remnants of Man battle for supremacy and resources against mutants, the dead and each other! Where the warriors of the
wastelands want but one thing, the black gold, the guzzoline."

Warlands is a miniatures wargame involving vehicular combat in a post-apocalyptic (Road Warrior, Deathrace, Doomsday, etc. inspired) setting. Players can build forces of weaponized cars, trucks, dune-buggies, bikes, walkers, as well as foot infantry.

Gameplay is quick and is alternating activation. Players roll for initiative, and each activates a model, based on speed, where they move, shoot, accelerate, decelerate and perform special actions (emergency braking, bootlegger reverse, un-jam weapon, etc). Once all activations have been performed the turn ends.

Each vehicle type (Car, Truck, Buggie, Semi, Walker, etc) has their own special abilities and base attributes. These include their speed and maneuverability, ability to absorb damage, and off-road capabilities.

Shooting involves die rolling, where shooter must roll higher than a fixed target value, based on the target's current speed (the faster it's going, the harder it is to hit). Models in very close range get extra bonuses to hit. Shooting has critical success / failure mechanisms, where a success would be an auto hit and a failure results in a weapons jam.

Damage is modified by the target's armor and the weapons armor penetration value. This will determine the target value for the dice rolled to damage the target. Each target has a number of hit points. Critical damage rolls result in special damage to a vehicle that can range from degrading its performance to outright destroying it in a ball of fire.

Movement has compulsory movement to simulate momentum, and varies by the model type and current speed. Each model has a number of 45 degree turns it's allowed within a turn and how far it must move in a straight line before it can turn again. Special Maneuvers require a die roll to beat a target value, the roll is modified by the driver's skill, current vehicle speed and available turns the vehicle has. Success generally means the vehicle can turn or maneuver any way it wants, failure results in random movement or total wipe-out of vehicle.

The scale is 20mm and is compatible with most die-cast toy cars (Matchbox, Hotwheels, etc.). The line will include not only vehicles but blister packs of weapons and customization bitz to upgrade existing toy cars. At first this seems odd for a miniatures wargaming scale, but the movement works well within a 4x4 table and being able to customize toy cars will be a hobby in itself.

name: Free Realms
description:
Tied into the Sony Online Entertainment MMO of the same name, Free Realms is a simple, fun Trading Card Game, aimed at children, but capable of holding the attention of more experience TCG players.

Each player attempts to score twelve point by "Hunting" with their troops against an empty corresponding spot on their opponent's side, or "Attacking" their opponent's troops in the opposite spot.

Attacks are resolved by flipping cards from the top of a player's deck, and counting the gems along the bottom of the flipped card, and adding the number to the attack or defense strength. Additionally, the gems, of varying designs, can activate special powers of the attacker or defender.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers

name: 謙信上洛 (Kenshin Joraku)
description:
Uesugi Kenshin was the best war commander of the "Sengoku" period but died in April 1578. Kenshin Joraku (Kenshin's march to Kyoto) imagines he lives longer.

Each troop is organized in one or more unit.
Each game turn is divided in two player sub-turns. Each player may Movement phase, none active side reaction movement phase, Force march phase and combat phase. All unit can move in movement phase, but required pass activity check in reaction and force march phase. Combat result by fire power CRT and two dice.

The victor is decided by victory points. The victory points are provided by the capture of a castle, the destruction of enemy units and the control of Kyoto, the old capital of Japan.


Note: 謙信 means "Kenshin"
上洛 means "up, to the Kyoto capital".

Republished in Game Journal #46.
publishers: Game Journal, Kilovolt Design, Tsukuda Hobby

name: Racing Dwarfs
description:
Racing Dwarfs is a game of strategy and anticipation for 2-4 players

It’s widely known that the dwarfs who live in the mountains work hard extracting metals inside their dark chambers. But what most people ignore is their fondness of mine wagons races.

Today, some restless dwarfs have gathered for a new competition. In front of them, a little maze of spinning platforms traversed by rails awaits them to be crossed.

Will you be able to manage your team skilfully enough, by moving mine wagons and rotating platforms, to be the first to guide all your dwarfs beyond the opposite end of the maze?

GOAL

The players will try to lead their wagons beyond their opposite end of the board, by following the paths the platforms’ rails allow.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Hanabi: ¡Gana o explota!
description:
Hanabi (Cordobesian) variant rules, printed as a mini-expansion card for the Spanish edition of Hanabi (Cocktail Games - Asmodée Ibérica).
Free promo item at the Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2013.
publishers: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba, Jugamos Tod@s

name: Munchkin Turbobooster 1
description: Munchkin Turbobooster 1 contains three out-of-print German-language Munchkin boosters — Star Munchkin: Raumschiffe, Munchkin: Feenstaub and Munchkin: Zum Töten freigegeben — as well as the three notebooks of Munchkin Journal Pack 1 and three Munchkin dice.

"3 designers, 6 games, 15 dice."

6 is a collaboration between three game designers to provide a collection of light dice games. The tin contains a collection of dice and rules for six games that can be played with them. The games are:

Airstrike: Drop dice sequentially onto the table to obtain a combination of values positions that ensures your bombers make it home.

Dicey Winks: A dexterity game about launching dice from the '6' tin to land your dice near to a target while displacing your opponent's dice.

Foiled: A dueling simulation and bluffing game about selecting the right dice and maneuvers to strike your opponent to push them off the piste.

Slipstream: A risk management racing game, in which turn order is determined by current score.

Triangles: A bidding game in which you must spot and exploit the highest value triangle that you can land your scoring die inside.

Wrestle: Establish the best hold to limit your opponents opportunities to escape it before running out of strength.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Race, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy – Luke the lucky pickpocket
description:
A promotional card given out during the 2014 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

The promo card reads: Roll a six sided die and steal up to its value in gold from an opponent.
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Moon Harvesters
description:
Helium-3 is one of only two stable isotopes with more protons than neutrons.* Its unusual properties give humanity access to technology beyond science fiction; for example, by combining superfluid helium-3 with common helium-4, a dilution refrigerator can maintain cryogenic temperatures at 2 millikelvins, and hyperpolarized 3He enables MRI imaging of the flow of air within the lungs.

So, once the speculation began that billions of years of solar winds should have embedded even more helium-3 in the surface of the Moon than we can find on Earth, it didn't take long for the first companies to propose the profitability of mining helium-3 from the lunar surface.

You head one such lunar mining company, with its own patented, uniquely-shaped helium-3 extraction apparatus. Of course, you also must regularly send moon rovers to identify new helium-3 deposits.

Moon Harvesters is a reimplementation of another game by the same designer called The Bitcoin Harvest and feels like a cross between Hippos & Crocodiles and Battle of LITS.

MATERIALS

Lunar surface gameboard (12×12 / 12×16 grid)
40 harvester pieces (10 of each of 4 types)
40 helium-3 deposits.
3 craters
Game case

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW

Players take turns placing a harvester, collecting all Helium3 deposits that the harvester has covered and then placing two new deposits on any two empty cells. When all players pass in sucession the game ends. The player with most deposits collected wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: YAKS: The Acronym Game!
description:
YAKS - The Acronym Game! is a party game where random letters become acronyms for whatever you care to create.

Each player has sixty seconds to form a phrase, name, or fictional organization from the 4 letters rolled our YAKS scientifically engineered dice.

Whoever's submission is the funniest will win an adorable miniature Yak. When all the Yaks have been handed out the player with the most wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Siege of the Citadel: Dark Apostles Expansion
description:
Expand your Siege of the Citadel game with an encounter with one of the five Dark Apostles: Ilian, Algeroth, Demnogonis, Muawijhe or Semai.

Power Cards define the Apostles' abilities and stats; and the Doomtroopers must deplete the Power Card deck to be able to defeat the Apostle.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Savagery and Sorcery
description:
Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Sorcery and Savagery is a 112-card expansion featuring one of the most iconic pairs of antagonists in the entire Warhammer 40,000 universe: Space Wolves and Thousand Sons.

The Space Wolves are an elite Imperial army, using genetic engineering and intense training to build a proud, deadly force. The Thousand Sons are the pride of Tzeentch, using sorcery to impose Chaos on the entire galaxy. Their battles are the stuff of legends and their heroes are revered millennia later. Now you can re-enact their stories.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Delta Vision Publishing, Pegasus Spiele, Steve Jackson Games

name: Witless Wizards: Viking Deck Mini Expansion
description:
The Viking Deck is one of the most aggressive, giving your wizard the chance to deal extra hits at the cost of their own stamina.

An addtional eight card deck for Witless Wizards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Cthulhu Wars: Something About Cats
description:
Something About Cats is an Expansion for Cthulhu Wars.

Contains:
4 Loyalty Cards
1 Spellbook
8 Assembled Plastic Miniatures
- 2 Cats from Mercury
- 2 Cast from Venus
- 2 Asteroid Cats
- 1 Terror Cat of Neptune
- 1 Elder God: Hagarg Ryonis
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Valor & Villainy: Minions of Mordak – Sunbathing Skelly Promo Card
description: A new Chump Minion (size I) first available during the Promo Paradise Kickstarter campaign by The Board Game Spotlight.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Twin Princes: Reborn Edition
description:
The players are twin princes competing for the throne of a kingdom.
Split 5 cards into 2 groups. Your opponent chooses one of them first. Then deploy them. This is an "I Split, You Choose" area control game for 2 players. Fly around by the Magic Carpet and get help from the Genie and Roc. Parents and pets can be a nuisance sometimes... Beware of the donkey! There is a bandit lurking in the bag.

—description from bodoge-hoobby.net (translated)

-----Differences from the previous work (Twin Princes New Edition)-----
・Compare the total number of moon symbols and star symbols to acquire an area. Compare the number of stars only if there is a tie
・Added the Royal Palace area. The score is high and the number of cards that can be placed has decreased.
・Added the initial position of Oji Koma and personal goal cards. It will serve as a starting point.
・One effect of djinn is determined before the game starts and does not change during the game.
・Added a new card. A donkey card that disables one placed card, a pet card that adds 2 points to the score of the area, a lock bird card that moves or removes the placed card ・The area has been changed from cards to tiles
・A few other small changes
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, I Cut, You Choose

name: Roll Pirates
description:
The roll-write game involves traveling on a pirate ship and having adventures.

On each turn of the game we have a pool of dice, with which we perform various actions in the game: improve the ship, train crew, travel, complete tasks, etc. In the course of the game we mark our journey on the map trying to skillfully plan the journey .

Each turn we use a pool of 6 D6 dice. At the beginning we choose one of 3 available places to start the adventure which we mark on the map. Then you use the dice to reinforce your crew and ship, so created points can be used to travel on land and sea. The moment you get to the adventure you can complete it using dice with specific values. In this way we travel all over the map (collecting rum by the way) and keeping the rule that we can not use the same route twice, so you have to plan your journey in advance. After 7 turns we count points for travels and adventures.

-description from designer

name: 1942: Carrier Duel in the Pacific
description:
1942: Carrier Duel in the Pacific is a World War 2 Pacific Theater of Operations Operational level micro-wargame starting from Spring 1942, after the success of the first stage of the Japanese offensive.
Players are divided into Japanese (6 CV) and U.S. (5 CV) forces, commanding aircraft carriers and fighting each other to reach the control of 5 keys airfields.

First appearance: free PnP distribution at events (2014)
categories: Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Carcassonne: Bonusplättchen Spiel 2022
description:
This single-tile mini-expansion can be added to any Carcassonne game. The design, however, matches that of the New Edition of Carcassonne (2014).

This promo was given out (for free) when making a purchase at the Hans im Glück booth at Spiel 2022, Essen.

This tile presents a road segment with an inn. No specific rules are included with the tile. The tile is simply mixed with the other landscape tiles. When a player draws the tile, he or she should place the tile according to the usual rules.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Dealer's Dilemma
description:
Dealer's Dilemma is a trick-taking game for 3 players that is all about precision bidding.
The dealer for the round faces a tough choice to pick, between 2 undealt cards, a trump suit and a lead card.

Players discard 2 cards from their hands to bid the number of tricks they will take.
There are 2 levels of bidding : easy bid if you want to do 2 predictions, and risky bid if you want to do a single prediction.

“It is risky bid-ness.” - Carol LaGrow

name: Peanuts Charlie Brown: Trim the Tree Game
description:
Charlie Brown wanted to get a tree with heart, but it’s going to need some love! Hang ornaments everywhere you can without losing the big red ornament. Work together and use a light touch to brighten Charlie Brown’s Christmas!


Cooperative gameplay brings your family together for a lively holiday game night!
Charlie Brown’s iconic Christmas tree takes center stage! Play as a team to decorate it – and be careful not to bend it too much!
Featuring 18 ornaments to hang on the tree, with art in the classic Peanuts style!
Use special star ornaments to help in a pinch and lighten up your tree!


—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Festival
description:
The great cities of the world are challenging each other to present the most beautiful festival imaginable. The closing fireworks ceremony, held in all cities, will be the final rose in the crown of the festivities.

In Festival, you select tiles to place on your tableau to create the most impressive and beautiful fireworks display possible...and of course, score the most points! This tile-placement and tile-stacking game will have you choosing to either take and place a firework tile on your turn, or select an objective card to complete for points at game's end.

Don't forget that the higher you stack your firework tiles, the more points you stand to collect in the end...and make sure to organize your display to land those coveted crowd-pleasers to earn even more points and lift your city to the top of the podium!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Layering, Market, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Expedition to Zanthalar
description:
Players take a trip to the fantasy world Zanthalar, going on quests, searching for treasure, and trying to be the first person to reach ten Expedition points.

The game plays out with seven different card types (to offer meaningful decisions and plenty of customization) in addition to the in-game resource, gold. On any given turn, a player will buy cards from their favorite card types, take an action to advance their position, and barter by exchanging cards for gold.

—description from the designer

name: Jetan
description:
Jetan, or Martian Chess, is a two-player abstract game played on a 10-by-10 board. Each side has a set of twenty pieces of varying types, with each type having its own set of movement options.

The game is unlike traditional Chess in a few important respects:
All pieces in Jetan have limited movement (i.e. the Chief moves three spaces in any direction or combination of directions).
One piece on each side (the Princess) cannot capture other pieces.
The conditions for a win or a draw (described below) are unusual.

"The game is won when a player places any of his pieces on the same square with his opponent's Princess, or when a Chief takes a Chief. It is drawn when a Chief is taken by any opposing piece other than the opposing Chief; or when both sides have been reduced to three pieces, or less, of equal value, and the game is not terminated in the following ten moves..." -- from Edgar Rice Burroughs' novel "The Chessmen of Mars".
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture
publishers: (Public Domain), Super Juegos, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Blade Runner
description:
Each player is dealt six cards. Each card has a number from one to ten. A player who is dealt a hand totaling thirty-five or more is a Replicant; otherwise one is Human. The object is find a Replicant and destroy one to win the game.

A player may take a look at any card in the player's hand by landing on any of the opponent's "VK Monitor Terminals."
Winning combat is a matter of rolling a higher number on the dice than the opponent.

The game is based on the movie Blade Runner but withdrawn because the publisher did not have permission from the movie studio. It was never put into full production and is thus exceptionally rare, only 100 boards were made. It was printed by a small company in California (now defunct) and released to test markets in San Francisco and Los Angeles back in 1982-83. These are licensed products and bear the "Blade Runner Partnership" trademark. - As for the game itself, it's obviously a prototype.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Monster Kit: Expansion
description:
Expansión para el juego base MONSTER KIT. 45 cartas nuevas y un juego extra de diez cartas llamado El monstruo comilón.

Expansion for Monster Kit base game.

The great sorcerer Márlat has run out of monsters to terrorize the world and needs reinforcements. This box contains 45 new cards with which you can create new and funny monsters.

In addition this box contains new cards with which to play the minigame called "El monstruo Comilon"
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Islamic State: Libya War
description:
Islamic State: Libya War (ISLW) is set in a near future scenario, late in this decade, where the Libyan and Tunisian states have collapsed into civil war, pitting Radical Islamists versus Nationalist forces, with most radical Islamists pledging loyalty to the Islamic State (IS) after the arrival of well-trained, elite IS cadres from Iraq and Syria. These IS forces defeated the Tripoli-based Muslim brotherhood forces and the Tobruk-based Nationalist government.

Now having control of most of Libya and Tunis, the new rogue state launched terror attacks against touristic resorts in Southern Greece, Italy and Spain. This, coupled with the arrival of huge masses of migrants fleeing from the war, threatened with destabilizing the southern shores of the European Union, which were already suffering the effects of a systemic, decade-long economic crisis. The IS got hold of oil and gas producing areas in Libya, thus financing their activities in Iraq and Syria, the Sahel, Sub Saharan Africa and elsewhere, with the aim of expanding militarily towards Sudan, Algeria, Chad and Mali. In a desperate attempt to stabilize the North African region, a coalition formed by the EU, the US, Egypt and the surviving anti-Islamist forces in Tunis and Libya launch a stabilization campaign spearheaded by elite special operation forces.

Libya War explores the first few weeks of that hypothetical pacification campaign scenario. The Western countries (US, NATO) and their Arab Allies (Tunisians and Libyan nationalists) are controlled by the player. The Islamic State (“IS” from now on) is controlled by the system.

Designed by Javier Romero and developed by Ty Bomba. Published in CounterFact Magazine #5 in late-2016.

name: Battle for Vedros: Starter Set
description:
Battle for Vedros is a skirmish tabletop miniatures game that utilizes the models of Warhammer 40,000. The rules of the game are similar to the Warhammer 40,000 game but have been simplified to appeal to younger players. The models in the starter set are compatible with Warhammer 40,000; in fact, it reuses half of the sprue molds designed for 2008's Warhammer 40,000 Fifth Edition starter set named Assault on Black Reach (for almost the same MSRP as the latter's – 83% ohn and 75% with inflation).

The starter set contains:

1 Space Marine Captain
6 Tactical Space Marines
1 Space Marine Terminator
1 Space Marine Dreadnought
1 Ork Warboss
5 Ork Nobz
12 Ork Boyz
1 Ork Deffkopta
1 Battle for Vedros rulebook
8 Dice


The six expansion packs are repackagings of selected Fifth Edition unit packs (with no change in price).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Sepoy Mutiny: The Great Indian Rebellion (1857-58)
description:
Sepoy Mutiny is a two-player wargame simulating the rebellion of Sepoy troops in the British Indian Empire in 1857-58. One player represents the British command, and the other the leadership of the Rebels. Both sides are trying to gain control of India. The game system is based on the one originally presented in our earlier S&T games: They Died with Their Boots On, Volumes 1 & 2 (S&T 236 & 242). It uses an interactive sequence of play in which command, rebellions and events are randomly generated. The British Empire player controls British Regular, Punjab (including Sikh), Loyal Sepoy, Auxiliary and Nepalese forces. The Rebels initially control no forces but will gain them from Sepoy and Rebel Badmashes units which mutiny. Both players can also mobilize various Princely State forces. Each turn represents roughly two months of time. Each hexagon is about 40 miles across. Each unit represents anywhere from 2000 to 10,000 troops. Leaders represent major commanders, their staffs, and guard troops.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters

Magazine: Strategy & Tactics #320
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Fightin' Fungi
description:
Fightin' Fungi is an advanced incarnation of the Song of Blades and Heroes fantasy skirmish rules — with a side serving of mushrooms. This stand-alone miniatures game features:

Plenty of special rules including weapon-based and martial arts traits;
A detailed magic system with 36 spells;
Hundreds of ready-to-play profiles, with a point system to add your own;
A dedicated 28mm miniatures line;
A unique setting in a valley populated by mushroom creatures.


As with all games in the Song of Blades and Heroes family, it's a miniatures game with individually activated figures. There is a press your luck element in deciding how many activation dice to roll: the more successes you roll, the more actions you can take with a given figure. But if you roll 2+ failures, your turn ends and it might leave you with unactivated troops.

Unlike most games in this system, Fightin' Fungi actually has (optional) miniatures made specifically for the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadowfist: Back For Seconds
description:
Starter deck expansion for Shadowfist.

From the shadowfist.com website:

"This two-deck follow-up to Combat in Kowloon features 50-card starters for the Monarchs and the Jammers, to fill out the new six-faction standard for Shadowfist!"
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Builders of Blankenburg: Fields & Flocks
description:
Add a whole new element to your adventures in Blankenburg with the addition of the Fields & Flocks expansion. Not only does Fields & Flocks add six player support to the game, but it introduces the Harvest phase, where you are able to direct the actions of your serfs in managing your agricultural holdings. Grow crops and raise livestock, either selling them to the various citizens in the town for silver, or attaching complete fields and flocks to structures for additional prestige. Fields & Flocks also includes more Characters, Citizens, Visitors, and Events, so each game is a unique experience.

Most new action takes place during the Harvest phase. This adds a worker placement mechanic to the game, where your serfs can interact with Fields and Flocks, as well as Citizens and structures. Depending on the Citizens in town and the structures in play, different strategies are available.

As an added bonus, the expansion comes with a full reprint of all cards from the base game. These will be printed on higher quality card stock, along with a switch to symbols instead of color bars on structures and the inclusion of district symbols to avoid confusion and aid color blind players. Some art which originally came out darker than anticipated will be rebalanced to ensure everything looks great.

name: Ulaya Chronicles: Raptor Claw Island
description:
A solo/cooperative skirmish scale miniatures game set in a land of dinosaur infested jungles and ancient technology.

Played over a series of interconnected games, Ulaya Chronicles is a story based campaign experience.
Make important choices which effect the narrative, steer the combat style of your character, and reveal a mysterious plot which you, the players, must unravel.

A solo or cooperative experience, Ulaya Chronicles features a card driven AI system. Each type of enemy (mostly dinosaurs!) have unique behaviours and personalities. Each enemy type is a different tactical puzzle to solve, and ensure every play through is a different experience.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Green Hell: The Board Game
description:
Green Hell: The Board Game is a non-legacy, campaign, survival, fully cooperative game for 1-4 players. The board game follows the recipe for success implemented by its electronic counterpart, by introducing a highly optimizable set of survival mechanics, pitting players against a changeable and unpredictable jungle environment. The core mechanics of the game are:

Exploration:

Players are all members of a search and rescue party, sent into the Amazon rainforest to locate Jake Higgins - the protagonist known from the computer game. Avoiding too many spoilers, the plot of the board game campaign runs its own course and uses some hallmark elements of the overarching Green Hell story, without spoiling the electronic adventure to anyone.

Apart from the characters in the team - who have varying roles and asymmetric skills (the Survival Expert, the Guide, the Medic, the Scientist) the other main character of the game is the jungle itself. With a map based on random card setup, providing modularity (no two games of the same scenario will look the same), and an ever-expanding area to cover (each scenario will allow players to uncover a part of a greater region, and sometimes the players will have to backtrack to an already known location) the jungle creation system introduces variability and unpredictability to each session.

Resources -> Backpack -> Crafting:

You can’t have a survival game without crafting and collecting resources! Green Hell: the Board Game allows you to collect resources in various ways. Luck based dice rolls for the most basic and universal resource, harvesting map locations for larger and more scarce resources, or interacting with specific, rare, tiles for unique resources which, when uncovered, can be a reward in themselves.

These resources will be needed to craft weapons, armor, and some items required to finish Scenarios in the campaign.

As any experienced survivalist knows, a backpack is an important part of the system and knowing what and how much we can fit cleverly into our backpack to optimize space is crucial.
